11016606.ContentEN: Only the dead keep silent forever. Fulvis will definitely kill me. We're both on this mission, and you've seen his fabricated evidence, so he surely won't spare you either.
11016606.Subtitle: Only the dead keep silent forever. Fulvis will definitely kill me. We're both on this mission, and you've seen his fabricated evidence, so he surely won't spare you either.

11016609.ContentEN: ...If I \"kill\" you and feign allegiance to him, it'll lower his guard, allowing you to go unnoticed... It's the only way to ensure your survival.
11016609.Subtitle: ...If I \"kill\" you and feign allegiance to him, it'll lower his guard, allowing you to go unnoticed... It's the only way to ensure your survival.

11016610.ContentEN: No, Sir Avar... Let's just fight our way out... There's got to be a way out!
11016610.Subtitle: No, Sir Avar... Let's just fight our way out... There's got to be a way out!

11016611.ContentEN: Not everything can be solved with a fight, kid. My life has more value than you think — it serves a greater purpose.
11016611.Subtitle: Not everything can be solved with a fight, kid. My life has more value than you think — it serves a greater purpose.

11016612.ContentEN: I'll try to negotiate with Fulvis, though I believe it's going to fail in the end, so don't get your hopes up. The negotiation is for a more important purpose—
11016612.Subtitle: I'll try to negotiate with Fulvis, though I believe it's going to fail in the end, so don't get your hopes up. The negotiation is for a more important purpose—

11016614.ContentEN: Take this recording device. It'll provide the evidence needed to expose and destroy Fulvis.
11016614.Subtitle: Take this recording device. It'll provide the evidence needed to expose and destroy Fulvis.

11016615.ContentEN: Without it, all you have is your word, which happens to be the most unconvincing evidence. The cries of our fallen comrades will be lost to the winds of Lonza Fortress.
11016615.Subtitle: Without it, all you have is your word, which happens to be the most unconvincing evidence. The cries of our fallen comrades will be lost to the winds of Lonza Fortress.

11016617.ContentEN: Why the long face? Cheer up, kid! A true soldier laughs at adversity.
11016617.Subtitle: Why the long face? Cheer up, kid! A true soldier laughs at adversity.

11016619.ContentEN: I'm proud to have been your instructor, {nickname2}... And I'm sorry for dragging you into this mess.
11016619.Subtitle: I'm proud to have been your instructor, ... And I'm sorry for dragging you into this mess.

11016620.ContentEN: You must survive. Bring the truth to Chief Sibylle and His Majesty. Let the entire Empire know that every soldier here held true to their creed and duty, and everyone fought till their very last breath.
11016620.Subtitle: You must survive. Bring the truth to Chief Sibylle and His Majesty. Let the entire Empire know that every soldier here held true to their creed and duty, and everyone fought till their very last breath.

11016701.ContentEN: ...That's exactly what happened in the central control room that day.
11016701.Subtitle: ...That's exactly what happened in the central control room that day.

11016702.ContentEN: Sir Avar fought valiantly, confronting a conspiracy far greater than any individual could withstand alone. He sacrificed his life to secure crucial evidence — his final act in defence of justice.
11016702.Subtitle: Sir Avar fought valiantly, confronting a conspiracy far greater than any individual could withstand alone. He sacrificed his life to secure crucial evidence — his final act in defence of justice.

11016703.ContentEN: But, we underestimated the enemy's meticulousness. As I drifted in and out of consciousness, I sensed Fulvis's adjutant, Falsi, removing the recording device from me.
11016703.Subtitle: But, we underestimated the enemy's meticulousness. As I drifted in and out of consciousness, I sensed Fulvis's adjutant, Falsi, removing the recording device from me.

11016704.ContentEN: By the time I fully regained consciousness, Fulvis had seized control of the fortress. Confronting him would have led to our deaths, and the truth would have been buried with us.
11016704.Subtitle: By the time I fully regained consciousness, Fulvis had seized control of the fortress. Confronting him would have led to our deaths, and the truth would have been buried with us.

11016705.ContentEN: That's why we decided to come to you like this. I believe that you have the authority to recover that evidence, or at least secure a testimony from Falsi.
11016705.Subtitle: That's why we decided to come to you like this. I believe that you have the authority to recover that evidence, or at least secure a testimony from Falsi.

11016706.ContentEN: Warden Hellfire, I know you hold justice above all else, and I believe you possess the means to defend it. Please, go get Falsi. She holds the truth you want.
11016706.Subtitle: Warden Hellfire, I know you hold justice above all else, and I believe you possess the means to defend it. Please, go get Falsi. She holds the truth you want.

11016707.ContentEN: Hyperborea functions like a vast machine, requiring every component to operate flawlessly.
11016707.Subtitle: Hyperborea functions like a vast machine, requiring every component to operate flawlessly.

11016708.ContentEN: My role is to uphold the law and protect the justice defined by Hyperborea. If anyone attempts to manipulate me to subvert this law, they will face severe consequences.
11016708.Subtitle: My role is to uphold the law and protect the justice defined by Hyperborea. If anyone attempts to manipulate me to subvert this law, they will face severe consequences.

11016709.ContentEN: I will investigate Falsi. Be aware of the consequences if what you said proves to be false and a waste of my time.
11016709.Subtitle: I will investigate Falsi. Be aware of the consequences if what you said proves to be false and a waste of my time.

11016801.ContentEN: {nickname2}, Warden Hellfire has instructed me to bring Miss Theodore here.
11016801.Subtitle: , Warden Hellfire has instructed me to bring Miss Theodore here.

11016802.ContentEN: During her interrogation, she repeatedly requested to see you.
11016802.Subtitle: During her interrogation, she repeatedly requested to see you.

11016805.ContentEN: ...You weren't supposed to know that part...
11016805.Subtitle: ...You weren't supposed to know that part...

11016806.ContentEN: Well, I don't know what happened, but the interrogator seemed much more accommodating this afternoon. She even asked if I wanted anything.
11016806.Subtitle: Well, I don't know what happened, but the interrogator seemed much more accommodating this afternoon. She even asked if I wanted anything.

11016807.ContentEN: My testimony hasn't changed... Did you say something that swayed the Warden?
11016807.Subtitle: My testimony hasn't changed... Did you say something that swayed the Warden?

11016808.ContentEN: ...Or is this some sort of final kindness before our execution!?
11016808.Subtitle: ...Or is this some sort of final kindness before our execution!?

11016809.ContentEN: You're right. I pleaded guilty. We'll be executed soon.
11016809.Subtitle: You're right. I pleaded guilty. We'll be executed soon.

11016810.ContentEN: ...Really...? I see. I suppose you had no other choice. No one can withstand such intense interrogation.
11016810.Subtitle: ...Really...? I see. I suppose you had no other choice. No one can withstand such intense interrogation.

11016811.ContentEN: It's alright. You've done so much to protect me already...
11016811.Subtitle: It's alright. You've done so much to protect me already...

11016812.ContentEN: It's not true. I was just messing with you...
11016812.Subtitle: It's not true. I was just messing with you...

11016813.ContentEN: Wha... You really scared me... Y—You owe me an apology...
11016813.Subtitle: Wha... You really scared me... Y—You owe me an apology...

11016814.ContentEN: If Warden Hellfire's investigation goes well, we'll be free soon. I'll make it up to you by taking you to the opera house.
11016814.Subtitle: If Warden Hellfire's investigation goes well, we'll be free soon. I'll make it up to you by taking you to the opera house.

11016815.ContentEN: The Warden believed what I said and went to investigating Falsi.
11016815.Subtitle: The Warden believed what I said and went to investigating Falsi.

11016817.ContentEN: ...You've got a lot more injuries. They must hurt... I... I'll beg them to give me back my first-aid kit...
11016817.Subtitle: ...You've got a lot more injuries. They must hurt... I... I'll beg them to give me back my first-aid kit...

11016818.ContentEN: I'm fine. You should take care of your own injuries though...
11016818.Subtitle: I'm fine. You should take care of your own injuries though...

11016819.ContentEN: ...If Warden Hellfire's investigation goes well, we'll be free soon.
11016819.Subtitle: ...If Warden Hellfire's investigation goes well, we'll be free soon.

11016821.ContentEN: ...And one more thing. I'm sorry, this might bring back painful memories, but I must ask while I can.
11016821.Subtitle: ...And one more thing. I'm sorry, this might bring back painful memories, but I must ask while I can.

11016822.ContentEN: Back at the fortress, the situation was so desperate that you didn't have time to tell me about my father's death. But I've sorted out my mood. Can you tell me about it now? Did my father... leave anything behind?
11016822.Subtitle: Back at the fortress, the situation was so desperate that you didn't have time to tell me about my father's death. But I've sorted out my mood. Can you tell me about it now? Did my father... leave anything behind?

11016824.ContentEN: Sir Avar kept this with him at all times, in the pocket closest to his heart.
11016824.Subtitle: Sir Avar kept this with him at all times, in the pocket closest to his heart.

11016825.ContentEN: He wanted you to have this message—
11016825.Subtitle: He wanted you to have this message—

11016826.ContentEN: \"Find Daphne if possible. If she's alive, get her out of here... Once you're both safe, tell her—\"
11016826.Subtitle: \"Find Daphne if possible. If she's alive, get her out of here... Once you're both safe, tell her—\"

11016827.ContentEN: \"I'm sorry, my baby girl. I've always wanted to hear you call me Dad again, just like when you were little.\"
11016827.Subtitle: \"I'm sorry, my baby girl. I've always wanted to hear you call me Dad again, just like when you were little.\"

11016829.ContentEN: So long that... I'm not the little girl in the photo anymore...
11016829.Subtitle: So long that... I'm not the little girl in the photo anymore...

11016830.ContentEN: Alright. Both of you have again passed the Warden's test. Miss Daphne, you may leave now.
11016830.Subtitle: Alright. Both of you have again passed the Warden's test. Miss Daphne, you may leave now.

11016832.ContentEN: Per the Warden's orders. I was to confine you both here and monitor your interactions.
11016832.Subtitle: Per the Warden's orders. I was to confine you both here and monitor your interactions.

11016833.ContentEN: Right, if we were guilty, we'd make use of every opportunity to collude in our testimonies... I understand. Thank you for giving us a chance to prove our innocence.
11016833.Subtitle: Right, if we were guilty, we'd make use of every opportunity to collude in our testimonies... I understand. Thank you for giving us a chance to prove our innocence.

11016834.ContentEN: Perhaps... we'll leave this place soon.
11016834.Subtitle: Perhaps... we'll leave this place soon.

11016903.ContentEN: A directive to expedite all procedural reviews has been issued from above. The only document I received is a writ demanding your immediate execution.
11016903.Subtitle: A directive to expedite all procedural reviews has been issued from above. The only document I received is a writ demanding your immediate execution.

11016904.ContentEN: Ma'am, this is not right — it goes against the standard procedures of interrogation.
11016904.Subtitle: Ma'am, this is not right — it goes against the standard procedures of interrogation.

11016905.ContentEN: Take a look at the writ and the signatures at the bottom. Even the Supreme Minister of Justice has signed it. Not even Chief Sibylle can stop it. Your case has grown beyond anyone's control.
11016905.Subtitle: Take a look at the writ and the signatures at the bottom. Even the Supreme Minister of Justice has signed it. Not even Chief Sibylle can stop it. Your case has grown beyond anyone's control.

11016906.ContentEN: What about Falsi? As long as we find Falsi and the recording device, we can prove that...
11016906.Subtitle: What about Falsi? As long as we find Falsi and the recording device, we can prove that...

11016908.ContentEN: An explosion occurred during the battle. Falsi was last seen outside the fortress. Her bloodstained pistol was found along the riverbank. Although the Legion continues to search, it is likely that she is deceased.
11016908.Subtitle: An explosion occurred during the battle. Falsi was last seen outside the fortress. Her bloodstained pistol was found along the riverbank. Although the Legion continues to search, it is likely that she is deceased.

11016909.ContentEN: ...Ma'am, do you really believe in such a coincidence?
11016909.Subtitle: ...Ma'am, do you really believe in such a coincidence?

11017001.ContentEN: Your Royal Highness Prince Vergilius! This place isn't fitting for someone of your stature. Please don't proceed any further!
11017001.Subtitle: Your Royal Highness Prince Vergilius! This place isn't fitting for someone of your stature. Please don't proceed any further!

11017003.ContentEN: Gathering so many signatures must have been quite the feat.
11017003.Subtitle: Gathering so many signatures must have been quite the feat.

11017004.ContentEN: Yet, these signatures might weigh less than the one in my hand, I suppose?
11017004.Subtitle: Yet, these signatures might weigh less than the one in my hand, I suppose?

11017006.ContentEN: Does the royal family intend to intervene in this military case?
11017006.Subtitle: Does the royal family intend to intervene in this military case?

11017007.ContentEN:
Intervene? I must ask, do you view His Majesty's decree of pardon as an \"intervention\"?\
Is the Royal Military Prison no longer under the crown's jurisdiction?
11017007.Subtitle:
Intervene? I must ask, do you view His Majesty's decree of pardon as an \"intervention\"?\
Is the Royal Military Prison no longer under the crown's jurisdiction?

11017009.ContentEN: I need to speak with {nickname2} alone. Everyone else may leave.
11017009.Subtitle: I need to speak with  alone. Everyone else may leave.

11017101.ContentEN: Thank goodness. One moment later and I might have to talk to your headstone instead.
11017101.Subtitle: Thank goodness. One moment later and I might have to talk to your headstone instead.

11017102.ContentEN: By all that is holy, my friend, you've really landed yourself in some serious trouble. You know how hard it is to meet my brother, and how rarely I get involved with politicians. But fortune favours you today — I was summoned for a different matter and seized the opportunity to secure your pardon.
11017102.Subtitle: By all that is holy, my friend, you've really landed yourself in some serious trouble. You know how hard it is to meet my brother, and how rarely I get involved with politicians. But fortune favours you today — I was summoned for a different matter and seized the opportunity to secure your pardon.

11017103.ContentEN: Things have finally blown over. You're free at last. Where do you want to go, the art gallery, the opera house, or just a simple stroll along Whisper River for fresh air?
11017103.Subtitle: Things have finally blown over. You're free at last. Where do you want to go, the art gallery, the opera house, or just a simple stroll along Whisper River for fresh air?

11017105.ContentEN: ...You... look pale. They did go rough on you. Why don't you come to my place? My personal physicians will tend to your wounds.
11017105.Subtitle: ...You... look pale. They did go rough on you. Why don't you come to my place? My personal physicians will tend to your wounds.

11017106.ContentEN: I can't believe after seven centuries, the prisons of Hyperborea still resort to primitive, barbaric, and utterly inhumane forms of torture... Those obsequious writers hail this era as \"the greatest and most prosperous of times,\" which is nothing but a tragic farce.
11017106.Subtitle: I can't believe after seven centuries, the prisons of Hyperborea still resort to primitive, barbaric, and utterly inhumane forms of torture... Those obsequious writers hail this era as \"the greatest and most prosperous of times,\" which is nothing but a tragic farce.

11017107.ContentEN: Let's not dwell on that... How's Daphne?
11017107.Subtitle: Let's not dwell on that... How's Daphne?

11017108.ContentEN: I heard about your efforts to ensure her safety. Fear not, the pardon includes her as well.
11017108.Subtitle: I heard about your efforts to ensure her safety. Fear not, the pardon includes her as well.

11017109.ContentEN: That's a relief... Sorry, I don't have anything to repay your kindness at the moment.
11017109.Subtitle: That's a relief... Sorry, I don't have anything to repay your kindness at the moment.

11017110.ContentEN: Repay me? Hmm... How about serving as my bodyguard for six months?
11017110.Subtitle: Repay me? Hmm... How about serving as my bodyguard for six months?

11017112.ContentEN: Yes. I'm assigned to oversee matters in Scarletriver in the name of royalty for about half a year. It'd be reassuring to have you by my side.
11017112.Subtitle: Yes. I'm assigned to oversee matters in Scarletriver in the name of royalty for about half a year. It'd be reassuring to have you by my side.

11017113.ContentEN: And staying away from the Legion might be wise for now. The stigma of a criminal charge lingers. Going back to the Legion at this point could be awkward.
11017113.Subtitle: And staying away from the Legion might be wise for now. The stigma of a criminal charge lingers. Going back to the Legion at this point could be awkward.

11017114.ContentEN: I suggested your name as my aide when I was summoned today, and my brother consented.
11017114.Subtitle: I suggested your name as my aide when I was summoned today, and my brother consented.

11017115.ContentEN: You want me to leave the capital right now?
11017115.Subtitle: You want me to leave the capital right now?

11017116.ContentEN: Yes. Just think of those signatures — how many people are watching you in Dismania. Your prowess may deter approaching Filthoids, but not hidden assassins.
11017116.Subtitle: Yes. Just think of those signatures — how many people are watching you in Dismania. Your prowess may deter approaching Filthoids, but not hidden assassins.

11017117.ContentEN: I know what you're worried about. Sibylle Mason is an old friend of Daphne. She is obviously inclined to your innocence, so she will at least ensure Daphne's safety.
11017117.Subtitle: I know what you're worried about. Sibylle Mason is an old friend of Daphne. She is obviously inclined to your innocence, so she will at least ensure Daphne's safety.

11017118.ContentEN: I understand. Then I shall do as you say. Shall I pledge an oath of service, Your Highness?
11017118.Subtitle: I understand. Then I shall do as you say. Shall I pledge an oath of service, Your Highness?

11017119.ContentEN: ...Come on, you know there's nothing I hate more than these pointless customs and etiquette. But you're in the mood for jokes now, which is a good sign.
11017119.Subtitle: ...Come on, you know there's nothing I hate more than these pointless customs and etiquette. But you're in the mood for jokes now, which is a good sign.

11017120.ContentEN: The bloody stench of this prison is proving itself extremely noisome. Let's depart from this dismal place once you're ready.
11017120.Subtitle: The bloody stench of this prison is proving itself extremely noisome. Let's depart from this dismal place once you're ready.

11017123.ContentEN: (There is <H>something</> there... that I didn't even tell the Warden...)
11017123.Subtitle: (There is something there... that I didn't even tell the Warden...)

11017201.ContentEN: {nickname2}, so you're not going to ask me anything?
11017201.Subtitle: , so you're not going to ask me anything?

11017202.ContentEN: You just said soldiers must obey.
11017202.Subtitle: You just said soldiers must obey.

11017203.ContentEN: Given what we've been through, are you really going to be as rigid as a piece of wood?
11017203.Subtitle: Given what we've been through, are you really going to be as rigid as a piece of wood?

11017204.ContentEN: You also said that one must fully concentrate when engaging in combat.
11017204.Subtitle: You also said that one must fully concentrate when engaging in combat.

11017205.ContentEN: The current circumstances are perilous; being sidetracked by criticism might lead to casualties.
11017205.Subtitle: The current circumstances are perilous; being sidetracked by criticism might lead to casualties.

11017301.ContentEN: Don't tell me you're the only Griffin left alive. Where are the rest of your squad?
11017301.Subtitle: Don't tell me you're the only Griffin left alive. Where are the rest of your squad?

11017302.ContentEN: They're right ahead. Most of them are heavily injured. Please follow me.
11017302.Subtitle: They're right ahead. Most of them are heavily injured. Please follow me.

11017403.ContentEN: You take Katya and the guys and leave this place...
11017403.Subtitle: You take Katya and the guys and leave this place...

11017404.Content: 这是……继电器，总之先关闭一个

11017407.ContentEN: The water is not going down!
11017407.Subtitle: The water is not going down!

11017408.ContentEN: Let's get through from the side.
11017408.Subtitle: Let's get through from the side.

11017411.Content: 好，月髓连接上了【待包装】

11017412.ContentEN: Eh? It's blocked. Seems like we need to take a detour...
11017412.Subtitle: Eh? It's blocked. Seems like we need to take a detour...

11017413.ContentEN: The switch doesn't work, maybe I should activate the connected Phoxynamo Wheel first.
11017413.Subtitle: The switch doesn't work, maybe I should activate the connected Phoxynamo Wheel first.

11017415.Content: 炮台的能源已经全部连通，回来汇合吧。【待包装】

11017416.ContentEN: Go activate the Phoxynamo Wheels once you're ready.
11017416.Subtitle: Go activate the Phoxynamo Wheels once you're ready.

11017417.ContentEN: (These cables should lead me to the Phoxynamo Wheels.)
11017417.Subtitle: (These cables should lead me to the Phoxynamo Wheels.)

11017420.ContentEN: They refer to this place as a \"Simulated Battlefield,\" saying that... \"The theme this time is the Defence of Icelake City.\"
11017420.Subtitle: They refer to this place as a \"Simulated Battlefield,\" saying that... \"The theme this time is the Defence of Icelake City.\"

11017421.ContentEN: I heard that this Icelake City is covered in snow, something that I've never seen in my entire life... How I wish I could go there and see it myself!
11017421.Subtitle: I heard that this Icelake City is covered in snow, something that I've never seen in my entire life... How I wish I could go there and see it myself!

11017422.ContentEN: ...I mean, if, by any chance, I could make it out alive.
11017422.Subtitle: ...I mean, if, by any chance, I could make it out alive.

11017501.ContentEN: The engine room is the \"heart\" of the entire fortress, and all the power that keeps the fortress running comes from the Phoxichor tank in there.
11017501.Subtitle: The engine room is the \"heart\" of the entire fortress, and all the power that keeps the fortress running comes from the Phoxichor tank in there.

11017502.ContentEN: But a direct attack would only lead to explosion, so you need to shut down the <H>Phoxynamo Wheels</> around it first.
11017502.Subtitle: But a direct attack would only lead to explosion, so you need to shut down the Phoxynamo Wheels around it first.

11017503.ContentEN: You should be able to recognise those wheels, aka the blue ones, right? What you need to do is turn them yellow.
11017503.Subtitle: You should be able to recognise those wheels, aka the blue ones, right? What you need to do is turn them yellow.

11017504.ContentEN: I graduated a long time ago, Sir. You don't have to lead me through all the basic steps.
11017504.Subtitle: I graduated a long time ago, Sir. You don't have to lead me through all the basic steps.

11017505.ContentEN: ...You kiddo! Alright, play it by ear then. I'll contact you if necessary.
11017505.Subtitle: ...You kiddo! Alright, play it by ear then. I'll contact you if necessary.

11017506.ContentEN: (Following the cables on the ground may help me get to the Phoxynamo Wheels. I hope they're not too tricky to be found.)
11017506.Subtitle: (Following the cables on the ground may help me get to the Phoxynamo Wheels. I hope they're not too tricky to be found.)

11017509.ContentEN: The door due east is now open. You can go that way.
11017509.Subtitle: The door due east is now open. You can go that way.

11017510.ContentEN: (Put the Phoxynamo Wheel in such a weird place... Those engineers sure know how to make things involved.)
11017510.Subtitle: (Put the Phoxynamo Wheel in such a weird place... Those engineers sure know how to make things involved.)

11017514.ContentEN: <W>WARNING: Abnormal Phoxynamo Wheel shutdown detected. Re-activating Phoxynamo Wheels now.</>
11017514.Subtitle: WARNING: Abnormal Phoxynamo Wheel shutdown detected. Re-activating Phoxynamo Wheels now.

11017517.ContentEN: <W>WARNING: Phoxichor tank overload risk detected. Please check if more than required Phoxynamo Wheels have been activated.</>
11017517.Subtitle: WARNING: Phoxichor tank overload risk detected. Please check if more than required Phoxynamo Wheels have been activated.

11017519.ContentEN: Listen, {nickname2}. I need you to go to the lower floor of the engine room, activate all the back-up Phoxynamo Wheels, then evacuate immediately.
11017519.Subtitle: Listen, . I need you to go to the lower floor of the engine room, activate all the back-up Phoxynamo Wheels, then evacuate immediately.

11017520.ContentEN: Since we can't shut them down our way, we can let them do it in a self-destructive way.
11017520.Subtitle: Since we can't shut them down our way, we can let them do it in a self-destructive way.

11017521.ContentEN: You mean... exploding the Phoxichor tank by overloading it? Got it.
11017521.Subtitle: You mean... exploding the Phoxichor tank by overloading it? Got it.

11017601.ContentEN: Back-up Phoxynamo Wheel No.1 is ready. Now activate it.
11017601.Subtitle: Back-up Phoxynamo Wheel No.1 is ready. Now activate it.

11017602.ContentEN: Well done. I'll unlock the control authority for the remaining three Phoxynamo Wheels.
11017602.Subtitle: Well done. I'll unlock the control authority for the remaining three Phoxynamo Wheels.

11017603.ContentEN: Activate them once the yellow light is on.
11017603.Subtitle: Activate them once the yellow light is on.

11017604.ContentEN: (The light is on. Looks like Sir Avar has made it on his side.)
11017604.Subtitle: (The light is on. Looks like Sir Avar has made it on his side.)

11017605.ContentEN: <W>WARNING: Phoxichor tank is overloaded by 50%. Please shut down the Phoxynamo Wheels immediately; unauthorized departure is not permitted.</>
11017605.Subtitle: WARNING: Phoxichor tank is overloaded by 50%. Please shut down the Phoxynamo Wheels immediately; unauthorized departure is not permitted.

11017607.ContentEN: No.3 is also ready. Go get it!
11017607.Subtitle: No.3 is also ready. Go get it!

11017609.ContentEN: Quick and clean! Well done, kid.
11017609.Subtitle: Quick and clean! Well done, kid.

11017610.ContentEN: The control authority is unlocked. This is the last one!
11017610.Subtitle: The control authority is unlocked. This is the last one!

11017611.ContentEN: <W>WARNING: Phoxichor tank sabotage detected. Anyone held responsible should confess your crime.</>
11017611.Subtitle: WARNING: Phoxichor tank sabotage detected. Anyone held responsible should confess your crime.

11017612.ContentEN: Run! Get behind the safety door!
11017612.Subtitle: Run! Get behind the safety door!

11017613.ContentEN: <W>WARNING: Phoxichor tank sabotage detected. Anyone held responsible should confess your crime.</>
11017613.Subtitle: WARNING: Phoxichor tank sabotage detected. Anyone held responsible should confess your crime.

11017702.ContentEN: Sir, we can get into the sewer tunnels from here.
11017702.Subtitle: Sir, we can get into the sewer tunnels from here.

11017706.ContentEN: Watch out! There's a condenser up ahead. You'll get hurt if you get too close!
11017706.Subtitle: Watch out! There's a condenser up ahead. You'll get hurt if you get too close!

11017707.ContentEN: Sir... Steam produced by the condenser is dangerous. We should not stay too long.
11017707.Subtitle: Sir... Steam produced by the condenser is dangerous. We should not stay too long.

11017708.ContentEN: Huff, huff... It's so hot... Are you okay, sir?
11017708.Subtitle: Huff, huff... It's so hot... Are you okay, sir?

11017712.ContentEN: Thank you for saving our lives! It turned out not all the Imperial soldiers are...
11017712.Subtitle: Thank you for saving our lives! It turned out not all the Imperial soldiers are...

11017713.ContentEN: Ah, sorry! I mean, I used to think that Imperial soldiers were no different from those Forsaken rotters. But now I know I was wrong!
11017713.Subtitle: Ah, sorry! I mean, I used to think that Imperial soldiers were no different from those Forsaken rotters. But now I know I was wrong!

11017802.ContentEN: The view is good. Let's bombard the central control room from here.
11017802.Subtitle: The view is good. Let's bombard the central control room from here.

11017804.ContentEN: Take down the Filthoids first. Don't let them distract you!
11017804.Subtitle: Take down the Filthoids first. Don't let them distract you!

11017806.ContentEN: Next, let's start with the relatively thin <H>side door</>.
11017806.Subtitle: Next, let's start with the relatively thin side door.

11017807.ContentEN: Keep it up! Use the High-Explosive Shells!
11017807.Subtitle: Keep it up! Use the High-Explosive Shells!

11017808.ContentEN: That should do it. Let's go check it out after we get rid of the remaining Filthoids.
11017808.Subtitle: That should do it. Let's go check it out after we get rid of the remaining Filthoids.

11017809.ContentEN: Snap out of it! Keep firing!
11017809.Subtitle: Snap out of it! Keep firing!

11017810.ContentEN: Are you okay? Did you get hurt?
11017810.Subtitle: Are you okay? Did you get hurt?

11017811.ContentEN: By the time you break the door, my baby would've become a granny! Go back to the cannon.
11017811.Subtitle: By the time you break the door, my baby would've become a granny! Go back to the cannon.

11017901.ContentEN: Go, stay in touch, and be careful.
11017901.Subtitle: Go, stay in touch, and be careful.

11017903.Content: 准备好了，就激活髓动轮出发吧。

11018002.ContentEN: We cannot afford any mistakes in our mission moving forward. We have to rule out all the potential risks — this girl and the old man, they should stop here.
11018002.Subtitle: We cannot afford any mistakes in our mission moving forward. We have to rule out all the potential risks — this girl and the old man, they should stop here.

11018003.ContentEN: ...Why? As you can see, there are Filthoids all over this place. If you leave us here, Mr Frank and I will die!
11018003.Subtitle: ...Why? As you can see, there are Filthoids all over this place. If you leave us here, Mr Frank and I will die!

11018004.ContentEN: Sir, please! We offered help, we led you all the way here so you could rendezvous with them... Please... I'm begging you, don't leave us behind!
11018004.Subtitle: Sir, please! We offered help, we led you all the way here so you could rendezvous with them... Please... I'm begging you, don't leave us behind!

11018006.ContentEN: Maybe you're overthinking it, sir. If they were enemies, misleading us in the sewer tunnels would be a better idea, but they didn't do that.
11018006.Subtitle: Maybe you're overthinking it, sir. If they were enemies, misleading us in the sewer tunnels would be a better idea, but they didn't do that.

11018007.ContentEN: What if they're up to something else? Don't you think that they are \"too familiar\" with everything of this fortress along the way?
11018007.Subtitle: What if they're up to something else? Don't you think that they are \"too familiar\" with everything of this fortress along the way?

11018010.ContentEN: I could have trusted you if we haven't got into the central control room. But now it seems to me that you're just \"too familiar\" with this fortress.
11018010.Subtitle: I could have trusted you if we haven't got into the central control room. But now it seems to me that you're just \"too familiar\" with this fortress.

11018011.ContentEN: The central control room is the core of Lonza Fortress, even the Forsakens wouldn't let their enslaved labor hang out in such an essential place.
11018011.Subtitle: The central control room is the core of Lonza Fortress, even the Forsakens wouldn't let their enslaved labor hang out in such an essential place.

11018012.ContentEN: You're not supposed to know the routes so well.
11018012.Subtitle: You're not supposed to know the routes so well.

11018014.ContentEN: If you're so interested in acting, little girl, I suggest you find a job in the Grand Theatre in the capital.
11018014.Subtitle: If you're so interested in acting, little girl, I suggest you find a job in the Grand Theatre in the capital.

11018015.ContentEN: We're running out of time. Let's go. Leon, stay here and keep an eye on them.
11018015.Subtitle: We're running out of time. Let's go. Leon, stay here and keep an eye on them.

20000402.ContentEN: Hey, you! Yes, you! The kid over there.
20000402.Subtitle: Hey, you! Yes, you! The kid over there.

20000502.ContentEN: A girl who looks just like... Snow?
20000502.Subtitle: A girl who looks just like... Snow?

20000504.ContentEN: Who are you calling \"girl\"? The younger generation nowadays is so disrespectful.
20000504.Subtitle: Who are you calling \"girl\"? The younger generation nowadays is so disrespectful.

20000505.ContentEN: You should watch what you say! Although all Lunarians look young, she's actually as old as your great-great-grandmother.
20000505.Subtitle: You should watch what you say! Although all Lunarians look young, she's actually as old as your great-great-grandmother.

20000506.ContentEN: (The young \"girl\" with a hammer had a similar voice and appearance as Snow, but their age and experiences were completely different. <H>Lunos</> are indeed peculiar.)
20000506.Subtitle: (The young \"girl\" with a hammer had a similar voice and appearance as Snow, but their age and experiences were completely different. Lunos are indeed peculiar.)

20000508.ContentEN: Very well. I'll let it slide this time.
20000508.Subtitle: Very well. I'll let it slide this time.

20000510.ContentEN: Never mind, arguing with a youngster isn't worth my time.
20000510.Subtitle: Never mind, arguing with a youngster isn't worth my time.

20000511.ContentEN: Actually, I caught a whiff of something remarkable as you passed by just now.
20000511.Subtitle: Actually, I caught a whiff of something remarkable as you passed by just now.

20000512.ContentEN: That's right. It's the scent of a <H>legendary weapon</>! Do you have any special weapons on you, kiddo?
20000512.Subtitle: That's right. It's the scent of a legendary weapon! Do you have any special weapons on you, kiddo?

20000513.ContentEN: Weapon? This sword is all I have.
20000513.Subtitle: This sword is all I have.

20000515.ContentEN: (She carefully examined the sword, attempting to glean some information from its pattern.)
20000515.Subtitle: (She carefully examined the sword, attempting to glean some information from its pattern.)

20000516.ContentEN: Amazing! That's incredible! Look at the texture and the craftsmanship! This clearly wasn't made by those mediocre Hyperborean blacksmiths. Where did you get it?
20000516.Subtitle: Jesus! That's incredible! Look at the texture and the craftsmanship! This clearly wasn't made by those mediocre Hyperborean blacksmiths. Where did you get it?

20000517.ContentEN: (The Luno blacksmith recognised that this sword was no ordinary weapon.)
20000517.Subtitle: (The Luno blacksmith recognised that this sword was no ordinary weapon. )

20000520.ContentEN: This sword has been with me for as long as I can remember. Maybe it was passed down to me by my parents?
20000520.Subtitle: I got it when I was young. Maybe it was passed down to me by my parents?

20000522.ContentEN: Intriguing. Very intriguing. I've been a blacksmith my whole life, yet I've never seen a weapon like this before.
20000522.Subtitle: Intriguing. Very intriguing. I've been a blacksmith my whole life, yet I've never seen a weapon like this before.

20000523.ContentEN: Kiddo, I'm Lunosmith, a wandering blacksmith. Would you mind if I accompanied you on your journey?
20000523.Subtitle: Kiddo, I'm Lunosmith, a wandering blacksmith. Would you mind if I accompanied you on your journey?

20000524.ContentEN: I've travelled all over the land, from Hyperborea to Elysium, and I've forged countless weapons. If you require any weapons, I'm at your disposal.
20000524.Subtitle: I've travelled all over the land, from Hyperborea to Elysium, and I've forged countless weapons. If you require any weapons, I'm at your disposal.

20000525.ContentEN: Wow! So you're an experienced master blacksmith!
20000525.Subtitle: Wow! So you're an experienced master blacksmith!

20000526.ContentEN: All I request is a basic salary, and an opportunity to examine your sword, hehe.
20000526.Subtitle: All I request is a basic salary, and an opportunity to examine your sword, hehe.

20000528.ContentEN: Look, I can see scepticism written on your face.
20000528.Subtitle: Look, I can see scepticism written on your face.

20000529.ContentEN: You can trust me. You must know the saying, \"Lunos never harm.\" Everyone in Atlasia knows that.
20000529.Subtitle: You can trust me. You must know the saying, \"Lunos never harm.\" Everyone in Atlasia knows that.

20000531.ContentEN: (She was right. You could see that trait in Snow. Besides, what could she get from you? You have nothing to offer.)
20000531.Subtitle: (She was right. You could see that trait in Snow. Besides, what could she get from you? You have nothing to offer.)

20000532.ContentEN: Yeah, you're right. Let's head back together then.
20000532.Subtitle: Yeah, you're right. Let's head back together then.

20000533.ContentEN: So you'll have me? Excellent! Then take me to where you live.
20000533.Subtitle: So you'll have me? Excellent! Then take me to where you live.

20000602.ContentEN: I've seen many who resemble you and Snow. Are they also <H>Lunos</>?
20000602.Subtitle: I've seen many who resemble you and Snow. Are they also Lunos?

20000603.ContentEN: Did you come from a remote village or something, kiddo?
20000603.Subtitle: Did you come from a remote village or something, kiddo?

20000604.ContentEN: Yes, my hometown isn't a big city.
20000604.Subtitle: Yes, my hometown isn't a big city.

20000605.ContentEN: Ha, that explains it. In all my travels, wherever there are humans, Lunos can always be found. It's quite uncommon to come across someone like you who's never heard of us.
20000605.Subtitle: Ha, that explains it. In all my travels, wherever there are humans, Lunos can always be found. It's quite uncommon to come across someone like you who's never heard of us.

20000606.ContentEN: We share a similar appearance. Everyone is as attractive as me. And we live very long lives.
20000606.Subtitle: We share a similar appearance. Everyone is as attractive as me. And we live very long lives.

20000607.ContentEN: Like the master blacksmith, every Luno has a particular forte.
20000607.Subtitle: Like the master blacksmith, every Luno has a particular forte.

20000608.ContentEN: Wow. Then do you have any unique talents, Snow?
20000608.Subtitle: Wow. Do you have any unique talents, Snow?

20000609.ContentEN: Hmm... Yeah... Of course, I do!
20000609.Subtitle: Yeah... Hmm... Of course, I do!

20000610.ContentEN: As you can see, I have demonic appendages on my head. No other Lunos have these!
20000610.Subtitle: As you can see, I have demonic appendages on my head. No other Lunos have these!

20000611.ContentEN: Indeed. In all my years, I've never seen a Luno with horns like those. You look just like those human <H>Charons</>.
20000611.Subtitle: Indeed. In all my years, I've never seen a Luno with horns like those. You look just like those Charons.

20000612.ContentEN: Sooooo, I'm Luno the Demon King, different and unique! Perhaps I was meant to lead the Lunos and dominate the world!
20000612.Subtitle: Sooo, I'm the special and unique Luno the Demon King. Perhaps I was meant to lead the Lunos and dominate the world!

20000614.ContentEN: Unfortunately, most Lunos lack ambition. They'd rather follow the humans, and are content with just a few words of appreciation. But for me, I want so much more!
20000614.Subtitle: Unfortunately, most Lunos lack ambition. They'd rather follow the humans, and are content with just a few words of appreciation. But for me, I want so much more!

20000615.ContentEN: My little minion, you must stick with me. After I conquer the world, you'll be the leader of my legion! Just you wait and see!
20000615.Subtitle: My little minion, you must stick with me. After I conquer the world, you'll be the leader of my legion! Just you wait and see!

20000618.ContentEN: Hmm... How about 20 letters of praise written by this Demon King? Anyway, we can talk about the details when the time comes. All you need to know is that I'll never let you down.
20000618.OptionTopic: 你说的那个军团长给开多少工钱啊？
20000618.Subtitle: Hmm... How about 20 letters of praise written by this Demon King? Anyway, we can talk about the details when the time comes. All you need to know is that I'll never let you down.

20000620.ContentEN: (Wow, so unique and different from other Lunos...)
20000620.Subtitle: (Wow, so unique and different from other Lunos...)

20000805.ContentEN: I promised to come check up on you, remember?

20000807.ContentEN: Your eyes... are you having trouble seeing things again, like what happened at the pit?

20000808.ContentEN: Yeah, my vision's a bit blurry again... Don't worry, it's just an old problem acting up.

20000809.ContentEN: I might be a bit tired. A few days' rest should help.

20000810.ContentEN: Why were you sighing to yourself here all alone?

20000811.ContentEN: Why did you sigh at the flowers?

20000812.ContentEN: I'd love to, but Mr Henrik told me to stay inside, so... Oh! Now that you're here...

20000815.ContentEN: The potted plant here... Can you describe for me how well the flowers are blooming?

20000816.ContentEN: (You observed the flowers. They don't look very healthy. The stems and leaves are yellowing and the petals lack their usual lustre.)

20000818.ContentEN: ...Thank you for saying that to make me feel better, but...

20000819.ContentEN: I touched it and the petals felt wrinkled. I don't think the flowers are doing well.

20000820.ContentEN: Could you take a closer look? The well-being of flowers hinges on careful observation, but I can't do that now...

20000821.ContentEN: The flowers are bright yellow... A very vibrant hue.

20000822.ContentEN: Mm, I love yellow flowers. They remind me of the sun and warm my heart...

20000823.ContentEN: The petals don't have smooth edges. Instead, there are plenty of irregular gaps running along the margins.

20000824.ContentEN: Right... Try touching the petals softly. I love running my fingers along the edges of petals. Every petal feels different as if they have their own story to tell...

20000825.ContentEN: But these petals seem to have lost their shine. The edges are dark and curled, as though they've been burnt...

20000826.ContentEN: Hmm... I believe the flowers are thirsting for some water.

20000827.ContentEN: The petals have soft stripes that radiate from the center outward, somewhat resembling the veins of the leaves. However, they seem not to be very plump...

20000828.ContentEN: The stripes deliver nutrients and function just like the veins of the leaves.

20000829.ContentEN: Although the flowers usually steal our attention, they're not that different when compared to leaves. Both parts of the plant are doing their best to respire and grow.

20000830.ContentEN: Let me see... If they look shrivelled, they may be low on nutrients.

20000831.ContentEN: I think I understand the issue now, thank you.

20000832.ContentEN: Is this kind of flower hard to care for?

20000833.ContentEN: No, it's quite resilient actually — it can even thrive in places with long winters, like Icelake.

20000834.ContentEN: As long as it is well trimmed, fertilised, and given the proper humidity and temperature, it can bloom beautifully for weeks on end... But I didn't do it well. I'm far from being as good a florist as my parents.

20000835.ContentEN: You might be right, but... oh, wait, {nickname}! Something just occurred to me.

20000836.ContentEN: I've grown it the same way as my parents did, and it's always been in Icelake, so the environment should be consistent... Ah, I get it!

20000839.ContentEN: Yes. Dad used to gather special soil from a cave beyond Icelake for our plants.

20000840.ContentEN: He mentioned that the special soil is more fertile than the others. Perhaps I can go there and—

20000841.ContentEN: ...Um, forget it. I'll worry about this later...

20000842.ContentEN: Don't worry, I can collect some for you.

20000843.ContentEN: You don't have to do that... Just coming here and talking with me is already—

20000844.ContentEN: It's okay, I'll have to leave town for the commissions anyway. Gathering soil isn't that hard. So where's that cave you mentioned?

20000846.ContentEN: I was about to say thank you, but I think we're beyond such formalities with each other.

20000847.ContentEN: Let me give you the location of the cave.

20000901.ContentEN: Psyche, here's the soil from that cave. Does it look right?

20000902.ContentEN: Hmm... Its touch is exactly like that of the soil Dad used to grow flowers with.

20000903.ContentEN: And there's so much of it... This should be enough to help every plant thrive here.

20000904.ContentEN: I'm glad you're happy. This trip was totally worth it.

20000905.ContentEN: (Psyche is lost in happiness as she feels the soil in her hand. You suddenly remember the flower — the one that Psyche gave you.)

20000906.ContentEN: (You take out the flower and it rests peacefully on your palm. Though much time has passed since you received it, its petals remain immaculate.)

20000907.ContentEN: Aww, it's that flower I gave you... And you've been carrying it around all this time.

20000908.ContentEN: Of course, it's a precious gift. You love these flowers, don't you? Is it okay for you to pluck one from the plant and give it away?

20000909.ContentEN: Hmm... I was not, when I was little.

20000910.ContentEN: Have you seen freshly cut flowers sold at the florists? I never liked that practice... It always made me feel sorry for the flowers.

20000911.ContentEN: Flowers, stems, and leaves all belong to the same plant, yet people cut the flowers to admire their beauty, leaving them to wilt and die alone.

20000912.ContentEN: It does seem so, from our perspective...

20000913.ContentEN: You said when you were little... Does that mean you feel differently now?

20000915.ContentEN: Can I ask you something first? What do you think about flowers that are plucked from their plants?

20000916.ContentEN: I'm glad I gave you the flower. I knew you'd take good care of it.

20000917.ContentEN: Hmm... I understand. That's what I thought.

20000918.ContentEN: You feel the same way I did when I was little.

20000919.ContentEN: Now, when I see cut flowers, I still feel a bit sad. But over the years, I've come to realise that they are amazing — far more amazing than I thought.

20000920.ContentEN: A plucked flower would no longer bear fruit. It's fated to perish in a slow, wilting death...

20000921.ContentEN: Yet it tries to absorb water, as if still rooted, blooming fully before its brief life fades.

20000922.ContentEN: I no longer pity them — I'm impressed by them.

20000924.ContentEN: You have a kind soul... And yes, you're right — it might be best not to cut them at all.

20000925.ContentEN: Oh, just listen to how sombre and heavy our conversation has become. That wasn't my intention...

20000926.ContentEN: Anyway, the soil you brought back is great. The wetness and softness are perfect... You might have a real knack for gardening!

20000927.ContentEN: Certainly! I'd be delighted to share all the gardening secrets I know! ...If time allows.

20000929.ContentEN: {nickname}... you are such a wonderful person.

20000930.ContentEN: Apart from my parents, nobody else has ever taken my casual remarks so seriously or done so much for a simple plant.

20000931.ContentEN: Please, take this as a token of my appreciation. It's not much, but I hope you'll accept it.

20000932.ContentEN: Do come back and admire these flowers when they bloom once more.

20001001.ContentEN: The soil here feels dry... perhaps I should look elsewhere.

20001201.ContentEN: Found it...! The soil is soft and the wetness feels right. I should collect more.

20001301.ContentEN: {nickname}, did you manage to find the soil?

20001303.ContentEN: It's alright. You don't need to go to all this trouble for me...

20001401.ContentEN: Oh, before I forget — I have a couple of questions:

20001402.ContentEN: Have you ever stood under the Heaventree? Are the legends really true — is the Heaventree so massive that its crown covers the entire sky? Could we see... a glittering canopy of crystals looking up its trunk?

20001403.ContentEN: And... and another question — is the sandy beach really as soft and smooth as they say — malleable like dough, and not at all rough on the feet?

20001404.ContentEN: Sorry for bombarding you with so many questions! I'm asking for my friends at the inn... Hehe, they are all very fascinated by your hometown.

20001501.ContentEN: Okay... This should be enough. Time to head back and bring it to Psyche.

20001603.Content: 赛琪怎么还没出来，我们去瞅瞅吧。【临时版】

20001701.ContentEN: Stopping a Deteriorator won't be an easy task. Make sure you're well-prepared before heading out of the city to look for Psyche.

20001801.ContentEN: Waah... The wind's gonna blow me away!

20001802.ContentEN: Stay behind us, Snow. We make our moves when it calms a little.

20001803.ContentEN: And if the wind gets strong, we can stay behind the rocks to take a little break. Don't rush in.

20001901.ContentEN: There's a storm blowing over the frozen lake. It should be the direction Psyche has headed to...

20002001.ContentEN: ...Butterflies? How come there are butterflies in such a coldness?

20002002.ContentEN: And it seems as if... they are leading the way for us...

20002101.ContentEN: These Filthoids are half-dead, probably defeated by Psyche.

20002102.ContentEN: So if we trace them all the way back, we might be able to find Psyche...

20002203.Content: 外面情况怎么样？【临时版】

20002204.Content: 刮了好大的风，秽兽的行为也很反常。【临时版】

20002301.ContentEN: (Psyche has lost her senses, and is till fighting against Deterioration... We need to do something...)

20002401.ContentEN: ...Psyche seems to have rushed out of the city.

20002402.ContentEN: Because there are fewer people there, right? She tried to keep herself from the crowd with her last shred of sanity.

20002501.ContentEN: Are you... going to find Psyche?

20002502.ContentEN: Once you find her, please, end her pains. I think she would want you to do the same...

20002601.ContentEN: Papa, that young lady just swooshed by. How did she do that?

20002602.ContentEN: Ssh, drop it and get back into the city! That is a Deteriorator!

20002603.ContentEN: Don...Don't panic... The Escort will be here soon!

20002604.ContentEN: Don't you slip into the city amidst the chaos! Show your travel permit first!

20002605.ContentEN: Please, let us in. We did accidentally lose our travel permit!

20002606.ContentEN: All you can think of is that damn travel permit! We must get in, or we'll die here!

20002607.ContentEN: Stop! I said stop! One step closer and I'll shoot!

20002608.ContentEN: Go ahead! Make the damn noise and draw the Deteriorator here to kill you too!

20002609.ContentEN: You... Fine, just get in. I'll get to you after the Escort has taken care of the Deteriorator.

20002701.ContentEN: The wind is strong... Taking a direct jump could get us blown away.

20002702.ContentEN: Over there, we could use the lift.

20002801.ContentEN: It's okay, we already know where Psyche has gone. All we have to do is follow her track.

20002802.ContentEN: Right! As long as we can find Psyche, there's gotta be a way to save her!

20002901.ContentEN: (I've filled in Outsider and Snow on everything that happened today.)

20002902.ContentEN: (Now, all that's left to do is get to the meeting spot... and wait.)

20003302.ContentEN: Hm? Oh, it's you. See you tonight.

20004501.ContentEN: My dearest child, thank you for coming into the world.

20004502.ContentEN: You are the pride of our lives.

20004503.ContentEN: Psyche, pinky promise. We'll be best friends for life!

20004504.ContentEN: I'll remember that you've lived in this world.

20004506.ContentEN: Fate, please have mercy on me. Let me help her fulfill this wish.
20004506.Subtitle: Fate, please have mercy on me. Let me help her fulfill this wish.

20004507.ContentEN: Take this flower with you. It will bring you good luck.
20004507.Subtitle: Take this flower with you. It will bring you good luck.

20004508.ContentEN: You'll go to a small island, where you can build a house by the sea and grow white flowers around it.
20004508.Subtitle: You'll go to a small island, where you can build a house by the sea and grow white flowers around it.

20004509.ContentEN: Psyche, I'm here to take you home.

20004702.ContentEN: Well, it's made from scrap, after all. I was surprised that it would work!

21000101.Content: 背白白进场台词（测试用）

21000102.Content: 背白白退场台词（测试用）

50000101.ContentEN: Travel permit check — oi, I'm talking to you! Got your travel permit on you?
50000101.Subtitle: Travel permit check — oi, I'm talking to you! Got your travel permit on you?

50000201.ContentEN: A Phoxhunter? Can't believe anyone would still make it here. You've got what it takes to be a hero like them, I guess.
50000201.Subtitle: A Phoxhunter? Can't believe anyone would still make it here. You've got what it takes to be a hero like them, I guess.

50000301.ContentEN: D*mn it, it's all Grandet's fault! What am I supposed to do now... Hm? What are you looking at? I've got no work for you today!
50000301.Subtitle: D*mn it, it's all Grandet's fault! What am I supposed to do now... Hm? What are you looking at? I've got no work for you today!

50000501.ContentEN: Once I've recovered, I will start my next adventure.
50000501.Subtitle: As soon as I'm back in form, I'm off on another adventure.

50000601.ContentEN: What gift should I get for Elsa... She must've missed me terribly.
50000601.Subtitle: What gift should I get for Elsa... She must've missed me terribly.

50000801.ContentEN: The flowers today are quite lovely. I should save a few for that kid.
50000801.Subtitle: The flowers today are quite lovely. I should save a few for that kid.

50000901.ContentEN: Good day, you look great with this flower... That kid would have said so, if she were still here.
50000901.Subtitle: Good day, you look great with this flower... That kid would have said so, if she were still here.

50001001.ContentEN: Hello, gorgeous! I bet you'd be a vision in our apparel.
50001001.Subtitle: Hello, gorgeous! I bet you'd be a vision in our apparel.

50001101.ContentEN: Try these fine fruits from our orchard — grown with unmatched cultivation techniques!
50001101.Subtitle: Try these fine fruits from our orchard — grown with unmatched cultivation techniques!

50001301.ContentEN: Hmm... I've made up my mind — hello, Test subject No. 1!
50001301.Subtitle: Hmm... I've made up my mind — hello, Test subject No. 1!

50001401.ContentEN: {Nickname}, lovely to see you again! I'm trying my best to learn new things every day, let's keep at it!
50001401.Subtitle: , lovely to see you again! I'm trying my best to learn new things every day, let's keep at it!

50001601.ContentEN:
I've witnessed deeds that daylight never sees, and not all are the work of \"demons\".\
...Sometimes, between humans and Charons, I can't tell which is the true demon.
50001601.Subtitle:
I've witnessed deeds that daylight never sees, and not all are the work of \"demons\".\
...Sometimes, between humans and Charons, I can't tell which is the true demon.

50001701.ContentEN: Pah! Stupid hag! Let's see how long you can keep this charade up!
50001701.Subtitle: Pah! Stupid hag! Let's see how long you can keep this charade up!

50001801.ContentEN: Good grief! Who'd have thought a gentle soul like myself would be beset by an inspiration-stealing spectre?! Such wretchedness would surely draw heaven's own tears!
50001801.Subtitle: Good grief! Who'd have thought a gentle soul like myself would be beset by an inspiration-stealing spectre?! Such wretchedness would surely draw heaven's own tears!

50001901.ContentEN: What a drag! Who arranged these pointless events? I'd rather have half a day off!
50001901.Subtitle: What a drag! Who arranged these pointless events? I'd rather have half a day off!

50002001.ContentEN: \"The rain hurt Mum's flowers, so the sky said sorry by leaving her lots of tiny flowers in the puddles.\"
50002001.Subtitle: \"The rain hurt Mum's flowers, so the sky said sorry by leaving her lots of tiny flowers in the puddles.\"

50002002.ContentEN: You know what, this little verse is called \"Apology\", and it's written by a six-year-old student of mine.
50002002.Subtitle: You know what, this little verse is called \"Apology\", and it's written by a six-year-old student of mine.

50002101.ContentEN: The rocks cast against the laws of nature will inevitably fall back on one's own head.
50002101.Subtitle: The rocks cast against the laws of nature will inevitably fall back on one's own head.

50002201.ContentEN: Where could he have gone off to...
50002201.Subtitle: Where could he have gone off to...

50002301.ContentEN: I hope tonight's creamy mushroom soup will bring some comfort to her ladyship.
50002301.Subtitle: I hope tonight's creamy mushroom soup will bring some comfort to her ladyship.

50002401.ContentEN: Poor thing, having lost her mind like that.
50002401.Subtitle: Poor thing, having lost her mind like that.

50002402.ContentEN: No wonder her daughter had left.
50002402.Subtitle: No wonder her daughter had left.

50002501.ContentEN: I oversee all the rubbish bins around the city, and oh, the treasures to be found in each of them! Nearly new deerskin boots, still-fresh lilies, and the fragments of someone's shattered dreams...
50002501.Subtitle: I oversee all the rubbish bins around the city, and oh, the treasures to be found in each of them! Nearly new deerskin boots, still-fresh lilies, and the fragments of someone's shattered dreams...

50002601.ContentEN: The train to the next station is about to depart. Please process your ticket purchase here — What's that? You've got no money? Then less dreaming, more moving, if you please!
50002601.Subtitle: The train to the next station is about to depart. Please process your ticket purchase here — What's that? You've got no money? Then less dreaming, more moving, if you please!

50002701.ContentEN: Pipe No. 13 is under repair — blimey, it's swarming with rats in there.
50002701.Subtitle: Pipe No. 13 is under repair — blimey, it's swarming with rats in there.

50002901.ContentEN: Ugh... why won't this bloodstain come off?
50002901.Subtitle: Ugh... why won't this bloodstain come off?

50003001.Content: 凶猛的狼咆哮着 撕咬着狡猾的狗

50003002.Content: 狡猾的狗呜咽着 啃食着腐朽的肉

50003201.ContentEN: ♪ \"Monsters beyond the walls feast on our flesh; the ones within shear our fleece. While the hounds dine on fine white loaves; we lowly sheep are content with chewing grass...\"
50003201.Subtitle: ♪ \"Monsters beyond the walls feast on our flesh; the ones within shear our fleece. While the hounds dine on fine white loaves; we lowly sheep are content with chewing grass...\"

50003202.ContentEN: Whoa, whoa! Where did you learn that ditty... you're going to get us both killed one of these days!
50003202.Subtitle: Whoa, whoa! Where did you learn that ditty... you're going to get us both killed one of these days!

50003203.ContentEN: Ah, welcome! What can I get you, dear customer? Each piece here is crafted by my own hands, top-notch quality guaranteed!
50003203.Subtitle: Ah, welcome! What can I get you, dear customer? Each piece here is crafted by my own hands, top-notch quality guaranteed!

50003301.Content: 真好呀！真好！生活这么美好，怎么大家都愁眉苦脸的呢？我们生活在一个幸福的世界里，多么幸运！

50003401.Content: 呜呜……爸爸妈妈，你们在哪里……我好想你们……

50003501.Content: 这是我在广场那边买的纪念品！他们说来冰湖城绝不能错过……

50003601.Content: 求您了……再多给两个子儿吧，只给这个数，我连过冬的炭火都买不起啊……

50003602.Content: 子爵大人要最好的皮料！要从最健壮的头狼身上剥下的顶级货！懂了吗蠢蛋！你的这些残次品只配给乞丐穿！

50003701.ContentEN: Popcorn! Cigs! Booze! Lost something, you say? Didn't see it! I swear!
50003701.Subtitle: Popcorn! Cigs! Booze! Lost something, you say? Didn't see it! I swear!

50003801.ContentEN: If every Charon could live as long as I have, I wouldn't feel so alone.
50003801.Subtitle: If every Charon could live as long as I have, I wouldn't feel so alone.

50003901.ContentEN: Welcome! And don't worry about my broken arm — I can still get you anything you need. So, what will it be?

50004101.ContentEN: I've yet again been commissioned recently. Let's go with the usual 80-20 split and head out after I finish this bottle. What do you say?

50004201.ContentEN: You'll never run dry on deals or drinks in The Asphodel.

50004301.ContentEN: ♪ \"Nightingale, broken wings, you can weep you can sleep...\"

50004302.ContentEN: ♪ \"Nightingale, rise above, you will free you will see...\"

50004401.ContentEN: S-Scoot if you ain't buying any Phoxene... Lest your presence draws the soldiers' attention to us...

50004501.ContentEN: Dance! Find your own groove! What's the meaning of life, you ask? Into the bin with all the stress and the fuss, and let's dance the night away!

50004601.ContentEN: Sir, about this month's Imperial pension... Oh, you haven't received approval for that yet? *cough* *cough*... It's okay, I'll put my own money down first... Sorry to trouble you...

50004701.ContentEN: Treasure the intel, never miss the thrill!

50004801.ContentEN: Come join the Fishermen's Mutual Aid Society, let's hook the fun!

50004901.ContentEN: Properly disinfected, it can become a delicious dish!

50005101.ContentEN: When his side quest is complete: What do you want?

50005201.ContentEN: Stay true to yourself. stay true to yourself... Ugh, what am I supposed to do to stay true to myself...

50005301.ContentEN: The train to the next station is about to depart. Please process your ticket purchase here — What's that? You've got no money? Then less dreaming, more moving, if you please!

50005401.ContentEN: Hahaha, she's running so fast, faster than a mouse!

50005501.ContentEN: Stinky Charon, what are you waiting for? Go after your little brat!

50005601.ContentEN: Should we get a bigger board...

51000101.ContentEN: Hmm, I think I'll make cream of mushroom soup tonight... Ah, what a lovely child you are.

51000102.ContentEN: (The elderly woman gives your head a hearty pat with her large hand and then pinches your cheek. Her overwhelming enthusiasm leaves you a bit flustered.)

51000103.ContentEN: Here, have some of this cream of mushroom soup! It's a special recipe from Scarletriver — I bet you've never had anything quite like it.

51000104.ContentEN: (Without waiting for your response, she sets a steaming bowl of soup in front of you, and you half-expect her to spoon-feed you right there—)

51000105.ContentEN: (The rich, creamy broth soothes your throat, bringing a comforting warmth.)

51000106.ContentEN: It's good, isn't it? Aunt Sally never disappoints, haha!

51000107.ContentEN: Ungrateful brat! You don't know what's good for you.

51000108.ContentEN: Ever since her ladyship was a little girl, she has loved my soups — it's been almost forty years.

51000109.ContentEN: *sighs* Her ladyship... I wonder if she'll ever get better.

51000110.ContentEN: (The smile slowly fades from the old woman's eyes, replaced by glistening tears.)

51000111.ContentEN: Yeah, she's getting worse day by day... *sigh* She left the comforts of Scarletriver for this frozen wasteland, and I couldn't persuade her to go home no matter what.

51000112.ContentEN: She's still obsessed with something that happened forty years ago, asking around town every day, and she won't let me help her.

51000113.ContentEN: Well, I must get back to my chores now!

51000114.ContentEN: (She mentioned a lady in search of something... If you come across her, it might be worth your attention.)

51000190.ContentEN: I can't cure her heartache, so I make different soups every day, hoping to at least make her feel better with tasty food.

51000201.ContentEN: I hope tonight's cream of mushroom soup brings her ladyship some comfort... Ah, you're back, child.

51000202.ContentEN: (The elderly woman gives your head a hearty pat with her large hand and then pinches your cheek. Her overwhelming enthusiasm leaves you a bit flustered.)

51000203.ContentEN: Here, have some of this cream of mushroom soup! It's a special recipe from Scarletriver — I bet you've never had anything quite like it.

51000204.ContentEN: (Without waiting for your response, she sets a steaming bowl of soup in front of you, and you half-expect her to spoon-feed you right there—)

51000205.ContentEN: (The rich, creamy broth soothes your throat, bringing a comforting warmth.)

51000206.ContentEN: It's good, isn't it? Aunt Sally never disappoints, haha!

51000207.ContentEN: Ungrateful brat! You don't know what's good for you.

51000208.ContentEN: Ever since her ladyship was a little girl, she has loved my soups — it's been almost forty years.

51000209.ContentEN: *sigh* Her ladyship... I wonder if she'll ever get better.

51000210.ContentEN: (The smile slowly fades from the old woman's eyes, replaced by glistening tears.)

51000301.ContentEN: Where could he have gone off to...

51000302.ContentEN: (The old lady's sorrowful gaze lingers in the distance, oblivious to your approach.)

51000303.ContentEN: (Her attire, though slightly worn, is crafted from fine fabric and exquisitely tailored, indicating an affluent background.)

51000304.ContentEN: (She gazes beyond the city gates, seemingly waiting for someone's return.)

51000305.ContentEN: (Her aged eyes are filled with sorrow, seemingly bearing the weight of a long and hopeless wait.)

51000306.ContentEN: (The old woman glances at you briefly before turning away, seemingly uninterested in conversation.)

51000308.ContentEN: I haven't seen you before. Are you from a nearby village?

51000309.ContentEN: Have you ever come across a Charon man named Hamel Dickinson? He's an Icelake local, light brown hair, about nineteen years old, wears... Oh, no, I think he'd be about my age now.

51000310.ContentEN: I left Icelake forty years ago and lost touch with him ever since. Now I'm back, but I haven't found any trace of him.

51000311.ContentEN: He was born and raised here in Icelake, so I figure, even if he doesn't live here anymore, he can't be far. Young one, have you seen him around?

51000313.ContentEN: If you do see him someday, could you pass on a message?

51000314.ContentEN: \"Hilin has returned to Icelake. She's been waiting for you and an explanation that is forty years overdue.\"

51000315.ContentEN: If you don't see him until next year, ask him why he's forty-one years late. If it's the year after, it'll be forty-two... I've been keeping count.

51000316.ContentEN: (Lady Hilin looks deeply distressed, likely the lady Ms Sally mentioned. There might be a way to help them both.)

51000402.ContentEN: Ah, you're back, my dear daughter!
51000402.Subtitle: Ah, you're back, my dear daughter!

51000403.ContentEN: (A woman stops you. Her dry, vacant eyes roam over you, as if desperately searching for something inside of you.)
51000403.Subtitle: (A woman stops you. Her dry, vacant eyes roam over you, as if desperately searching for something inside of you.)

51000404.ContentEN: I knew you'd come back! How could you leave me like that!
51000404.Subtitle: I knew you'd come back! How could you leave me like that!

51000405.ContentEN: (The woman is lost in her own world, and no matter what you say, it's futile.)
51000405.Subtitle: (The woman is lost in her own world, and no matter what you say, it's futile.)

51000406.ContentEN: You just said you're not Annie...
51000406.Subtitle: You just said you're not Annie...

51000407.ContentEN: It's all my fault! I pushed Annie away... She's all I have, it's been just us two all along. I'll do anything for you if you find my baby!
51000407.Subtitle: It's all my fault! I pushed Annie away... She's all I have, it's been just us two all along. I'll do anything for you if you find my baby!

51000408.ContentEN: Thank you. Thank you so much...
51000408.Subtitle: Thank you. Thank you so much...

51000490.ContentEN: ...Annie, what are you talking about? Mum's made your favourite, Borealberry Salad and Cream Pudding...
51000490.Subtitle: ...Annie, what are you talking about? Mum's made your favourite, Borealberry Salad and Cream Pudding...

51000491.ContentEN: Come back home, sweetheart. Mum won't be hard on you anymore, no more forcing you into being a lady of high society. All I want is for my baby to be safe...
51000491.Subtitle: Come back home, sweetheart. Mum won't be hard on you anymore, no more forcing you into being a lady of high society. All I want is for my baby to be safe...

51000492.ContentEN: (The woman appears deeply distressed, seemingly having lost her daughter. Try to gently calm her down.)
51000492.Subtitle: (The woman appears deeply distressed, seemingly having lost her daughter. Try to gently calm her down.)

51000493.ContentEN: (You're merely humouring her. Now, better gently coax her into calmness. It appears she has lost her daughter.)
51000493.Subtitle: (You're merely humouring her. Now, better gently coax her into calmness. It appears she has lost her daughter.)

51000502.ContentEN: My goodness! Have you found Annie?
51000502.Subtitle: My goodness! Have you found Annie?

51000505.ContentEN: How do you think a child can manage without her mother...
51000505.Subtitle: How do you think a child can manage without her mother...

51000506.ContentEN: (Elsa strides off, as if ushered by an unseen force, her tears mingling with a smile on her weary face, vanishing into the distance soon.)
51000506.Subtitle: (Elsa strides off, as if ushered by an unseen force, her tears mingling with a smile on her weary face, vanishing into the distance soon.)

51000507.ContentEN: (In her haste, she leaves behind a small box — meant as a gift for the kind soul who helps seek out her daughter. After your endeavours on her behalf, this reward is duly yours.)
51000507.Subtitle: (In her haste, she leaves behind a small box — meant as a gift for the kind soul who helps seek out her daughter. After your endeavours on her behalf, this reward is duly yours.)

51000590.ContentEN: I've been a terrible mother — how could I just wait here for others to help me? My Annie must've waited for me for so long... It's okay, I'll set off to find her now... I'll find my baby on my own...
51000590.Subtitle: I've been a terrible mother — how could I just wait here for others to help me? My Annie must've waited for me for so long... It's okay, I'll set off to find her now... I'll find my baby on my own...

51000591.ContentEN: My Annie... My sweet Annie, she'd never leave her mother like this! You're lying, you dirty liar!
51000591.Subtitle: My Annie... My sweet Annie, she'd never leave her mother like this! You're lying, you dirty liar!

51000602.ContentEN: Oh my God, miracles do happen...
51000602.Subtitle: Oh my God, miracles do happen...

51000603.ContentEN: Let Mum have a good look at you, sweetie... I've missed you so much that I almost lost my mind! Hm? You seem a bit different... Much thinner than before...
51000603.Subtitle: Let Mum have a good look at you, sweetie... I've missed you so much that I almost lost my mind! Hm? You seem a bit different... Much thinner than before...

51000604.ContentEN: It's okay, I've made your favourite Borealberry Salad and Cream Pudding; let's go home, my baby, everything's okay now...
51000604.Subtitle: It's okay, I've made your favourite Borealberry Salad and Cream Pudding; let's go home, my baby, everything's okay now...

51000605.ContentEN: (Tears of joy stream down the woman's face as she utters her gratitude repeatedly. After the tears dry, a mother and a child will live happily ever after... hopefully.)
51000605.Subtitle: Bless you, kind soul. This is for you. I thought I'd never see my Annie again. Thank you, thank you so much...

51000606.ContentEN: My precious daughter... As long as you don't leave me, I'll do anything for you...
51000606.Subtitle: My precious daughter... As long as you don't leave me, I'll do anything for you...

51000690.ContentEN: (Tears of joy stream down the woman's face as she utters her gratitude repeatedly. After the tears dry, a mother and a child will live happily ever after... hopefully.)
51000690.Subtitle: (Tears of joy stream down the woman's face as she utters her gratitude repeatedly. After the tears dry, a mother and a child will live happily ever after... hopefully.)

51000702.ContentEN: I... my head's all foggy. I don't know who I am or where I am...
51000702.Subtitle: I... my head's all foggy. I don't know who I am or where I am...

51000703.ContentEN: I was rescued by a kind travelling doctor from the snowy mountains up north. He said I had suffered a severe fever, which impaired my memory...
51000703.Subtitle: I was rescued by a kind travelling doctor from the snowy mountains up north. He said I had suffered a severe fever, which impaired my memory...

51000705.ContentEN: The only thing I could remember these past few days was the relentless blizzard as I struggled to make my way across the mountain... But right now I'm in no condition to go anywhere. Could you help me with the investigation?
51000705.Subtitle: The only thing I could remember these past few days was the relentless blizzard as I struggled to make my way across the mountain... But right now I'm in no condition to go anywhere. Could you help me with the investigation?

51000706.ContentEN: Apart from the kind doctor who saved me, you are the only one willing to offer a helping hand to a penniless girl like me. I don't know what else to say but thank you...
51000706.Subtitle:
Apart from the kind doctor who saved me, you are the only one willing to offer a helping hand to a penniless girl like me.\
I don't know what else to say but thank you...

51000790.ContentEN: Oh, the doctor said he found this letter on me, though I have no memory of it... This might serve as a clue, hopefully.
51000790.Subtitle: Oh, the doctor said he found this letter on me, though I have no memory of it... This might serve as a clue, hopefully.

51000791.ContentEN: (The threads begin to connect between the two individuals you've recently come across — Ms Elsa, who's been driven near to madness in search of her daughter, and this amnesiac girl. And then there's the letter, seemingly penned to a mother.)
51000791.Subtitle: (The threads begin to connect between the two individuals you've recently come across — Ms Elsa, who's been driven near to madness in search of her daughter, and this amnesiac girl. And then there's the letter, seemingly penned to a mother.)

51000792.ContentEN: (The thought crosses your mind that the girl bereft of memory might very well be Elsa's missing daughter, Annie.)
51000792.Subtitle: (The thought crosses your mind that the girl bereft of memory might very well be Elsa's missing daughter, Annie.)

51000793.ContentEN: (Intuition suggests bringing her to Elsa for recognition, yet Elsa's delusion leads her to see Annie in every youthful face... Gathering more substantial evidence of the girl's identity seems the prudent course at the moment.)
51000793.Subtitle: (Intuition suggests bringing her to Elsa for recognition, yet Elsa's delusion leads her to see Annie in every youthful face... Gathering more substantial evidence of the girl's identity seems the prudent course at the moment.)

51000801.ContentEN: You've returned safely. Did you find anything?
51000801.Subtitle: You've returned safely. Did you find anything?

51000802.ContentEN: (The girl standing before you is all alone, and Ms Elsa has been driven to the brink of madness by her daughter's disappearance... You find yourself wishing she were Annie.)
51000802.Subtitle: (The girl standing before you is all alone, and Ms Elsa has been driven to the brink of madness by her daughter's disappearance... You find yourself wishing she were Annie.)

51000804.ContentEN: ...It's all coming back to me now...
51000804.Subtitle: ...It's all coming back to me now...

51000805.ContentEN: My name is Alice, I'm an archaeology student from Iserl...
51000805.Subtitle: My name is Alice, I'm an archaeology student from Iserl...

51000806.ContentEN: I was conducting a survey in the Vidofnir Mountains when I got caught in a snowstorm that lasted for days, and soon I lost my way...
51000806.Subtitle: I was conducting a survey in the Vidofnir Mountains when I got caught in a snowstorm that lasted for days, and soon I lost my way...

51000807.ContentEN: Later on, I met Annie, who was clinging to life by a mere thread. Together, we struggled to live on for several days. We encouraged each other to try to survive, and she invited me to visit her home in Icelake after the storm...
51000807.Subtitle: Later on, I met Annie, who was clinging to life by a mere thread. Together, we struggled to live on for several days. We encouraged each other to try to survive, and she invited me to visit her home in Icelake after the storm...

51000808.ContentEN: But she was so seriously injured and didn't make it... In the end, she gave me her coat, hoping that I would make it out of the snowy mountains alive...
51000808.Subtitle:
But she was so seriously injured and didn't make it... In the end, she gave me her coat,\
hoping that I would make it out of the snowy mountains alive...

51000810.ContentEN: Thank you... I will always remember Annie.
51000810.Subtitle: Thank you... I will always remember Annie.

51000811.ContentEN: (Alice gently strokes the clothing which is a testament of one girl protecting the other. You bid farewell to Alice and get ready to tell Elsa the truth.)
51000811.Subtitle:
(Alice gently strokes the clothing which is a testament of one girl protecting the other.)\
(You bid farewell to Alice and get ready to tell Elsa the truth.)

51000812.ContentEN: Once I've recovered, I will start my next adventure.
51000812.Subtitle: Once I've recovered, I will start my next adventure.
