51000813.ContentEN: Your name is Annie. I've found your mother, and that letter you're carrying is meant for her.
51000813.Subtitle: Your name is Annie. I've found your mother, and that letter you're carrying is meant for her.

51000814.ContentEN: Thank you! She must be worried about me.
51000814.Subtitle: Thank you! She must be worried about me.

51000815.ContentEN: Once my mother gets better, I'll take her to see the beauty in the great outdoors!
51000815.Subtitle: Once my mother gets better, I'll take her to see the beauty in the great outdoors!

51000890.ContentEN: (Recalling Elsa's words about how she and her daughter were the only two in their family, a dreadful thought crosses your mind — if you had <H>never seen</> Alice's diary...)
51000890.Subtitle: (Recalling Elsa's words about how she and her daughter were the only two in their family, a dreadful thought crosses your mind — if you had <H>never seen</> Alice's diary...)

51000891.ContentEN: (Then the girl would have a warm hearth to return to, and Elsa would have her \"daughter\" back. <H>This seems like the perfect ending — except, they both have the right to know the truth...</>)
51000891.Subtitle: (Then the girl would have a warm hearth to return to, and Elsa would have her \"daughter\" back. <H>This seems like the perfect ending — except, they both have the right to know the truth...</>)

51000892.ContentEN: (The dilemma stands: to unveil the harsh truth or perpetuate the comforting falsehood?)
51000892.Subtitle: (The dilemma stands: to unveil the harsh truth or perpetuate the comforting falsehood?)

51000894.ContentEN: Annie... So that's my name. Has a strange ring to it...
51000894.Subtitle: Annie... So that's my name. Has a strange ring to it...

51000895.ContentEN: Sorry, I really don't remember a thing... Thank you, really, thank you so much! Could you take me to my mother? She will definitely give you a ton of thank-you gifts!
51000895.Subtitle: Sorry, I really don't remember a thing... Thank you, really, thank you so much! Could you take me to my mother? She will definitely give you a ton of thank-you gifts!

51000901.ContentEN: A new customer! What brings you here? But if you're looking for some fun, you've come to the right place with Martin!
51000901.Subtitle: A new customer! What brings you here? But if you're looking for some fun, you've come to the right place with Martin!

51000902.ContentEN: (The man in front of you performs an extravagant bow, then magically displays a bunch of scattered goods.)
51000902.Subtitle: (The man in front of you performs an extravagant bow, then magically displays a bunch of scattered goods.)

51000903.ContentEN: Feel free to choose. Trust Martin's choice! You can find everything here, seen or unseen, occasionally spicing up your life!
51000903.Subtitle: Feel free to choose. Trust Martin's choice! You can find everything here, seen or unseen, occasionally spicing up your life!

51000904.ContentEN: You're quite impolite. Being able to appraise doesn't mean you have good taste, sweetheart.
51000904.Subtitle: You're quite impolite. Being able to appraise doesn't mean you have good taste, sweetheart.

51000905.ContentEN: Isn't letting them go to waste also a crime? I just want to find a home for them all.
51000905.Subtitle: Isn't letting them go to waste also a crime? I just want to find a home for them all.

51000906.ContentEN: Nah-ah. That's a trade secret. So, have you thought about what you'd like to exchange with me?
51000906.Subtitle: Nah-ah. That's a trade secret. So, have you thought about what you'd like to exchange with me?

51000907.ContentEN: (You look at his goods and sadly shake your head.)
51000907.Subtitle: (You look at his goods and sadly shake your head.)

51000908.ContentEN: Then I'm probably not the person you need, but I'll wait for the day you extend your patronage.
51000908.Subtitle: Then I'm probably not the person you need, but I'll wait for the day you extend your patronage.

51000909.ContentEN: I got it! You're a rare kind of person in Icelake…
51000909.Subtitle: I got it! You're a rare kind of person in Icelake…

51000910.ContentEN:
You're neither a slum dweller here to buy cheap supplies nor a noble interested in the private lives of your neighbors.\
You have no desire or need for Martin. You've never even heard my name, have you?
51000910.Subtitle:
You're neither a slum dweller here to buy cheap supplies nor a noble interested in the private lives of your neighbors.\
You have no desire or need for Martin. You've never even heard my name, have you?

51000911.ContentEN: Then allow me to introduce myself! I am the King of Scavengers in Icelake, the confidant brother of every rubbish bin, and the best spokesperson and promoter of discarded items.
51000911.Subtitle: Then allow me to introduce myself! I am the King of Scavengers in Icelake, the confidant brother of every rubbish bin, and the best spokesperson and promoter of discarded items.

51000912.ContentEN:
In fact, rubbish bins hide all sorts of secrets. As long as you're patient enough and don't mind the hard work,\
they will continue to share with you the secrets of their households.
51000912.Subtitle:
In fact, rubbish bins hide all sorts of secrets. As long as you're patient enough and don't mind the hard work,\
they will continue to share with you the secrets of their households.

51000913.ContentEN: Now you get intrigued? That's great. I know ordinary goods won't impress you, but Martin has his ways.
51000913.Subtitle: Now you get intrigued? That's great. I know ordinary goods won't impress you, but Martin has his ways.

51000914.ContentEN: If you can help find their owners, you might understand this city better. Even if you get nothing, at least you satisfy your curiosity.
51000914.Subtitle: If you can help find their owners, you might understand this city better. Even if you get nothing, at least you satisfy your curiosity.

51000915.ContentEN: (Martin produces some indescribable things and winks at you.)
51000915.Subtitle: (Martin produces some indescribable things and winks at you.)

51000916.ContentEN: Want to give it a try?
51000916.Subtitle: Want to give it a try?

51000990.ContentEN: My name probably speaks for itself. I am Martin.
51000990.Subtitle: My name probably speaks for itself. I am Martin.

51000991.ContentEN: I'm willing to sell \"puzzles\" to you. You can treat them as \"someone's scars\" or \"lost items\".
51000991.Subtitle: I'm willing to sell \"puzzles\" to you. You can treat them as \"someone's scars\" or \"lost items\".

51001001.ContentEN: (You see a person dressed as a vendor at the ticket counter, seemingly in a dispute with the ticket seller.)
51001001.Subtitle: (You see a person dressed as a vendor at the ticket counter, seemingly in a dispute with the ticket seller.)

51001002.ContentEN: Can't I even ask? Didn't your mother teach you manners?!
51001002.Subtitle: Can't I even ask? Didn't your mother teach you manners?!

51001003.ContentEN: Oh alright, sir. So, after I politely tell you the ticket price, what do you plan to do?
51001003.Subtitle: Oh alright, sir. So, after I politely tell you the ticket price, what do you plan to do?

51001004.ContentEN: H...How do you know I don't have...
51001004.Subtitle: H...How do you know I don't have...

51001005.ContentEN: Off you go, you shack-dwelling tycoon.
51001005.Subtitle: Off you go, you shack-dwelling tycoon.

51001006.ContentEN: (The vendor leaves, lips trembling, while the ticket seller snorts arrogantly, glancing disdainfully at you.)
51001006.Subtitle: (The vendor leaves, lips trembling, while the ticket seller snorts arrogantly, glancing disdainfully at you.)

51001007.ContentEN: What about you? What do you want? I advise you not to waste my time, or you'll slink back into your rat hole just like him.
51001007.Subtitle: What about you? What do you want? I advise you not to waste my time, or you'll slink back into your rat hole just like him.

51001008.ContentEN: Not another one! Before I send you my sincerest regards, you'd better disappear quickly!
51001008.Subtitle: Not another one! Before I send you my sincerest regards, you'd better disappear quickly!

51001009.ContentEN: W...What are you talking about? I don't understand!
51001009.Subtitle: W...What are you talking about? I don't understand!

51001010.ContentEN:
(You take out the \"scrap\" you got from Martin, a jar of pentagonal stars made of paper.)\
(You unfold one to find out it's clearly an expired ticket.)
51001010.Subtitle:
(You take out the \"scrap\" you got from Martin, a jar of pentagonal stars made of paper.)\
(You unfold one to find out it's clearly an expired ticket.)

51001013.ContentEN: (She seems extremely shocked. Before you know it, tears are streaming down the face of this haughty ticket seller.)
51001013.Subtitle: (She seems extremely shocked. Before you know it, tears are streaming down the face of this haughty ticket seller.)

51001014.ContentEN: Why... Why do you have to show this to me again?
51001014.Subtitle: Why... Why do you have to show this to me again?

51001015.ContentEN: Why remind me of dreams that can't be fulfilled?
51001015.Subtitle: Why remind me of dreams that can't be fulfilled?

51001016.ContentEN: Every day, I watch trains roar in and out. I hope to ride them like those high officials, but all I have are unsold tickets.
51001016.Subtitle: Every day, I watch trains roar in and out. I hope to ride them like those high officials, but all I have are unsold tickets.

51001017.ContentEN: Some people live their entire lives without seeing a ticket. I'm luckier because at least I get to hold an unfulfillable entry pass every day.
51001017.Subtitle: Some people live their entire lives without seeing a ticket. I'm luckier because at least I get to hold an unfulfillable entry pass every day.

51001018.ContentEN: But that's where my luck ends. In this world, there are wishes even stars can't fulfill. I realised this, and that's why I threw them away...
51001018.Subtitle: But that's where my luck ends. In this world, there are wishes even stars can't fulfill. I realised this, and that's why I threw them away...

51001019.ContentEN: Then who will build this ladder to heaven for me? The Fairy Godmother?
51001019.Subtitle: Then who will build this ladder to heaven for me? The Fairy Godmother?

51001020.ContentEN: You're right. How am I any different from them?
51001020.Subtitle: You're right. How am I any different from them?

51001021.ContentEN: You're right... I can't lose this job that I hate yet make a living from.
51001021.Subtitle: You're right... I can't lose this job that I hate yet make a living from.

51001022.ContentEN: I might be disillusioned with the world, but I'm not crazy yet, though that day might not be far off.
51001022.Subtitle: I might be disillusioned with the world, but I'm not crazy yet, though that day might not be far off.

51001023.ContentEN: (The ticket seller takes the ticket stars from your hand, finds a dry place, and sets these wish-bearing papers on fire.)
51001023.Subtitle: (The ticket seller takes the ticket stars from your hand, finds a dry place, and sets these wish-bearing papers on fire.)

51001024.ContentEN: I always scold those who want to leave as dreamers,
51001024.Subtitle: I always scold those who want to leave as dreamers,

51001025.ContentEN: but maybe it's me who should wake up from the dream.
51001025.Subtitle: but maybe it's me who should wake up from the dream.

51001026.ContentEN: (From then on, Jessica just sat indifferently in the ticket hall, giving mechanical responses to anyone who asked like a ticket machine.)
51001026.Subtitle: (From then on, Jessica just sat indifferently in the ticket hall, giving mechanical responses to anyone who asked like a ticket machine.)

51001090.ContentEN: Will you politely pull out a huge amount of money to buy a ticket, or will you fiddle with your empty pockets and boss me around?
51001090.Subtitle: Will you politely pull out a huge amount of money to buy a ticket, or will you fiddle with your empty pockets and boss me around?

51001091.ContentEN:
This weather is just right for you to strike a match and call for grandma, dreaming that she takes you on a train.\
Go wherever you like in your dream, and stop shaming yourself in front of me!
51001091.Subtitle:
This weather is just right for you to strike a match and call for grandma, dreaming that she takes you on a train.\
Go wherever you like in your dream, and stop shaming yourself in front of me!

51001092.ContentEN: (But the good thing is she was no longer as temperamental and foul-mouthed as before.)
51001092.Subtitle: (But the good thing is she was no longer as temperamental and foul-mouthed as before.)

51001101.ContentEN: (A Filthoid, wandering from nowhere, clutched a notebook in its jaws. After defeating the Filthoid, you picked up the notebook...)
51001101.Subtitle: (A Filthoid, wandering from nowhere, clutched a notebook in its jaws. After defeating the Filthoid, you picked up the notebook...)

51001102.ContentEN: (If what's written in this diary is true, then the real identity of the amnesiac girl becomes quite clear. Likewise revealed is the fate of Ms Elsa's missing daughter, Annie...)
51001102.Subtitle: (If what's written in this diary is true, then the real identity of the amnesiac girl becomes quite clear. Likewise revealed is the fate of Ms Elsa's missing daughter, Annie...)

51001103.ContentEN: (...Annie has tragically passed away, while the other girl, Alice, who ended up with Annie's clothes, has survived. Although Alice made it through the ordeal in the snowy mountains, the severe fevers she suffered afterwards took away her memories.)
51001103.Subtitle: (...Annie has tragically passed away, while the other girl, Alice, who ended up with Annie's clothes, has survived. Although Alice made it through the ordeal in the snowy mountains, the severe fevers she suffered afterwards took away her memories.)

51001201.ContentEN: A Phoxhunter? Can't believe anyone would still make it here. You've got what it takes to be a hero like them, I guess.
51001201.Subtitle: A Phoxhunter? Can't believe anyone would still make it here. You've got what it takes to be a hero like them, I guess.

51001202.ContentEN: Well, who else but this old geezer would bother keeping these birds nowadays.
51001202.Subtitle: Well, who else but this old geezer would bother keeping these birds nowadays.

51001203.ContentEN: Are you insane?? Do you have any idea how precious these birds are to a miner?!
51001203.Subtitle: Are you insane?? Do you have any idea how precious these birds are to a miner?!

51001204.ContentEN: Miners today have grown so reliant on the high-tech gadgets from the Alchemy Academy, that they have forgotten the old ways.
51001204.Subtitle: Miners today have grown so reliant on the high-tech gadgets from the Alchemy Academy, that they have forgotten the old ways.

51001205.ContentEN:
Exactly, their amazing sensitivity to harmful gases made them a must-have for us miners in the old days.\
We'd always have one by our side underground to help detect whether the tunnels were safe.
51001205.Subtitle:
Exactly, their amazing sensitivity to harmful gases made them a must-have for us miners in the old days.\
We'd always have one by our side underground to help detect whether the tunnels were safe.

51001206.ContentEN: Well said. Quite rare to find young folks with such insight these days.
51001206.Subtitle: Well said. Quite rare to find young folks with such insight these days.

51001207.ContentEN: Hmph, I do what I do for us miners' sake. I don't need others' approval.
51001207.Subtitle: Hmph, I do what I do for us miners' sake. I don't need others' approval.

51001208.ContentEN: Soulless tools may fail you, or even betray you. It's the companion you've always cherished that will stand by you through every trial.
51001208.Subtitle: Soulless tools may fail you, or even betray you. It's the companion you've always cherished that will stand by you through every trial.

51001209.ContentEN: Should the day come when the Academy's fancy tools give out, it may well be these loyal friends that save miners' lives...
51001209.Subtitle: Should the day come when the Academy's fancy tools give out, it may well be these loyal friends that save miners' lives...

51001210.ContentEN: (The old miner's gaze settles on a nearby mound, his lips trembling with unvoiced thoughts, culminating in nothing but a weary sigh.)
51001210.Subtitle: (The old miner's gaze settles on a nearby mound, his lips trembling with unvoiced thoughts, culminating in nothing but a weary sigh.)

51001211.ContentEN:
(In silence, the elder periodically snaps from his thoughts, letting out a lingering sigh.)\
(It's unclear whether it's a tribute to a fallen comrade or a lament for the changing times.)
51001211.Subtitle:
(In silence, the elder periodically snaps from his thoughts, letting out a lingering sigh.)\
(It's unclear whether it's a tribute to a fallen comrade or a lament for the changing times.)

51001301.ContentEN: That blasted Camilla! Stupid hag! She has no idea what good stuff tastes like!
51001301.Subtitle: Blasted Camilla! Stupid hag! She has no idea what good stuff is like!

51001302.Subtitle: Pah! What's it to you? Are you her lawyer? If not, mind your own business!

51001303.ContentEN: Ugh! You must pay for this! Gimme your money! Nearly broke my nose, you!
51001303.Subtitle: Ugh! You must pay for this! Nearly broke my nose, you!

51001304.ContentEN: Jumping to her defence, are we? Ha, you must be one of those \"Camilla fan club\" idiots! Pathetic losers, all bamboozled by that two-faced witch!
51001304.Subtitle: Quick to her defence, are we? Ah, I get it, you're one of those \"Camilla fan club\" idiots! Pathetic losers, all bamboozled by that phoney!

51001305.ContentEN: Had a sharp tongue just now, didn't ya? What, did the cold finally clear your head enough to see through that hag?
51001305.Subtitle: What's the matter? Cat got your tongue? Has your stupidity-fueled trust started to waver at last? Wake up!

51001306.Subtitle:
An articulate argument; clearly, you're not a local. Let me guess —\
You've never ventured beyond The Asphodel for a tipple since landing in Icelake, have you?

51001307.ContentEN: If you shopped around, you'd see Camilla's brew is an odd fit for Icelake.
51001307.Subtitle: If you shopped around, you'd notice that Camilla's brews are an odd fit for Icelake.

51001308.ContentEN: I mean, in Icelake, every tavern owner except her is my client. My stuff's good enough to knock people out, but she always turns me down — what a stubborn mule! Doesn't that seem fishy to you?
51001308.Subtitle:
All tavern owners but her in the city are my clients. My stuff is celebrated, but she's always turned me down. What a stubborn mule!\
There must be something fishy in there, don't you think?!

51001309.ContentEN: Fact is, my booze is half the price of Camilla's and tastes just as good — I assure you! Try it, and you'll understand what a real bargain means.
51001309.Subtitle:
Fact is, my fermented drinks are half the price of Camilla's, and they taste nearly the same, I assure you!\
Just give it a try, and you'll understand what the word \"bargain\" really means.

51001310.ContentEN: Ha, now we're talking! Thanks for your patronage!
51001310.Subtitle: Thanks for the purchase!

51001312.ContentEN: Just a word of advice — always take what you hear in Icelake with a grain of salt.

51001313.ContentEN: Come on, give it a try and you'll—

51001314.ContentEN: Not bad — I see you're keeping your wits about you.

51001315.ContentEN: Wh—What do you want!? I didn't go to your place and meddle in your business!

51001316.ContentEN: Don't get me wrong, I'm not interested in your business. I'm here to discuss something else with you.

51001317.ContentEN: Recently, someone's been using my name to sell shoddy knock-offs, claiming they're \"the new special from The Asphodel\", or that they'd be \"sold out at the bar in a minute, impossible to snag a sip...\"

51001318.ContentEN: As you know, in business, brand image is everything. The quality of our drinks is the face of The Asphodel, and I can't just let someone drag our name through the mud.

51001319.ContentEN: ...Wh—What's that got to do with me? I don't have time for your problems!

51001320.ContentEN: Outta my way. I've got business to run.

51001321.ContentEN: Not so fast. When The Asphodel turned you down, I kept a sample of your booze. And guess what—

51001322.ContentEN: Your booze exactly matches the knock-offs on the market. Seems more than coincidental, wouldn't you say?

51001323.ContentEN: What are you implying!? That's slander! I—I—I'm not selling fakes! You're just scared my booze will steal your regulars — that's why you're spouting nonsense here!

51001324.ContentEN: Fake booze? You call my stuff fake? Now I see, you two are in cahoots, twisting the truth...

51001325.ContentEN: Fine! I'll show you this isn't fake!

51001327.ContentEN: (Dean grabs a barrel of liquor and starts guzzling it down.)

51001328.ContentEN: (But before he can drain it, he staggers as if struck in the gut and then crashes heavily to the ground, his spilt drink reeking up the place.)

51001329.ContentEN: As I've always said, Icelake isn't some idyllic haven. Keeping your wits about you is the only way to survive here.

51001330.ContentEN: *sigh* If we just leave him be, he might just kick it. I'll get him to a hospital, and settle the score with him later.

51001331.ContentEN: By the way — unlike Dean's \"bargains\", if you're looking for quality that truly matches the price, The Asphodel welcomes you anytime.

51001332.ContentEN: The best brews? You'll find them at The Asphodel, no question.

51001333.ContentEN: Intoxicating aroma, full-bodied flavours, and what sets it apart most? The smooth, clean finish — it lingers on the tongue.

51001334.ContentEN: A fine drink is like a seductive lover... Ah, I think I need another refill...

51001335.ContentEN: There's more to The Asphodel than just great drinks.

51001336.ContentEN: Because you can enjoy a tipple here without having to worry about getting caught in a brawl with drunkards or getting whacked by some random lunatic...

51001337.ContentEN: After all, this is Camilla's turf. Her name alone keeps everyone in line — no one dares stir up trouble here.

51001339.ContentEN: Love... what does it really taste like!? Was it the rush of ecstasy when I joined Camilla's fan club, or the crushing heartbreak when I heard she disbanded it?

51001340.ContentEN: Boohoo... Only Lady Camilla's smile can piece back together my shattered heart!
51001340.Subtitle: Boohoo... Only Lady Camilla's smile can piece back together my shattered heart!

51001401.ContentEN: \"The rain hurt Mum's flowers, so the sky said sorry by leaving her lots of tiny flowers in the puddles.\"
51001401.Subtitle: \"The rain hurt Mum's flowers, so the sky said sorry by leaving her lots of tiny flowers in the puddles.\"

51001402.ContentEN: You know what, this little verse is called \"Apology\", and it's written by a six-year-old student of mine.
51001402.Subtitle: You know what, this little verse is called \"Apology\", and it's written by a six-year-old student of mine.

51001403.ContentEN: (The children around Sunny are in finery, presumably from aristocratic families.)
51001403.Subtitle: (The children around Sunny are in finery, presumably from aristocratic families.)

51001404.ContentEN: Haha, actually, there are many more like this one, and their creativity never ceases to amaze me.
51001404.Subtitle: Haha, actually, there are many more like this one, and their creativity never ceases to amaze me.

51001405.ContentEN: I've always believed that unfettered creativity and imagination are a child's most precious qualities.
51001405.Subtitle: I've always believed that unfettered creativity and imagination are a child's most precious qualities.

51001406.ContentEN: It's just that, to the nobility, a tutor like me is deemed quite incompetent.
51001406.Subtitle: It's just that, to the nobility, a tutor like me is deemed quite incompetent.

51001407.ContentEN: Ah, it's nearly time for class. Excuse me, I have to go now.
51001407.Subtitle: Ah, it's nearly time for class. Excuse me, I have to go now.

51001408.ContentEN: (Sunny glanced at her pocket watch, excused herself, and hurried off.)
51001408.Subtitle: (Sunny glanced at her pocket watch, excused herself, and hurried off.)

51001409.ContentEN: Haha, thank you. I've never once regretted my choice, even if it costs me my job.
51001409.Subtitle: Haha, thank you. I've never once regretted my choice, even if it costs me my job.

51001410.ContentEN: In the future, my students will have to embark on a path filled with Imperial Law recitations and military test preparations.
51001410.Subtitle: In the future, my students will have to embark on a path filled with Imperial Law recitations and military test preparations.

51001411.ContentEN:
This being our final lesson, I must let them know — no matter the cruelty or drudgery of the reality ahead,\
I'll forever be proud of their dreams.
51001411.Subtitle:
This being our final lesson, I must let them know — no matter the cruelty or drudgery of the reality ahead,\
I'll forever be proud of their dreams.

51001412.ContentEN: Absolutely! I've received the most amazing gift in the world!
51001412.Subtitle: Absolutely! I've received the most amazing gift in the world!

51001413.ContentEN: \"My teacher says I'm a star in the sky, and she's just my reflection in the sea at night.\"
51001413.Subtitle: \"My teacher says I'm a star in the sky, and she's just my reflection in the sea at night.\"

51001414.ContentEN: \"But heavens and seas are so far apart — that doesn't seem right.\"
51001414.Subtitle: \"But heavens and seas are so far apart — that doesn't seem right.\"

51001415.ContentEN: \"So I say: 'Look! A shooting star zooming by!'\"
51001415.Subtitle: \"So I say: 'Look! A shooting star zooming by!'\"

51001416.ContentEN: You know what, this little verse is called \"Come to You\", and it's written by a six-year-old student of mine.
51001416.Subtitle: You know what, this little verse is called \"Come to You\", and it's written by a six-year-old student of mine.

51001417.ContentEN: I wonder what those kids have been up to lately. They must have grown taller, haven't they?
51001417.Subtitle: I wonder what those kids have been up to lately. They must have grown taller, haven't they?

51001490.ContentEN: (As Sunny's class concluded, the children waved goodbye. Sunny smiles warmly as she watches them leave.)
51001490.Subtitle: (As Sunny's class concluded, the children waved goodbye. Sunny smiles warmly as she watches them leave.)

51001501.ContentEN: Ugh... why won't this bloodstain come off?
51001501.Subtitle: Ugh... why won't this bloodstain come off?

51001502.ContentEN: I don't wanna get beaten up for this again...
51001502.Subtitle: I don't wanna get beaten up for this again...

51001504.ContentEN: Oof, I'm swamped right now. Maybe talk to me after I'm done cleaning.
51001504.Subtitle: Oof, I'm swamped right now. Maybe talk to me after I'm done cleaning.

51001505.ContentEN: (He scrubs hard with the rough cloth, over and over, finally removing the bloodstain just as he's about to collapse from exhaustion.)
51001505.Subtitle: (He scrubs hard with the rough cloth, over and over, finally removing the bloodstain just as he's about to collapse from exhaustion.)

51001506.ContentEN: *sigh* That fight earlier was brutal, blood splattered everywhere. Such a nightmare to clean up.
51001506.Subtitle: *sigh* That fight earlier was brutal, blood splattered everywhere. Such a nightmare to clean up.

51001507.ContentEN: Much easier when it's a quick kill, or with poison — hardly any mess.
51001507.Subtitle: Much easier when it's a quick kill, or with poison — hardly any mess.

51001508.ContentEN: Who asked you? Easy to judge when you're not in my shoes. Mind your own business!
51001508.Subtitle: Who asked you? Easy to judge when you're not in my shoes. Mind your own business!

51001509.ContentEN: What choice do I have? When the floor's dirty, I gotta clean it, or it's beatings and scoldings for me.
51001509.Subtitle: What choice do I have? When the floor's dirty, I gotta clean it, or it's beatings and scoldings for me.

51001510.ContentEN:
I used to feel sorry for them, but there's only so much sympathy to go around.\
I'm struggling to keep myself alive — can't afford to worry about others!
51001510.Subtitle:
I used to feel sorry for them, but there's only so much sympathy to go around.\
I'm struggling to keep myself alive — can't afford to worry about others!

51001511.ContentEN: Over time, blood's just another red spill to me. Being numb helps me make it through the day...
51001511.Subtitle: Over time, blood's just another red spill to me. Being numb helps me make it through the day...

51001512.ContentEN: Alright, I should get back to work. There's another mess waiting for me...
51001512.Subtitle: Alright, I should get back to work. There's another mess waiting for me...

51001513.ContentEN: Alright, I should get back to work. There's another mess waiting for me...
51001513.Subtitle: Alright, I should get back to work. There's another mess waiting for me...

51001602.ContentEN: (Dressed in ragged military garb, the Charon man before you sends menacing glares towards the passersby.)
51001602.Subtitle: (Dressed in ragged military garb, the Charon man before you sends menacing glares towards the passersby.)

51001603.ContentEN: Oi! What are you doing?! Looking for trouble?!
51001603.Subtitle: Oi! What are you doing?! Looking for trouble?!

51001604.ContentEN: You've got horns too, just like us.
51001604.Subtitle: You've got horns too, just like us.

51001605.ContentEN:
Look at that, a saint here! Why not enlighten the security bureau with your little sermon?\
Maybe they'll reward you with a free lesson on how to watch your mouth.
51001605.Subtitle:
Look at that, a saint here! Why not enlighten the security bureau with your little sermon?\
Maybe they'll reward you with a free lesson on how to watch your mouth.

51001606.ContentEN: Think the security bureau would show you any respect if you were in my shoes?
51001606.Subtitle: Think the security bureau would show you any respect if you were in my shoes?

51001607.ContentEN: How dare you! Who do you think you're talking to? You think you and I are the same kind?
51001607.Subtitle: How dare you! Who do you think you're talking to? You think you and I are the same kind?

51001608.ContentEN: For your information, we Charons aren't all cut from the same cloth!
51001608.Subtitle: For your information, we Charons aren't all cut from the same cloth!

51001609.ContentEN:
Since I was a kid, I've held myself to human standards, and never mingled with other Charons.\
Ever met a Charon who speaks like I do? Just so you know, this is a standard Dismania accent!
51001609.Subtitle:
Since I was a kid, I've held myself to human standards, and never mingled with other Charons.\
Ever met a Charon who speaks like I do? Just so you know, this is a standard Dismania accent!

51001610.ContentEN: Jealous, huh? Well, I've earned this!
51001610.Subtitle: Jealous, huh? Well, I've earned this!

51001611.ContentEN: Got it? I'm more human than any of you could ever be, that's why I've become an officer, while you roam around in rags like a beggar.
51001611.Subtitle: Got it? I'm more human than any of you could ever be, that's why I've become an officer, while you roam around in rags like a beggar.

51001612.ContentEN: Alright, I've indulged you this long only because my heart's as big as any human's. Consider this as a gratis lesson for you Charons. Now shoo, take your lowlife vibes away from me.
51001612.Subtitle: Alright, I've indulged you this long only because my heart's as big as any human's. Consider this as a gratis lesson for you Charons. Now shoo, take your lowlife vibes away from me.

51001614.ContentEN: I've heard about this \"Laurelled Charon\" medal that Hyperborea grants to the most distinguished Charons.
51001614.Subtitle: I've heard about this \"Laurelled Charon\" medal that Hyperborea grants to the most distinguished Charons.

51001615.ContentEN: Someone as brave, loyal, and with an impeccable accent like you must have one. I'd be thrilled to finally see it!
51001615.Subtitle: Someone as brave, loyal, and with an impeccable accent like you must have one. I'd be thrilled to finally see it!

51001616.ContentEN: ...I... must've left it at home! Maybe next time!
51001616.Subtitle: ...I... must've left it at home! Maybe next time!

51001617.ContentEN: Is that so? I truly admire you, sir!
51001617.Subtitle: Is that so? I truly admire you, sir!

51001619.ContentEN: There's that famous \"Maidé Upp\" fountain in the inner city, isn't there?
51001619.Subtitle: There's that famous \"Maidé Upp\" fountain in the inner city, isn't there?

51001620.ContentEN: A lowly Charon like me will probably never get to see it. Could you tell me if the statue by the fountain is a lion or a wolf. Please, sir, I'm dying to be enlightened!
51001620.Subtitle: A lowly Charon like me will probably never get to see it. Could you tell me if the statue by the fountain is a lion or a wolf. Please, sir, I'm dying to be enlightened!

51001621.ContentEN: Err... it's... a lion. Right, a lion!
51001621.Subtitle: Err... it's... a lion. Right, a lion!

51001622.ContentEN: Are you sure, sir? Because a friend of mine said...
51001622.Subtitle: Are you sure, sir? Because a friend of mine said...

51001623.ContentEN: Ah, wait... had a rough night, headache's killing me! Now that I think about it, it's a wolf — walked by it just this morning, happy now?
51001623.Subtitle: Ah, wait... had a rough night, headache's killing me! Now that I think about it, it's a wolf — walked by it just this morning, happy now?

51001624.ContentEN: (A veneer of admiration remains on your face, yet a whirlwind of emotions sweeps through your mind — from initial anger to bewilderment, settling finally on pity.)
51001624.Subtitle: (A veneer of admiration remains on your face, yet a whirlwind of emotions sweeps through your mind — from initial anger to bewilderment, settling finally on pity.)

51001625.ContentEN: Seems your memory's still playing tricks on you. Because there's no \"Maidé Upp\" fountain — it's actually a made-up fountain.
51001625.Subtitle: Seems your memory's still playing tricks on you. Because there's no \"Maidé Upp\" fountain — it's actually a made-up fountain.

51001626.ContentEN: You crafty little twerp...! How dare you—!
51001626.Subtitle: You crafty little twerp...! How dare you—!

51001627.ContentEN: (Anticipating his move, you nimbly dodged the man's furious punch.)
51001627.Subtitle: (Anticipating his move, you nimbly dodged the man's furious punch.)

51001628.ContentEN: Goodbye, sir. Hope I can pick your brain about the inner city again some other time.
51001628.Subtitle: Goodbye, sir. Hope I can pick your brain about the inner city again some other time.

51001629.ContentEN: Scram!! Don't let me catch sight of you again!! Beat it!!!
51001629.Subtitle: Scram!! Don't let me catch sight of you again!! Beat it!!!

51001690.ContentEN: What, you again? Didn't I tell you to get out of my sight?
51001690.Subtitle: What, you again? Didn't I tell you to get out of my sight?

51001691.ContentEN: My human friends all say they can't tell that I'm actually a Charon from the way I speak. They say I sound just like one of them.
51001691.Subtitle: My human friends all say they can't tell that I'm actually a Charon from the way I speak. They say I sound just like one of them.

51001692.ContentEN:
For three years straight, I'd start every morning reading \"Hyperborean News\" for two hours,\
fine-tuning my accent while cringing at the crimes some Charon had disgracefully committed.
51001692.Subtitle:
For three years straight, I'd start every morning reading \"Hyperborean News\" for two hours,\
fine-tuning my accent while cringing at the crimes some Charon had disgracefully committed.

51001693.ContentEN: I've heard that Laurelled Charons are entitled to live in the inner city. You must own a splendid mansion there, like something out of a storybook — with legions of butlers and servants!
51001693.Subtitle: I've heard that Laurelled Charons are entitled to live in the inner city. You must own a splendid mansion there, like something out of a storybook — with legions of butlers and servants!

51001701.ContentEN: Pipe No. 13 is under repair — blimey, it's swarming with rats in there.
51001701.Subtitle: Pipe No. 13 is under repair — blimey, it's swarming with rats in there.

51001702.ContentEN: (Dutton looks up, reeking so strongly that you're forced to step back. You manage to stifle a gag.)
51001702.Subtitle: (Dutton looks up, reeking so strongly that you're forced to step back. You manage to stifle a gag.)

51001703.ContentEN: Hey! That was a bit uncalled for. Comes with the territory when you work in sewers, doesn't it?
51001703.Subtitle: Hey! That was a bit uncalled for. Comes with the territory when you work in sewers, doesn't it?

51001704.ContentEN: You might not believe it, but there was a time people respectfully addressed me as \"Doctor Dutton\".
51001704.Subtitle: You might not believe it, but there was a time people respectfully addressed me as \"Doctor Dutton\".

51001705.ContentEN: You get what that title means to a Charon who's come up from the slums, right?
51001705.Subtitle: You get what that title means to a Charon who's come up from the slums, right?

51001706.ContentEN: I've treated countless Charons at the central hospital; even the nobility sought me out for consultations.
51001706.Subtitle: I've treated countless Charons at the central hospital; even the nobility sought me out for consultations.

51001707.ContentEN: Don't take my word for it — go ask the younger Charons. Their folks always told them to model themselves on me.
51001707.Subtitle: Don't take my word for it — go ask the younger Charons. Their folks always told them to model themselves on me.

51001708.ContentEN: I was quite a stickler for cleanliness back then; a single speck of dust between the tiles would drive me nuts...
51001708.Subtitle: I was quite a stickler for cleanliness back then; a single speck of dust between the tiles would drive me nuts...

51001709.ContentEN: I used to patch up people, and now I patch up pipes. Not much difference, eh?
51001709.Subtitle: I used to patch up people, and now I patch up pipes. Not much difference, eh?

51001710.ContentEN: (Dutton gave a serene smile, seemingly turning a page on some tough memories without a grudge.)
51001710.Subtitle: (Dutton gave a serene smile, seemingly turning a page on some tough memories without a grudge.)

51001711.ContentEN: Picture this: a pedestrian collapsed from an acute condition right in front of a doctor, who heroically opted to save him.
51001711.Subtitle: Picture this: a pedestrian collapsed from an acute condition right in front of a doctor, who heroically opted to save him.

51001712.ContentEN: Curious about what happened next? Hand me that wrench first—
51001712.Subtitle: Curious about what happened next? Hand me that wrench first—

51001713.ContentEN:
No miracle happened, just a massive lawsuit for medical malpractice.\
For the sake of the hospital's reputation, an employee had to be fired.
51001713.Subtitle:
No miracle happened, just a massive lawsuit for medical malpractice.\
For the sake of the hospital's reputation, an employee had to be fired.

51001714.ContentEN: Imagine that—someone who knew nothing but how to heal, ending up in the sewer pipes.
51001714.Subtitle: Imagine that—someone who knew nothing but how to heal, ending up in the sewer pipes.

51001715.ContentEN: Funny enough, a few months down here cured me of that intense fixation with cleanliness. A silver lining, am I right?
51001715.Subtitle: Funny enough, a few months down here cured me of that intense fixation with cleanliness. A silver lining, am I right?

51001716.ContentEN: At least this gig keeps me from starving on the streets, though I'll be paying debts till I'm six feet under.
51001716.Subtitle: At least this gig keeps me from starving on the streets, though I'll be paying debts till I'm six feet under.

51001717.ContentEN: (Dutton turns, focusing on tightening the screws of the replacement pipe with his wrench, his arms swinging skillfully, seemingly oblivious to your question.)
51001717.Subtitle: (Dutton turns, focusing on tightening the screws of the replacement pipe with his wrench, his arms swinging skillfully, seemingly oblivious to your question.)

51001718.ContentEN: (Yet, in the echoing silence that ensues, the answer is clear to both of you without a word spoken.)
51001718.Subtitle: (Yet, in the echoing silence that ensues, the answer is clear to both of you without a word spoken.)

51001719.ContentEN: Ow...! The rats are taking over down here!
51001719.Subtitle: Ow...! The rats are taking over down here!

51001801.ContentEN: Hey, kid! Word's got around about your big score at Glevum Pit. Really impressive, I'd say! How about you and I team up for a gig? I'll take a 20% cut, you keep 80%. What do you say?
51001801.Subtitle:
Hey, kid! Word's got around about your big score at Glevum Pit. Really impressive, I'd say! How about you and I team up for a gig?\
I'll take a 20% cut, you keep 80%. What do you say?

51001803.ContentEN: Camilla, put the drink on my tab. I'll pay you back once I get the reward.
51001803.Subtitle: Camilla, put the drink on my tab. I'll pay you back once I get the reward.

51001804.ContentEN: Same as always then, your pocket watch stays here as collateral.
51001804.Subtitle: Same as always then, your pocket watch stays here as collateral.

51001805.ContentEN: Sure, sure. {nickname}, let's make short work of this.
51001805.Subtitle: Sure, sure. , let's make short work of this.

51001901.ContentEN: (Before even enter The Asphodel, you already hear the echoing curse words, as if wanting the whole city to listen to his rage.)
51001901.Subtitle: (Before even enter The Asphodel, you already hear the echoing curse words, as if wanting the whole city to listen to his rage.)

51001902.ContentEN: How dare you show yourself in front of my face! I was such a fool. I should have done more than just kick you out!
51001902.Subtitle: How dare you show yourself in front of my face! I was such a fool. I should have done more than just kick you out!

51001903.ContentEN: You paraded around with our family name for so many years. Did you use my warning letters as kindling?
51001903.Subtitle: You paraded around with our family name for so many years. Did you use my warning letters as kindling?

51001904.ContentEN: Yes, yes, you are right, but after all, that surname is what you...
51001904.Subtitle: Yes, yes, you are right, but after all, that surname is what you...

51001905.ContentEN: (Wells, like a child who's misbehaved, stands with his head bowed in front of an old man, allowing the latter's finger to jab at him.)
51001905.Subtitle: (Wells, like a child who's misbehaved, stands with his head bowed in front of an old man, allowing the latter's finger to jab at him.)

51001906.ContentEN: Shut up! You have no talent, yet you try to be a Phoxhunter. Do you really think you deserve this money and fame? Running around like a dog for others. The inner city now sees the Wells family as a joke!
51001906.Subtitle:
Shut up! You have no talent, yet you try to be a Phoxhunter. Do you really think you deserve this money and fame?\
Running around like a dog for others. The inner city now sees the Wells family as a joke!

51001907.ContentEN: I was just thinking, if I make something of myself someday, maybe you'll reconsider things about me and Sara—
51001907.Subtitle: I was just thinking, if I make something of myself someday, maybe you'll reconsider things about me and Sara—

51001908.ContentEN: How dare you mention her name! Forget about it. You and my daughter will never get back together, never!
51001908.Subtitle: How dare you mention her name! Forget about it. You and my daughter will never get back together, never!

51001909.ContentEN: Don't say I didn't warn you. If you dare step foot in the inner city, I'll break your legs.
51001909.Subtitle: Don't say I didn't warn you. If you dare step foot in the inner city, I'll break your legs.

51001911.ContentEN: (The old man, glaring at the nodding Wells, grows even more infuriated, looking around and finally setting his eyes on you, who just enters The Asphodel.)
51001911.Subtitle:
(The old man, glaring at the nodding Wells, grows even more infuriated,)\
(looking around and finally setting his eyes on you, who just enters The Asphodel.)

51001912.ContentEN: And you, a Phoxhunter? I've seen many like you, dreaming of making a name for yourself as a Phoxhunter, and becoming a laurelled Charon.
51001912.Subtitle: And you, a Phoxhunter? I've seen many like you, dreaming of making a name for yourself as a Phoxhunter, and becoming a laurelled Charon.

51001913.ContentEN: Father-in-law, {nickname} is a capable one, not a loser like me...
51001913.Subtitle: Father-in-law,  is a capable one, not a loser like me...

51001914.ContentEN: Mr. Ferdinand Wells, I had no right to interfere what happened between you two. But if you keep harassing my other guests for no reason like this, The Asphodel might have to show you the door.
51001914.Subtitle:
Mr. Ferdinand Wells, I had no right to interfere what happened between you two. But if you keep\
harassing my other guests for no reason like this, The Asphodel might have to show you the door.

51001915.ContentEN: (Camilla, sitting behind the counter, puffs out a ring of smoke. Her casual words echoing powerfully in the empty tavern.)
51001915.Subtitle: (Camilla, sitting behind the counter, puffs out a ring of smoke. Her casual words echoing powerfully in the empty tavern.)

51001917.ContentEN: (The elder didn't quite catch what you said, and continued to curse Wells. Maybe it's better to wait a bit for him to calm down.)
51001917.Subtitle: (The elder didn't quite catch what you said, and continued to curse Wells. Maybe it's better to wait a bit for him to calm down.)

51001919.ContentEN: (The elder is left speechless by your words, and glares fiercely before storming out.)
51001919.Subtitle: (The elder is left speechless by your words, and glares fiercely before storming out.)

51001920.ContentEN: Sorry for causing everyone so much trouble. Well, my father-in-law... I mean Mr. Ferdinand Wells hasn't been to the outer city for years.
51001920.Subtitle: Sorry for causing everyone so much trouble. Well, my father-in-law... I mean Mr. Ferdinand Wells hasn't been to the outer city for years.

51001921.ContentEN: It's alright. We wouldn't be here today if we gave in to every slight or insult. Anyway, I heard you were injured recently during a commission. Are you okay?
51001921.Subtitle:
It's alright. We wouldn't be here today if we gave in to every slight or insult.\
Anyway, I heard you were injured recently during a commission. Are you okay?

51001922.ContentEN: It's nothing. Luckily this thing saved me from being fatally injured.
51001922.Subtitle: It's nothing. Luckily this thing saved me from being fatally injured.

51001923.ContentEN: (Wells takes out a finely crafted pocket watch from his chest. The dial is covered in cracks, and the hands are twisted upwards in an exaggerated manner, making closing the watch cover a mere wish.)
51001923.Subtitle:
(Wells takes out a finely crafted pocket watch from his chest. The dial is covered in cracks,)\
(and the hands are twisted upwards in an exaggerated manner, making closing the watch cover a mere wish.)

51001924.ContentEN: He made it himself. Over a decade ago, there wasn't a soul who hadn't heard of Todd Wells, the prodigy clockmaker. Back then, his craftsmanship almost won him the title of Laurelled Charon.
51001924.Subtitle:
He made it himself. Over a decade ago, there wasn't a soul who hadn't heard of Todd Wells, the prodigy clockmaker.\
Back then, his craftsmanship almost won him the title of Laurelled Charon.

51001925.ContentEN: Such a beautifully crafted watch. It's a pity it cracked like that.
51001925.Subtitle: Such a beautifully crafted watch. It's a pity it cracked like that.

51001926.ContentEN: Haha. Actually the hands had been broken for a long time, you know. I just keep it with me as a memento.
51001926.Subtitle: Haha. Actually the hands had been broken for a long time, you know. I just keep it with me as a memento.

51001927.ContentEN: Why don't you try to fix it then?
51001927.Subtitle: Why don't you try to fix it then?

51001928.ContentEN: The tools and materials needed for repairs were cut off by my father-in-law, so even if I wanted to fix it, I just couldn't.
51001928.Subtitle: The tools and materials needed for repairs were cut off by my father-in-law, so even if I wanted to fix it, I just couldn't.

51001929.ContentEN: ...It's the way it is. Not everything can be fixed just because you want to and put effort into it.
51001929.Subtitle: ...It's the way it is. Not everything can be fixed just because you want to and put effort into it.

51001931.ContentEN: Never mind that. Thank you for what you did just now. If you hadn't spoken up for me, my ears would have probably been done for. Eat and drink whatever you want today, it's all on me!
51001931.Subtitle:
Never mind that. Thank you for what you did just now. If you hadn't spoken up for me, my ears would have probably been done for.\
Eat and drink whatever you want today, it's all on me!

51001932.ContentEN: (Wells' face wears the familiar smile again, but the sorrow hidden behind the laughter, cradling the pocket watch, was probably just as irreparable as the watch itself.)
51001932.Subtitle:
(Wells' face wears the familiar smile again, but the sorrow hidden behind the laughter, cradling the pocket watch,)\
(was probably just as irreparable as the watch itself.)

51001933.ContentEN: Come on, let's drink and party all night!
51001933.Subtitle: Come on, let's drink and party all night!

51001990.ContentEN: Let me tell you something. <H>Icelake hasn't had many living laurelled Charons for years.</> Charons only end up rotting in some dark alley!
51001990.Subtitle: Let me tell you something. Icelake hasn't had many living laurelled Charons for years.Charons only end up rotting in some dark alley!

51001991.ContentEN: (As if the temperature in The Asphodel rose significantly in the smoke.)
51001991.Subtitle: (As if the temperature in The Asphodel rose significantly in the smoke.)

51001992.ContentEN: Let's just say he's more... traditional. Don't take his words to heart.
51001992.Subtitle: Let's just say he's more... traditional. Don't take his words to heart.

51002001.ContentEN: Ladies and gentlemen, drop by and drop a few coins, and you will get something unimaginable! Yes, the clue to the secret treasure of a southern island!
51002001.Subtitle:
Ladies and gentlemen, drop by and drop a few coins, and you will get something unimaginable!\
Yes, the clue to the secret treasure of a southern island!

51002002.ContentEN: Are you really content with cold bread and stale wine every day? Why not embark on an adventure, seize the opportunity, and change your life!
51002002.Subtitle: Are you really content with cold bread and stale wine every day? Why not embark on an adventure, seize the opportunity, and change your life!

51002003.ContentEN: (The middle-aged man in front of you is spouting opportunistic rhetoric. But his ragged appearance and oddly passionate speech make him seem untrustworthy.)
51002003.Subtitle:
(The middle-aged man in front of you is spouting opportunistic rhetoric.)\
(But his ragged appearance and oddly passionate speech make him seem untrustworthy.)

51002004.ContentEN: Oh, I'm just an old man. I'd rather give the opportunity to the younger generation.
51002004.Subtitle: Oh, I'm just an old man. I'd rather give the opportunity to the younger generation.

51002005.ContentEN: If I were your age, I'd surely be packing my stuff and setting off right now.
51002005.Subtitle: If I were your age, I'd surely be packing my stuff and setting off right now.

51002006.ContentEN: What, you are interested? You do know how to seize opportunities.
51002006.Subtitle: What, you are interested? You do know how to seize opportunities.

51002007.ContentEN: I like smart kids like you, so I can indeed reveal a thing or two for free.
51002007.Subtitle: I like smart kids like you, so I can indeed reveal a thing or two for free.

51002008.ContentEN: What are you talking about? You accuse me of defraudation without even hearing me out. Where are your manners?
51002008.Subtitle: What are you talking about? You accuse me of defraudation without even hearing me out. Where are your manners?

51002009.ContentEN: Since you think I'm a swindler, let me tell you a few things to set things straight.
51002009.Subtitle: Since you think I'm a swindler, let me tell you a few things to set things straight.

51002010.ContentEN: Actually, I'm not a local from Icelake. I was born on an island in the southern part of the Empire.
51002010.Subtitle: Actually, I'm not a local from Icelake. I was born on an island in the southern part of the Empire.

51002011.ContentEN: Our island was covered by a giant Heaventree, that you couldn't find on any ordinary map.
51002011.Subtitle: Our island was covered by a giant Heaventree, that you couldn't find on any ordinary map.

51002012.ContentEN: There's a secret cave on the island with a statue of a goddess more beautiful than any woman you've ever seen! Legend has it that the treasure is hidden right behind this goddess statue.
51002012.Subtitle:
There's a secret cave on the island with a statue of a goddess more beautiful than any woman you've ever seen!\
Legend has it that the treasure is hidden right behind this goddess statue.

51002013.ContentEN: As for what this treasure is, if you want to hear more, just a few silver coins will suffice.
51002013.Subtitle: As for what this treasure is, if you want to hear more, just a few silver coins will suffice.

51002014.ContentEN: (It sounds a lot like Purgatorio Island. This guy is probably a swindler. Best not to waste any time on him.)
51002014.Subtitle: (It sounds a lot like Purgatorio Island. This guy is probably a swindler. Best not to waste any time on him.)

51002015.ContentEN: Forget it. My coins are in short supply so I can't throw them around just to hear something.
51002015.Subtitle: Forget it. My coins are in short supply so I can't throw them around just to hear something.

51002016.ContentEN: This southern island you're talking about, does it have a giant Heaventree near it, and do they call it Purgatorio Island?
51002016.Subtitle: This southern island you're talking about, does it have a giant Heaventree near it, and do they call it Purgatorio Island?

51002018.ContentEN: How do you know that name?
51002018.Subtitle: How do you know that name?

51002020.ContentEN: ...You're from there too? Have they stopped preventing villagers from leaving?
51002020.Subtitle: ...You're from there too? Have they stopped preventing villagers from leaving?

51002021.ContentEN: Tell you what, when I was twenty, I went out to fish on the sea. I looked at the coastline of the Empire, which was winding like the saddles and castles I'd read about in books.
51002021.Subtitle:
Tell you what, when I was twenty, I went out to fish on the sea. I looked at the coastline of the Empire,\
which was winding like the saddles and castles I'd read about in books.

51002022.ContentEN: So, instead of taking my catch home as usual, I kept heading east, to this side of the coast. But life here turned out to be a bit different from what I had imagined...
51002022.Subtitle:
So, instead of taking my catch home as usual, I kept heading east, to this side of the coast.\
But life here turned out to be a bit different from what I had imagined...

51002023.ContentEN: It's been over a decade, and now I can't even scrape together enough for the fare back. I can only make ends meet with my eloquence.
51002023.Subtitle: It's been over a decade, and now I can't even scrape together enough for the fare back. I can only make ends meet with my eloquence.

51002024.ContentEN: So, since you're also from Purgatorio Island, do you know how the family at the easternmost part of the village is doing?
51002024.Subtitle: So, since you're also from Purgatorio Island, do you know how the family at the easternmost part of the village is doing?

51002025.ContentEN: (You told him about the village being attacked by Filthoids, with most villagers escaping by boat.)
51002025.Subtitle: (You told him about the village being attacked by Filthoids, with most villagers escaping by boat.)

51002027.ContentEN: But you just said they all escaped, right? Thank god... As long as they've got away...
51002027.Subtitle: But you just said they all escaped, right? Thank god... As long as they've got away...

51002028.ContentEN: By the way, if you ever get a chance to go back to Purgatorio Island, could you check near my old house to see if there's anything left?
51002028.Subtitle: By the way, if you ever get a chance to go back to Purgatorio Island, could you check near my old house to see if there's anything left?

51002029.ContentEN: If you can't find anything, just bring back something for me. Anything will do, even a blade of grass.
51002029.Subtitle: If you can't find anything, just bring back something for me. Anything will do, even a blade of grass.

51002031.ContentEN: It was so hard to leave when I was young, and now I can't go back...
51002031.Subtitle: It was so hard to leave when I was young, and now I can't go back...

51002102.ContentEN: There's a box here; is there anything inside that I could bring to him?
51002102.Subtitle: This book... Could it be his? Might as well take it back to him.

51002103.ContentEN: Let's see if there is a way to open the chest.

51002201.ContentEN: Ladies and gentlemen, drop by and drop a few coins, and you can join The Fisheries in Icelake to get the best and latest— Oh! It's you...
51002201.Subtitle:
Ladies and gentlemen, drop by and drop a few coins, and you can join the Icelake Fishermen's Mutual Aid Society\
to get the best and latest— Oh! It's you...

51002203.ContentEN: Jesus! Yes, this is the book I used to read over and over again when I was a kid. I thought about coming to the land because of it...
51002203.Subtitle: Jesus! Yes, this is the book I used to read over and over again when I was a kid. I thought about coming to the land because of it...

51002204.ContentEN: Thank you. Thank you so much. I need to give it a good read tonight. But for now, *sigh* making a living is more important.
51002204.Subtitle: Thank you. Thank you so much. I need to give it a good read tonight. But for now, *sigh* making a living is more important.

51002205.ContentEN: Take care, and don't be a swindler anymore.
51002205.Subtitle: Take care, and don't be a swindler anymore.

51002206.ContentEN: Ladies and gentlemen, those who are interested in Icelake Fishermen's Mutual Aid Society can learn more about it. We have decades of fishing experience from veteran fishermen. Fishing is great either serving as a hobby or a job!
51002206.Subtitle: Ladies and gentlemen, those who are interested in Icelake Fishermen's Mutual Aid Society can learn more about it. We have decades of fishing experience from veteran fishermen. Fishing is great either serving as a hobby or a job!

51002207.ContentEN: Oh, there you are, {Nickname}. Got time to learn fishing? But you're also from Purgatorio Island, so your fishing skills must be quite good...
51002207.Subtitle: Oh, there you are, . Got time to learn fishing? But you're also from Purgatorio Island, so your fishing skills must be quite good...

51002301.ContentEN: Young one, any news of Hamel Dickinson?

51002302.ContentEN: (Indeed, it is the same name on the title page of the journal you retrieved from Glevum Pit.)

51002303.ContentEN: (If your guess is correct, then the monster haunting the depths of the pit might just be...)

51002304.ContentEN: (Her cloudy eyes brighten slightly at the mention of that man. The name Hamel Dickinson clearly holds great significance for her. She is awaiting an answer.)

51002306.ContentEN: (Word by word, she silently reads through the journal. Tears stream down her deeply lined cheeks.)

51002307.ContentEN: (She then clasps the journal to her chest, as if embracing a long-lost beloved.)

51002308.ContentEN: ...Thank you, young one. Thank you for uncovering this secret that's been buried for forty years.

51002309.ContentEN: Please see my maid Sally for your reward. I'd like some time alone.

51002310.ContentEN: (She turns away, her frail, stooped back towards you.)

51002401.ContentEN: Child, thank you for all your help. Here's a little something for you.

51002402.ContentEN: *sigh* Her ladyship's health has worsened since last year, and I fear she doesn't have much time left. Her past with Mr Dickinson was the last thing on her mind...

51002403.ContentEN: Though it wasn't the news we hoped for, I still want to thank you for helping her retrieve this final piece of her past.

51002404.ContentEN: Well... I suppose there's no point in keeping secrets now.

51002405.ContentEN: You might have guessed — Mr Dickinson was her ladyship's beau forty years ago. At that time, her ladyship... well, it was Miss Hilin back then — was a cheerful, lively girl.

51002406.ContentEN: Hamel Dickinson was a miner of her age, working at her father's Glevum Pit.

51002407.ContentEN: As it often goes in such stories, the greater their social divide, the more stubbornly they clung to each other against all odds.

51002408.ContentEN: They say love burns brighter under opposition, but those stories don't tell you how quickly it can be extinguished by harsh reality!

51002409.ContentEN: When the master, who was the director of Glevum Pit appointed by the Aeolipile, learned about their relationship, Hamel Dickinson received a terrible thrashing instead of the master's blessing.

51002410.ContentEN: It was not just because of his background — the master had already arranged a politically advantageous marriage for Miss Hilin.

51002411.ContentEN: She was supposed to marry a noble from Flagson — a perfect match that would benefit both a new money family and a declining noble line.

51002412.ContentEN: But Miss Hilin didn't give up. She was such a brave and assertive young lady back then. She secretly asked me to deliver a letter to Mr Dickinson, asking him to meet her at midnight on April 26th at the Silver Peace Square.

51002413.ContentEN: That day happened to be the master's birthday, and all hands would be busy preparing for the celebration. Miss Hilin saw it as her only chance to escape her father's control.

51002414.ContentEN: She made up her mind that if he showed up, she would run away with him, no matter the destination.

51002415.ContentEN: That's right. Miss Hilin waited there till dawn, but only her furious father showed up. Soon after, she was sent away like a parcel to Flagson.

51002416.ContentEN: Thank goodness that her husband — his lordship — treated her well, and she spent forty peaceful years with him.

51002417.ContentEN: She never mentioned those days again, as if Hamel Dickinson had never existed.

51002418.ContentEN: A year ago, his lordship passed away, and her ladyship's health began to fail. One day, she suddenly told me she wanted to return to Icelake in her final days, to find the answer she deserved.

51002419.ContentEN: That's when I realized, she had never forgotten Hamel Dickinson — he had become a missing piece of her heart.

51002420.ContentEN: So we moved back to Icelake, but no one knew of Hamel Dickinson's whereabouts.

51002421.ContentEN: We managed to track down a few old miners, but after racking their memories, the last time they remembered seeing Mr Dickinson was forty years ago...

51002422.ContentEN: ...I never expected the truth to be like this! Turns out Mr Dickinson didn't stand her up, and it was because of Lady Hilin that he went to that pit... I don't know if this means consolation or more pain to her.

51002423.ContentEN: ...I really don't know how to console her ladyship at the moment...

51002424.ContentEN: Ugh, my head hurts! I should go prepare dinner now. I just hope my soup might make her feel a little better.

51002425.ContentEN: (Although the truth is harsh, in her final days, she has finally found the answer that was forty years late. At least, she won't have to step into the grave with doubts and regrets.)

51002426.ContentEN: (Perhaps this is as close to a good ending as one might hope for.)

51002427.ContentEN: I hope tonight's cream of mushroom soup brings her ladyship some comfort... Ah, you're back, child.

51002501.ContentEN: S—Scoot if you ain't buying any Phoxene... Stop drawing the soldiers' attention to me...

51002502.ContentEN: (Despite his strong, powerful build, the man cowers in the corner. His shifty gaze and the bag of Phoxene by his side suggest he's desperate to rid himself of it but hesitant to ask for help.)

51002503.ContentEN: Show some mercy and look the other way, please. Once I sell this load of Phoxene I'll leave Icelake at once and never ever come back.

51002504.ContentEN: (The man grabs his bag and bolts. After a breathless chase, you manage to tell him who you really are and convince him you were joking. In a hushed voice, he reveals his dire circumstances.)

51002505.ContentEN: Find me a buyer and I'll let you take 70 percents! No, 80! Please! I really need the help!

51002506.ContentEN: (Although you've agreed to help this man, his nervous expression and the bloodstains on the bag hint that this load of Phoxene might be dangerous. You realise there is only one possible \"buyer.\")

51002604.ContentEN: Huh, this must be a trap. You're trying to distract me with an errand, aren't you?

51002605.ContentEN: (The phone by the gate suddenly rings. Kevin leaps up like a startled hare and quickly picks up the phone.)

51002606.ContentEN: This is Kevin... Suspicious-looking man spotted in Mist Aken? Got it. I'm heading right over.

51002607.ContentEN: ...Probably the one you just mentioned. Could you lead the way?

51002701.ContentEN: Oh, isn't this Larry, our former model miner? Why are you here all by yourself? You've always got buddies hanging around with you — where are they today?

51002703.ContentEN: Well, doesn't matter where they are. Actually, I came to warn you that unauthorised mining and sales of Phoxene are illegal. The brass wants me to... Oooh! What's up with the blood on this bag of yours?

51002801.ContentEN: You friggin' liar! Why did you bring the soldiers over?

51002802.ContentEN: Shut up and put your hands where I can see them... Hands open wide, and drop that bag!

51002803.ContentEN: (With a gun barrel pointed straight at his head, Larry hesitates shortly before letting go of the bag. The bag drops to the ground and bloodstained Phoxene scatter all over the place.)

51002804.ContentEN: ...Gosh. Did you kill your buddies by bashing them with those rocks?

51002805.ContentEN: They attacked me first... It... It was all self-defence!

51002806.ContentEN: Well, none of us can be the judge of that! Alright, you need to come with us!

51002807.ContentEN: It wasn't me! Wasn't my fault...! It's the bag of Phoxene! If we never opened this damned bag, all of us would still be around! We'd all be alive!

51002809.ContentEN: Oh, before I forget — Thank you, {nickname}, for assisting the Escort. Here's your reward.

51002810.ContentEN: (Kevin drags Larry away, disappearing into the distance. The bloody story of the \"bloodstained stones\" became yet another tale buried under the Icelake snow.)

51002811.ContentEN: The bloody story of the bloodstained stones became yet another tale buried under the Icelake snow.

51002901.ContentEN: (You come to The Asphodel to pick some new commissions. A loud man captivates the audience with his dramatic recitations, eliciting bursts of merry laughter from time to time.)

51002902.ContentEN: Phantoms from the deep mountains, ghosts from the Icelake itself!

51002903.ContentEN: They're pressing in! They're getting closer!

51002905.ContentEN: I don't have any proper jobs for you at the moment, but...

51002907.ContentEN: A phantom!!! A silent stalker that ignores the doors!!!

51002908.ContentEN: As you can see, we've got a bit of a situation here.

51002909.ContentEN: Mr Buck. Orders only juice and milk at The Asphodel. Profession... a third-rate playwright and a first-rate producer of mumble-jumble. Look, he's been spinning his yarns for a while now.

51002910.ContentEN: As you can see, the man struggles to convey his thoughts clearly. Could you help by translating his flamboyant narratives?

51003001.ContentEN: (You tune into the playwright's bombastic musings.)

51003002.ContentEN: Nights can be particularly long for poets... and playwrights! Our pens track the vibe amongst people, and our hearts naturally rise and fall with the moon and tide!

51003003.ContentEN: When the night falls, we can cast away the blinding sun, the worldly voices, and the unsettled thoughts and reflections. It is the hour when I can truly commune with the cosmos itself!

51003004.ContentEN: Alas! Either my unwitting arrogance has peeved the goddess of inspiration, or the deity of sleep has played his cruel tricks on me! Otherwise, I would have noticed the sands of time trickling by!

51003005.ContentEN: I ought to have greeted dawn with pages filled with prose and stanzas. Instead, I awoke refreshed with an empty soul, and my sheets of paper blank!

51003006.ContentEN: In my enthralling dreams, I heard gentle footsteps, light as the dance of fairies. The scent of ripe fruits slathered in sweet honey wafted through the air!

51003007.ContentEN: Perhaps I was lost in my dreams, but those sounds and smells brought me back to reality! They are ephemeral, lingering by my side. Yet I am certain of their existence...

51003008.ContentEN: They are not hallucinations, yet I fail to grasp their trails. I cannot fathom these strange incidents. Are they phantoms? Ghosts? Or mere illusions?

51003009.ContentEN: My dilapidated abode remained untouched. This spirit stole nothing but my inspiration, which I cherish as dearly as life itself! It threatens to shatter my dreams...

51003101.ContentEN: The half-full jar of water next to the entrance seems to contain alcohol.

51003102.ContentEN: Beneath the window of Mr Buck's home, you find popcorn buried under the snow alongside a child's footprints.

51003201.ContentEN: A child involved with alcohol and popcorn... I think I know who this \"Inspiration Stealer\" may be. I'll look around the theatre.

51003302.ContentEN: Even a Charon has limits on cold tolerance... The temperature will be down by twenty degrees this evening. We might lose a few kids to the cold. *sigh*...

51003303.ContentEN: The last show of the theatre has ended. Why are you still here?

51003304.ContentEN: Greetings, my dear patron! Did you enjoy the play? You must be hungry after sitting through the show for three hours! Would you like some snacks and drinks?

51003305.ContentEN: Or perhaps you were captivated by the thrilling performance — how about a poster with the thespians' signatures?

51003306.ContentEN: Okay, let's see what you've got.

51003307.ContentEN: A special edition poster signed by Vitti, Tales of Icelake souvenir albums, glacial meltwater, theatre-themed popcorn, and refreshing fermented beverages!

51003308.ContentEN: Don't you worry! This barely contains any alcohol and won't get you drunk!

51003309.ContentEN: That's hard to say... Do you happen to know Mr Buck the playwright?

51003310.ContentEN: Of course I do! Mr Buck frequents the theatre and is one of my most cherished patrons! Despite being a noble, he actually respects Charon kids like me. Mr Buck is one fine gentleman!

51003311.ContentEN: I know people make fun of Mr Buck, but unlike most people, he genuinely deserves respect.

51003312.ContentEN: But this is no reason to sneak into his home through the window and put fermented beverages into his cup, I believe.

51003314.ContentEN: Mr Buck has a habit of writing his works at night. Your actions have delayed his progress for a month, so he hired me to find the mysterious \"Inspiration Stealer\".

51003315.ContentEN: (You formulate a theory but pause before articulating it, needing to organise your thoughts more clearly.)

51003316.ContentEN: Your business income isn't enough to cover your needs through the winter. Mr Buck might not be wealthy, but he is a noble and his house is warm enough. So, you sneaked into Mr Buck's home for the heating.

51003317.ContentEN: As for why you chose Mr Buck — even the smallest amount of alcohol makes him doze off. You could then sleep in his house without the fear of freezing to death. Am I right?

51003318.ContentEN: Ugh... You are indeed a great detective. You've got every detail right.

51003319.ContentEN: You might as well arrest me. I'm truly sorry for what I did. Though if I hadn't done it, I wouldn't be here for you to arrest...

51003320.ContentEN: I don't get to decide what to do with you. I'm taking you to my client.

51003402.ContentEN: You relay your findings to Mr Buck.

51003403.ContentEN: Oh! My brave saviour! Allow me to express my gratitude a millionfold! From this evening forth, I shall once again be graced by the goddess of inspiration!

51003404.ContentEN: As for you... the little thief in my dreams, you have given me a most unexpected surprise!

51003405.ContentEN: I'm very sorry, Mr Buck... But please believe me, I never intended to hurt you...

51003406.ContentEN: Oh, my little burglar. I'm well aware of how people scoff and snicker about me behind my back. They label me a third-rate playwright whose works never see the light of success.

51003407.ContentEN: Adorning my prose with the most exquisite words hasn't made them appreciate my efforts. They close their ears and their hearts... From what I see, someone who truly speaks from the heart is indeed a rare gem.

51003409.ContentEN: What I mean is that you, unlike others, have never seen me as a fool chasing impossible dreams. Therefore, I hold great respect for you, my young friend. If the winter proved too harsh, why didn't you come to me sooner?

51003410.ContentEN: I would gladly prepare a room for you. And if you wish, you may even peruse some of my manuscripts as bedtime stories. Though, I can't guarantee they will help you sleep.

51003411.ContentEN: What...? You'd really let me stay at your place...? Sir, you don't have to do that... But I can help with chores around the house. Please let me do this to make up for the delay I caused.

51003412.ContentEN: Thank you for everything you've done, my dear Phoxhunter! You are indeed the most meticulous detective in all of Icelake. This tale of unexpected kindness has given me much inspiration and forged a friendship between two kind souls.

51003413.ContentEN: Ah! I am brimming with inspiration! I must hurry and pen this down! If my prose achieves fame, your name shall be celebrated for centuries to come!

51003414.ContentEN:
The two of them depart, each with their desires fulfiled.\
However, you remain skeptical about whether Mr Buck's forthcoming work\
will be as thrilling as he predicts.

51003501.ContentEN: We thank thee for the sacrifice, mercy, and the Silverpeace that kept the plague, ignorance, and demons far from us...

51003502.ContentEN: Emma? Emma!? Snap out of it.

51003504.ContentEN: Emma, you have been distracted lately. Focus, will you?

51003505.ContentEN: Ugh... This is so boring... I wonder how Granny's doing.

51003506.ContentEN: Well, I have my reasons. I can tell you about it, but you must promise to keep it a secret.

51003509.ContentEN: Last month, I sneaked out to the slums and ran into a mysterious old lady called Belinda in an alleyway!

51003510.ContentEN: And she's got magic hands — she can braid all sorts of pretty pigtails and dye my nails with fresh flowers! She even told me stories I'd never heard before!

51003511.ContentEN: Ms Belinda never nagged at me nor treated me like a child. Though it was the first time I met her, she felt like my own granny when she held me in her arms...

51003512.ContentEN: That sounds really beautiful. Why do you want to keep it a secret?

51003513.ContentEN: Because Ms Belinda has horns... She might get into trouble if I tell my parents, classmates, or teachers about her...

51003514.ContentEN: We were supposed to meet today. But I can't make it anymore because the school suddenly added this memorial event. If you have the time, could you bring this doll to her?

51003515.ContentEN: I gotta go meet my classmates. Please make sure you give the doll to Ms Belinda. Thank you!

51003520.ContentEN: May our student, Emma, offer the floral tribute...

51003601.ContentEN: Thank you, Ms Belinda. I feel a lot better. If this is the wish of Robb, then I'll be brave and live on... for his sake.

51003602.ContentEN: May you find the strength to leave your sadness behind. We are always with you, kid. Belinda's hut is always open if you need anything.

51003604.ContentEN: Greetings. I haven't seen you around before. Have you just arrived at Icelake? Is there anything you seek from this old lady?

51003605.ContentEN: (The doll, though crudely made, captures Belinda's essence. The old Charon lady's eyes light up with joy as she gently caresses the doll.)

51003606.ContentEN: I can feel the plaza's essence in this doll... Ah, my memory eludes me! It's Memorial Week, filled with all sorts of events...

51003607.ContentEN: Thank you very much, {性别:young man|young lady}.

51003608.ContentEN: (She observes you silently for a long moment.)

51003609.ContentEN: You seem to be carrying a heavy burden. I smell the ocean's breeze and tides on you, and the lingering warmth in your palm... it is fading...

51003610.ContentEN: Every moment you spend in this city is entwined in confusion and sorrow. You try to hide your pain, keeping your sorrows buried deep away from others...

51003611.ContentEN: Pardon me for this intrusion, but have you recently lost someone dear?

51003612.ContentEN: Indeed. It is rare for Charons to reach my age.

51003614.ContentEN: You don't have to put on an act. I see the pain you hide.

51003615.ContentEN: Though I'm unsure how to ease your suffering, an old saying might provide some comfort...

51003616.ContentEN: \"They don their boots to traverse as Fate retracts her spindle. Doubt and uncertainty dost confound, but what is lost may come around.\"

51003617.ContentEN: You may leave. You shall find everything you've lost on your journey, {性别:young man|young lady}.

51003618.ContentEN: It's the epilogue from The Spindle of the Goddess of Fate... The hero, having lost everything, reunites with all they had lost in the realm of duality... Are you suggesting we'll meet again?

51003619.ContentEN: Consider it a token of gratitude for bringing the doll. You are clever, as I've seen... You'll unravel the meaning on your own.

51003620.ContentEN: I offer a small gift to first-time visitors, but I require a piece of iron or wire with your essence on it.

51003622.ContentEN: These are the wires we used when we lived on Purgatorio Island. Just collect and take some back.

51003630.ContentEN:
You can see tear marks on the Charon's face, but his eyes now glimmer with hope and a will to live on.\
