Belinda gives him a hug and he leaves with some hesitation.

51003631.ContentEN: Belinda gives him a hug and he leaves with some hesitation.

51003701.ContentEN: (Belinda takes the wires from you and crafts it into a girl's silhouette. You can see that the handicraft resembles Berenica.)

51003702.ContentEN: My skills are modest. I see only shadows and cannot be sure if this resembles the one you yearn for. I hope it brings you comfort.

51003703.ContentEN: It is my sincere wish that you are reunited.

51003704.ContentEN: (You leave Belinda's tent, now understanding why Emma treasures this place. Belinda's powers may be limited, but she uses them to mend souls and soothe wounds.)

51003801.ContentEN: You... Charon... You're one of us...

51003802.ContentEN: (The girl before you mumbles to herself. She seems to be looking at you... or gazing at a faraway place.)

51003806.ContentEN: (The girl lifts her messy hair to reveal a partially undone pigtail. There is no horn nor stump of any kind. It is more than obvious that she is actually a human.)

51003808.ContentEN: No, they're my horns... They're just cloaked by magic, so they look like hair to you! They've all seen them — two, thick, massive horns!

51003809.ContentEN: It's true! I don't know how to explain it, but...

51003810.ContentEN: I... I don't know how to describe it to you, but...

51003813.ContentEN: There you are, Faye! So you came to the outer city. We've been looking for you everywhere!

51003814.ContentEN: What, don't you like the special gift we prepared just for you? I spent my entire day's allowance to hire two Charon kids to catch all those rats.

51003815.ContentEN: Come back already. Everyone's so \"worried\" about you.

51003816.ContentEN: No... I'm not... I'm not going back...

51003817.ContentEN: Hey, look. Isn't that a Charon?

51003818.ContentEN: Hahaha! I was right — she's a demon!

51003819.ContentEN: So you came to the slums to look for your relatives? How interesting!

51003820.ContentEN: No! I didn't! ...No! NO! I'm a...

51003821.ContentEN: The girl covers her ears and runs away.

51003901.ContentEN: (The girl stands at the corner with her head down. She looks very upset.)

51003902.ContentEN: (The girl turns her head away. She does not seem very eager to talk.)

51003905.ContentEN: Yeah... I'm sorry... Really sorry... I messed up again.

51003908.ContentEN: I can't do anything right. Both my mom and my teachers say I'm stupid.

51003909.ContentEN: My classmates are smart. They said that the reason I'm stupid is because I'm a Charon, and my parents hid my horns with magic.

51003910.ContentEN: It's all my fault... I shouldn't have showed up among humans...

51003911.ContentEN: (You know that is a blatant lie. It also brings up unpleasant memories of what happened to you and Berenica on Purgatorio Island.)

51003912.ContentEN: (Those malicious acts may have been invited because of your weakness and differences, or, perhaps they just happened — the perpetrators only wanted to vent their hatred and you were just unlucky.)

51003913.ContentEN: (But this girl is more helpless than you. She didn't even have a friend like Berenica to share the pain.)

51003915.ContentEN: The fault lies with those who are mean to others.

51003916.ContentEN: There's nothing to be afraid of. Fight back.

51003918.ContentEN: Since they call you a demon, you might as well act like one.

51003920.ContentEN: They came up with a lie and made fun of you. But...

51003921.ContentEN: Since they call you a demon, you might as well act like one.

51003922.ContentEN: Let's go back and confront them.

51004004.ContentEN: She already made friends with a Charon? I knew it! Charons of a horn flock together!

51004006.ContentEN: (The girl tries to say something, but she just can't get the words out. Perhaps she needs a little help to tell her classmates how she feels.)

51004007.ContentEN: Yeah... Just... get... out of my... way!

51004008.ContentEN: ...Or I... My friend and I will send you all to hell...!

51004009.ContentEN: Or... Since you like worms and rats so much... I... I'll send you into the sewers...!

51004010.ContentEN: Wait... No. Even the rats would think you're gross!

51004011.ContentEN: (As if breaking free from some intangible shackles, the girl, who was once so quiet, is now unleashing a stream of invective.)

51004012.ContentEN: She curses at us?! Is she insane?

51004013.ContentEN: Ugh, I'm so pissed off right now! Someone teach her a lesson! Do it properly and this money is all yours!

51004101.ContentEN: That white-haired demon is so strong!

51004102.ContentEN: Umm... This doesn't look good! We better scoot!

51004104.ContentEN: For your information, Faye has signed a demon contract with me. If you ever mess with her again, I will show up immediately to deal with you.

51004107.ContentEN: See? That's all they can do.

51004109.ContentEN: Thanks for helping me... You looked really cool throwing those punches!

51004110.ContentEN: R—Really? I... I just said the things that I'd wanted to say but couldn't.

51004111.ContentEN: Thank you so much. I've never felt so relieved and happy in my life!

51004112.ContentEN: You're welcome. Your classmates should leave you alone for a while. I'll walk you home. Here, this is my address — come find me if they give you trouble again.

51004113.ContentEN: I don't want to go home...!

51004114.ContentEN: I'm a Charon and I want to stay with my people...

51004115.ContentEN: (The girl gives you a stubborn pout, clearly unconvinced.)

51004116.ContentEN: Don't you see that? They acted all tough and mighty towards you, but once someone stronger shows up, they just run away.

51004117.ContentEN: They're not as strong as they pretend to be. Likewise, their words are not as truthful as they seem. Faye, don't listen to them. You're a hundred percent human.

51004118.ContentEN: Remember, never doubt yourself just because someone says bad things about you... My family taught me this, and I hope you'll keep it in mind too.

51004119.ContentEN: (The girl blinks her eyes in confusion. She probably doesn't understand everything you just said, but her expression softens.)

51004120.ContentEN: Okay... If that's what you say, I'll try my best! But before I leave, I still have a teensy-weensy request...

51004123.ContentEN: (The girl carefully extends her frail hand and touches the horn on your head.)

51004124.ContentEN: Alright then. I won't touch it. But can I at least get a better look...?

51004125.ContentEN: (She carefully approaches you and studies the horn on your head.)

51004126.ContentEN: So this is what a real Charon horn looks like...

51004127.ContentEN: It's red and really delicate... it even reflects the sunlight. It looks way cuter than my pigtails.

51004128.ContentEN: You're the first to tell me that. But my pigtails are all messed up now... I have to braid them again.

51004129.ContentEN: (The girl takes out a comb from her bag. She then carefully combs and re-braids her pigtails. Once she's done, she lifts them up.)

51004130.ContentEN: Now, do they look like demon horns?

51004133.ContentEN: I have plenty of hairbands in my pocket. Can I braid a pigtail for you?

51004134.ContentEN: Please! I wanna see how it looks!

51004135.ContentEN: (The girl stands on her toes and pushes you down to reach your hair. She seems a lot more positive and energetic than before.)

51004136.ContentEN: Come on, just squat down a little...

51004137.ContentEN: (You feel the girl slightly tugging your hair. She combs your hair very gently. You don't have to worry about losing any.)

51004138.ContentEN: Done! Wow, you look so pretty with pigtails!

51004139.ContentEN: Too bad I don't have a mirror...

51004140.ContentEN: Ah...! I know! I can draw a picture of you.

51004141.ContentEN: (The girl opens her backpack and takes out a notebook. She then tries to draw a nice picture of you.)

51004142.ContentEN: Oh, I forgot to ask — what's your name?

51004143.ContentEN: Okay, {nickname}! I'll always remember you. Here, keep this picture I drew of you. See you around!

51004145.ContentEN: (The girl is about to leave but she suddenly turns around and gives you a serious gaze.)

51004146.ContentEN: Oh yeah... While I was combing your hair, I suddenly remembered something.

51004147.ContentEN: They kept telling me that Charons are demon's children who are stupid, evil, and are always doing bad things...

51004148.ContentEN: I don't think those words are true.

51004149.ContentEN: They were just lies made up as an excuse to bully your kind, right?

51004150.ContentEN: You must have... suffered way more pain than I ever have.

51004151.ContentEN: If there's anything I can do to help in the future, please do let me know... It's not because we're the same kind, but because we're friends.

51004202.ContentEN: (The man before you squints, his lips cracked and dry, as he gruffly spits out his words.)

51004203.ContentEN: Tell me. Who sent you here?

51004204.ContentEN: (Answering a question with another question always works.)

51004205.ContentEN: (It is obvious that he's waiting for someone.)

51004206.ContentEN: (I don't know what he meant, but that's an answer that no one will refuse.)

51004207.ContentEN: (The man broods silently for a while, assessing you. His health seems poor, his posture decrepit as he raises his head with an audible creak.)

51004209.ContentEN: (He snorted, but he seemed to be satisfied with your answer.)

51004210.ContentEN: I don't care who the fixer is. You're here for the stuff in my pocket, ain't that right?

51004211.ContentEN: (He opens his collar to reveal a dull iron piece. After showing it, he quickly conceals it again, looking around warily.)

51004212.ContentEN: (He immediately tightened his collar and looked around warily.)

51004213.ContentEN: Calibre 4. Double barrelled. Single shot. No Charon or Filthoid can survive a blast from this baby.

51004214.ContentEN: (His lip curls, as if he's just discussing the uses of a pesticide.)

51004215.ContentEN: You can have it for free, but I'll need you to do something for me.

51004216.ContentEN: Cut the crap. You're here for this piece of metal, ain't that right?

51004217.ContentEN: Do the job, and it's yours. I can even give you extra money.

51004218.ContentEN: Are you in or what? I ain't got all day.

51004219.ContentEN: Fine, I'm in. What's the deal?

51004220.ContentEN: Good. I'll give you a location. Kill everything there except for a woman.

51004222.ContentEN: None of your beeswax. Just get it done.

51004223.ContentEN: (The man tightens his collar and licks his dried lips, unwilling to utter another word.)

51004301.ContentEN: That was impressive. Now, take the quid and leave. I don't want to see you around here anymore.

51004302.ContentEN: You just wanted the Filthoids cleared? You didn't need to hire me for that. Someone would have handled it eventually.

51004303.ContentEN: Someone? You mean those bloody uniformed buggers treating Charons like trash?

51004304.ContentEN: What do you think happens when they find a frail Charon woman alone in there?

51004305.ContentEN: (The man suddenly clutches his chest, shaking and wincing as if a deep, old wound has flared. He stops shaking after a while, and then turns his head to spit on the ground.)

51004306.ContentEN: A kind Charon woman once threw stones at a hound that ran out of the inner city to save an injured stranger.

51004307.ContentEN: For that, they flogged her, dragged her bleeding body outside Icelake, and left her in this wilderness.

51004308.ContentEN: ...Maybe you can figure out a way to get her out of Icelake and live somewhere else.

51004309.ContentEN: ...I'm working on it. Soon I'll have enough cash.

51004310.ContentEN: (The man turns around to face the tent. His stiff lips open into what seems to be a smile, a rare expression for this man.)

51004311.ContentEN: (You thought you heard the cracks made by dried wood being straightened out.)

51004401.ContentEN: What's in the sewers that never goes away?

51004403.ContentEN: This is no place for a clueless fool like you.

51004901.ContentEN: (A woman holding a stack of papers by the street catches your attention. You notice a list of reagents written on one of the sheets. Perhaps this woman has something to do with <H>one of the things you got from Margie</>.)

51004902.ContentEN: You decide to show her one thing you got from Margie.

51004903.ContentEN: (The woman remains silent. She looks at you warily and shakes her head. Perhaps what you showed her isn't something she lost.)

51004905.ContentEN: Dr Luna, is it? Did you write this prescription?

51004906.ContentEN: (You present the prescription in your hand and show Luna the dangerous lines.)

51004907.ContentEN: \"Wild Filthoids gorge on our flesh, city lords shear our fleece. The hounds dine on fine white loaves, while lowly Charon sheep chew yellowed grass. We roll and we crawl, we baa and we fawn. The masters laugh, while we bear it all.\"

51004909.ContentEN: (Luna starts to stammer and gesture wildly with her hands. Her handwriting and reactions prove that you have found the right person.)

51004910.ContentEN: (Your words seem to calm Luna down a little.)

51004911.ContentEN: (Your actions seem to make her more anxious.)

51004912.ContentEN: If this piece of paper falls into the hands of someone else, you might get into some serious trouble.

51004913.ContentEN: (Luna points at the scar on her neck. She then picks up a blank piece of paper and quickly writes something on it.)

51004914.ContentEN: \"I was a wandering bard but a few Charon-haters kidnapped me and slit my throat.\"

51004915.ContentEN: Then why are you still writing stuff like that?

51004916.ContentEN: (Luna lowers her head and keeps on writing.)

51004917.ContentEN: \"Keeping it bottled up inside hurts a lot.\"

51004918.ContentEN: \"I know. I can't even show others what I wrote. But I just can't help it.\"

51004919.ContentEN: \"I can't sing anymore. And if I give up writing too, I'll lose the last valuable thing I have. When that happens, I'll truly have nothing to call my own.\"

51004920.ContentEN: You can find something else to keep yourself occupied. That should make you feel better. You can also keep writing if it helps, just don't lose your work again.

51004921.ContentEN: (The woman thinks for a while and then nods.)

51004922.ContentEN: \"Thank you for returning this to me, gentle soul. Please accpet this as a thank-you gift.\"

51004923.ContentEN: \"You flatter me. I'm just a coward whose complaints remain on useless pieces of scrap. I don't even have the courage to show them to anyone.\"

51004924.ContentEN: Expressing your true feelings in writing already makes you braver than most people. Just try to keep your work safe and don't lose it again.

51004925.ContentEN: (The lady gives a faint smile and nods. You can see tears welling in her eyes.)

51004926.ContentEN: \"Thank you for returning this to me, gentle soul. Please accpet this as a thank-you gift.\"

51004927.ContentEN: (The lady gives a raspy wail and buries her sad face in her hands. After a long time, she finally opens her purse and gives you some money while quaking in fear.)

51004928.ContentEN: \"This is all yours. Just give me back that piece of paper.\"

51004929.ContentEN: (You give a satisfied nod — if the poetry falls into the wrong hands, she would lose more than just a wad of cash. You saved her from that fate and deserve the payment.)

51004931.ContentEN: (Luna still mumbles unintelligibly. Her eyes dart about to avoid your gaze.)

51005002.ContentEN: (The middle-aged woman is dusting the old furniture with great efficiency. She seems so familiar with the Hypnos' House — a place that is not supposed to have any other visitors.)

51005003.ContentEN: Excuse me. I simply did not expect others to come to this place.

51005004.ContentEN: I am a housekeeper employed by Mr Henrik. My job is to regularly clean and maintain his property. Today just happens to be a scheduled workday.

51005005.ContentEN: So, may I ask who you are?

51005006.ContentEN: I'm a tenant living in the old house next door. I just came by to check if the doors and windows of this house are properly locked.

51005007.ContentEN: I'm not sure if you've been notified, but Mr Henrik has passed away... You no longer have to do this job.

51005009.ContentEN: But Mr Henrik has already made full payment. Before the contract formally expires, I shall abide by the code of conduct of my profession.

51005010.ContentEN: It's four in the afternoon. I am here to provide about three hours of housekeeping services.

51005011.ContentEN: Should you have any needs, please do not hesitate to inform me, and I will assist you as best as I can.

51005012.ContentEN: (While cleaning, Lina discovers scratch marks left by Psyche during her Deterioration, and soon notices dried patches of what appears to be Henrik's blood.)

51005013.ContentEN: I am not one to judge the lifestyles of my employers. My focus is solely on finding solutions to clean, fix, and improve the appearance of their properties.

51005014.ContentEN: (Lina proceeds with her tasks, each movement carried out with meticulous professionalism, showing no sign of disturbance even while mopping the bloodstained floor.)

51005015.ContentEN: I've actually... seen worse, in a house far more opulent than this. I once knew a master who burned down his manor along with his entire family.

51005016.ContentEN: This place, by comparison, feels much more like a home. At least Mr Henrik made it look like one.

51005017.ContentEN: (Her composure is unwavering, but you find yourself compelled to observe this poised and efficient woman more closely. Perhaps she's not as unflappable as she seems.)

51005018.ContentEN: He was a renowned doctor twenty years ago, and I was merely a maid in a viscount's household. Mr Henrik was called to diagnose the viscount's wife, which was when I first met him. I never thought our paths would cross again.

51005019.ContentEN: I was tasked with escorting the doctor back to his hotel. On our way, a Charon girl collapsed right before us. Without a moment's hesitation, Mr Henrik saved her and asked me to look after her.

51005020.ContentEN: Mr Henrik was not only a skilled doctor but also a man who cherished every life, regardless of one's background.

51005021.ContentEN: Mr Henrik never cared for fame... My high regard for him remains unchanged.

51005022.ContentEN: That is precisely what made him a noble soul.

51005023.ContentEN: It is truly heartrending to hear the misfortunes he endured.

51005024.ContentEN: Yet, I feel I still haven't done enough.

51005025.ContentEN: Mr Henrik likely wanted to maintain a certain distance; hence, my visits were infrequent. Otherwise, you and I might have met sooner.

51005026.ContentEN: He probably didn't want me here too often after his passing. Thus, I believe it's time to return the key to its rightful owner. I shall place it on Mr Henrik's desk in your presence.

51005027.ContentEN: (You fail to recall anything. Perhaps it was a mistaken feeling.)

51005028.ContentEN: (The key you got from Margie closely resembles Lina's key to the Hypnos' House.)

51005029.ContentEN: (You remember seeing it on Henrik. It must have been lost during the turmoil of that night and inadvertently found by Margie.)

51005030.ContentEN: Mr Henrik has a chest for important documents. This key might open it.

51005031.ContentEN: He once instructed that should any misfortune befall him, the chest is to be opened and his will read.

51005032.ContentEN: I couldn't find the key in the house, but now it has found its way back. Thank you for taking proper care of it.

51005033.ContentEN: May I ask you to witness as I fulfill Mr Henrik's final wishes exactly as he intended?

51005034.ContentEN: (With Ms Lina's intimate knowledge of every corner of the Hypnos' House, you successfully locate the chest and open it. She solemnly reads the will, with you as the witness.)

51005035.ContentEN: (Henrik may have anticipated his tragic demise, but his will is thoughtful and clear. He not only expressed his profound guilt over his daughter's death but also had the following statement—)

51005036.ContentEN: \"In the event of my passing, all properties under my name shall be transferred to Ms Lina Bell—\"

51005037.ContentEN: \"—as a token of my gratitude for her years of dedicated service to the Hypnos' House and my Charon patients.\"

51005038.ContentEN: \"I am deeply grateful for everything Ms Bell has done and regard her as a highly honourable lady.\"

51005040.ContentEN:
You leave Henrik's office alone. Ms Lina, overwhelmed with emotion, appears to need some time to herself.\
It is best to leave her undisturbed for a while.

51005041.ContentEN: Now, you have a new landlady.

51005102.ContentEN: I really appreciate what you did for us last time! The money helped the families in the slums get food on the table. They wanted me to thank you for that.

51005104.ContentEN: It's everything! I haven't met anyone as kind, capable, and polite as you in ages.

51005105.ContentEN: How's life in Icelake, now that you've been here for a while?

51005106.ContentEN: Well, even though I agree that life is a journey to the finish line, it would be a shame to miss out on the scenery along the way!

51005107.ContentEN: I TOTALLY UNDERSTAND THAT! I felt exactly the same when I first got here! The place has so many strange rules and the people are pretty weird as well!

51005108.ContentEN: Hmm, guess your hometown is not very safe... You're not happened to be a refugee as well, huh?

51005109.ContentEN: Anyway, let's talk about something else.

51005110.ContentEN: Ooh! Come check out what I've got lately! They are all novelties and strange little gadgets. If you find anything you like, I'll give you a 20% discount as a thank-you for helping me catch that filthy thief.

51005111.ContentEN: (You stoop to take a closer look at Margie's \"new arrivals.\" The shelves are filled with random objects, most of which have obviously been used before, but they have all been cleaned meticulously.)

51005112.ContentEN: But they're fun. The real value isn't all about money, you know!

51005113.ContentEN: Of course not! I'm an upright citizen! Somebody probably chucked them, but it would be a crime to see them end up in the bin. I just want to find a loving home for them!

51005115.ContentEN: (You find it hard to turn down her generous offer and start going through Margie's shelves to find something valuable.)

51005116.ContentEN: Didn't find anything that catches your eye? Well, come back next time when I restock.

51005117.ContentEN: Not bad. You've got an eye for value and treasure. Perhaps you have the keen senses of a detective!

51005118.ContentEN: A detective? That's all it takes?

51005119.ContentEN: The things you picked up are hardly worth anything in cold hard cash. Most people simply ignored them. But they might also be the most valuable things here.

51005120.ContentEN: The price lies in... their mysterious and interesting backstories! You chose it specifically for that reason, right?

51005121.ContentEN: With patience and meticulous observation, you can definitely unveil the story and secrets behind the treasure.

51005122.ContentEN: Never underestimate rubbish bins. They're usually where interesting stories and crime evidence are found! Me myself slowly learned my way about Icelake by going through its dustbins, you know.

51005123.ContentEN: Already curious, huh? Want to learn more about this city? Pay now and you can take these babies home for some digging up!

51005124.ContentEN: (Wait, did I just walk into a setup...?)

51005125.ContentEN: Hey! Stop looking at me as if I'm running a rip-off scam! This is just marketing. And you've already noticed something special about them, right? You can't just give up halfway.

51005126.ContentEN: What, you're not even gonna haggle? You're making me feel a bit guilty...

51005127.ContentEN: Hmm. Getting down to the dimes and nickels, eh? You're truly a Phoxhunter...

51005128.ContentEN: Heyyyy! Don't go! At least try to haggle a bit! Come on!

51005129.ContentEN: Now they are yours. Think of it as my token of extreme gratitude for your help in catching that thief the other day!

51005130.ContentEN: (Margie stuffs the three items into your arms before you can refuse.)

51005131.ContentEN: Good luck with your investigations, Detective!

51005132.ContentEN: Once you've investigated the stories behind them, come back and tell me what you think about Icelake!

51005202.ContentEN: Now tell me what you've found!

51005203.ContentEN: It seems a bit cruel to ask her to stop writing those poems... I'll keep an eye on any waste paper that appears in her bin just in case her poems lands her in trouble.

51005204.ContentEN: The outside world may not be as wonderful as she imagines... But perhaps she really needs that dream to get her through the day.

51005205.ContentEN: You and Ms Lina are incredibly lucky! Perhaps fate really reward the kind-hearted!

51005206.ContentEN: Those were some fascinating discoveries! You're like the most astute superdetective I've ever met!

51005207.ContentEN: Icelake holds all sorts of surprises... or horrors... hidden in the most unexpected corners.

51005208.ContentEN: Anyway, having spent some time investigating, do you feel differently about Icelake?

51005209.ContentEN: Wow... That response is so you! I tried guessing what you might say, but I was way off!

51005210.ContentEN: I have a feeling that you'll be staying here for quite some time. Overnight travellers rushing to somewhere else wouldn't be that philosophical!

51005211.ContentEN: That means we'll see each other for quite a while, right?

51005212.ContentEN: I don't know if anyone has told you this yet, but I'm gonna say it again—

51005301.ContentEN: Once this is properly sterilised, it'll make a tasty dish!

51005302.ContentEN: ...The fishy taste is gone, but I can't get the umami flavour out of the ingredients...

51005303.ContentEN: (The man speaks extremely fast, his bloodshot eyes darting between a notebook and some seafood. He makes hurried notes with a hand covered in scallion bits.)

51005304.ContentEN: (The rusty rings of the notebook suggest it's been well-used and poorly maintained.)

51005305.ContentEN: (You take a closer look at the messy drawings and lines, and make out the names of a number of spices and cooking techniques. This is probably the man's recipe.)

51005306.ContentEN: (Turning to leave might be wise, but as you pivot, your foot squelches loudly in a puddle of sticky fluid.)

51005307.ContentEN: (The man snaps his attention to you.)

51005310.ContentEN: A Phoxhunter? Then maybe you'd consider a commission to help me perfect a delicious dish?

51005311.ContentEN: Thank you. The first dish is an improvement of traditional marinated seafood popular among local fishermen. Could you help me gather some ingredients for the marinade?

51005312.ContentEN: Exactly! While you gather those, I'll set up for the cooking and sterilisation process.

51005313.ContentEN: The natural salt spring here seems to provide the necessary ingredients for marinating. Please take some back.

51005401.ContentEN: Chop the scallions... rinse the fish and shrimp... add salt and vinegar. Considering Icelake's palate, maybe some sugar too...

51005402.ContentEN: (Marcus grabs the bag of ingredients you've collected and drags it into the alley, mumbling about his recipe.)

51005403.ContentEN: (After a while, Marcus rushes out from the alley, not realising how comical he looks until he trips and faceplants into the snow. He scrambles up with an embarrassed grin.)

51005405.ContentEN: Here, try this — can you taste the unique flavour of Icelake?

51005406.ContentEN: (He presents a packet of fish and shrimp marinated in a dark, aromatic sauce. The pungent smell hits you even through the sealed membrane.)

51005407.ContentEN: Don't be so conservative. This is refined cuisine. You should try something unconventional in life, or you'll miss out on so many thrills.

51005408.ContentEN: Hahah, forget it. You look like you're about to faint.

51005409.ContentEN: Hmph. You're quite set in your own ways, aren't you? Luckily, not everyone is like you.

51005411.ContentEN: I'm working on a second recipe. I'm counting on you, my taste-bud partner!

51005501.ContentEN: A stew would be perfect as an appetiser in this cold. I'm just missing one thing...

51005502.ContentEN: (The biting winds of Icelake have turned Marcus's face a ghastly white. To the casual observer, he might as well be a statue carved from ice.)

51005503.ContentEN: (However, Marcus is entirely oblivious to the harsh environment and the sorry state of his health.)

51005504.ContentEN: (The man is wholly focused on quickly jotting down and then dismissing various recipes and cooking methods.)

51005506.ContentEN: Let's get started! I need some obese Frostspines to complete the dish. Can you fetch some for me?

51005507.ContentEN: (While catching fish is more dangerous, you still breathe a sigh of relief as you know that Marcus won't be asking you to eat it raw.)

51005508.ContentEN: After a long while, you finally got the obese Frostspines Marcus needed.

51005601.ContentEN: (Marcus is peeling Borealberries without a word. The man appears more and more like a statue of ice. His brow twitches occasionally, betraying a pain he's never known before.)

51005602.ContentEN: (The berries and peels are bloodied and muddy, some crushed. Marcus's hands are raw and bleeding, suggesting he climbed a cliff to gather these berries.)

51005603.ContentEN: (One side of Marcus's clothing is soaked in blood. Though he's managed to stop the bleeding, it's clear his injuries are still severe.)

51005605.ContentEN: It's okay. Just a scratch. I had a little fall while collecting Borealberries.

51005606.ContentEN: (Marcus dismisses further talk of his injuries, tossing the berries into the stew, tasting and adjusting the seasoning.)

51005607.ContentEN: Adding fresh Borealberries into the stew really enriched the flavours.

51005608.ContentEN: I probably have to come up with a new way of dealing with the obese Frostspines...

51005609.ContentEN: (Despite his injuries, Marcus painstakingly trims, skillets, and simmers the fish, his dedication unwavering.)

51005610.ContentEN: (After considerable effort, the aromas blend into a delightful explosion of flavours. Marcus serves up a bowl of the steaming fish stew, his face expectant for your critique.)

51005611.ContentEN: *cough*... It's done. Try this. I hope it's special enough to impress you.

51005612.ContentEN: It's delicious. Really warms you up.

51005613.ContentEN: Fantastic! I'm heading back to the city to show the boss our creation.

51005614.ContentEN: Thanks a lot, partner! We really nailed this recipe. People will love it! And it'll surely blow my boss' mind too!

51005702.ContentEN: (This is the third time you see Marcus. He's seated quietly, a lunchbox in his lap. The man looks utterly spent, his skin shrivelled up, as if deprived of sleep for quite a while.)

51005703.ContentEN: (His injuries have yet to be properly treated. In a warmer city, those wounds might have festered and started to smell.)

51005704.ContentEN: ...Are you alright? What did your boss say?

51005706.ContentEN: ...Hah. He didn't even look at it. Said none of my dishes made any money, so he's let me go.

51005708.ContentEN: That's okay. I finished my last recipe, though. Wanna try?

51005709.ContentEN: (With trembling hands, Marcus opens the lunch box. The rich scent of vegetable stew and meat patties fills the air, hinting at nourishment and care.)

51005710.ContentEN: (It's not the kind of steak that rich people usually have, but a meal that can feed a labourer after a day of hard work. There are even several star-shaped hash browns that serve as a loving touch.)

51005711.ContentEN: (You take a bite. The food, ordinary in appearance, bursts with flavours that invigorate your spirit. Even the cold of Icelake seems to fades away.)

51005712.ContentEN: (Beneath the lunchbox, a recipe filled with corrections is neatly placed. Marcus nods his head, indicating it's now yours. He awaits the food critic's review with a smile.)

51005713.ContentEN: Thank you for trying my food...

51005714.ContentEN: (Marcus gives a long sigh of relief. He slowly lowers his listless arms and closes his weary eyes.)

51005715.ContentEN: You really worked hard collecting all sorts of ingredients for me. You deserve some rest... I need a break myself too...

51005716.ContentEN: I have failed multiple times, but you still believe in me and are willing to try the food I've made... Thank you so much. That means the world to me.

51005717.ContentEN: (Marcus gives a long sigh of relief. He slowly lowers his listless arms and closes his weary eyes.)

51005718.ContentEN: I should be working harder for my loyal partner, but I'm a bit exhausted... I'll take a rest for now...

51005719.ContentEN: (From Marcus's satisfied smile, it seems he just received the feedback he's been waiting for.)

51005801.ContentEN: (Despite all your efforts, the chest stubbornly refuses to open.)

51005802.ContentEN: Heeey! Stop messing around with our stuff!

51005803.ContentEN: That was bold. Bigger Bro, this {性别:lad|lass} ain't someone to be messed with.

51005804.ContentEN: It's alright. Me didn't know either...

51005805.ContentEN: (Bigger Bro suddenly clamps his hand over Big Bro's mouth and gives him a punch.)

51005808.ContentEN: Nice weather today, isn't it? We got both the sun and the moon.

51005809.ContentEN: (Another man suddenly pops out near the chest, dark ink dripping from his hand behind him.)

51005810.ContentEN: (He attempts a nonchalant whistle. The chest next to his feet is suddenly marked by the words \"Stuff of the Imperial 3\"! Obviously they were just written by this Small Bro.)

51005811.ContentEN: No one in the Empire touches the Imperial Three's stuff! You gotta pay us like seven... eight... nine... What's after nine?

51005816.ContentEN: Bigger Bro, nine is followed by more nines. We call it ninety-nine!

51005817.ContentEN: Bloody bugger! This one's playing tricks on the Imperial Three! We're gonna teach you a real lesson, and it won't be over unless you pay us ninety-nine zillion silver coins!

51005901.ContentEN: Shhh... Don't move. Just play dead.

51005902.ContentEN: I'm dead. I'm really dead. I'm totally dead...

51005903.ContentEN: You... You killed my Big Bro and Bigger Bro... You owe me blood money!!

51005904.ContentEN: (No matter how hard you hit him, Big Bro refuses to let go of the chest. Small Bro clings onto your leg with great vigour. You are obviously trapped in a ploy to extort money.)

51005905.ContentEN: Hahahaha! We're alive again! Stupid potato head! No one messes with the Imperial Three!

51005906.ContentEN: Yeah, stupid potato... Potato...? It makes my stomach growl.

51005907.ContentEN: We'll buy some potatoes once we sell this chest. Let's get moving.

51005908.ContentEN: You may leave, but the chest stays.

51005909.ContentEN: You killed me bros and you kicked me! Argh! My arm! You broke my arm! You gotta pay me! Double!

51005910.ContentEN: (Small Bro simply refuses to let go of your leg.)

51005911.ContentEN: Hey, what are you doing? Drop your hands, now.

51005912.ContentEN: I saw everything. {nickname} found the chest first. What you did was robbery — and now it's become extortion, which is even worse.

51005913.ContentEN: (Outsider gives you a look. He's hinting that he'll take care of the problem.)

51005914.ContentEN: It's not yours! The chest got our name on it!

51005915.ContentEN: Stuff of the Imperial 3. Your writing is... wild.

51005916.ContentEN: Wizard, ain't it? Been practising with this marker pen.

51005917.ContentEN: Marker pen? Sounds really cool. Can I have a look?

51005918.ContentEN: Hmph. What a hick. Here, take a look.

51005919.ContentEN: (Outsider takes the pen and spins it in the air. He then writes something on Bigger Bro's back.)

51005920.ContentEN: Alright. Following your logic, all of you are now working for Mr Outsider. That's me.

51005922.ContentEN: Wait... Bigger Bro's got something on his back... \"Outsider's Sidekick\". Whoa...

51005923.ContentEN: If Bigger Bro is Outsider's Sidekick, and Bigger Bro is our boss... Does that make us Outsider's...

51005924.ContentEN: Yay! I'm Outsider's Sidekick! What's a sidekick?

51005926.ContentEN: Huh! I see... Nah, still don't get it.

51005927.ContentEN: It means you all listen to me and follow my lead. I'm a generous man. If {nickname} and I make some quid, we'll make sure all of you get a share.

51005928.ContentEN: That sounds awesome! We'll call you Super Bros and you can call us Bigger Bro, Big Bro, and Small Bro. We're all part of the same bro-team. Alright, bros, all together—

51005930.ContentEN: Yeah, okay. Now tell me why you were robbing people here.

51005931.ContentEN: We came here from Scarletriver to make a living. But we kept running into Filthoids and snow wolves. And there's this huge scrap between The Forsakens and the Legion. But we gotta eat, you know...

51005932.ContentEN: You're pretty far away from home. How did you get here?

51005933.ContentEN: It's not that far. We walked here!

51005935.ContentEN: How much walking are we talking about?

51005936.ContentEN: At least six months, I guess. Only those lacking common sense would attempt a thing like this.

51005937.ContentEN: Ahem, alright. I am a fair Super Bro. Give back the chest to {nickname} and run some errands for me, and I'll show mercy and forgive you.

51005938.ContentEN: Well, I'm trying to make them show some respect. Besides, we're not taking advantage of them. They're going to thank us for this.

51005939.ContentEN: Huh? We got nothing left! It's true! Our pockets are emptier than a ghost town!

51005943.ContentEN: Alright, looks like we've got everything settled. Come to my place tonight. Dinner's on me.

51006001.ContentEN: For this month, the Old Hunters is in the lead, with Victims of Ms Camilla's Gaslighting right behind them, and Our Aim is to Become Naturally Invincible Super Phoxhunters is ranked third...

51006002.ContentEN: The older teams have proper names, but the new ones... *sigh* We're running out of space on this bulletin board.

51006003.ContentEN: (A tavern waiter mumbles to himself while writing down a series of strange names on the board. He seems to be intently worried about something.)

51006005.ContentEN: Huh? Oh, I'm updating the Phoxhunter Team Rankings for the month. It was Ms Camilla's idea to keep track and showcase how the Phoxhunters are doing.

51006006.ContentEN: This includes how many commissions they've knocked out this month, their average earnings per job, whether they've had any dust-ups with clients, that sort of thing.

51006007.ContentEN: So, if you're thinking of starting a new team with Outsider, do take the time to discuss your team's name and get back to me once you're ready to register.

51006008.ContentEN: That makes sense. Snow's heard quite a few complaints about the bad-tempered Phoxhunters here. They do have a reputation for being a bit grumpy and intimidating.

51006009.ContentEN: But — imagine teams named \"Paw Buddies\" or \"Kitten Pals\" — they'd seem so friendly! Everyone knows animal lovers are good people.

51006010.ContentEN: Well, I don't think so. My solo team was named after a small critter but that didn't help me get more commissions.

51006011.ContentEN: Whoa? Mutt Ears! You just popped up from nowhere!

51006012.ContentEN: I was just passing by and saw our new friend. So I came to check on you guys and see if you need any help.

51006013.ContentEN: What's the name of your team?

51006015.ContentEN: Well, for starters, when people talk about small animals, they don't usually think of insects. Besides, you probably know why your team's name hasn't exactly been drumming up more commissions...

51006016.ContentEN: Exactly! I knew there was no way for Outsider to name his team after cutesy furballs!

51006017.ContentEN: What do you know? I'm trying to stand out from the crowd and leave an impression. What do you think, {nickname}? The name of my team left its mark on you, right?

51006020.ContentEN: NO WAY! Keep messing around like this and our team will hit the rock bottom of the list!

51006021.ContentEN: Being at the rock bottom might get people interested as well—

51006023.ContentEN: Now that we've teamed up, it's time to scrap the old team name of yours and come up with a new one!

51006024.ContentEN: Umm, okay. But what if the three of us can't agree on the name?

51006025.ContentEN: Hah! This Demon King is way ahead of you. Let's hold a little contest, and the winner chooses the name. Come on, follow me for the three challenges!

51006101.ContentEN: Ah, isn't this our resident loud chatterbox, Snow!? And behind you is... Mr Siteolder from the Edible Insects Researcher Squad, and our newest Phoxhunter whose performance data has yet to be recorded...

51006102.ContentEN: Oh, it's you, Lunoxplorer. Flattered you remember my team's name, but you've botched my name again. It's only been a few days!

51006103.ContentEN: That's because I'm always too focused on your performance data. I promise I'll get your name right next time, Mr Siteolder.

51006104.ContentEN: So, Snow the Loud Chatterbox, tell me about this one.

51006105.ContentEN: {性别:He|She} is my newly recruited little minion. I'm showing {性别:him|her} the ropes of being a qualified Phoxhunter.

51006106.ContentEN: That being said, time for me to introduce Lunoxplorer! She's the most adventurous Luno I've ever met, and she loves to collect all sorts of information about adventurers.

51006107.ContentEN: To prove that, she actually remembers that horrible name of Outsider's team!

51006108.ContentEN: While Mr Oldsiter may not excel at naming, he's certainly a seasoned Phoxhunter. An ordinary Phoxhunter stuck with a team name like that would have quit or starved to death by now.

51006109.ContentEN: Starved to death...? Um, fine. Let's change that name. So, Button Mushroom, tell us more about the little trials.

51006110.ContentEN: Hmph, you've finally come around! Let me fill in Lunoxplorer on the situation.

51006111.ContentEN: (Snow gave a very exaggerated and animated tale of how Outsider was obsessed with the original name of his team and how the three of you decided to have a competition to decide the team's name.)

51006112.ContentEN: Got it, we're deciding it through that challenge. Well, I won't be losing!

51006113.ContentEN: Yes. You've made some of the most attempts so far. But {nickname} might not be familiar with my challenge, so here's a quick overview.

51006114.ContentEN: Simply put, I've gotten to know the Phoxhunters by observing and documenting their skills and performance.

51006115.ContentEN: The thing is, with so many Phoxhunters, observing them during live missions is too risky. That's why I enlisted the help of a respected elder — a smith who looks a bit like you.

51006116.ContentEN: Are you talking about Lunosmith? We know her!

51006117.ContentEN: Great, that makes things easier — you must have seen her handiwork.

51006118.ContentEN: I asked her to make a magical gadget — a location marker that can be placed anywhere. Interacting with the marker displays a brief message and records nearby activities.

51006119.ContentEN: You complete the challenge by fulfilling the task specified in the message. And if the results are good, I might even have a prize for you. That's how I keep tabs on Phoxhunters' performance.

51006120.ContentEN: I'm all too familiar with these challenges. You bet on the wrong horse, Button Mushroom. I don't even know how to lose.

51006121.ContentEN: Easy now. Let's see the results speak for themselves. Come find me here if you're up for it, {性别:young man|young lady}.

51006122.ContentEN: (Lunoxplorer took out a pen and marked a spot on your map of Icelake.)

51006201.ContentEN: Okay. Let's go over the rules before we start. Once I say \"GO\", you need to navigate through the glowing circles I've marked along the path.

51006202.ContentEN: Don't worry. That Outsayer may look confident, but my money's on you. Go get 'em!

51006301.ContentEN: Easy peasy. I've got this in the bag.

51006302.ContentEN: Huh? Who spilt oil on the ground?

51006303.ContentEN: What? A dog on the rooftop?

51006305.ContentEN: It's okay, try again. I believe in you!

51006401.ContentEN: Well done, {nickname}. Now, follow me to the second challenge.

51006402.ContentEN: Keep up, Oldtryer. Don't lose sight of us.

51006501.ContentEN: The rules for this challenge are also quite simple. Once I say \"GO\", balloons crafted by Lunosmith at my request will rise.

51006502.ContentEN: Shoot and pop them. That's it!

51006602.ContentEN: ...Dammit. I got oil on my hands. I can hardly reload.

51006603.ContentEN: Don't bother reloading. {nickname} has already completed the challenge.

51006701.ContentEN: Congratulations, {nickname}. I was right. You've proven yourself a Phoxhunter with real promise.

51006702.ContentEN: Hmm-hmph. So, according to our agreement, you get to decide the team's name! Outsider, any problem with that?

51006703.ContentEN: Hell yeah! You must have set some traps for me!

51006704.ContentEN: Nonsense. As a professional at tracking Phoxhunter performance, I don't take sides or target individuals.

51006707.ContentEN: Unless someone takes these challenges as a job and tries to bleed me dry like Outsider! Can you believe this man? Every time I set up a new batch of challenge markers, he's the first to finish, then hounds me for rewards — the cheek!

51006708.ContentEN: And because no one could ever beat his records, nobody else wanted to take on my challenges anymore! That's why somebody needs to be taught a lesson!

51006709.ContentEN: Is that why you've been sabotaging me!? And you finally got my name right. Have you been messing it up on purpose all this time?

51006710.ContentEN: Well... I didn't realise you were collecting data. I thought you were just burning through your coin stash out of boredom.

51006711.ContentEN: Well, now you know. So don't come to bust my challenges next time.

51006712.ContentEN: Ah, sorry to drag you into this. But you did really well in the challenges, and I'm not lying about that.

51006713.ContentEN: Indeed. Almost beat my records. Almost!

51006714.ContentEN: I think you need another lesson!

51006716.ContentEN: You... I'm not going to dignify that with a response.

51006717.ContentEN: Let's get back to the main topic. Since {nickname} won, {性别:he|she} gets to decide the team's name.

51006719.ContentEN: But are you sure you don't want an impressive name like \"Edible Insects Researcher Squad\"? Just hearing it will jolt you awake at night, you know!

51006720.ContentEN: No, thanks! I'd say something like \"Squires of the Demon King of Light\" has more allure.

51006721.ContentEN: Then... how about \"Intern Researchers on Edible Insects of the Demon King of Light\"?

51006722.ContentEN: Hmph... we should make the word \"insect\" less conspicuous. What about \"Intern Researchers on Yummy Bugs of the Demon King of Ultralight from the Pure White Infernal\"?

51006723.ContentEN: We're focusing too much on the Demon King of Light part! I think we should go for \"Intern Researchers on the 99 Innovative Culinary Styles of Delicious Winged Hexapods of the Demon King of Ultralight from the Pure White Infernal\". What do you say?

51006724.ContentEN: While these two knuckleheads are bickering, take your time to think. Many agonize over naming their teams, but my advice? Follow your heart.

51006726.ContentEN: \"Life is like a lonely cruise through the boundless darkness of the night.\"

51006727.ContentEN: \"The river weeps, overflowing its banks, while the thorny thickets on either side stand as a testament to its sorrow.\"

51006728.ContentEN: Cruise through the night... Nocturnal voyagers...

51006731.ContentEN: Hmm... The name's a little short, but it doesn't sound bad.

51006732.ContentEN: Now that you're the team leader, do keep Mr Outsider and Snow in check. A good leader always keeps their men in line.

51006734.ContentEN: \"The Noctoyagers\"... Hmm, sounds pretty good! If other teams were like you, there would be plenty of space on the board.

51006735.ContentEN: Keep it up. Try to best those long, tongue-twisting names and get to the top.

51006801.ContentEN: May your soul find peace in the depths of the Misty Sea...

51006802.ContentEN: (In this place burdened with your poignant memories, a woman draped in black veils speaks softly, eyes downcast. Her lantern emits a soft, eerie glow as she murmurs her prayer.)

51006805.ContentEN: You have come, child... Please, wait while I complete this final rite.

51006806.ContentEN: …May you be reborn within the bosom of Mother Embla.

51006807.ContentEN: Greetings, child. I roam as the Ferrywoman of the Misty Sea — or, if you prefer a more personal touch, you may call me Lady Nifl.

51006808.ContentEN: I heard the whispers of a wandering soul here, so I came to guide her to return to the Misty Sea.

51006810.ContentEN: Indeed. Child, have you come here for someone who has passed?

51006812.ContentEN: My eyes can see the longings of souls.

51006813.ContentEN: As I guided her, I glimpsed all she held dear — and among these visions, I saw you.

51006815.ContentEN: I... I failed to protect her. She must be... disappointed in me.

51006816.ContentEN: Quite the opposite. Many souls I've witnessed depart with intense grievances and bitterness, their cries thick as the fog along the riverbanks.

51006817.ContentEN: But her voice was very gentle. It bore no sorrow, anger, nor resentment — only expressions of gratitude and... blessings.

51006818.ContentEN: Perhaps, those were meant for you.

51006821.ContentEN: I refuse to accept this ending.

51006822.ContentEN: (Lady Nifl smiles gently, as if she had anticipated your response.)

51006823.ContentEN: Child, I have lived long and bid farewell to countless souls, and I've heard such words time and again.

51006824.ContentEN: Just as plants succumb to wildfires and bugs perish in storms... Impermanence is a part of life. Sooner or later, death touches us all.

51006825.ContentEN: Rather than cursing fate's indifference and cruelty, or lamenting our frailty, we can choose to... cherish the memories we hold dear.

51006826.ContentEN: After all, if death is the inevitable, then every moment alive is a miracle that defies the odds, isn't it?

51006827.ContentEN: I believe that the gentle soul who journeyed to the Misty Sea would also wish that... when you recall your time together, you'd find yourself smiling, not crying with grief.

51006829.ContentEN: The Misty Sea... is the cradle and resting place of life for the people of Charon. Souls of the deceased return there, and the living emerge from it, life flowing in endless cycles.

51006831.ContentEN: Can I go to the Misty Sea and bring her back?

51006832.ContentEN: Will she ever return to me?

51006833.ContentEN: (Lady Nifl does not answer immediately. She raises her tender, compassionate eyes, and after a long pause, speaks again—)

51006834.ContentEN: Were it someone else asking, my answer would be thus: The cycle of life and death is a universal law, not to be defied by human might.

51006835.ContentEN: However, child, I sense... you are bound by an unusual destiny.

51006836.ContentEN: One day, when you have garnered enough strength to confront this world's truths and perhaps even challenge its very laws... then, perhaps the river to the Misty Sea might flow backwards for you.

51006838.ContentEN: Hehe... I am merely an observer by the riverbank. The answer to this question must be discovered by yourself.

51006839.ContentEN: If your heart truly yearns for it, then proceed on your path.

51006841.ContentEN: Child, even though the path ahead is uncertain, always proceed with determination.

51006901.ContentEN: (The train ticket booth catches your eye, reminding you of an item you got from Margie — an item related to \"tickets.\")

51006902.ContentEN: (You've come at a bad time — a foreign-looking Charon is in a heated argument with the ticket seller.)

51006903.ContentEN: Get lost if you have no money!

51006904.ContentEN: Goodness, I just asked a simple question! Why so angry!?

51006905.ContentEN: Alright, Mr Quirky Accent — after I've politely told you the fare, what's your plan? To fumble through those empty pockets and then boss me around?

51006906.ContentEN: What you say? How you know me no—

51006907.ContentEN: What's there to know? Like a Charon would have more than five coins in their pocket! This place is reserved for the rich and the powerful — not penniless wanderers like you!

51006908.ContentEN: (The foreigner fumbles a retort in his mother tongue, but the ticket seller, not understanding a word, merely gives him a scornful glance before turning away. The man leaves, crestfallen.)

51007001.ContentEN: You here, ask about trains? Careful, mean gatekeeper girl here!

51007002.ContentEN: Enough for me! Want to leave, very, very much!

51007003.ContentEN: Still learning! Language here, different from home!

51007004.ContentEN: (This ticket seller looks tough. But considering you'll eventually need to leave Icelake, crossing paths with her seems inevitable... Should you take action now?)

51007005.ContentEN: (Perhaps this \"intel\" from Margie could help break the ice...)

51007006.ContentEN: (Despite good intentions, you're momentarily at a loss for solutions.)

51007007.ContentEN: Thank you! You are good! I watch you handle this!

51007101.ContentEN: (As you both approach the ticket booth, Jessica eyes you coldly for a moment before speaking.)

51007103.ContentEN: Mind your tone. I'm not some broke Charon. Heard of the owner of the Hypnos' House? I'm leasing another property of his.

51007104.ContentEN: Hah? Everyone knows that grump hates outsiders. Do some research before you try to impress people with a lie. Since you're so delusional, you should lock yourself up in that \"mansion\" and stay out of sight!

51007105.ContentEN: That's mean! Please, speak, make her stop mean talk!

51007106.ContentEN: (Place the box of paper stars you got from Margie on the desk.)

51007107.ContentEN: (At the sight of the paper stars, the ticket seller's expression softens for a moment, but she quickly resumes her earlier demeanour, eyeing you with disdain.)

51007108.ContentEN: Why did you put this rubbish on my desk? This isn't a recycling centre! Get them outta here!

51007109.ContentEN: Why call them rubbish? To me, these are delicate handicrafts. You can tell the maker must've put a lot of effort and feelings into them.

51007110.ContentEN: Paper stars, Huaxu tradition too. People say, make many, dreams come true.

51007111.ContentEN: That explains it... I was curious about how they were made, so I unfolded one and found something written inside.

51007112.ContentEN: It appears to be... someone's wish.

51007114.ContentEN: Just one. I noticed it was made from a train ticket, and the message on the back was also train-related, so I came here, hoping to perhaps find its rightful owner.

51007115.ContentEN: But since you call them rubbish, I guess I'll just take care of them myself.

51007116.ContentEN: (As you pick up the box of paper stars, the ticket seller's eyes clearly follow, though she remains tight-lipped.)

51007117.ContentEN: Whoever made these stars couldn't afford a ticket but still wrote some station names on them, probably dreaming of visiting those places one day.

51007118.ContentEN: Do they really want their dreams discarded like rubbish?

51007119.ContentEN: \"May 21st. Mrs Catherine tossed silver coins at my feet and told me to pick them up one by one from the ground. She said I didn't deserve to take the money directly from her hand. Ah, if only I had endless coins too...\"

51007120.ContentEN: \"September 13th. Dreamt again last night of finally saving enough for a ticket. This time, the terminal was Scarletriver...\"

51007122.ContentEN: So, they belong to you, don't they?

51007123.ContentEN: (You recall the name you've seen on one of the tickets.)

51007126.ContentEN: ...Alright, fine. I'm Jessica. I'm the one who threw this \"rubbish\" away, happy? You've just danced around to mock me, huh?

51007127.ContentEN: Yes, like every other pauper here, I can't even afford half a ticket. Are you happy now!?

51007129.ContentEN: If you too dream of riding the train but can't afford it, shouldn't you empathise with those poor folks like you? Why are you so harsh towards them?

51007130.ContentEN: Heh, what am I supposed to do then — gently comfort them?

51007131.ContentEN: And let them nurse fantasies about someday boarding the trains meant for the rich lords!?

51007132.ContentEN: Can ride, just need to make money! We Starweavers, do business, make money slowly.

51007133.ContentEN: You're a Starweaver!? Then, do you know another Huaxu Starweaver named Jiayan? He was here in Icelake thirteen years ago.

51007136.ContentEN: Was this person a friend of yours?

51007137.ContentEN: Hmph, a friend? No, he's the person I hate the most.

51007138.ContentEN: (Jessica picks up another paper star and tears it open. She glances at the words within and continues to unfold the rest one by one.)

51007139.ContentEN: He claimed he had visited many countries, met many fascinating people, and had countless wonderful experiences. With each piece of merchandise he sold, he told a story of the outside world.

51007140.ContentEN: I noted every line of his stories and memorised all of them like an idiot, believing it would bring me closer to that vast world he described.

51007141.ContentEN: He said, \"Stars are the seeds of wishes; as they fall, like fruit to be harvested, your desires come to fruition.\" He also said, \"Countless stars, crafted from cherished dreams, will sprout upon the earth.\"

51007142.ContentEN: I wanted to go with him and hear more of his endless stories. But I couldn't afford the ticket, so all I could do was watch him board that train and leave.

51007143.ContentEN: (She unfolds another star. The train ticket has yellowed with age. On its back, it reads, \"I want to leave here, to follow your steps.\")

51007144.ContentEN: Ha... here it is. This is the ticket from the train he boarded. That train crossed plains and deserts, headed for the distant East.

51007145.ContentEN: The ticket seller at the time felt sorry for me, so she gave me an expired unsold ticket after the train left and told me there would be more trains heading that way.

51007146.ContentEN: But I could never afford a ticket. All I could do was stand by and watch the trains leave. Over time, I learned the ticketing process well and eventually took over from her, until today.

51007147.ContentEN: (She sighs deeply, ceasing her unfolding of the stars, and gathers both the opened and intact ones, pushing them to the corner of her desk.)

51007148.ContentEN: Now you get it, right? These paper stars are nothing but rubbish. Thanks for bringing them back to me. Next time, I'll tear them up before throwing them away.

51007150.ContentEN: I don't need you to pity me, Starweaver.

51007151.ContentEN: Would it kill you to be nice?

51007152.ContentEN: Be nice? You mean like that Starweaver and that ticket seller, sugar-coating reality with pretty, empty words about \"the outside world\" or \"the future\" and getting people's hopes up for nothing?

51007153.ContentEN: As a Charon, you should know what a terrible place Icelake is better than I do, or at least better than this Huaxu man does!

51007154.ContentEN: Take a walk around the city — everyone's complaining, wailing, and cursing! In such a place, what good does being nice do?

51007156.ContentEN: (The foreigner suddenly thinks of something. He turns to start rummaging through his backpack. Jessica and you hear a series of clinks and clangs, wondering what he's up to.)

51007157.ContentEN: (Moments later, the noise subsides, and he presents Jessica with an exotic-looking small box.)

51007158.ContentEN: This box, made in Huaxu! It locks, no lose stars, no one see.

51007159.ContentEN: What do you mean...? There's no way I can afford this fancy box...

51007160.ContentEN: No need money, a gift! Dreams, don't lose!

51007161.ContentEN: (Jessica pauses, looking down at the box, then turns away, silent.)

51007163.ContentEN: ...See? Kindness isn't entirely meaningless — sometimes, it turns into a pretty little box, safeguarding a dream tucked within stars.

51007164.ContentEN: (You gather the paper stars from the desk, place them into the box, and hand it back to Jessica.)

51007165.ContentEN: Maybe, when you find time, you could refold these stars.

51007167.ContentEN: A—Alright... I'll take it — but only because I've had enough of your rambling. Th—Thank you.

51007169.ContentEN: Take it away. Why do you think I wanted to throw those stars away? I've thought it all through over the years and have come to terms with reality.

51007170.ContentEN: Alas, a pity, a real pity!

51007172.ContentEN: ...By the way, even to the same destination, ticket prices vary. Some are cheaper — not by much, but still...

51007173.ContentEN: If you ever manage to scrape together enough for a ticket, I can help you find the cheapest available.

51007174.ContentEN: In exchange, don't tell others about the stars.

51007175.ContentEN: Thank you, thank you! So you are a kind ticket lady!

51007176.ContentEN: The Starweaver you say, if me see him, me tell him for you.

51007177.ContentEN: Thank you, but... you don't have to. If I ever get to leave here, I probably won't go looking for him. I'd rather go to a warm place where it never snows, to see if the people are different from those in Icelake.

51007178.ContentEN: Sound good too. Work hard, save money, you can leave.

51007180.ContentEN: Thank you, kind Charon friend, big help. Me no money, but me give gift, please accept!

51007181.ContentEN: Li Ande, me name, a Starweaver. Days ago, business bad, now sell goods at city gate, me work hard! Please come!

51007182.ContentEN: Ah, it's you... Let me know if you need to buy a ticket.

60010101.ContentEN: What?! They're using poison gas... That's despicable! Quick, use the Serum!

60010102.ContentEN: Hmm... They don't seem to be affected by it either. They must have Serum too.

60010103.ContentEN: I've found a place nearby with lots of Serum. Let's head over there!

60010201.ContentEN: Great, we can escape over here. Quickly, let's go!

60010301.ContentEN: I found a Serum storage point! I'm pretty awesome, ain't I?

60010401.ContentEN: I've found another Serum storage point. I've marked it for you!

60010501.ContentEN: Adventure time! Let's have a look around and uncover the secrets here.

60010601.ContentEN: Danger alert! We're running low on serum, better find some more ASAP.

60010701.ContentEN: Phew, finally got some more serum. This should keep us going a bit longer. Now, where's the nearest Serum Storage Point around here...

60020101.ContentEN: The thing we're looking for is supposed to be here, but where is it exactly...?

60020201.ContentEN: Whoa! Tons of enemies suddenly rushed out! I can't delay my research, so I'll just leave them to you!

60020301.ContentEN: The enemies have stopped attacking for now...

60020401.ContentEN: Research is so tiring... Here, please claim your reward! Now, do you want to continue or go back?

60020501.ContentEN: I mean, it's just a little harmless study, why are they so mean to us? For the sake of our awesome research plan, let's take them out quickly.

60020601.ContentEN: Oof, if it goes on like this, this poor researcher will be crushed together with the Crystallo in no time... The most awesome Phoxhunter, do something!

60020701.ContentEN: Hmm... drawing a blank here, am I looking at it the wrong way? Hang in there, I need a bit more time!

60020801.ContentEN: Whew, finally! Here's a little thank-you gift from me!

60030101.ContentEN: Ewww, there's poison gas everywhere here... Our Serum won't last long at this rate.

60030102.ContentEN: There should be a Potion Station nearby for making Serum. Let's go find it.

60030201.ContentEN: Let's hurry and find the Potion Station while we still have some Serum left.

60030301.ContentEN: Here come the baddies! According to the potion station's manual, we've got to take down enemies around it so it can collect the serum they carry.

60030302.ContentEN: Ah, don't forget to grab the serum once it's collected! If we run out of serum, we'll have to bail on the mission!

60030303.ContentEN: The manual's also got some gobbledygook, but I think it means fighting near the potion station can make us much stronger. Isn't Snow smart!

60030401.ContentEN: Shh... I've picked up on some odd noises. Sounds like a big 'un is coming this way!

60030402.ContentEN: Better check if we've got enough serum to keep us going.

60030501.ContentEN: We can leave now, but if we explore a bit more, we might find more stuff! Do you want to continue?

60030601.ContentEN: No, no, no! If enemies are defeated too far from the Potion Station, their Serum won't be recovered!

60030701.ContentEN: You look pale. Maybe the Serum is running low...

60030702.ContentEN: Don't push yourself too hard. Hurry up, use the Serum we prepared at the Potion Station!

60030801.ContentEN: I've activated a new Potion Station!

60030901.ContentEN: No! There's no Serum left in the Potion Station. Let's get out of here!

60031001.ContentEN: Now, use the Serum we prepared.

60031101.ContentEN: Grrr... Poisons... Rise... Death... Races... Grrr... Grrr...

60031201.ContentEN: Enemies incoming! We're lucky this Potion Station is working. Let's fight next to it!

60040101.ContentEN: Why do we keep getting these weird commissions? Let's go find that car the client mentioned.

60040201.ContentEN: Woohoo! Getting close and sending a signal actually got the car moving. Keep an eye on the surroundings while we escort the car to the destination.

60040301.ContentEN: Argh, they have locked the checkpoint gate! Guess we'll have to take them all out.

60040401.ContentEN: The gate is open. Let's keep going! Bee-bee-beep!

60040501.ContentEN: Something's blocking the way. Let's smash it!

60040601.ContentEN: Almost there, keep it up, smash it and charge through!

60040701.ContentEN: Hmph, puny obstacle can't stop us. Now keep escorting the car and sending the signals to help our client move the car.

60050101.ContentEN: So, this commission is about taking out the enemies in this area? Easy-peasy, time to roll up our sleeves!

60050201.ContentEN: Alright, that should be enough to teach them a lesson! Let's wrap this up and head back for our paycheck.

60060101.ContentEN: The target is defeated. Commission failed.

60060201.ContentEN: This commission is a bit tricky. We need to rescue a trapped target, and then escort them to safety.

60060202.ContentEN: Let's follow the client's marks and find the <H>Secret Cells</> within the enemy stronghold.

60060203.ContentEN: Speaking of which, I wonder who the target is... This commission has a fat paycheck and plenty of hush-hush. Probably some big shot?

60060204.ContentEN: Or perhaps the client has some secret relationship with the target... Ooooohh...

60060205.ContentEN: The client once said no prying, or no payment, remember?

60060206.ContentEN: Alright, I'll stop being curious for now.

60060301.ContentEN: According to the intel, there are lots of isolated tiny rooms in that area, one of which holds our target.

60060302.ContentEN: The enemies are pretty cautious! If they spot a rescue attempt, they might choose to silence our target...

60060303.ContentEN: Try to stay on your toes!

60060401.ContentEN: Look! It's up ahead! Remember to avoid the <H>Patrollers</>!

60060402.ContentEN: If they activate the alarm, our target will be in danger!

60060501.ContentEN: Argh, all these rooms look exactly the same to me... Luckily, my little minion has more than enough ingenuity to find the right one.

60060502.ContentEN: Let's quickly find the target! This Demon King will watch out for you.

60060602.ContentEN: Don't panic, we're Phoxhunters. We're here to save you!

60060603.ContentEN: Huh...? Oh, I got it. They must have sent you here...

60060604.ContentEN: Thank you! Let's get out of here now, I can't wait to see...

60060701.ContentEN: Oh no, that patroller activated the alarm!

60060702.ContentEN: I knew this was going to happen! These guys got desperate and decided to execute the target!

60060703.ContentEN: Gotta rescue the target before it's too late!

60060801.ContentEN: Ooh, I think I hear the target crying for help!

60060802.ContentEN: It's that cell over there! Hurry up!

60060901.ContentEN: I... I can't move... Please... help me...!

60060902.ContentEN: I can't... stop here... I... haven't...

60110101.ContentEN: Our goal is to capture a target. If they resist, we'll just have to defeat them first.

60110201.ContentEN: The target has been knocked out. Now seize them before they recover and escape.

60110301.ContentEN: Quest accomplished. Let's get out of here.

60110501.ContentEN: The target this time excels at [Stealth], and is not only good at hiding themselves...

60110502.ContentEN: ...They can also confuse their opponents by using identical-looking decoys! Don't let them deceive you!

60110601.ContentEN: The target this time is highly [battlewise] and has a robot that enhances their abilities!

60110602.ContentEN: The explosive robot can self-destruct, so be careful!

60110701.ContentEN: The target this time is great at [Armed Assault]. Watch out for their mines and gunstocks!

60120101.ContentEN: This is the area we need to excavate. Let me find a suitable place to deploy my precious Excavator.

60120201.ContentEN: Excavator deployed! Remember to protect it. If it stops moving, find some Excavator Modules by defeating enemies.

60120301.ContentEN: Excavation complete! Here's your reward. Do you want to continue or go back?

60120401.ContentEN: The excavator's stalled, better fetch some excavator modules for it.

60120501.ContentEN: There's another spot over there that needs a look, I've marked it for you; just head over and I'll set up the excavator.

60120601.ContentEN: That's right, what you've got there are excavator modules; now go pop them into my precious excavator!

60130101.ContentEN: The Forsakens have set up a dangerous bomb here! If we don't destroy it, everyone's lives will be in grave danger.

60130102.ContentEN: The client mentioned three members from The Forsakens are behind this explosion; I'll let you know if I find them.

60130103.ContentEN: Taking them down before breaking Supreme Glory's detonator should smooth things over for the mission.

60130201.ContentEN: One down! I found a letter on him... Got it! The other two members of The Forsakens are probably in the area that I marked.

60130301.ContentEN: Supreme Glory's detonator is exposed, time to wreck it!

60130302.ContentEN: Geez, it's not like WE planted this bomb, how come all enemies are coming at us...

60130401.ContentEN: It's dismantled. Time to run! The client said the faster we get back, the more generous our reward will be.

60130501.ContentEN: Found one of the \"Soldiers\" of The Forsakens!

60130502.ContentEN: The client asked us to prevent Supreme Glory from blowing up, so taking down these \"Soldiers\" should work in our favour, let's go!

60140002.ContentEN: Show me what you're made of.

60140003.ContentEN: Not bad, I must say. Keep it up.

60140006.ContentEN: Don't think you can get away!

60140202.ContentEN: Right... I don't deserve... to live...

60140401.ContentEN:
The Voice From Your Memories\
My dearest child, thank you for coming into the world.

60140402.ContentEN:
The Voice From Your Memories\
You are the pride of our lives.

60140403.ContentEN:
The Voice From Your Memories\
Psyche, pinky promise. We'll be best friends for life!

60140404.ContentEN:
The Voice From Your Memories\
I'll remember that you've lived in this world.

60140405.ContentEN:
The Voice From Your Memories\
We'll wait for your return.

60140406.ContentEN:
The Voice From Your Memories\
Fate, please have mercy on me for once and for all. Let me help her fulfill this wish.

60140407.ContentEN:
The Voice From Your Memories\
Take this flower with you. It will bring you good luck.

60140408.ContentEN:
The Voice From Your Memories\
You'll go to a small island, where you can build a few houses by the sea and grow white flowers around them.

60140409.ContentEN:
The Voice From Your Memories\
Psyche, I'm here to take you home.

60140501.ContentEN: All verdicts are in the name of justice.

60140502.ContentEN: How dare you defy the law...

60140503.ContentEN: You... have proved yourself in the face of fiery flame.

60140505.ContentEN: Writhing pathetically won't delay your sentence.

60140506.ContentEN: Meet your demise within these chains.

60140507.ContentEN: The law shall recount your crimes.

60140508.ContentEN: No escape from the inferno's grasp.

60149001.ContentEN: H-H-H-H-Hands in the air! Ooh, this one looks tough... I'm outta here.

60149002.ContentEN: Argh, not you again! H-H-H-Have a nice day, bye!

60149003.ContentEN: Y-Y-Your money or your life...! Gosh! How am I supposed to mug a walkin' arsenal? See ya!

60149004.ContentEN: Tell you what, I also major in escapin'!

60149005.ContentEN: Luno who mugs and runs away, lives to mug another day! Just take these and lemme scarper!

60149006.ContentEN: Ugh, just take that and lemme off the hook!

60149008.ContentEN: Ugh, this is not over! Better watch your back at night!

60149010.ContentEN: You ju-ju-jumbo dumbo are too stupid to catch me! HYA-HYA-HYA!

60149011.ContentEN: I've mucked it all up! You'll get yours next time — just you wait! Boohoo...

60149012.ContentEN: North, south, east and west! I'm your pappy and I'm da best! Ask around and you will know, give your money to this Luno!

60149014.ContentEN: Hmph, this Lulu Lunoloot is not someone you can mess with!

60149015.ContentEN: Huff... huff... Ain't you tired yet? What did they feed you?

60150003.ContentEN: I can't run any further... I surrender...

60150006.ContentEN: No way you can catch me!

60200101.ContentEN: Uh-oh, we've been spotted by the enemy!

60200201.ContentEN: Enemies in sight; stop them before they call for backup.

60200301.ContentEN: Watch out, the enemy's about to call for backup! Things will get sticky if we don't nip this in the bud.

60200401.ContentEN: They're going to call for backup! Do something! Now!

60200501.ContentEN: Ugh, thought we hid well. Eh, let's sort them out quickly.

60300101.ContentEN: Shh... I think I heard the crying of a Geniemon! Let's go rescue it!

60800101.ContentEN: A chest key needed... Look around to seek one.

60800102.Content: 【待包装】似乎能在附近找到钥匙B

60800103.Content: 【待包装】似乎能在附近找到钥匙C

60800104.Content: 【待包装】似乎能在附近找到钥匙D

60800105.Content: 【待包装】似乎能在附近找到钥匙E

60800106.Content: 【待包装】似乎能在附近找到钥匙F

69990101.Content: 唔，看起来我们是闯进秽兽的聚集地啦，你可要保护好我！

69990102.Content: 怎么有这么多秽兽啊，真讨厌！

69990151.Content: 不舒服的气息，这里可能有很强大的家伙！

69990201.Content: 奇怪，怎么这里也有帝国军，小心啊小仆人！

69990202.Content: 比起笨笨的秽兽，这些帝国军真讨厌，就交给你啦！

69990251.Content: 这里的帝国军似乎有精锐成员在，可别轻视他们呀！

69990252.Content: 好像和零星的搜查部队不太一样，可能有指挥官在哦！

69990301.Content: 还真是深入到了不得了的地方呀。

69990302.Content: 这应该就是最后的考验了，看我的仆人狠狠收拾你，哼哼！

69990351.Content: 那边居然有火光，我们快去看看吧！

69991101.ContentEN: A serene, haunting melody reaches your ears as a procession of robed kids slowly approaches...

69991102.ContentEN: You know full well that this place should hold no living beings.

69991103.Content: 神秘的歌声吸引着你，似乎有神秘的力量

69991201.ContentEN: A serene, haunting melody reaches your ears as a procession of robed kids slowly approaches...

69991202.ContentEN: You know full well that this place should hold no living beings.

69991203.Content: 神秘的歌声吸引着你，似乎有神秘的力量

69991301.ContentEN: The flickering glow of flames catches your eye — a rusty forge stands before you.

69991302.ContentEN: Your adventure logs suggest it belongs to a mysterious blacksmith.

69991303.ContentEN: Yet, the blacksmith is nowhere in sight. The place feels steeped in mystery.

69991401.ContentEN: An old man stands alone amidst piles of weapons, his hammer rising and falling in a steady rhythm.

69991404.ContentEN: \"Alas, another poor soul off to their doom... Speak now, while the forge is hot. What is it you seek?

69991502.ContentEN: \"Adventurer, don't let any chance to strengthen yourself slip away.\"

69991503.ContentEN: \"Give a bit of that light of yours — this minor exchange might just save your life on the journey ahead.\"

69991603.ContentEN: \"Give a bit of that light of yours — this minor exchange might just save your life on the journey ahead.\"

69991604.ContentEN: \"You may want to give it your all.\"

69991701.ContentEN: A shimmering lake appears as if out of nowhere, and at its centre stands a blurry figure, gazing down at her own reflection in the water.

69991702.ContentEN:
The reflection, though hazy, is captivating, as if even the stars were enchanted by its beauty.\
\"O lost traveller,\"\
The figure beckons.

69991703.ContentEN: \"The fairest maiden, as beautiful as I, is trapped beneath these deep waters. Will you help set her free?\"

69991801.ContentEN: A shimmering lake appears as if out of nowhere, and at its centre stands a blurry figure, gazing down at her own reflection in the water.

69991802.ContentEN:
The reflection, though hazy, is captivating, as if even the stars were enchanted by its beauty.\
\"O lost traveller,\"\
The figure beckons.

69991803.ContentEN: \"The fairest maiden, as beautiful as I, is trapped beneath these deep waters. Will you help set her free?\"

69991901.ContentEN: A group of devotees gather around an extinguished lantern, their hymns to the divine still echoing, even though they know no miracles will come.

69991902.ContentEN: In the darkness that fell when the flame died out, all they have left to cling to in the abyss is their brittle faith...

69991903.ContentEN: Alongside that eerie lantern, stained by the filth of the abyss.

69992001.ContentEN: A group of devotees gather around an extinguished lantern, their hymns to the divine still echoing, even though they know no miracles will come.

69992002.ContentEN: In the darkness that fell when the flame died out, all they have left to cling to in the abyss is their brittle faith...

69992003.ContentEN: Alongside that eerie lantern, stained by the filth of the abyss.

69999101.Content: 无尽的深渊中你我相遇，一起来烤烤火？

69999201.Content: 也许我可以为你提供烛芯甚至宝物，只要你拥有…

69999301.Content: 这里居然有人，看起来还挺友善？没兴趣的话我们直接去探索更深处吧！

70010101.ContentEN: Recently, the Filthoids on the island have become increasingly active. All residents are preparing boats and supplies, ready to set sail and escape at any time.

70010201.ContentEN:
Residents, remember to stay away from unidentified ships when fishing at sea to avoid being detected by the Hyperborean authorities. \
Our ancestors fled here to avoid getting involved in meaningless wars. We must adhere to their ways.

70010301.ContentEN: (The villagers must've fled the Filthoid-ravaged village by now. The distant \"Heaventree\" serves as their natural lighthouse when out at sea.)

70010401.ContentEN: (A never-before-seen statue, dedicated to an unnamed deity. It's an artefact from an unknown era...)

70010501.ContentEN:
Some inscriptions have been carved into it with a blade. Only some of the content is discernible: \
...\
