Gralenia's Galas accompanied General Brendan's expeditionary forces here, expelling all the blind followers of the false goddess, Elysia. \
...\
Do everything you can to erase all traces of the false god. \
...\
Although I wish to remain here, the island is barren, so I don't think I can stay here permanently. \
...

70010601.ContentEN: (Judging from the huge statue and the ruined buildings at the edge of the cliff, it appears that this place was once a temple a long time ago.)

70010701.ContentEN: (The remains of a Filthoid. Its lingering warmth proves that there was a fierce battle here not long ago.)

70010801.ContentEN: (The painted statue, though well-preserved, is surrounded by ruins, indicating that this place was looted a long time ago.)

70010901.ContentEN: (It appears to be an alchemical device, but it's unclear why it's in these temple ruins.)

70011001.Content:
一张拍摄于十几年的照片，相框玻璃有着清晰的摩挲痕迹。照片中的卡戎少女恬淡地微笑着，任由微风拂过她的发尾。\
照片背后用钢笔写着一行字：“我的女儿——海莉，摄于红溪城”。虽然样貌并不十分相像，但少女澄澈无瑕的笑脸让你莫名想起了赛琪。

70011101.Content:
（高大的档案柜，按字母顺序井然有序地排列着“住客”的档案。每份档案除了孩子的照片，还清楚地记着孩子们在修普诺斯之家度过的每一天。）\
\
赛琪的档案\
年龄：17\
症状：失明，失聪\
赛琪来的时候已是秽蚀中期，但她还是坚强、热情地向每个人打招呼。我多么希望诊断的结果是错误的，这样我还能欺骗自己，赛琪并没有出现秽蚀，她的人生还能回到正轨。\
……\
她将父母来看望时送的花都放在床头，连落脚和睡觉的地方都被压缩得很小很小。\
……\
我把二楼的空房收拾了出来，那边采光更好，赛琪和她的花搬进去以后应该能待得更舒适一些。\
……\
她真的很喜欢花，每天仔细地打理花束，再分发给其他孩子们，如果不是因为秽蚀，她将来一定能将“牵念之花”打理得比她父母还要出色。\
……\
赛琪今天给我也送了支花，看着她恬静的笑脸，我仿佛又见到了你……海莉……\
……\
我看着账本发愁的样子不小心被赛琪看到了，她缠着我询问原因，我拗不过她，如实将修普诺斯之家财政上的问题说给了她听。\
（批注：我得尽快给收购者回信，不能再让孩子们担心下去了。）\
……\
赛琪把老宅打扫了出来，还顺势租给个来路不明的小鬼……希望那个小鬼别给修普诺斯之家惹来什么麻烦。\
……\
<H>她说想要活下去，哪怕能以人类的身份再多活一天也好，听到这句话时我既欣慰又愤怒。\
欣慰是因为她终于吐露了心声，她以看淡生死的样子强撑太久了。\
愤怒是因为那个小鬼！我不知道那个小鬼对赛琪做了什么，但给必死之人活下去的勇气，太过残忍了。\
如果无法拯救，那就不要给予无意义的希望！\
……\
（批注：但如果这是赛琪的愿望……我得加快抑制秽蚀手术的研究了。为了赛琪，为了孩子们。）</>

70011201.Content:
艾克的档案\
年龄：19\
症状：失明\
艾克是独自来修普诺斯之家的，不知道他的父母是不忍心看到孩子的结局，还是单纯的狠心。居然任由一个盲人独自来到冰湖城。\
……\
他说想看书，但我这里只有无趣冗长的医学典籍，即使这样他也没有嫌弃。我读着书，他坐在一旁听，就这样度过了一天。\
……\
我听到艾克在梦里呼唤他父亲的名字。\
……\
我在弗莱格桑行省找到了艾克的父亲，他没注意到我，只是专注地哼着摇篮曲，哄着他怀里的人族婴儿入睡。\
……\
我去买了些用盲文撰写的书，艾克开心地说谢谢父亲，我本想告诉他我不是，但最后只能艰难地嗯了一声然后匆匆离开了病房。\
……

70011301.Content:
罗比的档案\
年龄：18\
症状：成骨不全\
罗比被送到修普诺斯之家的时候浑身缠满了绷带，轻微的磕碰就可能引起严重的骨折，甚至连下床都很困难。\
……\
我把他的床位挪到了窗边，这样他可以多晒晒太阳。\
……\
康复训练很成功，莱娜女士的料理给罗比的身体提供了足够的营养，现在他可以拄着拐杖在修普诺斯之家走走了。\
……\
今天罗比的腿又骨折了，比来得时候还要严重。为了不给我添麻烦居然从楼梯上摔下来都不愿大声喊叫……看来我最近确实太憔悴了，害得孩子们反过来担心我。\
……\
他想出去采朵花作为赛琪的回礼，我同意了。虽然我们最后只捡到几根枯枝，但他还是笑得很开心。\
……

70011401.Content:
约瑟芬的档案\
年龄：17\
症状：脏器变形，呼吸困难\
她的秽蚀印记出现在脖子上，看着她跑上跑下活泼的样子，我反而有种不好的预感。\
……\
她突然跌倒在地喘着粗气，全身检查的结果很不理想，脏器出现了严重变形，接下来几天她都只能待在手术室了。\
……\
她的状态好些了，但还是离不开呼吸器，为了不让她在睡觉时出事，我必须每晚守在她的床边为她扶稳呼吸器，擦去冷汗。好在咖啡的储备足够，我还撑得住。\
……

70011501.ContentEN:
Due to adverse weather conditions, a major rollover accident has occurred on the primary highway outside the city.\
The 6th Legion's Escort is currently undertaking emergency repair work. Residents are advised to minimise travel and take necessary anti-slip measures when venturing out.

70011601.ContentEN:
The jammed gate has severed access to the pit. A cold, mechanical voice intermittently repeats the notice issued when the pit was closed. \
\
The Phoxene veins have been depleted... Effective immediately, the pit is designated as abandoned...\
The Legion will no longer ensure security in this area... \
Individuals assume all responsibility for any incidents resulting from unauthorised entry...

70011701.ContentEN:
A cold, mechanical voice relentlessly repeats the Legion's relocation instructions for miners. \
\
The 6th Legion's Garrison will escort miners on the list for relocation to the Flagson Province for continued labour. The transfer train will depart precisely three hours before the closure of Glevum Pit. Miners on the list must observe the following: \
1. Those carrying over five kilograms of personal belongings will face execution.\
2. Those failing to board at the designated time will face execution.\
3. Those questioning the list will face execution.

70011801.ContentEN: (A yellowed photo capturing the grand opening of The Asphodel. Commoners, merchant princes and even some officials from the inner city gathered here to offer their best wishes to this newly opened tavern.)

70011901.ContentEN: (A large poster, commonly seen throughout the Empire, bearing slogans like \"All glory to our Emperor\".)

70012001.ContentEN:
The latest 6th Legion recruitment (Charon Special) are set to commence shortly. Eligible Charons can proceed to the Security Bureau to submit their applications. Seize the moment to change your destiny. Under the flag of the Black Wolves, invoke the might of Emperor Julius and pledge your allegiance to Hyperborea! \
Note: \
1. Those with exceptional performance may earn the Laurelled Charon Medal, granting the privilege to be stationed in the Inner City.\
\
2. Those who do not receive the Laurelled Charon Medal but show outstanding performance will be conscripted into the Outer City Escort. \
3. Final interpretation rights of the recruitment belong to the 6th Legion's Cocytus Province Garrison; participants assume all responsibility for any incidents that occur during the assessment.

70012101.ContentEN: (A pale blue canister labelled \"Phoxichor\". This term is visible on a variety of items related to transportation and lighting across the Empire. The name itself suggests it is a derivative of Phoxene.)

70012201.ContentEN: Each time the clock hands pass 12, the name \"Todd Wells\" briefly appears on the dial. Combining mechanical ingenuity with optical principles to subtly incorporate his name into his work, Mr. Wells must be a master clockmaker.

70012301.ContentEN:
(Upon approaching the vehicle, you're greeted by an excited shout, \"Hey, there! You're also fascinated by this PRT20A, aren't you? I know, right?! I mean, this one here is the second-gen civilian model adapted from military use, powered by a Phoxynamo Wheel—a true epitome of wisdom passed down through the ages!)\
(Sure, it's not as speedy as the military versions, but just being able to hear the Phoxynamo Wheel purring up close while driving it around, that's a status symbol in itself...\", the speaker goes on and on, covering everything from the car's history, its engineering, the wheel, the body, down to the very treads on the tyres, talking your ear off for hours.)\
(When things finally quieten down, your head's still spinning with all sorts of technical jargon about cylinders and rotations. Looking around to find out why it's gone quiet, you see that the car fanatic has already scooted off to start up the same spiel with another poor soul passing by.)

70012401.ContentEN:
A towering monument, its back inscribed with names of the Empire's people, and on the front deeply engraved with a brief inscription: \
\
In memory of the soldiers who sacrificed themselves for the lasting peace on this land. \
All glory to our Emperor.

70012501.ContentEN: (In Icelake, the multitude of mining lamps, pickaxes, and minecarts is striking. The abundance of these mining tools speaks volumes of the city's once thriving Phoxene ore mining era. Yet, now they lie discarded beside rubbish bins, coated in dust, a poignant testament that the miners' days of glory have faded into history.)

70012601.ContentEN: The factory's immense shadow sprawls across the city, engulfing innumerable puny lives, like a giant looming over ants. Thousands of workers come and leave every day, and even from hundreds of metres away, one can hear the relentless rumble of this behemoth.

70012701.ContentEN: The roadblock prohibits any passage. The prominent sign nearby indicates that the area ahead is now under the control of the 6th Legion's Escort.

70012801.ContentEN: A heating facility powered by Phoxichor, providing a comforting warmth to those nearby. Its makeshift installation and placement, however, hint at the handiwork of a local amateur, as the Empire deems the provision of heating for Charons utterly unnecessary.

70012901.ContentEN: Messy graffiti crammed with insults to Charons.

70013001.ContentEN: A tiny grave, barely large enough to accommodate a bird. The headstone is bereft of names, inscribed only with, \"Here lies my constant companion, the hero who helped me escape from the mine. — Conon\".

70013101.ContentEN: A woven bag emitting a soft yellow glow, its bulging corners indicating it is filled with Phoxene, with the bottom marked by stains of blood.

70013201.ContentEN:
Building Blocks\
(Simple building blocks, once popular among children but now seeming outdated and worn.)

70013301.ContentEN:
Psyche's Room\
(A green butterfly drawing board hangs on the door, with childish scribble spelling out \"Psyche's Room\". This must have been where Psyche lived. But now the door is locked, presumably at her mother Daisy's behest.)

70013401.ContentEN: (Through the window of the boutique named Looks Galore, one can see an elegant long dress. Each piece of fabric is expertly tailored, accentuating the wearer's beautiful figure and grace, perfectly suited for someone like Harlan.)

70013501.ContentEN: (A bucket and mop set beside Lio, presumably for cleaning the ominous dark red stains nearby. A brutal confrontation might have occurred here.)

70013601.ContentEN:
A faded, barely legible old poster reads:\
...\
Lead vocalist Ms. Violetta's performance coming next week!\
Children From the Snowfield makes a classic return, with her ethereal voice set to resonate throughout Icelake!\
A full week of unmissable performances! Absolutely not to be missed!\
Pay for an exclusive opportunity to be smuggled into the Inner City! A glimpse into a musical feast for the elite!\
...\
Contact: Mr. Jack\
Meeting Point: Every midnight by the sewer manhole. Signal to the red-haired man with the code word \"Cuckoo, Cuckoo\".

70013701.ContentEN: (A tattered textbook, its blank spaces filled with crude doodles. In these scribbles, Fahy is portrayed as a horned demon practising sinister dark magic.)

70013801.Content:
时不时会在修普诺斯之家见到这位严肃的女性，她似乎会定期前来打扫卫生，再为孩子们做上一顿热饭菜。\
\
当别人问起，她会说：“恩里克先生雇佣了我，那么我就得为他工作，行业如此。”\
\
她似乎为此深感无奈，人们也就识趣地放弃了追问。\
\
但所有修普诺斯之家的孩子都知道，莱娜女士从未收过恩里克哪怕一分钱的报酬。

70013901.ContentEN: (An eclectic array of abandoned items, leaving one to wonder about Martin's criteria for selection. Who might their previous owners have been?)

70014001.ContentEN: (The alcoholic beverages rejected by Camilla. No one knows where they will end up next.)

70014101.ContentEN:
Footprints\
(Child-sized footprints. These likely belong to the footsteps Buck heard.)

70014201.ContentEN:
Popcorn\
(It appears that a small hole in the perpetrator's backpack left a trail of popcorn. \"The scent of ripe fruit\"... now it all adds up.)

70014301.ContentEN: A humble tent where Belinda has made her home and runs a small advisory shop, with no sign nor a clear business scope. Her clients seem to bring with them their own unspoken woes.

70014401.ContentEN: A gigantic crane powered by Phoxichor. With modifications by the Aeolipile, these cranes no longer require operators to be stationed atop them. A mere push of a joystick in the control room can now simultaneously manage multiple cranes, greatly enhancing efficiency. However, this advancement has also shattered the dreams of many young boys once enamoured with these colossal machines, along with numerous job opportunities for workers.

70014501.ContentEN: (An abandoned military drilling vehicle labelled PRT05MV. Its body bears the scars of time with weathering and patchy rust. Left unattended and unreclaimed, it is unclear whether this is due to the Empire's confidence in its vehicle security or the Legion's daunting presence deterring any creature from approaching this forsaken vehicle.)

70014601.ContentEN:
A mouldy piece of rye bread encased in old newspaper. The bread is surely inedible now. Smoothing out the newspaper and brushing off the mould, one can find it is an edition from over a decade ago, featuring a report about the 6th Legion's agreement with the original owners of Glevum Pit.\
\
...\
In the interest of the miners and for the betterment of Icelake, <H>Glevum Pit will henceforth cease private mining operations, with all affairs to be managed by the Legion.</>\
...\
\
The report includes several black and white photographs of the celebration ceremony. Oddly though, in these images, only the officer brandishing the agreement and the jubilant workers are visible. The pit's original owners are conspicuously absent — whether by choice or circumstance, one cannot tell.

70014701.ContentEN:
A crumpled letter, evidently mass-printed rather than handwritten, reads: \
\
Dear People of the Empire,\
\
Greetings from your greatest Dis I, the founder of the Hyperborea Empire, in Dismania, the imperial capital.\
Astonishing as it may seem, I am very much alive, having mastered the art of longevity.\
I am now gearing up to resume my great quest against Elysium.\
However, a small hitch — my required funds are all tied up in Icelake, and my current condition precludes me from accessing them personally. \
If you still have the honor and courage of being a man of the Empire, do send your sponsorship to No. 233, Triumph Street in the imperial capital. Rest assured, once I've bounced back and retrieved the full war funds, your investment will be returned twofold. \
Remember, the war is on the verge of breaking out, so please act swiftly! Your sponsorship is eagerly anticipated!\
Once I'm ready, I will return like lightning!

70014801.ContentEN:
(A fermented beverage known as \"Tales of Icelake\", just a valve turn away from filling your cup. Its hue resembles Phoxene, with an initial refreshing minty taste reminiscent of a brisk Icelake breeze. When swallowed, it leaves a honeyed sweetness akin to the glory of the Phoxene mining industry.)\
\
(Finally, a lingering peaty bitterness fills the senses, leaving an indelible aftertaste. True to its name, Tales of Icelake is unsurprisingly the most popular beverage at The Asphodel.)

70014901.ContentEN:
(An intricate gear mechanism that, despite its movements, leaves The Asphodel unchanged. However, the subtle mechanical sounds from behind the bar hint at a purpose beyond mere decoration.\
Perhaps, just like Camilla once remarked, \"for a sliver of profit, merchants would go to the gallows\" – and The Asphodel may well be more than just a hut selling fermented drinks.)

70015001.ContentEN: One example of Phoxene technology application in the everyday lives of Imperial citizens. While the lighting is average, its excellent efficiency, low cost, and longevity have made it the primary lighting choice in Icelake. In the past, during the expansion of Glevum Pit by the 6th Legion, these lamps were also used extensively.

70015101.ContentEN: At first glance, it seems like just an ordinary doorframe, the kind you'd see anywhere in the Empire. Yet, those two square panels strangely resemble a face, almost as if it's snarling, \"What are you looking at!?\"

70015201.ContentEN:
Beneath a pile of worn backpacks lie bones, weapons, and unfinished provisions — silent evidence of the grim fate that has claimed many a Phoxhunter who dared to descend into the forsaken pit.\
New or old, these backpacks once belonged to those chasing the same rags-to-riches dream, each believing they would escape such a fate, only to meet the same tragic end.

70015301.ContentEN: Tattered diaries and faded Phoxene cubes suggest that, had luck favoured them, their owners might have carved out a much brighter future.

70015401.ContentEN: An old copy of the Icelake Daily, discarded in a rubbish bin, catches your eye. Upon closer inspection, you spot a few typos — it's clearly a knockoff. As you leaf through it, you come across some sensational stories:

70015402.ContentEN:
Morris Glenville's Hidden Past\
Every citizen of Icelake is familiar with the meteoric rise and sudden downfall of the Glenville family — how Morris Glenville, once a man of humble origins, became a steel magnate, only for his family to be plagued by madness, mysterious deaths, and disappearances. But today, we ask a different question — why did Mr Glenville choose to preserve his modest past?

70015403.ContentEN: Few know that in his youth, Morris Glenville earned his seed money working under a high-ranking officer at the Aeolipile Alchademy, who was, in fact, a Laurelled Charon. Given Glenville's later vehement anti-Charon stance, one might wonder — what hidden history lies between him and his former Charon boss?

70015404.ContentEN:
The True Identity of Emperor Julius Revealed!!!\
Historical records and accounts from those who served at the royal palace consistently portrayed Prince Julius, before his ascension to the throne, as a humble, graceful, and cautious gentleman. So, what caused his drastic change in demeanour upon taking the throne? There's only one plausible explanation — the real Julius was assassinated, and the man now ruling is an imposter!\

70015405.ContentEN: Realising you may have stumbled onto something you shouldn't, you quickly toss the knockoff newspaper back into the bin.

70015501.ContentEN:
A decade-old photograph, its frame worn from countless sentimental touches, shows a serene Charon girl smiling as her hair stirs in the breeze.\
On the back, written in neat penmanship: \"Hayley, my beloved daughter. Photographed in Scarletriver.\" Although her face is unfamiliar, something about her pure smile subtly reminds you of Psyche.

70015601.ContentEN: The cover of the heavy journal bears a simple inscription: \"May their souls rest in the Misty Sea.\" As you flip through the pages, you recognise names and dates that are all too familiar.

70015602.ContentEN:
...\
September 3, Carolina Brown.\
...\
October 29, Hunt Clark.\
...\
November 25, Psyche Frey.

70015701.ContentEN: A crystal that resembles Phoxene at first glance, but a closer inspection reveals its texture and pattern are entirely different — just an ordinary glowing rock.

70015702.ContentEN:
Humans rank minerals by their usefulness, and while Phoxene is a highly coveted resource, these stones are deemed worthless.\
As a result, while Phoxene ore was mined to exhaustion, shattered, and refined into cold Phoxichor in roaring factories, these unassuming rocks remain untouched, preserved in their natural state.

71000100.ContentEN: A stray cat meows feebly, hoping to catch the attention of a compassionate passerby.
71000100.Subtitle: A stray cat meows feebly, hoping to catch the attention of a compassionate passerby.

71000200.ContentEN: Hello, do you sell cat food here?
71000200.Subtitle: Hello, do you sell cat food here?

71000210.ContentEN: Excuse me, do you sell cat food here?
71000210.Subtitle: Excuse me, do you sell cat food here?

71000300.ContentEN: The cat bounds away but pauses and glances back at you, as if urging you to follow.
71000300.Subtitle: The cat bounds away but pauses and glances back at you, as if urging you to follow.

71000310.ContentEN: The cat bounds away but pauses and glances back at you, as if urging you to follow.
71000310.Subtitle: The cat bounds away but pauses and glances back at you, as if urging you to follow.

71000320.ContentEN: The cat bounds away but pauses and glances back at you, as if urging you to follow.
71000320.Subtitle: The cat bounds away but pauses and glances back at you, as if urging you to follow.

71000330.ContentEN: The cat circles around your feet, obviously happy and content. A warm sense of peace and joy fills your heart.
71000330.Subtitle: The cat circles around your feet, obviously happy and content. A warm sense of peace and joy fills your heart.

71000501.ContentEN: Hey, stop it! Or I'll have to pull out my secret weapon... Alright, you asked for this — HELP! AAHHH!!!
71000501.Subtitle: Hey, stop it! Or I'll have to pull out my secret weapon... Alright, you asked for this — HELP! AAHHH!!!

71000503.ContentEN: That was the last of them. All clear.
71000503.Subtitle: That was the last of them. All clear.

71000504.ContentEN: I'll go check if there are any more enemies nearby. Be careful on your own.
71000504.Subtitle: I'll go check if there are any more enemies nearby. Be careful on your own.

71000506.ContentEN: Aww, you're here too... *sob*... I can't believe so many people are willing to help me. Here's a little something for your trouble. Thanks, everyone! You guys are the best!
71000506.Subtitle: Aww, you're here too... *sob*... I can't believe so many people are willing to help me. Here's a little something for your trouble. Thanks, everyone! You guys are the best!

71000511.ContentEN: Thank you, I'm safe now! On to more adventures!
71000511.Subtitle: Thank you, I'm safe now! On to more adventures!

71000512.ContentEN: Thank you, I'm safe now! On to more adventures!
71000512.Subtitle: Thank you, I'm safe now! On to more adventures!

71000601.ContentEN: Barrels washed ashore line the beach. Maybe they hold something useful.
71000601.Subtitle: Barrels washed ashore line the beach. Maybe they hold something useful.

71000612.ContentEN: This barrel has a gaping hole in the bottom. Whatever treasure it once held is long gone. Better try another.
71000612.Subtitle: This barrel has a gaping hole in the bottom. Whatever treasure it once held is long gone. Better try another.

71000613.ContentEN: Nothing but rotten fish and shrimp in this one. Better try another.
71000613.Subtitle: Nothing but rotten fish and shrimp in this one. Better try another.

71000615.ContentEN: Patience pays off! After careful searching, you manage to find some useful supplies hidden in a secret compartment of the barrel.
71000615.Subtitle: Patience pays off! After careful searching, you manage to find some useful supplies hidden in a secret compartment of the barrel.

71000701.ContentEN: Dang it! Only a few to go, and now this.
71000701.Subtitle: Dang it! Only a few to go, and now this.

71000711.ContentEN: I'm inspecting the Phoxichor pipes in town to make sure they're in good condition.
71000711.Subtitle: I was checking the condition of the Phoxichor pipes that connect the city.

71000721.ContentEN: I've only got a few pipes left to check, but my safety rope snapped. Can you get up there and take a look for me?
71000721.Subtitle: I've only got a few left, but my safety rope just snapped. Could you go check the rest of the pipes for me?

71000741.ContentEN: I've marked the remaining pipes for you. Thanks for the help!
71000741.Subtitle: I've marked the remaining pipes for you. I'm counting on you!

71000751.ContentEN: This pipe's in good shape. On to the next one.
71000751.Subtitle: This pipe's in good shape. Let's go check the next one.

71000761.ContentEN: The last one looks good too. Time to report back to the fitter.
71000761.Subtitle: The last one looks good too. Time to go back and inform the fitter.

71000771.ContentEN: All good? That's great news! Thank you so much!
71000771.Subtitle: All good? That's great news! Thank you so much!

71000780.ContentEN: This pipeline has some minor damage. Better inform the fitter.
71000780.Subtitle: This pipe has been slightly damaged. Better inform the fitter.

71000781.ContentEN: Oof... Looks like I'll be working overtime again. Here, take my key and shut off the main Phoxichor valve while I grab my tools.
71000781.Subtitle: Oof... Looks like I'll be working overtime again. Here, take my key and shut off the main Phoxichor valve while I grab my tools.

71000782.ContentEN: Thanks. I'll take it from here.
71000782.Subtitle: Thank you. I'll take it from here.

71000801.ContentEN: That man by the lake looks like he could use some help.
71000801.Subtitle: Hmm? Looks like that man by the lake could use some help.

71000802.ContentEN: What should I do? Should I take a chance?
71000802.Subtitle: What should I do? Should I take a chance?

71000812.ContentEN: So, I was thinking about gathering a Rime Shrub from the cave across the lake.
71000812.Subtitle: So, I was thinking about gathering a Rime Shrub from the cave across the lake.

71000813.ContentEN: But with the thaw setting in, I'm not sure if it's safe to cross. Could you help me out?
71000813.Subtitle: But with the thaw setting in, I'm not sure if it's safe to cross. Could you help me out?

71000815.ContentEN: Sorry, I'm a bit tied up right now.
71000815.Subtitle: Sorry, I'm a bit tied up right now.

71000821.ContentEN: Got it! Time to bring it back to Mr Theo now.
71000821.Subtitle: Got it! Time to bring it back to Mr Theo now.

71000831.ContentEN: Wow, you really saved the day! I can't thank you enough!
71000831.Subtitle: Wow, you really saved the day! I can't thank you enough!

71000901.ContentEN: Hide and seek! Come and play hide and seek!
71000901.Subtitle: Hide and seek! Come and play hide and seek!

71000902.ContentEN: Hide and seek! Come and play hide and seek!
71000902.Subtitle: Hide and seek! Come and play hide and seek!

71000903.ContentEN: I'm in! But I don't want to be the seeker, I want to hide!
71000903.Subtitle: I'm in! But I don't want to be the seeker, I want to hide!

71000904.ContentEN: Me too! I've found a super secret spot. I'm sure to win this time!
71000904.Subtitle: Me too! I've found a super secret spot. I'm sure to win this time!

71000905.ContentEN: But we need a seeker... Anyone else up for a game with us?
71000905.Subtitle: But we need a seeker... Anyone else up for a game with us?

71000906.ContentEN: The kids notice you passing by, their eyes wide with hope, eagerly waiting for your response.
71000906.Subtitle: The kids notice you passing by, their eyes wide with hope, eagerly waiting for your response.

71000907.ContentEN: 子供たちは興奮して飛び上がり、あっという間に街角に消えた。 さあ、この子たちをどこで探せばいいかを考えみよう。
71000907.Subtitle: The children cheer excitedly and vanish around the corner in the blink of an eye. Time to find them!

71000911.ContentEN: Alright, you win. Here's your prize. Come play with us again sometime!
71000911.Subtitle: Alright, you win. Here's your prize. Come play with us again sometime!

71001001.ContentEN: In an unattended parking lot, a shiny new car catches your eye. Could this be an opportunity to... make some quick cash?
71001001.Subtitle: In an unattended parking lot, a shiny new car catches your eye. Could this be an opportunity to... make some quick cash?

71001002.ContentEN: 車にはイコルエネルギー装置が満載でおり、まさに一獲千金のチャンスだ！
71001002.Subtitle: The car's got a full canister of Phoxichor — jackpot!

71001003.ContentEN: 何してるんだ！ 誰か早く来てくれ！
71001003.Subtitle: What do you think you're doing!? Guys, I need support!

71001004.ContentEN: これで邪魔者はいなくなる。車の鍵を開け、イコル液の入ったエネルギー装置を持ち去り、高値で売る。すべてが計画通りに進み、今日も楽しい一日だった。
71001004.Subtitle: With no one left to stop you, you pry open the door, grab the Phoxichor Canister, and walk away with a small fortune. Everything's going smooth. What a lucky day.

71001005.ContentEN: 結局、良識が誘惑に打ち勝ち、駐車場の手抜かりを城門の護衛に報告することにした。
71001005.Subtitle: Your better angels prevail. You decide to report the security lapse at the parking lot to the guards at the city gate.

71001006.ContentEN: お知らせいただきありがとうございます。今からパトロールを強化します。 これはちょっとしたお礼の品ですが、どうぞお受け取りください。
71001006.Subtitle: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. I'll send more patrols right away. Please accept this small gift as a gesture of gratitude from us.

71001201.ContentEN: The weeds have grown thick, obscuring the traces you and Berry once left here.
71001201.Subtitle: The weeds have grown thick, obscuring the traces you and Berry once left here.

71001202.ContentEN: Thanks to your efforts, the area around the statue is now pristine, just as it was the first time you visited.
71001202.Subtitle: Thanks to your efforts, the area around the statue is now pristine, just as it was the first time you visited.

71001301.ContentEN: Berry said this is where we used to live, but I can't remember a thing...
71001301.Subtitle: Berry said this is where we used to live, but I can't remember a thing...

71001302.ContentEN: Maybe if I look around, something will jog my memory.
71001302.Subtitle: Maybe if I look around, something will jog my memory.

71001303.ContentEN: The furniture looks pretty rough — lots of nails hammered deep into the wood, just like the door handles back in the village. Berry must have been incredibly strong even as a kid.
71001303.Subtitle: The furniture looks pretty rough — lots of nails hammered deep into the wood, just like the door handles back in the village. Berry must have been incredibly strong even as a kid.

71001304.ContentEN: Wait, is this... an alchemy storybook? So all those weird bedtime stories Berry told me when we were little came from this.
71001304.Subtitle: Wait, is this... an alchemy storybook? So all those weird bedtime stories Berry told me when we were little came from this.

71001305.ContentEN: But these notes in the margins are much neater than Berry's handwriting. Who could've written them?
71001305.Subtitle: But these notes in the margins are much neater than Berry's handwriting. Who could've written them?

71001306.ContentEN: Mm, I'm recalling a lot about Berry, but still nothing about this place.
71001306.Subtitle: Mm, I'm recalling a lot about Berry, but still nothing about this place.

71001307.ContentEN: Never mind. Maybe it'll come back to me someday.
71001307.Subtitle: Never mind. Maybe it'll come back to me someday.

71001401.ContentEN: You catch the fragrant aroma of Borealberries from afar. If you pick some, you could make a small fortune.
71001401.Subtitle: You catch the fragrant aroma of Borealberries from afar. If you pick some, you could make a small fortune.

71001402.ContentEN: According to seasoned Phoxhunters, this area is ripe with Borealberries. Might be worth looking around.
71001402.Subtitle: According to seasoned Phoxhunters, this area is ripe with Borealberries. Might be worth looking around.

71001403.ContentEN: You manage to collect some vibrant, plump Borealberries. It's clear these seasonal delights will fetch a good price anywhere.
71001403.Subtitle: You manage to collect some vibrant, plump Borealberries. It's clear these seasonal delights will fetch a good price anywhere.

71001404.ContentEN: There you are! Come on, sell me those Borealberries! You won't get a better deal anywhere in town!
71001404.Subtitle: I've been running this little stall in Icelake for years. Just a small business — it makes more friends than money. I mean, we can look out for each other in this city, am I right?

71001405.ContentEN: Hey, I see you've got some Borealberries. Why not sell them to me? I'll offer way more than any local trader would!
71001405.Subtitle: Hey, I see you've got some Borealberries. Why not sell them to me? I'll offer way more than any local trader would!

71001406.ContentEN: You made a deal with the local trader as promised, building a long-term business relationship based on trust.
71001406.Subtitle: You made a deal with the local trader as promised, building a long-term business relationship based on trust.

71001407.ContentEN: You took the time to find the out-of-town trader and sold the Borealberries for a better price. The extra profit is a reward for your business savvy.
71001407.Subtitle: Promises of future benefits aren't as reliable as immediate gains. You make the deal with the out-of-town trader and walk away with a hefty sum.

71001503.ContentEN: I can't seem to get this machine working properly. Why don't you give it a try? Let's see if it's the machine or just me.
71001503.Subtitle: I can't seem to get this machine working properly. Why don't you give it a try? Let's see if it's the machine or just me.

71001505.ContentEN: Impressive! Looks like I'm the problem then...
71001505.Subtitle: Impressive! Looks like I'm the problem then...

71001507.ContentEN: Um... are you sure a smack would work?
71001507.Subtitle: Um... are you sure a smack would work?

71001508.ContentEN: Wait, did a part just fly off?
71001508.Subtitle: Wait, did a part just fly off?

71001509.ContentEN: Wow, you've got the magic touch!
71001509.Subtitle: Wow, you've got the magic touch!

71001601.ContentEN: So many Filthoids... What am I going to do...?
71001601.Subtitle: So many Filthoids... What am I going to do...?

71001603.ContentEN: Wow, judging by your gear, you must be a really skilled Phoxhunter, right? Actually... I'm a Phoxhunter myself, but I'm not very strong...
71001603.Subtitle: Wow, judging by your gear, you must be a really skilled Phoxhunter, right? Actually... I'm a Phoxhunter myself, but I'm not very strong...

71001604.ContentEN: Could you help me retrieve my weapon from those Filthoids? If I don't get it back, I won't be able to take on my next commission...
71001604.Subtitle: Could you help me retrieve my weapon from those Filthoids? If I don't get it back, I won't be able to take on my next commission...

71001607.ContentEN: They're just up ahead. Be careful!
71001607.Subtitle: They're just up ahead. Be careful!

71001608.ContentEN: *sob* If I can't take it back, how am I supposed to make a living...? I haven't had a proper meal in days...
71001608.Subtitle: *sob* If I can't take it back, how am I supposed to make a living...? I haven't had a proper meal in days...

71001609.ContentEN: Thank you! I'm off to my next commission. Take care!
71001609.Subtitle: Thank you! I'm off to my next commission. Take care!

71001610.ContentEN: I know the whole story. Are you sure it's a good idea to give her the weapon back? With her strength, she might just die on her next commission. So, why not sell the weapon to me? It's the safer option for everyone.
71001610.Subtitle: I know the whole story. Are you sure it's a good idea to give her the weapon back? With her strength, she might just die on her next commission. So, why not sell the weapon to me? It's the safer option for everyone.

71001611.ContentEN: Thank you! Looking forward to our next deal!
71001611.Subtitle: Thank you! Looking forward to our next deal!

71001701.ContentEN: Oh, hey! Isn't that {nickname}? Come here!
71001701.Subtitle: Oh, hey! Isn't that {nickname}? Come here!

71001702.ContentEN: I've got some serious research to do here. Can you protect me while I work?
71001702.Subtitle: I've got some serious research to do here. Can you keep me safe while I work?

71001703.ContentEN: Why do baddies always show up when I'm in the middle of research? I'm counting on you! I'm just getting to the bottom of it.
71001703.Subtitle: Why do baddies always show up when I'm in the middle of research? I'm counting on you! Please don't let them interrupt me!

71001704.ContentEN: Let's see... Hmm... Huh... Almost there! Hang in there!
71001704.Subtitle: Let's see... Hmm... Huh... Almost there! Hang in there, you!

71001705.ContentEN: That's a wrap! Research successfully complete! Hooray!
71001705.Subtitle: That's a wrap! Research successfully complete! Hooray!

71001706.ContentEN: I couldn't have done it without you! Here's a little something for your trouble~ Let's team up again next time!
71001706.Subtitle: I couldn't have done it without you! Here's a little something for your trouble~ Let's team up again next time!

71001707.ContentEN: Oh... Well, if you won't stick around, I'd better leave. This place gives me the creeps...
71001707.Subtitle: Oh... Well, if you won't stick around, I'd better leave. This place gives me the creeps...

71002101.ContentEN: {nickname}! Thank goodness you're here! I need your help!
71002101.Subtitle: {nickname}! Thank goodness you're here! I need your help!

71002102.ContentEN: I was supposed to deliver this crate of supplies to my colleagues across the Lamenting Lake, but I've suddenly got this terrible stomachache. Could you deliver it for me? Please, I'm begging you!
71002102.Subtitle: I was supposed to deliver this crate of supplies to my colleagues across the Lamenting Lake, but I've suddenly got this terrible stomachache. Could you deliver it for me? Please, I'm begging you!

71002103.ContentEN: Hello, Kevin asked me to bring these supplies to you.
71002103.Subtitle: Hello, Kevin asked me to bring these supplies to you.

71002104.ContentEN: Wait a minute... The crate is missing two clips and a rifle. You took them, didn't you?
71002104.Subtitle: Wait a minute... The crate is missing two clips and a rifle. You took them, didn't you?

71002105.ContentEN: Embezzling imperial property is a serious offence. You're coming with me!
71002105.Subtitle: Embezzling imperial property is a serious offence. You're coming with me!

71002106.ContentEN: Whoa! I was in the bathroom for a minute, and you're already at each other's throats!
71002106.Subtitle: Whoa! I was in the bathroom for a minute, and you're already at each other's throats!

71002108.ContentEN: Look what this crook did — even had the nerve to steal legion supplies!
71002108.Subtitle: Look what this crook did — even had the nerve to steal legion supplies!

71002109.ContentEN: Huh? Oh, you mean two clips and a rifle? That's on me. I already took my share earlier.
71002109.Subtitle: Huh? Oh, you mean two clips and a rifle? That's on me. I already took my share earlier.

71002110.ContentEN: You're unbelievable! How could you just hand over legion supplies to a random stranger? {性别：He|She} could've been one of The Forsakens!
71002110.Subtitle: You're unbelievable! How could you just hand over legion supplies to a random stranger? {性别：He|She} could've been one of The Forsakens!

71002111.ContentEN: Ah, sorry, my bad! Lesson learned — won't happen again!
71002111.Subtitle: Ah, sorry, my bad! Lesson learned — won't happen again!

71002112.ContentEN: Here, {nickname}. Take this as an apology. Sorry for dragging you into this mess!
71002112.Subtitle: Here, {nickname}. Take this as an apology. Sorry for dragging you into this mess!

71002113.ContentEN: Trying to stall and slip away, huh? Everyone, keep a close eye on this kid. Don't let {性别：him|her} get away.
71002113.Subtitle: Trying to stall and slip away, huh? Everyone, keep a close eye on this kid. Don't let {性别：him|her} get away.

71002115.ContentEN: Huh? Missing supplies? Oh, you mean two clips and a rifle, right? That's on me. I already took my share earlier.
71002115.Subtitle: Huh? Missing supplies? Oh, you mean two clips and a rifle, right? That's on me. I already took my share earlier.

71002116.ContentEN: You're unbelievable! How could you just hand over legion supplies to a random stranger? {性别：He|She} could've been one of The Forsakens!
71002116.Subtitle: You're unbelievable! How could you just hand over legion supplies to a random stranger? {性别：He|She} could've been one of The Forsakens!

71002117.ContentEN: Ah, sorry, my bad! Lesson learned — won't happen again!
71002117.Subtitle: Ah, sorry, my bad! Lesson learned — won't happen again!

71002118.ContentEN: Here, {nickname}. Take this as an apology. Sorry for dragging you into this mess!
71002118.Subtitle: Here, {nickname}. Take this as an apology. Sorry for dragging you into this mess!

71002701.ContentEN: A few barrels float along the waterway, some emitting eerie noises. If you open them carefully, you might find something useful.
71002701.Subtitle: A few barrels float along the waterway, some emitting eerie noises. If you open them carefully, you might find something useful.

71002702.ContentEN: This barrel has a gaping hole at the bottom. Aside from the whistling wind passing through, there's nothing inside. Try another one.
71002702.Subtitle: This barrel has a gaping hole at the bottom. Aside from the whistling wind passing through, there's nothing inside. Try another one.

71002703.ContentEN: This barrel is filled with household waste and sewer water, creating revolting gurgling sounds and a nauseating stench. Try another one.
71002703.Subtitle: This barrel is filled with household waste and sewer water, creating revolting gurgling sounds and a nauseating stench. Try another one.

71002704.ContentEN: Persistence pays off. After a meticulous search, you uncover useful supplies hidden in a secret compartment of the barrel.
71002704.Subtitle: Persistence pays off. After a meticulous search, you uncover useful supplies hidden in a secret compartment of the barrel.

71002705.ContentEN: The rickety barrel collapses with a thunderous crash, attracting nearby Filthoids. Defeat them and claim your rightful spoils.
71002705.Subtitle: The rickety barrel collapses with a thunderous crash, attracting nearby Filthoids. Defeat them and claim your rightful spoils.

71002901.ContentEN: Under the sergeant's command, the enemy advances steadily towards you. Take down the sergeant as fast as you can to disrupt their formation.
71002901.Subtitle: Under the sergeant's command, the enemy advances steadily towards you. Take down the sergeant as fast as you can to disrupt their formation.

71002902.ContentEN: The enemy crumbles under your calm and decisive actions.
71002902.Subtitle: The enemy crumbles under your calm and decisive actions.

71002903.ContentEN: The sergeant has called in reinforcements. More enemies are closing in.
71002903.Subtitle: The sergeant has called in reinforcements. More enemies are closing in.

71003001.ContentEN: Restless Filthoids prowl and snarl, casting a foreboding shadow over the area. Dispatch them quickly.
71003001.Subtitle: Restless Filthoids prowl and snarl, casting a foreboding shadow over the area. Dispatch them quickly.

71003002.ContentEN: The oppressive aura thickens. You sense that something sinister is about to descend.
71003002.Subtitle: The oppressive aura thickens. You sense that something sinister is about to descend.

71003003.ContentEN: The sounds of battle summon an indomitable calamity. The avatar of doom arrives. Defeat it, just as you have countless times before.
71003003.Subtitle: The sounds of battle summon an indomitable calamity. The avatar of doom arrives. Defeat it, just as you have countless times before.

71003004.ContentEN: With the Filthoids vanquished, the sinister aura dissipates. For now, the area is safe.
71003004.Subtitle: With the Filthoids vanquished, the sinister aura dissipates. For now, the area is safe.

71003101.ContentEN: This land is rife with fanatics chasing Geniemons. Drive them off and save the poor creature.
71003101.Subtitle: This land is rife with fanatics chasing Geniemons. Drive them off and save the poor creature.

71003102.ContentEN: More Geniemon fanatics rush in from the distance.
71003102.Subtitle: More Geniemon fanatics rush in from the distance.

71003103.ContentEN: The Geniemon fanatics finally calm down. This Geniemon is safe now.
71003103.Subtitle: The Geniemon fanatics finally calm down. This Geniemon is safe now.

80010101.Content: 这是为了维系您与我之间的友谊，而有意为之的邀约，对吗？

80010107.Content: 酒的味道，颇有些……浓烈。长久以来，受到家族较多管束的缘故，我极少品尝这种饮品。

80010108.Content: 但既然您饱含诚意的邀请了，那回绝就过于失礼。

80010109.Content: 您不必为此介怀。对宾客投其所好或许是尽地主之谊的必要礼节，但适逢其时的好意本身已经足以慰藉风尘。

80010110.Content: 而且，我也在逐步学会适应“外面的一切”。

80010111.Content: 第一次抵达北境的时候，在冰天雪地的荒原上，也曾有一位年迈的猎人给了我同样的东西。

80010113.Content: 远比您调制的这杯更辛辣，更苦涩，甚至让人难以保持清醒的意志。

80010114.Content: 但却非常温暖。像一小簇火苗，让几乎冻僵的我们再次有了活着的知觉。

80010115.Content: 是的，这没什么值得隐瞒的。

80010116.Content: 您这个玩笑……我并不觉得非常有趣。

80010117.Content: 我是一名漂泊之人，如您所见。

80010118.Content: 也许您已经从希尔妲那里听说过，我们的故土，是迪斯玛尼亚——也许您会更加熟悉它的另一个称呼，“帝都”。

80010119.Content: 在那里，我和家族发生了一些冲突，致使流落至此。

80010120.Content: 请谅解。您是与我订立过重要契约的人，按照礼节，我本应坦诚以待。

80010121.Content: 但关于这件事，请容许我保守秘密——

80010122.Content: 我对您虽无戒备之心，但出于对您安全的顾虑，还是建议您不要牵涉过深为好。

80010123.Content: 时间有些迟了，谢谢您今日的邀请。回见。

80010201.Content: 与您共度的时光称得上令人欢悦，虽然我还不能很好地适应它的味道。

80010203.Content: 请不要误会，我并非在对您的邀约敷衍了事。

80010204.Content: 只是希尔妲不允许我对食物拥有偏好。她每日都会要求厨师奉上和此前完全不同的菜肴，而这些餐点里，喜爱的也好，厌弃的也好，她都会要求我一视同仁地品尝。

80010205.Content: 久而久之，我也就没有什么“喜爱的味道”了。

80010206.Content: 呵呵……您或许误解她了。她不是无礼之徒，此举也绝非傲慢地越俎代庖。

80010207.Content: 呵呵……如果您是我，想必就不会说出这样的话了。

80010208.Content: 希尔妲是个敏锐的姑娘。她非常清楚，对我而言，拥有喜好，便意味着危险。

80010209.Content: 比如……我来问您一个问题。您看这杯酒——

80010210.Content: 假设我喜爱浸泡了罗勒叶和迷迭香的酒，每次都会一饮而尽，

80010211.Content: 而您又是一名受雇于主，混迹于一众家仆之中，想要夺取我性命的“窥伺者”，

80010212.Content: 您要如何忍住，不把那漂亮而致命的毒液涂抹在罗勒叶之上呢？

80010213.Content: 哦？我只是做个简单的比喻。难道您真的……

80010214.Content: 呵呵，别太紧张。我不会怀疑您。

80010216.Content: 在我身边环绕着的人……或许更应该称呼他们是兽群。

80010217.Content: 他们像是一群秃鹫，随时在等待着我停止挣扎的一刻，然后分食。

80010218.Content: 迪斯玛尼亚的每一粒灵魂，包括我自己，都是污浊的。

80010219.Content: 呵呵……也许对您而言，漂泊在外意味着异邦的风土，喧哗而有趣的人们，焕然一新的人生。但至于我……

80010220.Content: 陌生的土地给了我片刻喘息，但我终究要到故乡。不过，并非因为我有多怀念它。

80010221.Content: 而是我全部的爱与憎恨，思念与愤怒，都在那个地方。

80010223.Content: 尝得出，相比上次，您在调和时有意减淡了口味。

80010224.Content: 多谢您，将我的无意之言记挂在心。

80010301.Content: 尝得出，您调制饮品的手艺愈发娴熟，甚至达到了希尔妲五成的水准。

80010302.Content: 我不像希尔妲那样，擅长社交上的体面辞令。我的意思是，以她为基准的话，五成也已经很了不起了。

80010303.Content: 如果说有什么值得特别留意的……

80010304.Content: 那就是您过于平等地糅合了所有原料，反而让人无法品尝出它的基底——也就是，调制者最想要呈现的味道。

80010305.Content: 您近日心绪也有些乱。也许，忧虑太多纷杂的事，不如选择一件最重要的，细细研磨。

80010307.Content: 杯子……粘上了……抱歉，我并非有意弄脏它。

80010308.Content: 只是赴约之前，我刚刚完成那幅画。没有希尔妲提醒，我忘记手指沾了些颜料。

80010311.Content: 过去吗？呵呵……如果这是真正的过去，就好了。

80010314.Content: 在我的居所，他们存在过的痕迹——连同他们的画像——都已经被残忍粗暴地抹去了。我只能通过老仆人的只言片语，去想象他们的样子。

80010315.Content: 年岁尚小的时候啊，我每天都在想，我总会与他们相见的。就在未来的某一天……

80010316.Content: 到那天，我们就可以像这样，邀来最优秀的画师，来为我们画一幅家族肖像。像那些可爱的三口之家一样。

80010317.Content: 但真正到了我能够把心中所思绘制在画布上的年纪，我才知道，我画的不是过去，亦非未来。

80010318.Content: 而是从未存在过，将来也不会存在的……

80010320.Content: 嗯。也许您早已猜到，在我记事之前，他们已经是墓园的白骨。

80010321.Content: 抱歉，我不小心自顾自地说起来了，连带您的心情也变糟糕了吧。

80010322.Content: 您认真地准备了饮品和茶点，想必并非打算听我喋喋不休地叨念些不快的旧事。

80010323.Content: 我们来聊些其他的吧，比如珀西·巴莱德的诗集。

80010402.Content: 我认为，我并不是一个可以给您带来欢愉的攀谈对象。

80010403.Content: 我今天读了一句诗：“好奇心会杀死一只知更鸟”……

80010404.Content: 罢了，既然您再度问起，那么我讲一个故事吧。

80010405.Content: 很久很久之前，有一个年轻的姑娘，她从出生起就住在一座黄金的牢笼里……

80010406.Content: 她似乎拥有世上的一切：她有一百顶镶着璀璨钻石的冠冕，有一百件皎洁珍珠编织的衣衫，有一百名仆人每天献上沾着晨露的鲜花……

80010407.Content: 但有一件东西是她始终得不到的：那就是黄金牢笼外的任何事物，哪怕是一滴雨，一缕风。

80010408.Content: 一个夜晚，一条陌生的龙闯进了黄金的牢笼。

80010409.Content: 她不知道那条龙硕大的身躯是如何钻进狭窄的栅栏，只知道它带来了她梦寐以求的一切——诗集，油彩，琴弦，剑术……以及她日思夜想的，牢笼之外的故事。

80010410.Content: 虽然身在牢笼之中，但她却从龙带来的故事里，看到了广阔的天空，触摸到旷野的清风，奔跑在金色的麦田，听到了广场上吟游诗人的歌谣。

80010411.Content: 她是如此感谢龙带给她的一切……

80010412.Content: 直到有一天，她无意间从传言中得知，正是那条龙，在她还在襁褓中时，灭亡了她的城市，杀死了她的亲生父亲……是的，它是一条恶龙。

80010413.Content: 然后，恶龙将她锁进了这座黄金的监牢。

80010414.Content: 少女将愤怒熔铸成刺剑，等待着恶龙再次踏着月色来访，她发誓将以利刃贯穿恶龙的心脏。但最后，她却犹疑了。她颤抖着询问传言的虚实，她渴望得到错误的答案。

80010415.Content: 但恶龙却亲口承认了一切。最后，她的剑只触及恶龙坚硬的鳞片。

80010416.Content: 不久之后，黄金囚笼里的吃穿用度，全部变了模样。每日奉上的鲜花，花蕾中再也不是晨露，而是毒刺。

80010417.Content: 终于有一天，一位聪明的女仆想方设法找到黄金的钥匙，打开了囚笼的门……女仆对少女说，她自由了。

80010418.Content: 但是少女知道，恶龙焚城的火焰在她的心底燃烧着，记忆的余烬环绕着她，将她投入深渊。她永远不会得到自由了。

80010419.Content: 嗯，很久之后我才得知，那两场<C=#FF0000>盛大的谋杀</C>。

80010420.Content: 从那之后，我的梦中永远是鲜血淋漓的身体，痛苦扭曲的面庞……每一晚，每一晚。

80010421.Content: 在用小刀划破自己皮肤的时候，我已经是那么痛了。那么被利剑贯穿的父亲，被埋在废墟中的母亲，该有多痛啊……

80010422.Content: 呵呵，您知道吗？您眼前的芙罗拉，并不是什么优雅高贵的贵族小姐……

80010423.Content: 她只是一个献祭生命也在所不惜的，复仇的恶鬼啊。

80010425.Content: {NickName}，我想，您拥有一位过于优秀的骑士。

80010426.Content: 贝蕾妮卡小姐，她把您护佑得多周全啊，无论是身体，还是灵魂。

80010427.Content: “新的人生”……好漂亮的愿望，就像孩子们吹出的肥皂泡……

80010429.Content: {NickName}，您真的是一个过于天真的家伙。

80010430.Content: 以至于，您可以笃定地认为，您有资格对抗我所对抗的东西。

80010431.Content: 您不知道，那是一个怎样的<C=#FF0000>“怪物”</C>……

80010433.Content: 失礼了，我今天说了太多错误的言辞。

80010434.Content: 把这一切都忘了吧。或者，请您只当它是从某本小说里读来的传奇故事。

80010435.Content: 以及，不要再邀请我赴约了。这样，我还可以视您为一名值得尊敬的受托人。

80010501.Content: 我应该说过，请您不要再邀请我。

80010502.Content: 如果事关我们的契约，谈判桌远比这里更加合适。

80010504.Content: 我想，上次我已经给了您清楚的回答。

80010505.Content: 回去吧。我的前路没有过去，也没有未来。只有紧紧闭锁的漆黑深渊。

80010506.Content: 即使是您放声呼喊，也无法将我从那里带回。

80010510.Content: 哪来的笨蛋{性别：先生|小姐}，幼稚鬼，秽兽一样的脑袋！你以为你是什么人？传奇小说里的屠龙勇士，神眷之子？少做白日梦了！我们的契约只是要你帮我找东西，可没约定过这种事！

80010511.Content: 你知道我的仇人是什么家伙吗？别犯蠢了，他一秒钟，一句话，就足以要你的命。

80010514.Content: 我希望可以成为芙罗拉的朋友，而非仅仅是受托人。不……甚至不只是朋友，而是可以共享哀乐，共享命运的人。

80010515.Content: 所以，如果我没有可以将芙罗拉带回的绳索，那就让我也一起跳下去吧。

80010516.Content: 我不是什么诸神眷顾的屠龙勇者，但我可以和你一起战斗至最后一刻。

80010517.Content: 哪怕最终你的剑折断了，至少还有人可以陪你一起躺在血泊里，而不是让你孤独一人面对死亡。

80010520.Content: 说到这份上，我要用什么办法才能甩掉你呢……

80010521.Content: 我没有过去，也没有未来。

80010522.Content: 除了千疮百孔的灵魂，一无所有。

80010523.Content: 既然你来了……那就和我一起，行走在鲜血淋漓的“现在”吧。

80010524.Content: 直到那漆黑之物杀死我们，或者我们杀死它。

80020100.ContentEN: Unless you have a task for me, we don't need to engage in much small talk. However, if your task is to have a chat, then a small service fee will buy my temporary companionship.

80020201.ContentEN: I must say, I envy you for having the leisure to throw a little tea party.

80020202.ContentEN: I've just completed a grueling assignment up north and feel like I'm falling apart. I'll probably need a full night and day of sleep to recover.

80020203.ContentEN: It's fine. I'm already seated — might as well have a drink with you before heading to bed.

80020204.ContentEN: Perhaps you can handle a commission for me next time.

80020205.ContentEN: Mm, maybe I should just reject further commissions from this client. The pay is good but hardly worth the danger.

80020206.ContentEN: She had me deliver a rather colourful letter to her violence-prone relatives back home, designed to make them see red.

80020207.ContentEN: I had to bolt the second I delivered the letter; otherwise, the phrase \"shoot the messenger\" might have become more than just metaphorical — I bet those savages have never been on the receiving end of the kind words used in that letter.

80020208.ContentEN: Then it was a whole night's trekking through the snow to dodge ambushes. Sure, I could easily handle them, but there's no extra pay for that...

80020209.ContentEN: Hmm? You look astonished. What's wrong?

80020210.ContentEN: Of course, at least for now.

80020211.ContentEN: Not really. I've been through worse.

80020212.ContentEN: Before I was Miss Flora's maid, I briefly held a different position where I acquired many of the skills I use today, whether necessary or not.

80020213.ContentEN: Like how to swiftly dismantle firearms, extract poison from plants, or knock someone out in three seconds without serious harm...

80020214.ContentEN: Well, you are my long-term client, so I'll just be upfront with you — I used to be an agent.

80020215.ContentEN: Some called us spies. But the title doesn't matter. Essentially, we were a nameless group, always cloaked in disguise and shadow.

80020216.ContentEN: You might brush past one on the street, thinking they're just an ordinary passerby, when in reality, they could be on their way to create chaos or deliver secret messages.

80020217.ContentEN: I once romanticised it as well, but reality is another story.

80020218.ContentEN: Indeed, it may sound exciting, but it's actually packed with challenges and risks.

80020219.ContentEN: Most agents are stuck with their legion, forced to follow orders — some even involve killing their own family.

80020220.ContentEN: I couldn't stand all those rules and restrictions, so I figured out a way to break free.

80020221.ContentEN: The escape was another heart-stopping story. This drink's not enough for me to share it, though.

80020222.ContentEN: I should go to bed now. I'll need to prepare breakfast for Miss Flora tomorrow. It's been days since she had my dessert.

80020223.ContentEN: And as a thank-you for this drink, I'll save a piece of cake for you.

80020301.ContentEN: I've finally got some free time today. I'm all yours if you're up for a few more drinks.

80020302.ContentEN: And after we're done here, I'm going to hit the shops — I've got some extra silver coins to squander from all those commissions I took.

80020303.ContentEN: Sure, I can help pick out something that suits you.

80020304.ContentEN: Like I'd breathe, have meals, and sleep.

80020305.ContentEN: Shopping is my way to unwind. It's thoughtless, gets me some fresh air, and I can wear what I like — a rare opportunity for me.

80020306.ContentEN: At work, I'm typically in my maid's uniform or a bulky trench coat filled with pockets for various mission-essential gadgets.

80020307.ContentEN: And to keep a low profile during a mission, I'd tie up my hair. You know, red hair tends to draw unnecessary attention.

80020308.ContentEN: But when I'm out shopping, I can let loose a bit and wear lighter-coloured clothes.

80020309.ContentEN: Light colours really complement my hair. Though when I'm out with Miss Flora, I still tend to wear a hat.

80020310.ContentEN: I always wear dark red shoes. You know, like a red velvet cake needs to be topped with red berries.

80020311.ContentEN: I'd also dab on some fragrances and wear exotic accessories from the Starweavers — they really lift my spirits.

80020312.ContentEN: With your light silver hair, you'd look more vibrant in bright colours too.

80020313.ContentEN: Hmm? I thought it was pretty straightforward.

80020314.ContentEN: Right? You should try it too.

80020315.ContentEN: Actually, my fascination with this started during my career as an agent. We had to master the art of disguise, looking completely unlike ourselves.

80020316.ContentEN: I started with the basics: playing a street flower girl, a heavily-jewelled lady, an elderly woman teetering in the breeze, and even a \"prince\" or \"princess\" at times.

80020317.ContentEN: Mm-hmm, it was quite convincing as long as I remained silent. There were even a few noble ladies who gave me their handkerchiefs — it was adorable.

80020318.ContentEN: Over time, I realised that disguising myself as someone else could also change my mood. Even a dress or a piece of jewellery can be a factor in brightening my day.

80020319.ContentEN: So, after that, I fell in love with shopping for new outfits.

80020320.ContentEN: Well, I've finished my drink. Let's go hit the shops. I'll help you put together an outfit as a thank-you.

80020401.ContentEN: Thanks for inviting me... Mm, thank you.

80020402.ContentEN: After this drink, I'm off to trim the flowers.

80020403.ContentEN: Quite the opposite, actually. I want to pick up the shears precisely because I'm not in the best spirits.

80020404.ContentEN: It's not about work, actually; it's more about stress relief.

80020405.ContentEN: When I feel the pressure mounting, I find snipping away at dying flowers quite cathartic — as if I'm trimming away my own gloom.

80020406.ContentEN: I hope you wouldn't find that strange. It's just my way of blowing off steam. After all, the assignments I take normally require much more than making conversations.

80020407.ContentEN: Back when I was an agent, some of my colleagues had... let's say, darker ways of unwinding.

80020408.ContentEN: An assassination that lasts only seconds might require a month of planning, a week of prep, and a whole day of agonising wait — and failure could mean a lifetime behind bars.

80020409.ContentEN: Considering that kind of pressure, randomly cutting several flowers seems quite mild, doesn't it?

80020410.ContentEN: Well, it's not really a bother.

80020411.ContentEN: It seems you're missing the point of this conversation, aren't you?

80020412.ContentEN: I was just thinking of... um, someone important.

80020413.ContentEN: She was a fellow agent, but she always thought I wasn't cut out for the job. So I made so much effort trying to prove to her that I was not only competent but exceptional.

80020414.ContentEN: In the end, it turned out she was right.

80020415.ContentEN: I couldn't put missions above all else like she could.

80020416.ContentEN: Yet, there's a part of me that's relieved that I didn't end up walking her path.

80020417.ContentEN: We lost touch when I left the Legion. Now that I'm settling in here, I find myself... wondering how she's doing.

80020419.ContentEN: You're right. Instead of trimming flowers here, perhaps I should just go see her in person.

80020501.ContentEN: You approached me as soon as I returned, inviting me for a drink. Please be honest with me — have you picked up some of my old agent tricks and been keeping tabs on me?

80020503.ContentEN: I was only teasing you. You came over because you're curious if I've met that lady who's important to me, aren't you?

80020504.ContentEN: Truth be told, no. She was reassigned away from the capital for certain reasons, so I've only caught snippets about her from others.

80020505.ContentEN: She's in a small town in the south — nothing like the icy grip here, but a place where she can enjoy bright sunlight and some music often.

80020506.ContentEN: To be honest, I was relieved. Because I wasn't sure how I would face her... But knowing she's doing well gives me some peace of mind.

80020507.ContentEN: This means the last ties between me, the Legion, and my past life as an agent have finally been severed.

80020509.ContentEN: The old me would, but no, not anymore.

80020510.ContentEN: She's actually a close family member of mine. She was the reason that I joined the Legion, and the reason I decided to leave.

80020511.ContentEN: She never wanted me to stay in such a dangerous profession, but I was desperate to show her that I could handle it — maybe even share some of her burdens.

80020512.ContentEN: It was the irony of fate that she and I received conflicting missions — hers to eliminate Miss Flora, mine to protect her.

80020513.ContentEN: So I took Miss Flora and fled before her assassination attempt could commence. At that time, I didn't have the leisure to dwell on my days in the Legion or anything related to her.

80020514.ContentEN: It's only because things have settled down recently, and you've been there for me to unload these old stories, that this whole thing had become a thorn in my heart, which led to my recent discomposure.

80020515.ContentEN: What I knew for sure was that eventually, I had to confront a complete farewell with her, which was something I had been trying to run away from.

80020516.ContentEN: Now that it's finally happened, it doesn't feel so bad. I'm even relieved that it'll no longer haunt me.

80020517.ContentEN: I've got so much I want to do now — trim flowers, bake a cake, shop for new outfits, maybe even dance a little.

80020518.ContentEN: But what I want to do most at the moment is thank you for helping me truly move on.

80020519.ContentEN: But I must also remind you: now that you know my past, it means that one day when the Legion comes after me and Miss Flora, you won't be able to stay out of it.

80020520.ContentEN: I hope you're not too scared. Do you feel like I've handed you a sugar-coated poison?

80020521.ContentEN: Please rest assured that, I, Hilda, the all-capable maid, will always ensure your safety.

80020522.ContentEN: Thank you — is it so strange to hear that from me? I mean it sincerely.

80030100.ContentEN: This holiday is precious, and spending it with you is just as enjoyable as sleeping.

80030101.ContentEN: Nothing beats having a refreshing drink after a good rest. It's so wonderful to have a break from work!

80030102.ContentEN: Speaking of which, I got a package before I came here. Let me take a look.

80030103.ContentEN: This must be the pyjamas and incense my subordinate bought me as a sleep aid. Perfect, I'll go back home and take another rest later.

80030104.ContentEN: Huh? \"Proposal on the Optimisation of Ornamental Plants of the 13th Legion\"? \"Application for Purchasing Recreational Facilities to Enhance Soldiers' Morale\"?

80030105.ContentEN: Urgh, it's always about work. Let's talk about this later. I won't let my holiday be spoiled by anything or anyone, except the Chief. But I doubt she'll show up here.

80030106.ContentEN: It's not easy to come up with such practical principles as these.

80030107.ContentEN: Whoa, how could you call this \"slacking off\"?

80030108.ContentEN: This is the \"Howard High-Efficiency Energy-Saving Mode\", created by yours truly, Randy Howard.

80030109.ContentEN: When you take a break, clear your mind of all work so that you can start working again in a good mood. That way, you won't dread getting back to work.

80030110.ContentEN: After years of practising and optimising this method, I've got it working perfectly.

80030111.ContentEN: This has helped me to figure out the most energy-saving solution to different problems in seconds.

80030112.ContentEN: Such as this conversation with an ulterior motive.

80030114.ContentEN: A bit too late to play dumb, don't you think?

80030116.ContentEN: Hah, so that's No. 0's name — Berenica.

80030117.ContentEN: A bit late to play dumb too, I'd say.

80030118.ContentEN: Well, playing dumb is how smart people start a conversation.

80030119.ContentEN: But honestly, your question's moot. For starters, even if I did tell you something, there's no way you could verify it.

80030120.ContentEN: Secondly, in the principle of the \"Howard High-Efficiency Energy-Saving Mode\", I keep work and life separate.

80030121.ContentEN: Life might blend into work, but work must never intrude on my life. Right now, I'm technically on vacation, and that's the most \"energy-efficient\" way I operate.

80030122.ContentEN: So, this conversation and any future talks about No. 0 aren't gonna get anywhere; but if you want to chat about life and other fun stuff, I'm all ears.

80030123.ContentEN: Then it seems we're done here. You can leave.

80030124.ContentEN: While I can't disclose her whereabouts, I can assure you, she's safe.

80030125.ContentEN: There's no way I could verify that.

80030126.ContentEN: Hahaha, smart people are all quick learners.

80030127.ContentEN: *sigh* It's sad to see good intentions go unappreciated — so much so that I might not be able to rest properly tomorrow...

80030128.ContentEN: Oh, wait! Maybe I should try to extend my holiday by taking sick leave. Like, I need a prolonged holiday 'cause my illness had prevented me from getting proper rest. That makes perfect sense, doesn't it?!

80030129.ContentEN: And the reason I'll use will be... I feel achy all over, especially in my heart.

80030130.ContentEN: Because of a conflict during a public opinion survey... but it has been resolved through private negotiations. Maybe I'll even get compensation out of it. Today has been very fruitful.

80030131.ContentEN: You just extended my holiday in mere seconds. My friend, you're the best!

80030132.ContentEN: I'm looking forward to my next excuse for... Ahem... I mean, our next meeting.

80030201.ContentEN: Looks like you're finally up for some casual chats, huh?

80030202.ContentEN: I'm still on a mission, so I couldn't meet up with you during working hours. I requested leave especially to grab a drink with you.

80030203.ContentEN: And my reason for this leave... I told them I was invited to a dance by a young lady of nobility.

80030204.ContentEN: Oh don't be surprised. It's quite common for young officers and noble ladies to have romantic affairs. The Legion turns a blind eye to them. After all, having relations with 'the nobility' can bolster the Legion's influence.

80030205.ContentEN: As a gentleman, I had to take longer leave for this reason. I think it makes perfect sense.

80030206.ContentEN: Your words are like a dagger in my heart. I might have to extend my leave to recover from that burn.

80030207.ContentEN: Thank you, I'll take that as a compliment.

80030208.ContentEN: I'm aware by the way, that 'gentleman' is often used sarcastically, not as praise.

80030209.ContentEN: When I was little, my sisters told me that being a gentleman is the ultimate goal for a man.

80030210.ContentEN: Maybe you're making that assumption based on your high opinion of me, but unfortunately, they're not lovely ladies, not at all.

80030211.ContentEN: I was just like any ordinary kid. Dumb and naive.

80030212.ContentEN: Look, I really don't feel like talking about my sisters. They tormented me during my childhood. But since you're my holiday buddy, I will tell you this.

80030213.ContentEN: I grew up with their \"love\". To survive their clutches... ahem, I mean love, I had to develop many skills.

80030216.ContentEN: Back then, they told me all the time that a gentleman should kiss a lady's dress when they meet, and that one should adhere to principles and etiquette to conceal their true thoughts and feelings.

80030217.ContentEN: When I was five or six years old, I acted like a gentleman to every woman I met, even though I didn't want to.

80030218.ContentEN: You can imagine how my sisters watched me and laughed. Later on, they told me that gentlemen didn't really have to do that.

80030219.ContentEN: They should actually kiss the back of a lady's hand. Not her dress.

80030220.ContentEN: Anyway, let's not talk about this. Here's a toast to my miserable childhood.

80030401.ContentEN: I'm here. I couldn't stand you up now, could I?

80030402.ContentEN: Check this out. The Military Alloy Temperature Control Vessel - Ultimate Type. I've tried it, and it works like a charm... *yawn*

80030403.ContentEN: I'm feeling a bit drowsy at the moment, I need to find a place to get some shut-eye. I've nearly run out of annual leave, and I can't report to Chief Sibylle tomorrow with dark rings around my eyes.

80030404.ContentEN: You're very perceptive. Yes, there's something on my mind.

80030405.ContentEN: I won't keep it from you. Basically, I had a nightmare.

80030406.ContentEN: Of course not. You know how lazy I am. I turn most invitations down.

80030407.ContentEN: To be honest, I had a nightmare last night, so I'm feeling a bit off today.

80030408.ContentEN: Well, like many of my nightmares, this one was about my dad.

80030409.ContentEN: He used to be a soldier in the Empire, but... he's been bedridden for years now.

80030410.ContentEN: Back when I was tricked by my sisters into becoming a gentleman, he was a sergeant in the Legion. He spent more time on the front lines than at home, just like me now.

80030411.ContentEN: But the difference between us is that he was proud of being a soldier. He treated the Legion as his home and his actual home as nothing more than a hotel where he could complain as much as he liked.

80030412.ContentEN: Whenever he came home, he'd complain about something or the other, like the Emperor's portrait not being hung up properly, or my sisters coming home too late.

80030413.ContentEN: And he'd always check up on me last.

80030414.ContentEN: He'd check how much taller I'd got, how many books I'd read, how many forts I'd learned the names of, and what new survival skills I'd acquired.

80030415.ContentEN: I tried talking to him about other things, but he wasn't interested in anything other than \"being a soldier\".

80030416.ContentEN: Once, to try to please him, I painstakingly carved a wooden pistol for him and eagerly awaited his praise.

80030417.ContentEN: But with a stren face he just snatched it from me, \"Don't waste your time on things like this. Think about how you can become a better soldier from now on.\"

80030418.ContentEN: At that moment, I felt something change within me. Something cold, bitter, intangible and unstoppable, like the howling wind outside our home.

80030419.ContentEN: Later, I gradually realised that it was hatred. Although it was weak to begin with, it was still strong enough to make me feel that the person in front of me was nothing more than a stranger.

80030420.ContentEN: So after that, I stopped trying to be the son he wanted me to be. I ignored his check-ups on me, no matter how much he scolded me.

80030421.ContentEN: Years passed. He was shot in the head while protecting one of his subordinates and was sent home with a purple heart. Although he was still alive, he had fallen into a coma.

80030422.ContentEN: When he came back, he had nothing but shiny medals, his slender savings, and a wooden pistol that was broken in two.

80030423.ContentEN: I thought he was disappointed in me because of that broken pistol, but his subordinates told me that he carried it with him at all times and that it broke when he fell on the battlefield.

80030424.ContentEN: It seems that he did love me after all. But his way of expressing it was unrecognisable. Maddening.

80030425.ContentEN: If he was proud of me, he should've told me. A few words of encouragement would've been enough, but instead, he just forced me to do things I didn't enjoy.

80030426.ContentEN: Although he'd never push me to do anything again, I still joined the army, just like he wanted.

80030427.ContentEN: I was curious about the Legion, the place that had turned my father into a taciturn man. I also wanted to prove that I could live a great life even without his scolding.

80030428.ContentEN: But unfortunately for both of us, I found out that he was right all along. He was protecting me.

80030429.ContentEN: We're unlike most people in the Legion. We crawled out of piles of corpses on the battlefield, and kneel down to receive the medals they bestowed upon us like charity.

80030430.ContentEN: A decent job, a great life, and a means of survival. Everything about us is determined by those small medals. For the sake of our family, my dad devoted himself to them.

80030431.ContentEN: He obeyed, endured, suppressed his feelings, pushed back the tears, and turned himself into a husk of a man.

80030432.ContentEN: I can't do that, but I need money to support myself and maintain my family's decent lifestyle. So, I'm a happy loser now, as you can see.

80030434.ContentEN: You have a keen eye. But to be frank, I have no idea what I want to do. After a long bout of depression, I've finally realised that.

80030435.ContentEN: Even though I haven't lived up to my dad's expectations, I'm happy with the life I have.

80030436.ContentEN: I hope so. If that happens, my nightmares may finally end.

80030437.ContentEN: That tastes good. This will help me sleep without nightmares.

80030438.ContentEN: Thanks, holiday buddy, but I need some sleep now, or else I'll have to take more leave tomorrow.

80030439.ContentEN: Don't worry, I'll be the regular Randy you know the next time we meet. And if I have another nightmare, please make me one more cup of this delicious drink.

80030501.ContentEN: A hot drink with extra sugar, please. I brought some desserts from the Imperial Capital. I queued up to buy them during my break. Want to try some?

80030502.ContentEN: I sure am. I'm in the mood for a sweet drink as a prelude to my invitation.

80030503.ContentEN: Ooh! I want to ask a small favour of you, but I wouldn't call it a \"plan\".

80030504.ContentEN: Ahem... Maybe this is a little sudden, but do you want to attend a dance with me?

80030505.ContentEN: Like I mentioned to you before, the Legion needs to maintain ties with some local nobility. So, I need to attend annoying social balls in the inner city from time to time.

80030506.ContentEN: I really don't want to go. The trip is paid for, but dealing with the nobility is such a headache.

80030507.ContentEN: So, I have a perfect solution. I can take a gorgeous lady with me as my partner.

80030508.ContentEN: That way, no one will try to introduce me to a female relative I've never met before.

80030509.ContentEN: Well... I was thinking... maybe... you could try to disguise yourself as a lady.

80030510.ContentEN: I can't. I'm the one who's been invited.

80030511.ContentEN: Sorry, but you're my last hope. I'm really clutching at straws here!

80030512.ContentEN: We've had so many drinks together, and you're my closest friend. I'm even closer to you than my siblings, so I'm begging you for help.

80030513.ContentEN: If you help me in my time of need, I'll give you half of my salary for the next six months. And, if Chief Sibylle tries to arrest you next time, I'll come forward and protect you!

80030514.ContentEN: If that's not enough, then I'll dress up like a lady and entertain you after the ball. What do you say?

80030515.ContentEN: No, no, no! You've got the wrong idea! What makes you think that?

80030516.ContentEN: I mean, it's normal, right? Best buds do everything together — hang out, share meals, hit the restroom, try on dresses...

80030517.ContentEN: Hey, don't laugh at me. I'm really in a bind here. Please just give me your answer. If you say \"no\", I'll have to find another solution.

80030519.ContentEN: Huh? Really? That's fantastic! You're a lifesaver!

80030520.ContentEN: You've done me a huge favour. I'll repay you however I can.

80030521.ContentEN: But let's talk about this after the ball. I need to go home and prepare my outfit now before you change your mind.

80030522.ContentEN: I'll see you later, my holiday buddy, break-time pal, and the target of my pursuits to this very day.

80030523.ContentEN: Please give it plenty of consideration. After the ball, I'll find many creative ways to repay you, just like how I come up with excuses to take time off.

80030524.ContentEN: Take as much time as you need. I really need your help, and I'm certain that you'll come through for me.

80030525.ContentEN: I'll be awaiting your answer. See you later, my holiday buddy, break-time pal, and the target of my pursuits to this very day.

80030526.ContentEN: Yes, you're my best dancing partner, after all. The question is, are you willing to do me this favour?

80030528.ContentEN: Why on earth would you think that? If I really wanted to arrest you, I could've done that the first time we met.

80030529.ContentEN: I don't see the point in using my precious leave to come here and organise something like a \"secret arrest ball\".

80030530.ContentEN: And what if you turn me down? How would my plan work in that case?

80030531.ContentEN: You must be kidding. Do you seriously think I'm a scheming fool like that?

80030532.ContentEN: Alright then. If you really did misunderstand me and think I was a shameless jerk who'd betray his friends like that, I'd need a month's leave to recover from such heartbreak.

80030533.ContentEN: Hey, at least deny that I betrayed my friends for personal gain, or else you'll hurt my feelings!

80030534.ContentEN: But now there's one thing I'm sure of — You're not afraid of risk at all.

80030535.ContentEN: So, you were messing with me to see my reaction.

80030536.ContentEN: I didn't know you love mean tricks like me. Where did you pick that up?

80030537.ContentEN: I panicked for a moment then. Although deep down I knew it was impossible, I was still worried. What if you really thought that way?

80030538.ContentEN: So, to make up for your trick, you must help me.

80030540.ContentEN: Okay, fine, you're right. I've been wanting to arrest you for ages. Every morning, I wake up and think about how to carry out my devious plan, but I procrastinate too much to actually do it.

80030541.ContentEN: This time, I was hoping to fulfil my duty but failed. What do I do?

80030542.ContentEN: One day, I'll be fired by the Legion and end up homeless and destitute on the cold streets of Icelake.

80030543.ContentEN: Do you really want to see me turn into an ice sculpture on the street?

80030544.ContentEN: Maybe you can think twice before answering me...

80030545.ContentEN: ... Huh? Really? That's fantastic! You're my lifesaver!

80030546.ContentEN: You've done me a huge favour. I'll repay you however I can.

80030547.ContentEN: But let's talk about this after the ball. I need to go home and prepare my outfit before you change your mind.

80030548.ContentEN: I'll see you later, my holiday buddy, break-time pal, and the target of my pursuits to this very day.

80040101.ContentEN: There we go. Try this, Berry.

80040103.ContentEN: So, why were you so eager to take the ladle from me earlier?

80040104.ContentEN: Because you were about to add pomegranates to the fish soup!

80040105.ContentEN: What's wrong with that? I remember you used to love pomegranates when you were little.

80040106.ContentEN: Remember last year when we walked past that big pomegranate tree? You picked a whole bag of them. Too bad they all rolled down the hill when you slipped. You said it was such a waste.

80040107.ContentEN: So this time, I picked some just for you... Don't you like them anymore?

80040108.ContentEN: It's not about the pomegranates. It's just that pomegranates and fish might not taste good together, don't you think?

80040109.ContentEN: But you like berries dipped in milk... It's hard to buy milk here on this island, so I thought soup would work just as well.

80040110.ContentEN: It's really not the same. Fish soup has a strong salty, fishy taste, so it doesn't go well with sweet fruits. Plus, fruits are best eaten fresh; they'd lose their crunch if boiled.

80040111.ContentEN: And even if you were to cook pomegranates, you should at least peel them first...

80040112.ContentEN: Uh... this is way more complicated than I thought.

80040113.ContentEN: It is. \"The interplay of ingredients is a culinary art. Only the right combinations bring out the best in each\" — That's what they say in \"The Art of Cooking\".

80040114.ContentEN: So, the funny sour taste in that stew last time was because I added berries?

80040116.ContentEN: And the time you said the shrimp was too rich, was it because I used honey instead of salt? I thought honey was better since it's more expensive...

80040118.ContentEN: Ah... So I messed up all those times...

80040119.ContentEN: I've heard that honey is sweet, and sweetness is good; while bitterness, like in chicory, is bad. But I can't really tell what sweet or bitter tastes like.

80040120.ContentEN: I was taught very young that food is just a means of filling the stomach; tasty food is a distraction from what's important and might lead to indulgence, so I wouldn't need a sense of taste.

80040121.ContentEN: They made me drink a potion; and ever since then, I haven't been able to taste anything.

80040123.ContentEN: Sorry, I've made you eat so much awful food...

80040125.ContentEN: ...Not at all. Your cooking is usually great. Those were just minor hiccups — everyone has off days.

80040126.ContentEN: I always look forward to trying whatever new dish you've invented... And you know what? It's the author of \"The Art of Cooking\" who has no taste! They don't appreciate innovative ingredient combinations.

80040127.ContentEN: You really think so? Or are you just saying that...

80040128.ContentEN: Have I ever lied to you?

80040130.ContentEN: Well, can you tell me what a pomegranate tastes like?

80040131.ContentEN: It's a bit sweet, a bit sour, and — well, let's keep that a secret for now.

80040133.ContentEN: Tasting is something you should experience yourself.

80040134.ContentEN: If it's the potion that made you lose your taste, there's got to be something that can bring it back, right?

80040135.ContentEN: Alright, starting today, I'm going to earn as much as I can, so that I can soon get off this island to find that cure!

80040136.ContentEN: Once your sense of taste is back, we'll try all the delicious food out there in the world... and buy loads of your favourite pomegranates!

80040201.ContentEN: Home at last. Quick, Berry, take a seat!

80040204.ContentEN: You got hurt, didn't you? Let me see your hand... I'll bandage you up.

80040208.ContentEN: How many times have I told you? Always protect yourself first when there's danger.

80040209.ContentEN: Like with that sea eagle just now — why didn't you just dodge? Why did you have to confront it head-on and get scratched... Does it still hurt?

80040210.ContentEN: You were right behind me. If I had dodged, it would have hurt you.

80040211.ContentEN: I could have dodged it too!

80040212.ContentEN: I'll be more careful next time.

80040214.ContentEN: When we were kids, some bad grown-ups often picked on us. But you'd rather fight them head-on than back down with smart words, and you always ended up bruised and battered.

80040215.ContentEN: You'd always promise to be more careful next time, but every \"next time\" turned out to be another \"Sorry, I'll be more careful next time.\"

80040216.ContentEN: I'm not like you. You're good with words and always know what to say to different people. But I can't do that... People are too complicated. I never really understand what they really mean.

80040217.ContentEN: For me, the only way to solve problems is with what I have in my hands. If not weapons, then fists or teeth.
