80040218.ContentEN: It's okay. If you're not great with words, I'll speak for you, just like you've always protected me like a shield.

80040219.ContentEN: But you have to promise me to break this charging head-on habit, okay? You're strong now, you don't have to put yourself in danger anymore — it must hurt a lot.

80040220.ContentEN: Pain is nothing; it'll pass if I just bear it for a while. \"Those who don't fear pain have no weaknesses\"... This way of fighting is the most efficient.

80040221.ContentEN: ...Fine! If it works so well, guess I should learn it too. Next time there's danger, I'll just charge right in.

80040222.ContentEN: You... No, it's different for you!

80040223.ContentEN: What's the difference? Just saying that worries you, doesn't it? You should know how your habit worries me, too.

80040224.ContentEN: So, at least for my sake — take good care of yourself, okay?

80040226.ContentEN: Breaking a habit isn't easy... but I'll try.

80040227.ContentEN: Mm-hmm. Let's really make it stick this time!

80040303.ContentEN: Berry! You're covered in blood... What happened?! Did those monsters hurt you?!

80040304.ContentEN: It's Filthoid blood, not mine. They've attacked the village.

80040305.ContentEN: I figured as much. I was hiding here and heard those beasts charging like mad down the mountain.

80040306.ContentEN: It's weird... Those Filthoids usually keep to the deep woods. We barely see them. What drove them to suddenly come out and attack people?

80040307.ContentEN: It didn't make sense to me. I wanted to come find you right away, but then I thought with your combat skills, you might handle things better on your own.

80040308.ContentEN: Mm, you did the right thing staying put and waiting for me.

80040309.ContentEN: The village is crawling with Filthoids. Thankfully, it's still safe around here. Let's hole up for now. I've brought enough food to last a few days.

80040311.ContentEN: They were heading to the docks when I left, probably trying to escape by boat. No time to worry about them now, we need to find shelter quickly.

80040312.ContentEN: Let's go back to the cave I was hiding in.

80040315.ContentEN: I'm not scared when you're with me. If anything, I'm a bit... excited. This could be our <H>chance</>.

80040316.ContentEN: I've been thinking... maybe we can leave Purgatorio Island someday. What do you think?

80040317.ContentEN: Leave? Why, aren't you happy here?

80040318.ContentEN: It's not that. It's just... this island is so small — you can circle it in less than a day.

80040319.ContentEN: The people here think this tiny island is the whole world. They believe the ocean and the cosmos just revolve around this rock, day after day.

80040320.ContentEN: But I know that's not true! Remember that book, \"Betwixt Leaves And Branches\"?

80040321.ContentEN: Yeah, it was brought back from Hyperborea by the fishermen. The kids took all the snacks, and that book was tossed aside in the cabin like rubbish. You picked it up and brought it back like it was treasure.

80040322.ContentEN: Right. That book was a real eye-opener. It showed me that Purgatorio Island isn't the centre of the world — it's merely a speck on the map, tinier than an ant. Across the sea, far beyond the Heaventree, lies a vast continent...

80040324.ContentEN: North of us is the Hyperborean Empire, where the ancestors of the villagers come from. It's a vast land that stretches from the southern coasts to the northern snowfields, all connected by long trains.

80040325.ContentEN: Even further north, beyond Hyperborea, lie endless mountains and seas of floating ice, home to countless small settlements, each with its own fascinating customs.

80040326.ContentEN: To the south is the Elysian Church, the oldest civilization. It's a divine realm where gods live in a tower high above the sky. And to the east—

80040327.ContentEN: What's wrong, Berry? Are you alright?

80040328.ContentEN: I'm fine, just a bit tired. Let's not talk about this for now, okay?

80040329.ContentEN: Right, you must be exhausted, and here I am going on and on. Let's go to the cave and have some rest.

80040331.ContentEN: ...You're right. This island is a prison, and we've shut the world out.

80040332.ContentEN: But what if the world outside isn't as wonderful as you imagine?

80040401.ContentEN: Ugh, those Filthoids have found us... {nickname}, hide behind that tree!

80040409.ContentEN: I've patched up all your wounds. It should be all right for now.

80040410.ContentEN: No fever, your breathing's steady... looks like you're just worn out and fast asleep. Right, you've really been through a lot these past few days.

80040411.ContentEN: You always lecture me when I get hurt.

80040412.ContentEN: Now the tables have turned, and here you are, sleeping like a log... not giving me a chance to lecture you.

80040414.ContentEN: You always wonder why I feel the need to protect you... Hmm, why is that?

80040415.ContentEN: You're right, I'm just like you — sand in my eyes makes them itch, a tickle on my palm makes me laugh, and a cut on my hand hurts and bleeds.

80040416.ContentEN: There's no real difference between us. So why do I always feel this deep need to protect you... as if it's simply part of who I am?

80040417.ContentEN: I think I'm starting to understand now... maybe it's because you taught me these things—

80040418.ContentEN: Growing up with you, I learned that this is how people should live — we're not machines built for fighting and killing; we laugh when we're happy, and cry when sad.

80040419.ContentEN: When we're scared, it's okay to shout out; when in pain, we should find comfort in someone's embrace.

80040420.ContentEN: There's <H>her</> — don't know if I have the right to call her \"mother\" — and then there's you...

80040421.ContentEN: The two of you made me feel like I could live like a real person.

80040422.ContentEN: ...Sleep tight, {nickname}. I'll keep watch over you tonight.

80040424.ContentEN: Something doesn't add up... why have those Filthoids suddenly gone berserk?

80040425.ContentEN: Maybe you were right. It was naive of me to think staying on Purgatorio Island would keep us safe.

80040426.ContentEN: We can't keep hiding forever. They found us this time, and there'll be a next time.

80040427.ContentEN: {nickname}, when you wake up tomorrow, let's leave this island. We'll find somewhere vast and free. Like you said—

80040428.ContentEN: \"I'll be your shield, and you'll be my voice.\"

80040429.ContentEN: There's nothing to fear now — not anymore.

80050100.ContentEN: {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn, are you having a tea party? May I join you~?

80050101.ContentEN: Hello, {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn. I've just got this amazing gift from the Great Magician. Would you like to see it?

80050103.ContentEN: It's a box of building blocks.

80050104.ContentEN: Look at these blocks — they might look similar at first glance, but if you look closely, you'll see that each one has a unique shape, colour, and pattern!

80050105.ContentEN: I've counted — there are over a dozen different types here!

80050107.ContentEN: Spent casings... Is that what they're called? Wow, you know so much! Thanks for telling me. Now, let me show you how to stack them up — it's really fun!

80050108.ContentEN: Watch this! If you put them together like this, it becomes a tiny pistol.

80050109.ContentEN: And like this, it turns into a big cannon — BOOM!

80050111.ContentEN: It's Outsider who taught you all these, isn't it?

80050112.ContentEN: Yes! He showed me lots of cool ways to put them together, like making a giant robot that can shoot missiles from its shoulders and has wings on its back—

80050113.ContentEN: Oh! And the fists — they can launch too! I'll show you!

80050115.ContentEN: It's a bit tricky though... Whew, there it is!

80050116.ContentEN: I had no idea that spent casings could be this fun. Let me see it.

80050120.ContentEN: Sorry... please don't cry! I'll make it up to you with something else.

80050122.ContentEN: Then could you grant me four wishes, {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn? They say unicorns make people's wishes come true, and I'm sure you can too!

80050125.ContentEN: Isn't the standard three wishes? Why do you get four?

80050128.ContentEN: I want to learn magic! I know a little bit of the basics, but I don't know how to actually use it... {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn, can you teach me?

80050129.ContentEN: Why don't you ask Outsider to teach you?

80050130.ContentEN: He wouldn't... and he wouldn't let me read the magic books either — he put them up on a tall shelf, way out of my reach.

80050131.ContentEN: I sometimes stack chairs to sneak a book when he's not around — oh, please keep this just between us!

80050133.ContentEN: Huh? Um... would a big jar of marshmallows cover it?

80050134.ContentEN: But since it's Fina's wish, let's make it free.

80050136.ContentEN: Thank you so much! Outsider wouldn't teach me... and he wouldn't let me read the magic books either — he put them up on a tall shelf, way out of my reach.

80050137.ContentEN: I sometimes stack chairs to sneak a book when he's not around — oh, please keep this just between us!

80050138.ContentEN: He always says that learning magic means leaving one's cosy home, away from the warm fireplace, to trudge through the barren, harsh wilderness...

80050139.ContentEN: And there will be snow wolves with terrifying green eyes, and swamp witches on brooms, their cloaks dripping with poison.

80050140.ContentEN: He was just exaggerating to frighten you. It's not that scary.

80050141.ContentEN: Ah... I knew it! He's worried I might get sick or hurt. But what if I never get better...? I don't want to just lie in bed all day, being a burden to him.

80050142.ContentEN: ...I want to be helpful. I don't want to be looked down upon anymore.

80050143.ContentEN: Actually, there are things scarier than snow wolves and swamp witches.

80050144.ContentEN: If that's the case... I definitely can't let you go by yourselves. I need to master magic to help you.

80050145.ContentEN: So, could you teach me, please? I promise I won't tell anyone!

80050147.ContentEN: Yay! You're the kindest and sweetest {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn in the whole world!

80050201.ContentEN: My second wish is for {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn to secretly take me out of the city to see the real stars.

80050202.ContentEN: The sky is so vast and distant, and the stars are so bright... it's all so beautiful...

80050203.ContentEN: In the city, even on clear nights, you can only see a small patch of the sky because of the buildings and city walls.

80050204.ContentEN: The star lamp Outsider gave me is pretty, but there's nothing like the real starry sky... achoo!

80050205.ContentEN: Be careful not to catch a cold.

80050206.ContentEN: Stand behind me, I'll shield you from the wind.

80050207.ContentEN: I'm okay, really. You can feel my palm. It's quite warm! I'd like to stay out a little longer...

80050208.ContentEN: Look! Those stars over there, they look like a bunny together, don't they?

80050210.ContentEN: Hehe. Then I'll make up a story about a little bunny's marvelous adventures among the stars tonight.

80050211.ContentEN: They look more like a big drumstick.

80050212.ContentEN: Huh? ...I don't see it. Are you hungry?

80050214.ContentEN: They look more like a dolphin wearing pants on its head.

80050215.ContentEN: Huh? Wh—What's that?! I can't picture it...

80050217.ContentEN: Why do you like seeing the stars so much, Fina?

80050218.ContentEN: A long time ago, my mom told me a story about a little bird that turned into a star... It's my favourite, and I'd love to share it with you.

80050219.ContentEN: This bird wasn't like the others: she had ugly feathers, a jarring song, and her claws and beak were not sharp. The other birds didn't like her, always bullying her, trying to chase her away.

80050220.ContentEN: Yet, this little bird yearned for the starry sky. She prayed to the stars, wishing for a chance to join them, even if it meant perishing in their fiery glow.

80050221.ContentEN: So the stars answered her prayers?

80050222.ContentEN: No... Some stars ignored her, while some mocked her for overreaching: a plain little bird dreaming of soaring through the beautiful starry sky, how ridiculous.

80050224.ContentEN: She decided not to pin her hopes on others. Bidding farewell to her family, she flew toward the night sky alone.

80050225.ContentEN: The higher she flew, the colder the sky became; eventually, she froze, never to flap her wings again.

80050227.ContentEN: No, that's not the end. As the little bird lay frozen, she suddenly realised something: her plain body began to quietly burst into radiant flames, just like a shining <H>star</> in the sky.

80050228.ContentEN: That's right — she became a star herself!

80050229.ContentEN: And that's my story. Do you like it, {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn?

80050230.ContentEN: I love it. It's a beautiful story.

80050231.ContentEN: I love it. That little bird was much braver than I expected.

80050232.ContentEN: I didn't like it. It's too sad.

80050233.ContentEN: The little bird shouldn't have had to sacrifice herself... It was an evasion of real injustice. She should've fought back.

80050234.ContentEN: I see... well, that would indeed be a completely different story.

80050236.ContentEN: Do you think I can be like that little bird someday?

80050237.ContentEN: ...The little bird's family would be devastated.

80050238.ContentEN: Ah... I hadn't thought of that.

80050239.ContentEN: I always imagined her family would be proud and happy for her because she would always shine so brightly in the night sky.

80050240.ContentEN: If they missed her, they could simply look up at the starry sky on cloudless nights and say hello, just as we have done.

80050241.ContentEN: But you've made me realise that as a star, she could no longer speak or move. Her family would never be able to reach her, no matter how far they trekked.

80050242.ContentEN: Would that make her family sad? I need to think about it...

80050243.ContentEN: Thank you for taking me out to see the stars tonight, {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn. Let's go home.

80050301.ContentEN: My third wish is for {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn to take me up on the town walls of Icelake.

80050304.ContentEN: I'm fine, look! We're now at the highest point of the outer city! It feels like we're birds soaring in the sky!

80050305.ContentEN: Hello, Sun! Hello, Clouds! It's so nice to see you! I'm Fina, and this is {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn, my dear friend!

80050307.ContentEN: Keep it down, Fina — you wouldn't want Outsider to find out about this, would you?

80050310.ContentEN: Haha, you're full of energy today, {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn!

80050311.ContentEN: I've never seen Icelake from such a high point before! Oh, do you know Icelake well by now? Let me show you around—

80050312.ContentEN: See that brass-coloured, round thing with a spiky tip? That's the Silver Peace Monument! It's been there for hundreds of years.

80050313.ContentEN: And do you see those cramped rows of houses down south? One of them is my home! The neighbours are loud but friendly.

80050316.ContentEN: What's wrong? If you don't know that place, I can tell you about it.

80050318.ContentEN: That's the inner city... where I grew up. That house over there... that's where I used to live.

80050319.ContentEN: Oh, so you came from a rich family. That's nice.

80050320.ContentEN: No, it wasn't nice at all.

80050323.ContentEN: Because that place was just a house rather than a home.

80050324.ContentEN: My parents were taken to a faraway place. It all happened on a stormy night in August.

80050325.ContentEN: Dad was taken by a \"bad hunter,\" and his body was left hanging in the sky with a noose around his neck.

80050326.ContentEN: Mom was killed by a savage \"beast,\" and her blood, red as roses, was washed away by the pouring rain, leaving nothing behind.

80050327.ContentEN: They've gone to a faraway place... and there's no home for me there anymore.

80050330.ContentEN: Your hands are as warm as you, {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn...

80050331.ContentEN: Remember the story you told me? The one about the little bird and the stars?

80050332.ContentEN: Maybe your parents have become stars in the sky... Though they can't speak, they're still quietly, gently watching over you.

80050333.ContentEN: So, whenever you miss them, just smile at the night sky.

80050335.ContentEN: It's okay, don't feel bad for me, because I have a new home now.

80050336.ContentEN: I have the Great Magician, and I have you. I am more than content now.

80050402.ContentEN: Only one wish to go. Where do you want to go this time, Fina?

80050403.ContentEN: This time, we're not going anywhere because my last wish is already here with us.

80050404.ContentEN: Look, I've brought my new storybook!

80050405.ContentEN: Oh, it's a collection of stories by Fina... wait, why are all the pages blank?

80050406.ContentEN: Because I want to write a new storybook with you — that's my fourth wish.

80050407.ContentEN: Oh, that's a rather simple wish... Absolutely, we can do that.

80050408.ContentEN: But I'm not good at writing stories.

80050410.ContentEN: No pressure, we'll figure it out together.

80050411.ContentEN: Let's start the first story with a simple adventure~

80050412.ContentEN: One day, Little Nightingale and {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn embarked on an adventure together...

80050413.ContentEN: Was it just the two of them, or were there other friends?

80050415.ContentEN: Then it'd be their very own secret adventure.

80050417.ContentEN: Right, with the Great Magician along, it'd surely be a wonderful trip.

80050419.ContentEN: Hehe, Miss Butterfly and Little Nightingale could fly in the sky together then.

80050420.ContentEN: Alright, so they set off together. They arrived at...

80050421.ContentEN: A frozen land covered in ice.

80050422.ContentEN: Hmm, sounds a lot like Icelake.

80050423.ContentEN: A cluster of small islands at sea.

80050424.ContentEN: Right, so they set sail in a magical boat, carried away by playful waves.

80050425.ContentEN: A faraway realm in the east.

80050426.ContentEN: Hmm... Perhaps then, they'd meet the elegant Lady Dragon there?

80050429.ContentEN: A chest...? What could be in it? Silver coins, pretty flowers, or finely made building blocks?

80050430.ContentEN: Made new friends in a foreign land.

80050431.ContentEN: That means more companions for the journey — the more, the merrier!

80050433.ContentEN: Right, going on an adventure is about seeing all those wonderful places in the world.

80050435.ContentEN: Returned home with a wealth of treasures.

80050436.ContentEN: Settled down in another prosperous land and lived happily ever after.

80050437.ContentEN: Defeated the evil Demon Lord and became celebrated folk heroes.

80050438.ContentEN: Right! So this is how the story...

80050441.ContentEN: I just feel like... there's something missing from our story...

80050443.ContentEN: It's such a perfect story, with a happy ending for everyone... What could possibly be missing?

80050446.ContentEN: The problem with this story is just being \"perfect.\"

80050447.ContentEN: What's missing from the story is \"regrets.\"

80050448.ContentEN: Everything in this story goes perfectly, doesn't it? Without any real challenges or regrets, it all feels almost unreal.

80050450.ContentEN: Right... When I was little, the stories my mother told weren't just about happiness and laughter. There would also be bad things and tears:

80050451.ContentEN: Beautiful princesses fell into deep slumbers, enchanted princes turned into beasts, children were taken by evil sorcerers, and little birds froze in the night sky...

80050452.ContentEN: Even though the endings were normally good... but why must they experience sadness first? Why couldn't they be happy all the time?

80050453.ContentEN: Because that's just how life is.

80050454.ContentEN: Well, take your favourite marshmallows for example: They come in different flavours — some are sweet, some are sour, and some are even a bit bitter.

80050455.ContentEN: Right! I love those sweet ones, and hate the bitter ones... no, the mustard flavour is the worst. Why would anyone put mustard in marshmallows!?

80050456.ContentEN: Every time I had one of those by mistake, it'd bring tears to my eyes, and I had to find a sweet one to get rid of the mustard taste in my mouth. What's funny is that the sweet taste would seem stronger—

80050457.ContentEN: Ah, I get it now... It's precisely because of the bitter and mustard-flavored ones that the sweet ones taste so good.

80050459.ContentEN: And it's the same with the stories, right? If there's no sadness or regrets, then happiness wouldn't feel as precious...

80050460.ContentEN: So that's how it is... I see.

80050461.ContentEN: The story we just wrote stands for our fondest wish. But a real story, like our lives, has both laughter and tears...

80050462.ContentEN: Thank you, {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn. I think I'll need more time...

80050463.ContentEN: To grow, to live, to learn, and to travel — before I can finish this storybook.

80050464.ContentEN: So, {性别:Mr|Miss} Unicorn, you still owe me that wish!

80050466.ContentEN: Oof, I walked right into this, didn't I?

80050467.ContentEN: Hehe, let's fill this book with wonderful stories in the future!

80060100.ContentEN: Nothing's more important than having a good meal! Lemme see if you've had your fill!

80060101.ContentEN: Mmm — this bread drink smells amazing! Did you make it yourself? You've really got a knack for this!

80060102.ContentEN: At one of our food drives, a kind-hearted lady brought along her homemade bread drink. She said it was quite the project!

80060103.ContentEN: You gotta chop up bread into bits, sprinkle on some sweet malt sugar, toast it till it's nice and warm, then soak it to let it ferment into a bubbly delight...

80060104.ContentEN: Mmm... this tastes just as good as the bread drink she made!

80060105.ContentEN: Wow, you know how to make this? It's not a common drink.

80060106.ContentEN: Mm-hmm, I know everything about keeping bellies full!

80060107.ContentEN: I'm not bragging, you know — I'm like Elysium's walking encyclopedia of food! There's nothing about food that Commissary Truffle doesn't know!

80060108.ContentEN: So, any questions you've got about food — like where to find the best veggies in season right now, or what's in a certain dish — I've got all the answers!

80060109.ContentEN: Really? Can you guess which fruits are in this drink?

80060110.ContentEN: Challenge accepted~ Lemme have another sip! ...Mmm, borealberries! Though they are a bit tart right now; they'd become sweeter and juicier a couple of days later.

80060112.ContentEN: I know... Mmm, this taste is so familiar... just give me a moment...

80060114.ContentEN: —Vermilion Teardrops! Freshly picked this morning from the wild, right?

80060116.ContentEN: Haha, why so surprised? It's no big deal. Filbert and I have tried EVERYTHING you can imagine — there's nothing unfamiliar to my taste buds.

80060117.ContentEN: Now, Vermilion Teardrops are a bit sour, like plums, so they go well with sweet berries; giant pine cones have tough shells, but the nuts inside are tender, crunchy, and sweet!

80060118.ContentEN: Creeping Tendrils taste just as awful as they look; insulating sealant looks like milk and smells fruity, but if you eat it, you'll get a tummy ache... so never try it!

80060119.ContentEN: ...Please tell me you've never tried Filthoid tentacles...

80060120.ContentEN: Nope, haven't gotten around to those. Wonder how they taste? Probably very slimy and chewy... Should Filbert and I try them out sometime...

80060121.ContentEN: Mm, pass! Though Filbert can knock over small Filthoids, those big ones are quite violent. I can't put Filbert in danger!

80060122.ContentEN: It's a miracle you've managed to stay healthy growing up...

80060123.ContentEN: Uh-huh. When I was little and wandering with Filbert, we occasionally nibbled on something poisonous and got sick.

80060124.ContentEN: But don't worry! Now I'm quite the expert at identifying which plants are safe to munch on.

80060125.ContentEN: How come you've tried so many different \"foods\"?

80060126.ContentEN: Because there was nothing much to eat. I started wandering alone at a very young age.

80060127.ContentEN: I've always been a big eater, so even though kind people sometimes gave me food, it was never enough — I was always hungry...

80060128.ContentEN: Aww, don't feel bad for me! I'm not upset about it, because I met Filbert soon after.

80060129.ContentEN: That day, I was super hungry, and so was Filbert. She was just a tiny piglet then, but she gave me the only piece of bread she had found in a bin.

80060130.ContentEN: I don't quite remember what I was thinking back then, just that I whispered into her ear, \"Let's leave the city and find food in the wild together!\"

80060131.ContentEN: Wow, a pig that understands human speech...

80060132.ContentEN: Uh-huh, amazing, right? Filbert must be a gift from the gods.

80060133.ContentEN: Ever since that day, Filbert has carried me to fields and forests to find food... We never went hungry again, and we've even been able to share extra food with other starving people.

80060134.ContentEN: Ah... I wonder if Filbert's hungry out there on her own. Can I take the rest of this drink to share with her?

80060136.ContentEN: Aww, you're so kind-hearted! Some people frown upon me sharing treats with Filbert, just because she's a pig. But to me, Filbert is a dear friend...

80060137.ContentEN: Anyway, thank you so much for not judging!

80060138.ContentEN: I'd rather not share my drink with a pig...

80060139.ContentEN: Oh...Okay. Then I won't drink it either.

80060140.ContentEN: Filbert is my best friend; rejecting her is the same as rejecting me... it'd hurt her feelings, and mine too. But still, thank you for the bread drink.

80060141.ContentEN: I'm full now. See you around!

80060204.ContentEN: Huh? Oh, I'm fine... Hehe, hehehe!

80060205.ContentEN: Come on, I could spot that pout from a mile away.

80060206.ContentEN: Ah, you saw through me... Well, they say sharing bread is good and sharing troubles is bad, but since you asked... maybe you can help me figure this out!

80060207.ContentEN: A few days ago, I met a really obnoxious guy... He seemed to be a butler for some noble family, and he wanted to buy loads of nuts from us commissaries.

80060208.ContentEN: He and his men brought seven big bags, and the payment offered was all zeros and commas!

80060209.ContentEN: As a priestess in the church always says, \"A coin not earned is a coin lost!\" So, Filbert and I worked our tails off all day for this order.

80060210.ContentEN: Did he stiff you on the payment for those nuts?

80060211.ContentEN: It was the opposite. He paid in full and even added a bonus for our quick service — it should've been a great deal.

80060212.ContentEN: But as they were leaving, I noticed the butler picking out some fresh Twisty Pods from the bags and throwing them away.

80060213.ContentEN: I stopped him right there and explained those were perfectly good nuts — the white stuff was their natural fuzz, not mould.

80060214.ContentEN: And guess what, he said he knew they weren't mouldy, but they weren't good for extracting oil, so he didn't want them!

80060216.ContentEN: Uh-huh! They didn't buy those nuts to eat! You won't believe this—

80060217.ContentEN: He said his master's family bathe in boiled milk every day! And they only use milk from the healthiest cows on the farm!

80060218.ContentEN: And that's not all — they'd add fresh perfume to the bath milk. They used to use tulip petals for the fragrance, and now they're switching to essential oil from nuts!

80060219.ContentEN: As for the nuts that couldn't be used for oil? Straight into the bin!

80060221.ContentEN: Exactly! And even if I could look the other way, Filbert wouldn't be okay with it!

80060222.ContentEN: Hmm, bathe in milk... must be nice...

80060223.ContentEN: Ah, don't say that! Our scriptures say wasting food is a huge sin! They'll get their comeuppance!

80060224.ContentEN: I threw his money right back at him and took back my nuts. I just couldn't watch them waste food like that! According to the divine teachings, the worst sin is waste!

80060225.ContentEN: You're absolutely right, Truffle. Wasting food is bad.

80060226.ContentEN: Right? Every bit of wasted food could have filled a hungry belly. I can't let food go to waste! Not even a little bit!

80060227.ContentEN: But if they've already paid, isn't it their right to do as they please with their own stuff?

80060228.ContentEN: Huh? That's not what the gods teach... Though what you said does make sense... But something still doesn't feel right...

80060229.ContentEN: Ugh, so complicated. Well, if they have the right to waste their own food, then I have the right not to sell food to them!

80060230.ContentEN: If only those who never have to worry about food could see that there are still people starving out there...

80060231.ContentEN: Anyway — in the end, I got a lecture from a priestess for losing that order, but I still gave all those nuts to people in need.

80060232.ContentEN: I know what starving feels like — it's awful! I never want that again, and I don't want to see anyone else starve.

80060233.ContentEN: You have a kind heart, Truffle.

80060234.ContentEN: *sigh*... It feels like there's still a loooong way to go before Filbert and I can achieve our dream of feeding everyone in the world.

80060235.ContentEN: Well, I guess I should try even harder! I'm off to gather food with Filbert now! See you around — and don't forget to eat well!

80060301.ContentEN: Hehe, borealberry juice is just the best this season — so sweet and refreshing, not sour at all. Yum yum!

80060303.ContentEN: Can I have the recipe? Filbert would love this too!

80060305.ContentEN: Thank you! You're so benevolent and philam... phillan-tropic — did I get that right? Anyway, you're an angel!

80060306.ContentEN: Filbert and I used to pick borealberries very often. Just a little twist, and they'd fall into my hands. I'd fill baskets full of them, and Filbert was always so happy hauling them back.

80060307.ContentEN: One time, we ate so many our tongues and lips turned purple! We spent a lot of time washing our mouths by the stream, but the colour just wouldn't come off.

80060308.ContentEN: Filbert got so upset she jumped into the stream to wash up, and then a crab under the pebbles pinched her foot — it hurt so much she whimpered. So I jumped right in to save her, and guess what — there was another crab, a really big one...

80060309.ContentEN: We both ended up soaking wet, limping back with teary, purple-stained faces. Priestess McGuffin patched us up, all the while giving us a good scolding.

80060310.ContentEN: Since then, every time Filbert passes a berry bush, she just eyes those borealberries eagerly but never dares to nibble at one.

80060311.ContentEN: Are you two scared of Priestess McGuffin?

80060312.ContentEN: I'm not. But Filbert shivers whenever she's around, probably because she threatened to kick her out when we first came.

80060313.ContentEN: When Priestess McGuffin first took me in, she was worried that Filbert would eat up all the food in the church and leave everyone else hungry. But it didn't take long for Filbert to prove her wrong by bringing back far more food than she ever ate.

80060314.ContentEN: Priestess McGuffin eventually agreed to keep Filbert, though she still complains Filbert isn't cool enough. She'd say things like—

80060315.ContentEN: \"Little Truffle, have you read this Hyperborean novel about a hero who befriends a dragon? Why do they get such cool animal friends, and we just have a pig?\"

80060316.ContentEN: \"And here's another novel by a Huaxu writer — they have a pig too, but theirs is a celestial general who fights monsters! Does our pig have any special powers?\"

80060317.ContentEN: Maybe she has a point. You should find a cooler companion.

80060318.ContentEN: Nuh-uh! I would never leave Filbert!

80060320.ContentEN: Don't listen to her — riding a pig is super cool!

80060321.ContentEN: Wow, you really think so? You're the best! May the Gods of Life, Bounty, Borealberry, Burrowing Botato — any gods there are — bless you!

80060322.ContentEN: You really like Filbert. She must be a very special pig.

80060323.ContentEN: Special? She sure is! But I'm curious — why would you think so, {nickname}?

80060325.ContentEN: Actually, all pigs are pretty fast. Wild pigs can run as fast as rabbits. Compared to them, Filbert isn't even close.

80060326.ContentEN: Because Filbert can find lots of food.

80060327.ContentEN: She uses her nose to sniff out food in the wild. Actually, all pigs have sharp noses. If you train one from a young age, like taming a horse, it could find food for you too.

80060328.ContentEN: Actually, I've really thought about this after Priestess McGuffin asked me.

80060329.ContentEN: I wondered, among all those cool animals out there, why must it be Filbert? Why can't my partner be just another pig? I mean, they all look alike.

80060330.ContentEN: But I only thought about it for one night. The next morning, when Filbert nuzzled my face to wake me up, it suddenly all made sense.

80060331.ContentEN: Because only Filbert... is my Filbert! The one who helps me dig for mushrooms, carry bags of food handouts, and fight against bullies...

80060332.ContentEN: She's always been there for me — when I stumble through scriptures, when I get sick, and when I run around on errands.

80060333.ContentEN: So it's the many little moments you've shared together that make Filbert so special?

80060334.ContentEN: Exactly! Even if Filbert is just an ordinary pig, even if others don't think she's cool, or there are pigs out there that are faster, prettier, or can find more mushrooms...

80060335.ContentEN: Filbert is still the one and only in the world — Commissary Truffle's best partner!

80060336.ContentEN: Right, I remember she's the Special Commissary.

80060337.ContentEN: Right! Truffle and Filbert together, fighting hunger—

80060338.ContentEN: Ah! I almost forgot — I haven't divvied up today's food.

80060339.ContentEN: I have to go now, {nickname}. See you next time!

80060401.ContentEN: {nickname}! I... I have a really important question! Can you answer it right now?

80060403.ContentEN: I'm wondering — would you be happy if you get to fill yourself up every day?

80060406.ContentEN: Then I have another question — is just being able to fill yourself up every day enough to make you happy?

80060407.ContentEN: Uh-huh. What's there to be upset about when you're full?

80060408.ContentEN: Exactly! There's nothing more important than a full belly!

80060409.ContentEN: Nah, there's plenty of stuff to worry about.

80060410.ContentEN: Huh? Really? We might be different then.

80060411.ContentEN: For me, as long as I get to fill my belly every day, I'm happy. But I have two friends who don't feel the same way at all, so I'm a bit confused.

80060412.ContentEN: One is a lady from a rich merchant family. She lives out in the suburbs, and has loads of shiny gems that can be traded for tons of silver coins; she can easily afford to hire lots of amazing chefs to make as much delicious food as she wants.

80060413.ContentEN: But she's still not happy. One priestess told me it's because she has to move far away to a city she doesn't like, to live with someone she doesn't even know.

80060414.ContentEN: And the other one's the most devout follower in our church. He traded all the food he saved up for a month for a new set of scriptures at the shrine.

80060415.ContentEN: I mean, isn't that crazy? Wouldn't he end up starving because of that? He's always been so thin — the wind can easily carry him away like a leaf! But he says that reading the scriptures \"feeds his soul\"!

80060416.ContentEN: I just don't get it... Why are they so different from me?

80060417.ContentEN: Why are some people still upset even when they're full? And why are some happy even when they're starving?

80060418.ContentEN: The scriptures say we should all try to make others happy... but how can I make EVERYONE happy?

80060419.ContentEN: Human hearts are quite complicated. Everyone feels different.

80060420.ContentEN: You can't make everyone happy; that's just nonsense in the scriptures.

80060421.ContentEN: What do you mean? I don't get it...

80060422.ContentEN: People cry when they're sad, laugh when they're happy, yell when they're upset, and eat when they're hungry... What's so complicated about that?

80060424.ContentEN: Mm-hmm! The priestesses make fresh coriander juice for Filbert every day!

80060425.ContentEN: What about you, Truffle? Do you like coriander?

80060426.ContentEN: Mmm, coriander tastes weird — bitter on the tongue but strangely fragrant... I can only eat it if I hold my nose... Ah, I get it now!

80060427.ContentEN: Some people love hazelnut milk, but others hate its smell; Filbert loves coriander, but I don't... Our happiness comes from different things...

80060428.ContentEN: I see... For the two friends of mine, there are things that make them much happier than a full belly makes them, so they don't mind starving.

80060429.ContentEN: Then... what can I do for everyone?

80060430.ContentEN: You're already doing an amazing thing by filling so many people's bellies.

80060431.ContentEN: Really? Have I already made a lot of people happy?

80060432.ContentEN: Yes. Being full might not necessarily mean happiness for everyone, but starving certainly means misery.

80060433.ContentEN: Thank you! You're so sweet! I fell from a tree picking plums today, but your nice words just made the pain go away!

80060434.ContentEN: You can't attend to everyone; just focus on making yourself happy.

80060435.ContentEN: Stuff that makes me happy? Hmm, let's see...

80060436.ContentEN: I feel happy when I see everyone well-fed, when some priestess pats my head and says I did a good job, when Filbert nuzzles me with her snout, and... oh! Sitting here chatting with you makes me happy too!

80060437.ContentEN: So you're saying... I just keep doing what I'm already doing, and that's enough?

80060439.ContentEN: Well... you're smart, and I'm just silly. If even you don't know how to make everyone happy, then I certainly can't figure it out.

80060440.ContentEN: But I've made up my mind — I'll keep doing my best as a commissary!

80060441.ContentEN: Maybe I can't make everyone happy. But if filling their bellies makes them even a tiny bit happier, then I'm not failing the teachings of the gods, am I?

80060443.ContentEN: Hehe... Thank you! There's so much in this world I don't understand. If I ever get confused about anything, can I still come to you?

80060446.ContentEN: Then I want one filbert for one question.

80060447.ContentEN: Ah, I can't do that. Filbert would be scared without me by her side...

80060448.ContentEN: Oh, you meant the nut — sure! I'll bring you loads of filberts to fill you up!

80060449.ContentEN: It's a deal then. You'll be the official consultant for the great cause of Truffle and Filbert — pinky promise!

80070101.ContentEN: Chief Sibylle, I've cleaned up the office you were using before.

80070102.ContentEN: Consider it one of the perks of your promotion to Major. That's your workspace now.

80070103.ContentEN: His Majesty himself approves. Your achievements — capturing spies from the Elysian Church, suppressing The Forsakens, and neutralising large Filthoids — haven't gone unnoticed by His Majesty.

80070104.ContentEN: ...I owe it all to your leadership, Chief.

80070105.ContentEN: Save it. We don't entertain sycophants in the 13th Legion. Use your head, be smart with what Randy taught you.

80070106.ContentEN: D**n it, he's duped me again.

80070107.ContentEN: Since you're here, it's clear you have uncertainties, even as a Major. Let's hear them.

80070108.ContentEN: Right, I've come across some of your personal items while clearing out the office, and I thought you might wanna have a look, Chief.

80070109.ContentEN: These documents have the Spathatoi crest on them. They seem quite old.

80070110.ContentEN: You've always dealt with matters related to the Spathatoi personally, so I didn't pry. How would you like to proceed with these documents, Chief?

80070111.ContentEN: These are... just some old lists of smuggled items from the Spathatoi that Randy put together for the case years ago. They can be discarded now.

80070112.ContentEN: Lists of smuggled items... Aren't these vital evidence?

80070113.ContentEN: The 13th Legion operates directly under His Majesty's command — our actions are guided by objectives, not by evidence.

80070114.ContentEN: Your confusion is understandable. Until now, your enemies have been external, and you've yet to witness the internal machinations. Let's take this chance to bring you up to speed.

80070115.ContentEN: When our missions intersect with other internal organisations, the \"process\" becomes irrelevant. The 13th Legion focuses solely on achieving the \"results\" His Majesty desires.

80070116.ContentEN: Mr Willers, you stand accused of smuggling alchemical equipment to the black market. Would you prefer to come quietly, or shall I assist you?

80070117.ContentEN: I'm a senior alchemist. Even with the Emperor backing the 13th Legion, you cannot simply do as you please!

80070118.ContentEN: Ssh, I'd advise you to think carefully before you speak. If this is just about smuggling, the lucky ones might still be spared. But if you slander and question His Majesty, then it would be considered treason.

80070119.ContentEN: Hmm, you know what, you might as well go on — it saves me the trouble of dragging you back — I could just shoot you on the spot. Come on, keep talking.

80070120.ContentEN: No, no... I am utterly loyal to His Majesty and the Empire... I harbour no ulterior motives... Those devices were faulty, so I thought it better to exchange them for money to buy new ones than to let them go to waste...

80070121.ContentEN: Those devices might be useless to the Academy, but if they end up in the hands of The Forsakens — or even worse, the Elysians — through the black market, have you considered the consequences?

80070122.ContentEN: They could reverse-engineer our tech through those rejects, which would lead to more casualties.

80070123.ContentEN: The money you've made through smuggling is tainted with the blood of our soldiers fighting at the front.

80070124.ContentEN: They won't accuse you, for they're fallen heroes, and you're just a vile vulture circling their corpses.

80070125.ContentEN: The Empire has no need for loyalty-chanting flies.

80070126.ContentEN: No, please... In Hyperborea, my smuggling amount wouldn't warrant a death sentence... You even said yourself I could live — I demand a fair trial!

80070129.ContentEN: It's not that simple. The 13th Legion only takes orders from the Emperor. In the shadows, we are His Majesty's hidden blade, but in the light, we also serve as the messenger of his benevolence.

80070130.ContentEN: Executing a smuggler didn't close the case. We still needed to gather the alchemists together to deliver a message.

80070131.ContentEN: I bet they were too scared to even speak.

80070132.ContentEN: That was true. But what awaited them wasn't execution, but a speech announcing increased funding for the Spathatoi... With Willers's corpse nailed to the podium.

80070133.ContentEN: The Empire advances like a rumbling war chariot, and it cannot do without the academy as its engine. If we let a single act of smuggling impede the academy's research progress, that would be going against His Majesty's wishes.

80070134.ContentEN: So the rest of them just got off the hook just like that?

80070135.ContentEN: A spectacle of deterrence would suffice. All have witnessed the fate of those who betrayed the Empire.

80070136.ContentEN: The vermin and parasites like Willers would live in perpetual fear, dreading the knock at their doors every night. Those fence-sitters would breathe a sigh of relief, grateful for their prudence before making the wrong choice.

80070137.ContentEN: While the loyal — through the purge of the sinful and the commendation of the virtuous — will further cement their faith in His Majesty's justice.

80070138.ContentEN: Carrot and stick — the golden rule for commanding loyalty. We must tolerate some impurities, adjusting our grip as necessary.

80070139.ContentEN: Sounds too complicated for me to understand. I'm starting to think becoming a Major isn't all that great for me. Maybe I should stick to what I understand, like getting rid of this list.

80070140.ContentEN: Don't let the pressure overwhelm you. The 13th Legion spells death for our enemies but serves as a steadfast anchor for our allies. Take Randy — he'll help you navigate the minutiae.

80070141.ContentEN: Randy? He's tricked me more times than I can count.

80070142.ContentEN: His tricking you is also a lesson in disguise. He would never truly harm you. Though the smallest in number, the 13th Legion is composed of the forces' finest warriors. You need to learn how to blend in and build rapport with everyone.

80070143.ContentEN: Alright, I'll give it my best shot.

80070201.ContentEN: Chief, the lists of smuggled items have been dealt with. All that's left is a broken recorder and an old photo for your review.

80070202.ContentEN: The recorder just keeps buzzing non-stop when it's on — I almost thought it was some kind of torture device.

80070203.ContentEN: Uh, that one. Just leave it here. Though I have many like it, one more won't hurt.

80070204.ContentEN: As for what's on it, it's no surprise you don't know — it's the sound of an airship engine model used over a decade ago.

80070205.ContentEN: Modern Empire airships prioritise stability and endurance, unlike during that war when speed and firepower were all that mattered.

80070206.ContentEN: You mean the Divine Elegy offensive against the Elysian Church 23 years ago, right? In that battle, the 13th Legion stormed their tower in prototype airships. That's a story even kids in the street can sing a verse or two about.

80070207.ContentEN: And it was your valour in that battle that made you the youngest chief in Empire history.

80070208.ContentEN: ...Mm, we bypassed the hot zone at the border and struck directly at their normally untouchable tower, reaching the gods' lair for the first time. It's a tale worth retelling indeed.

80070209.ContentEN: But for the 13th Legion — or more precisely, for me — the campaign brought not only glory but also... anger and shame.

80070210.ContentEN: All 15 officers who attacked the tower were killed. Had I not been left to guard the airship outside, I might just be another number on the casualty list.

80070211.ContentEN: Behind the glory was our grievous defeat.

80070212.ContentEN: My last memory of that battle is piloting an out-of-control airship, carrying a severely wounded comrade, weaving through relentless artillery fire and magical barrages across the border.

80070213.ContentEN: This recording takes me back to that airship... to that moment. It reminds me of the smell of blood in my nose and the weary roar of the engines in my ears.

80070214.ContentEN: That explains why you always choose the spot closest to the engine on flights.

80070215.ContentEN: This is war. It changes people.

80070216.ContentEN: I've seen too many soldiers in hospitals, still haunted by the war long after leaving the front. Sometimes, a ceremonial cannon or even a child's toy gun can trigger a breakdown.

80070217.ContentEN: War leaves its mark even on the toughest among us. Take the Chief of the 11th Legion stationed at the border, who sleeps with one eye open.

80070218.ContentEN: In that campaign, their forces held off the bulk of the Elysian army at the border, bearing just as much burden and bloodshed as we did.

80070219.ContentEN: Is that why you replay this recording over and over? Out of guilt over your comrades' deaths?

80070220.ContentEN: No, just to keep myself sharp. When I feel tired, it helps me focus.

80070221.ContentEN: Many dwell on past failures, lamenting their impotence, wallowing in guilt, and torturing themselves — this is the instinct and privilege of the weak.

80070222.ContentEN: But to me, failure is the scar of the past. It's a harsh reminder for me to keep pushing, to climb from all the pain and shame to victory.

80070223.ContentEN: I honour my comrades' sacrifices, which is precisely why I refuse to fall as they did. Pausing for breath or to mourn the fallen before claiming final victory would only squander their sacrifices.

80070224.ContentEN: Many call me cold-hearted, and some even cite my humble origins, claiming that cruelty is in my Charon blood.

80070225.ContentEN: But in the end, they'd forget the failures and even the names of the fallen, just buzzing like bugs before they perish.

80070226.ContentEN: All that remains is me, bearing the scars of defeat, continually climbing upward.

80070227.ContentEN: From my perspective, Chief, you've already reached heights many can't even dream of...

80070228.ContentEN: No, it's not enough. The 13th Legion bears a \"true ideal\" not yet known to the world.

80070229.ContentEN: Some of those born into privilege have long been drunk with fame, power, and glory. They only look downward, always plotting to shove those bearing true ideals off the cliff.

80070230.ContentEN: Nobles who can barely ride or understand the basics of command don't belong in this country.

80070231.ContentEN: I cannot afford to mark time like they do. I must climb higher, to the utmost power.

80070232.ContentEN: When that time comes, we shall lead the Hyperborean Empire — no, all of humanity, into a new tomorrow. Do you understand, Lynn?

80070233.ContentEN: Honestly, I didn't quite follow. You know, I'm just here for the cash — didn't have much choice.

80070234.ContentEN: But if you're saying big changes are coming... Then when they do, I'll definitely fight my hardest to protect my family — didn't have much choice on that either.

80070235.ContentEN: I appreciate your candour, Lynn. However modest, you have something worth fighting for — that's all that matters.

80070301.ContentEN: I've taken care of the recorder. As for the photo… it's of my teacher and that naive fellow pupil of mine, right?

80070302.ContentEN: Why do you call everybody naive, Chief?

80070303.ContentEN: Ha, yes, I've said the same about you. But her naivety was different to yours. She was another pupil of my teacher, with a remarkably pure heart.

80070304.ContentEN: Even within the Spathatoi, she held onto some rather fanciful ideas about alchemy. I remember the first time I met her, she asked me and our teacher: \"Alchemy will make everyone's life better, right?\"

80070305.ContentEN: So, what do you think of alchemy, Lynn?

80070306.ContentEN: Some fancy tech. I've never really used it myself.

80070307.ContentEN: Haha, our ancestors had long ago refined alchemy into the very foundation of the Empire's lifestyle. You've been using it all along. You just didn't realise it.

80070308.ContentEN: Take the bullets and firearms you use — they are one of the products of alchemical technology.

80070309.ContentEN: Really? Huh, well, I'd sure be lost without my guns. Those alchemists must be some talented scholars.

80070310.ContentEN: Most would agree. Alchemists might be a bit eccentric, but their inventions have been steadily transforming this country.

80070311.ContentEN: My teacher always said alchemy was a profound science that would change the future of the Empire. While my fellow pupil believed it was the key to peace and hope.

80070312.ContentEN: But for me, alchemy is something more pragmatic — a tool for climbing the ladder of power.

80070313.ContentEN: It was my alchemy skills, coupled with my loyalty and competence, that first got the Emperor's attention, making me a key player in the Divine Elegy offensive.

80070314.ContentEN: I aced every subject at the academy but never really poured my heart into any research. The deep theoretical knowledge just didn't resonate with me.

80070315.ContentEN: That infuriated my teacher. At the graduation ceremony, she even said that I would never grasp true knowledge. But riddle me this — how many have truly understood knowledge and truth through the ages?

80070317.ContentEN: After all this time, if she were to ask me that question again, my answer would still be the same. Only now, there's no chance of that.

80070318.ContentEN: Right, I heard from Randy that the chief alchemist died years ago and that his relationship with his star pupil was... complicated.

80070319.ContentEN: Yes. Sadly, even when my teacher passed away, her favourite student — my fellow pupil — never showed up. It was just me there... along with a few ominous crows outside the hospital room.

80070320.ContentEN: What's sadder is that she never solved the formula that epitomized truth. Her monumental research ended up as indecipherable scribbles.

80070321.ContentEN: She entrusted her ideals and dreams to her, collapsing in her pursuit of truth. And what did she do?

80070322.ContentEN: She abandoned her prospects and resources for someone else, wasting her talents in a completely different field.

80070323.ContentEN: Didn't you say you don't dwell on the past?

80070324.ContentEN: I did, but that doesn't mean I'm devoid of feelings. Every time I look back, I'm overwhelmed by a mix of anger, confusion, regret, and even jealousy.

80070325.ContentEN: I always knew I wasn't one of her best students, who had their dreams, their ambitions, and limitless prospects.

80070326.ContentEN: But I know I'll be the one who makes it to the end.

80070327.ContentEN: By the way, though I know you wouldn't mention this conversation to anyone, I still have to remind you to keep it between us.

80070328.ContentEN: Understood! I don't really have anyone to talk to anyway. But I'm curious, Chief — if you don't want anyone to know, why share all this with me?

80070329.ContentEN: Because you're the right person for this. I know you don't care about nor understand those complex past events and emotions, and you're not one to offer empty sympathies, sincere or not.

80070330.ContentEN: I've never needed any sympathy or pity from anyone.

80070331.ContentEN: All we can truly rely on is what we wield. I think you understand that too.

80070332.ContentEN: That will be all for today. If you ever feel lost, you're welcome to talk to me.

80070333.ContentEN: While I may not offer comfort, I can guide you through resolving your doubts.

80080101.ContentEN: I'd never seen such a huge Filthoid before... My head was spinning, and I couldn't move my arms or legs. I knew I'd soon be returning to the Misty Sea and the bosom of Mother Embla, but I didn't expect that day to come so soon.

80080102.ContentEN: Then — {性别:he|she} suddenly charged forward. When I opened my eyes, {性别:he|she} was already shielding me from that Filthoid!

80080103.ContentEN: {性别:He|She} wasn't exactly strong, but {性别:he|she} bravely stared down the Filthoid, not backing down an inch...

80080104.ContentEN: And then that giant Filthoid leapt up, slammed down, and you both fell. Then you fought side by side and took it down. Then a man named Outsider popped up. And then—

80080106.ContentEN: You've told your Glevum Pit adventure three times already. I wish I had a coin for every time you told that story...

80080107.ContentEN: Well, I haven't told Fred yet, so... Um, right, that's what happened in the pit.

80080108.ContentEN: You must really like your new friend, Psyche.

80080109.ContentEN: Because you're especially talkative today, not that you're ever really quiet...

80080111.ContentEN: I've indeed never heard this story before. Let Psyche finish.

80080112.ContentEN: Alright! Now, where was I... Oh, Elisa already finished the second half for me.

80080113.ContentEN: Ooh! I just thought of something I haven't told you guys — that person isn't from around here but from a place far beyond Hyperborea — a small island to the south!

80080114.ContentEN: {性别:He|She} told me there's golden sand and white rosemary on that island... And the sea — it's as big as a hundred Lamenting Lakes put together!

80080115.ContentEN: There is also a giant Heaventree there — but unlike the one in Icelake, the breeze through the treetops is warm. Sailors use the Heaventree as a beacon at sea.

80080116.ContentEN: Sea, warm breezes, a Heaventree that's not just cold Phoxichor in factories, but a beacon for sailors...

80080117.ContentEN: Has that person ever stood under the Heaventree? From there, does the Heaventree look sparkling and magnificent — like in the songs by those wandering bards?

80080118.ContentEN: About the sand you mentioned just now...

80080119.ContentEN: I've heard that the sand by the sea is soft and smooth, and stepping on it feels like stepping on flour, not at all rough on the feet. And the sand is also very clean because of the waves, so it doesn't dirty your feet, right?

80080120.ContentEN: {性别:He|She} didn't mention any of this... I'll ask for you all next time!

80080121.ContentEN: What's the point in knowing all this, when we can't even leave Icelake?

80080124.ContentEN: No, it's not like that... Think of it this way:

80080125.ContentEN: Hunt shares tales of the Phoxhunters' adventures, and Mia tells us about all kinds of fish hiding beneath the ice of the Lamenting Lake...

80080126.ContentEN: Carolina gives us a fascinating glimpse into the novel lives of the ladies in the inner city, Elisa offers unique takes on old fairy tales, and Fred shares clever cleaning tricks...

80080127.ContentEN: Even if we don't get to experience all this first-hand, it's still wonderful to hear them from those who did.

80080128.ContentEN: Oh, it's really cool to learn so much when our lives are about to end — so we can take all this knowledge straight to the grave.

80080129.ContentEN: Don't you find that ironically cruel?

80080132.ContentEN: But, um, I still feel there's more to it...

80080133.ContentEN: I know my days are numbered — there's no denying that. But if I just sit here doing nothing, simply waiting for \"that day\" to come...

80080134.ContentEN: Then I couldn't forgive myself, even in the grave.

80080135.ContentEN: So I tend flowers, read, go on adventures, and share stories with everyone... I always feel that I should busy myself with something, anything...

80080136.ContentEN: Perhaps then, when that day comes, I'll have fewer regrets.

80080137.ContentEN: But I didn't mean to upset you, Elisa — I'm sorry. I'll try to keep my mouth shut from now on.

80080138.ContentEN: Huh? But Psyche, you're the only one willing to talk to me ever since Hunt left...

80080140.ContentEN: Don't worry about it. I was just speaking off the cuff... I'd actually miss your chatter if it was gone.

80080141.ContentEN: Okay... I'm glad you're not upset, Elisa.

80080142.ContentEN: Next time you see that person, could you ask about the golden sand for me?

80080144.ContentEN: Sure! I'll keep all this in mind. I'll ask for you next time I see {性别:him|her}.

80080202.ContentEN: I brought you some bread — I bet you've skipped the meals again. I'm not going anywhere until you finish it.

80080203.ContentEN: Why waste food... We're all going to leave the world soon anyway.

80080204.ContentEN: Don't say that... Do you see that plant over there? It'll eventually wither for sure, but we still water and take care of it so that it'll bloom one day.

80080205.ContentEN: But what if it never blooms?

80080206.ContentEN: Then, just watching it sprout and grow bigger is still wonderful, isn't it?

80080207.ContentEN: ...Forget it. I don't have your green thumb.

80080208.ContentEN: By the way, why was that person here earlier? {性别:He|She} is not a Deteriorator, so why the frequent visits? Is {性别:he|she} a spy for the Security Bureau?

80080209.ContentEN: You mean {nickname}? {性别:He|She}'s not a local. {性别:He|She} now works as a Phoxhunter and has nothing to do with the Security Bureau. I think {性别:he|she} was here for a commission.

80080210.ContentEN: I heard {性别:he|she} found something Dr Henrik needs. If it helps, maybe we... um, never mind.

80080211.ContentEN: Didn't you say you went out of town with that person yesterday and got an earful from Dr Henrik?

80080213.ContentEN: Then why still mixed up with {性别:him|her}? Since {性别:he|she}'s not one of us and not with the Security Bureau, {性别:he|she} has nothing to do with us, right?

80080214.ContentEN: I... I just thought there might be something I could do—

80080215.ContentEN: Honestly, Psyche, I don't understand you sometimes.

80080216.ContentEN: {性别:He|She} is just a stranger, and might just leave Icelake tomorrow. {性别:He|She} doesn't even know... what will happen to you... You know it — everyone here is not long for this world.

80080217.ContentEN: Yet you're always out helping others, giving away flowers, making meals, telling stories, helping travellers with accommodations... What's the point?

80080218.ContentEN: Maybe you should stop meddling in other people's business and focus on yourself more.

80080220.ContentEN: But you got one thing wrong — I'm not as selfless as you think.

80080221.ContentEN: To be more precise... I did all those things for myself.

80080222.ContentEN: I'm not afraid of dying — no, that's an overstatement... I am afraid.

80080223.ContentEN: But what terrifies me even more than death is... the idea of \"disappearing.\" Once you're forgotten, it's like the very evidence of your existence just gets wiped away.

80080224.ContentEN: So you go out of your way to help as many people as possible, hoping they'll remember you for as long as they can — is that it?

80080225.ContentEN: Yes... I'm actually... very selfish. You're right, {性别:he|she} will leave one day.

80080226.ContentEN: {性别:He|She} doesn't belong here. I've always known that {性别:he|she} is different — unlike us, trapped in Icelake forever.

80080227.ContentEN: And that's exactly why I want to be friends with {性别:him|her} — so that {性别:he|she} will carry memories of me while going on wonderful adventures around the world.

80080228.ContentEN: I've read about the never-setting sun in Askard to the north, the cloud-capped tower of Elysium down the south, and further east, the star-bound ships of Huaxu...

80080229.ContentEN: But you'll be gone by then.

80080230.ContentEN: But I'll live on in {性别:his|her} memories. That way, it's like my life continues with {性别:him|her}.

80080231.ContentEN: How do you know for sure that {性别:he|she} will remember you?

80080232.ContentEN: I... I'm not sure. I'm not as smart as you. I don't understand many things, and I don't know how to make people remember me more.

80080233.ContentEN: So I just try my luck... like chatting with {性别:him|her}, listening to {性别:his|her} problems, and helping out with things...

80080234.ContentEN: Hopefully, that will leave more of an impression in {性别:his|her} memory — it's really just a shot in the dark though...

80080236.ContentEN: You can be such a fool sometimes, Psyche.

80080237.ContentEN: ...Maybe give {性别:him|her} a gift. But please, no more of your flowers.

80080238.ContentEN: Huh? Then what should I get {性别:him|her}...?

80080239.ContentEN: Something that won't break or go bad easily, that's for sure... It should be durable, special, and easy for {性别:him|her} to carry around at all times, ideally something practical.

80080240.ContentEN: That way... it might always remind {性别:him|her} of you.

80080242.ContentEN: I've got it... I have the perfect \"treasure\" to give {性别:him|her}!

80080243.ContentEN: Thanks, Elisa! You really are much smarter than me.

80080244.ContentEN: Alright, you really need to eat the bread now.

80080245.ContentEN: And I'm going to water that plant... Hmm, where's the watering can... ah, there it is.

80080246.ContentEN: Ugh... why did I even say that...

80080302.ContentEN: I should've come a bit later to give you more time to say goodbye.

80080304.ContentEN: I mean that kid, {nickname}. It was hard letting go of {性别:him|her} when {性别:he|she} grasped your hand, wasn't it?

80080305.ContentEN: Yeah... you always see right through me.

80080306.ContentEN: But I know that even though {性别:he|she} was right in front of me, {性别:he|she} was actually very far away, as far as Icelake is from the ocean.

80080307.ContentEN: So even though {性别:he|she} reached out, I couldn't really grasp {性别:his|her} hand, just as I tried so hard to look at {性别:him|her}, but couldn't see anything.

80080308.ContentEN: ...Psyche, there's something I want you to know.

80080309.ContentEN: The development of anti-deterioration medication is finished.

80080310.ContentEN: Already? I thought the research would take longer...

80080311.ContentEN: I started the research years ago but put it aside after Hayley's death. I only picked it up again for you... for all of you.

80080312.ContentEN: Fortunately, all the previous theoretical data is still fresh in my mind, and with that piece of the Crystallo of Stella, I managed to replicate most of the experimental steps...

80080313.ContentEN: That's great! Your research succeeded! But... this is good news, right? Why do you still look so sad...?

80080315.ContentEN: Crystallo is highly unstable. Under specific medicinal catalysts, it can suppress the process of deterioration, or accelerate it... The conditions triggering each process are only minutely different.

80080316.ContentEN: Sadly, all the relevant pharmacological texts from Huaxu were lost in Hyperborea, and I can't verify each step of my work purely through theory.

80080317.ContentEN: The only option is clinical trials... but I can't bring myself to test an unverified new drug on you.

80080318.ContentEN: Perhaps your kindness is why the research on the anti-deterioration drug hasn't progressed further. Dr Henrik, please allow me to help you with the clinical trials.

80080319.ContentEN: Hypnos' House was founded to alleviate suffering... If I use you for experiments, how am I any different from the Legion!?

80080320.ContentEN: It's not like that... You've been taking care of us, going out of your way to ease our pain, but the pain hasn't disappeared — you've simply taken it upon yourself.

80080321.ContentEN: So, please let me share some of that burden.

80080322.ContentEN: It's more complicated than you might think... Do you realise what could happen if you take that medicine?

80080323.ContentEN: ... I'm not sure if I get this right. Do you mean it might work, but also might not?

80080325.ContentEN: You could recover and gain a second chance at life, or...

80080326.ContentEN: Your condition could deteriorate rapidly... You might even be robbed of your last moments.

80080328.ContentEN: Dr Henrik, I've made up my mind.

80080329.ContentEN: The anti-deterioration drug is a chance to ease the pain of us all. Even if the chances of success are slim to none, I'd still like to help with your research. Besides...

80080330.ContentEN: I feel like I've changed... I'm not who I used to be.

80080332.ContentEN: I've changed ever since I met someone and went on an adventure.

80080333.ContentEN: I've become much greedier... I now yearn for more time, more of everything...

80080334.ContentEN: I wish to hold someone's hand and escape Icelake, to travel to far-off lands...

80080335.ContentEN: I wish to grow older... so that one day I'll become a wrinkled old lady, sitting in the square, feeding birds and sharing stories of my youth with children...

80080336.ContentEN: I once thought that making the most of my last days was enough. But now, I want more...

80080338.ContentEN: So, Dr Henrik, please allow me to help with the research.

80080339.ContentEN: \"If fate decides I can't live like a person, then at least let me die like one...\"

80080340.ContentEN: That was Hayley — my daughter's last wish. You and her are so alike, yet so different...

80080341.ContentEN: \"To live like a person\" — I understand your wish now.

80080342.ContentEN: Fate, grant me mercy just this once... allow me to help her fulfil this wish.

80090100.ContentEN: Heehee, what mischief shall we get into today?

80090103.ContentEN: ...Hey! Didn't you see I suddenly vanished after finishing my drink? How could you just act like nothing happened?!

80090104.ContentEN: Right in broad daylight, Demon Tabethe the Red Hand mysteriously disappeared! Aren't you at least a bit curious or worried?

80090105.ContentEN: There was an extra chair here... It was you, wasn't it?

80090106.ContentEN: What?! You saw through my awesome disguise?!

80090107.ContentEN: Why would I be worried? If anything, I appreciate that you turned into a chair just to entertain me.

80090108.ContentEN: Pff, get over yourself — I was just trying to spook you! BOO! Get it?

80090109.ContentEN: Hmph, I slipped up this time. But next time, I'll turn into something you'd never expect!

80090110.ContentEN: What to turn into next... Maybe a barrel? A chandelier? Or even a big hammer?

80090111.ContentEN: Wow, you're really good at this.

80090112.ContentEN: Of course! I heard this trick of mine is called... caramel... camel... camel-something... Ah — camouflage! That's it!

80090113.ContentEN: So you can turn into anything?

80090115.ContentEN: I'll make an offer you can't refuse. Think it over before you respond.

80090116.ContentEN: What wakes me is business; what about you?

80090117.ContentEN: Haha — what wakes me is the blinding brilliance of Demon Tabethe the Red Hand!

80090118.ContentEN: Hehe, you're so sweet — sweeter than this drink you made!

80090119.ContentEN: Haha — I'm going to tell on you to Camilla!

80090120.ContentEN: I'm not scared of her! No one can catch Demon Tabethe the Red Hand!

80090121.ContentEN: But I can't turn into anything too big or too small. I can do a cat, but not a mouse; a barrel, but not a lamppost.

80090122.ContentEN: That's enough to fool most people, though. I can just turn into a bin or a crate, and those rotten thieves won't know what hit them!

80090123.ContentEN: ...Oh boy, this might be a problem someday.

80090125.ContentEN: Nothing, I just meant you are awesome.

80090126.ContentEN: But maybe avoid turning into bins or crates next time. Wouldn't want someone accidentally smashing you while looking for something useful...

80090128.ContentEN: Er... some overly curious passersby, perhaps?

80090129.ContentEN: Always taking what's useful and tossing the rest — typical bad grown-ups!

80090130.ContentEN: Those passersby wouldn't mean to hurt anyone! Anyway, who are those \"bad grown-ups\" you always talk about?

80090131.ContentEN: Sounds impressive; good thing you're not a baddy.

80090133.ContentEN: I mean, imagine if someone smart but nasty had your skills — the whole town would be in chaos.

80090134.ContentEN: Mm-hmm, I thought so too! I'm nothing like those bad grown-ups. Wait, are you saying I'm not smart?

80090135.ContentEN: Of course not, Tabethe is very smart. Anyway, I've been curious about these \"bad grown-ups\" you always talk about. Who are they?

80090136.ContentEN: Any bullies who pick on the weak! The first time I met bad grown-ups was at the orphanage. Those caretakers... well, calling them \"caretakers\" is a stretch — they were more like jailers.

80090137.ContentEN: Back then, when they caught me sneaking food in the kitchen, they'd beat me. Ugh, those monsters! I only did it because they never fed me enough!

80090138.ContentEN: If I ran into them now, I'd hang them upside down from the ceiling and make them watch as I eat up all the food in the kitchen!

80090139.ContentEN: There, there. Those bad grown-ups can't hurt you anymore.

80090140.ContentEN: Sounds great! Those baddies so deserve that.

80090142.ContentEN: Alright, I've finished my drink. I'll tell you more about those bad grown-ups next time. Now, let's go play outside!

80090143.ContentEN: Hehehe, wanna play hide and seek? I bet you won't find me so easily this time!

80090201.ContentEN: Mmm, this drink's a bit salty but so yummy — like sea breeze-flavored cotton candy!\

80090202.ContentEN: It kind of reminds me of something I drank long ago... back when I was still with my mom and dad, before our ship sank and I ended up at that orphanage...

80090203.ContentEN: But honestly, I'd choose wandering on my own over staying with those bad grown-ups! They were stingy with food, not to mention anything as nice as a drink.

80090204.ContentEN: At least being on the streets, I could scavenge for something to eat — beats starving under the watch of those bad grown-ups!

80090205.ContentEN: When I got a bit older, groups of rich visitors would come by now and then, taking away some unwanted kids with horns like me. People at the orphanage said they were adopted by rich families.

80090206.ContentEN: I didn't want new parents, but I thought being in a rich home meant I'd never go hungry again, so I wanted them to take me. But those bad grown-ups said no rich people would want a naughty troublemaker like me.

80090207.ContentEN: Hmph! As if I'd ever behave just to be chosen! I couldn't stand that awful place for another day, so during their visit, I transformed into one of their suitcases.

80090208.ContentEN: Turns out those rich folks weren't too bright — they just picked me up and walked away, completely clueless. It was rough on my ears, though — they were pulled as the handles, and I almost got dropped along the way!

80090209.ContentEN: Oof, that must've hurt a lot! I'll take extra care of your ears from now on!

80090211.ContentEN: Managing to escape from that place proves Demon Tabethe the Red Hand was awesome even as a kid!

80090212.ContentEN: Hehe, you bet! Too bad I wasn't as skilled back then, or I wouldn't have turned my ears into the handles.

80090213.ContentEN: Actually, I was planning to sneak in with those kids getting adopted, hoping I'd never starve again with a rich family.

80090214.ContentEN: But those rich people reeked of disinfectant — it stung my nose! And the way they looked at those kids... I don't know why, but it gave me the creeps...

80090215.ContentEN: It was like... a chef sizing up fish or ducks!

80090216.ContentEN: I've seen too many bad grown-ups to trust them — I might be better off on my own. So I didn't join those kids, and ended up running away by myself.

80090217.ContentEN: And that was my first step toward becoming Demon Tabethe the Red Hand!

80090218.ContentEN: I think you're not a bad kid, Tabethe. You're just... very special.

80090219.ContentEN: Not bad, just special? No one's ever put it that way before... A special kid, special... Hehe!

80090220.ContentEN: Those rich visitors sounded really sketchy; you made a smart call, Tabethe.

80090222.ContentEN: Back then, I was just focused on getting away. If I were as good at my disguise tricks then, I would've secretly followed them to see what they were really up to!

80090223.ContentEN: Getting out safely on your own was already something. Congratulations on earning your freedom, Tabethe.

80090224.ContentEN: Yeah, I did great! Breathing fresh air again was so awesome. For the first time, I realised the night sky wasn't always so dark, and the dim stars I'd seen through dirty glass were actually bright and beautiful.

80090225.ContentEN: I slept under the stars that night, right on the grass — and woke up to a beautiful sunny day! Since that day, I've been living in that little seaside town, free from those bad grown-ups!

80090227.ContentEN: Did you finally meet someone kind?

80090228.ContentEN: Yep, a really, really kind person! But I'm a bit tired now... even Demon Tabethe the Red Hand needs her rest!

80090229.ContentEN: Next time you whip up a new drink, I'll tell you all about it!

80090301.ContentEN: Yum-yum! This drink's so good — just like all the other drinks you've made! Hehe, you know exactly what I like.

80090302.ContentEN: I fell asleep on the grass under the stars last night. The sky turned from bright blue to dark navy, with stars twinkling like frosting on a blueberry smoothie!

80090303.ContentEN: Except for the night I escaped the orphanage, I almost never had such a sound night's sleep on the grass.

80090304.ContentEN: ...Because when I first got to the town, I did a lot of bad stuff...

80090305.ContentEN: The grown-ups there hated me for that. They called me a \"demon\"...

80090306.ContentEN: Did you maybe go too far with your pranks?

80090307.ContentEN: They could've handled it if they were smarter! Well... you're right, it was my fault.

80090308.ContentEN: Did you polish off all the fish in town?

80090309.ContentEN: I'm not that big of an eater! Well, you got part of it right though...

80090310.ContentEN: I had been living off stealing food from the street stalls. The vendors were so mad they tried to beat me, but I just mimicked their angry faces to piss them off. I didn't think what I did was wrong back then.

80090311.ContentEN: \"I just took a little, it's not like you'd starve! Tightwad!\"

80090313.ContentEN: She was the fishmonger's daughter. She caught me stealing from her dad's stall but didn't tell on me; instead, she gave me fish to fill my belly, asked if I was separated from my family, and even offered me a place to stay for the night. She was the first truly kind person I'd ever met.

80090314.ContentEN: A lot happened after that... She ended up without a home and had to go to the orphanage — like I'd let her go through what I had! I decided I'd be her family!

80090315.ContentEN: We'd giggle under the hot sun, splash each other by the sea, and race down muddy paths together. I'd turn into little animals just to make her laugh.

80090316.ContentEN: She was like a little sister to me — she'd call me Big Sis Tabethe. Even though we didn't always have enough food, she always said she was happy.

80090317.ContentEN: It was because of her that I decided to stop stealing from good grown-ups. From then on, Demon Tabethe the Red Hand would only target the bad ones!

80090318.ContentEN: Is it because you care about what she thinks?

80090319.ContentEN: Yeah. I didn't wanna break her heart.

80090321.ContentEN: Wha... Stop it! You're embarrassing both yourself and me!

80090322.ContentEN: I just wanted to see if you'd also take me in if I called you that...

80090323.ContentEN: ...Are you an eight-year-old? Come on, act your age.

80090324.ContentEN: Just kidding. So, was it because you really care about what she thinks?

80090325.ContentEN: She once asked me, \"Is it right to steal from good people?\"

80090326.ContentEN: At first, I didn't listen — how could those vendors be good people? I was starving, and they just yelled at me, never giving me anything to eat.

80090327.ContentEN: But then I realised — some vendors actually saw me stealing, but they looked the other way.

80090328.ContentEN: And those who chased me never really followed through... Of course, they couldn't catch me if they tried — I was fast...!

80090329.ContentEN: And some vendors even left unsold food out for me. But back then I thought they did it because they were scared of me and were paying protection money.

80090330.ContentEN: I held such a grudge against the bad people I met, that I was completely blind to the kindness of those good people.

80090331.ContentEN: When I realised all this, I felt so bad that the food I stole tasted off.

80090332.ContentEN: I guess I'd been taking out my hate for the bad grown-ups on those vendors.
