80090334.ContentEN: There's no need to beat yourself up, Tabethe. A lot of people fail to own up to their mistakes in a whole lifetime. You already did great.

80090335.ContentEN: Thank you... but you don't need to sugar-coat it for me. I know what I did was wrong.

80090336.ContentEN: You will grow up someday. Wouldn't bullying good people just make you one of the bad grown-ups?

80090337.ContentEN: You're right... Go ahead and let me have it. I won't talk back — I deserve this.

80090338.ContentEN: Ever since then, I'd only take stuff from bad thieves and mean grown-ups. It felt great, and it wouldn't hurt good people.

80090339.ContentEN: And guess what — those bad guys are loaded! I hardly ever go hungry now. Plus, I get to play tricks on them and watch them fume, hehe, it's so much fun!

80090340.ContentEN: It's more about the fun of playing tricks on them than finding stuff to eat, huh?

80090341.ContentEN: Exactly! Er, I mean, not really! This is about \"serving justice\". All I did was teach them not to mess with the good folks.

80090342.ContentEN: Whew, that was a lot of talking today — my throat's literally smoking!

80090343.ContentEN: Hehe, can I get a refill of that blueberry drink?

80090401.ContentEN: This is so good! I could never get enough of this drink! I don't often say nice things, but thank you for always making these for me.

80090402.ContentEN: Hehehe, since you've made so many good drinks for me, it's time I return the favour!

80090403.ContentEN: Before you is a suspicious dark drink, bubbling and giving off a strange scent. Upon closer inspection, you recognise various dried fruits and candies settled at the bottom.

80090404.ContentEN: Ta-da! Behold my special creation — Demon Tabethe the Red Hand — named after my own title! Just so you know, this glass is filled with my thanks, hehe!

80090406.ContentEN: Come on! This is the one and only \"Demon Tabethe the Red Hand\" in the world!

80090407.ContentEN: I've put all the good food that good grown-ups gave me into this drink. I've been saving the ingredients bit by bit — tried so hard not to eat them right away! I can't even imagine how yummy this drink will be with all that good stuff put together!

80090408.ContentEN: How about we share it? Not that I want to try it myself! I'm just setting an example for a coward!

80090412.ContentEN: I've put all the good food that good grown-ups gave me into this drink. I've been saving the ingredients bit by bit — tried so hard not to eat them right away! I can't even imagine how yummy this drink will be with all that good stuff put together!

80090413.ContentEN: Who else but you deserves such a precious drink, right? But could you share a little with me? Hehe, I'm curious what the best drink in the world tastes like!

80090414.ContentEN: Alright, I'm done getting all mushy! Cheers!

80090415.ContentEN: You both chug Tabethe's special concoction. A bizarre sweetness overwhelms your taste buds; soon after, you black out.

80090416.ContentEN: They're still breathing. Both of them are fine — just passed out.

80090417.ContentEN: Waah... I was so scared... I've warned Tabethe not to put just anything in that drink — it's not safe...

80090418.ContentEN: Hehehe, maybe it'll mess up their brains and cause some weird side effects!

80090421.ContentEN: You see several tentacles extending from Tabethe gently swaying in front of you.

80090422.ContentEN: Did you hear that...? {nickname} is talking to us.

80090423.ContentEN: To my knowledge, only Tabethe can hear us speak.

80090424.ContentEN: ...Oh no... This is bad, really bad! I knew it — every time 5 says something bad, it always happens for real! Could you zip it next time? I'm begging you!

80090426.ContentEN: Um... hello? Yes, we're Tabethe's tentacles. Never thought we'd be having a conversation like this! Life's full of surprises, huh? Haha...

80090427.ContentEN: Um... it might be that drink that caused this situation... We're so sorry... didn't mean to make you chug down something weird...

80090430.ContentEN: Based on my observations, you're both just reacting to some... special ingredients. A good sleep should fix it!

80090431.ContentEN: Ahem, just so you know — it was under my leadership that we concocted this beverage for Tabethe's unprecedented get-together with you!

80090432.ContentEN: Hmm? I thought it was because Tabethe knew nothing about making drinks, so she just threw in some pretty mushroom slices, which led to this.

80090433.ContentEN: Hehe, keep acting all smug, #3, and you might find yourself part of the next drink, hehehe.

80090435.ContentEN: Please, you guys are too loud... Aren't you tired? And don't scare {nickname}...

80090436.ContentEN: Got it — this is a dream. A really weird one.

80090437.ContentEN: That's one way to see it. Though no one knows how long the drink's effects will last... Actually, there's quite a lot we'd like to talk to you about! Maybe this is the chance... 1, you go first!

80090438.ContentEN: ...My sentience came into being on the ocean, right after the shipwreck. I kept Tabethe company during those dark times in the sea. She got through it by talking to me.

80090439.ContentEN: I... I woke up when Tabethe had just been taken in by the orphanage. The staff there were mean to her; she was scared, but wouldn't show weakness in front of anyone. At night, she'd cling on to me, shivering...

80090440.ContentEN: I myself joined this esteemed group in the orphanage's kitchen. In a dire moment, it was under my command that we managed to evade the patrolling guards and secure half a loaf of bread!

80090441.ContentEN: And as for my manner of speaking, it's a perfect impersonation of the head of the orphanage.

80090442.ContentEN: Yawn... I awoke the night we escaped the orphanage. The sense of relief was so heavy... that once we were safe, I fell asleep right away on the grass with her...

80090443.ContentEN: Hehe, keep acting all smug, 3, and you might find yourself part of the next drink, hehehe.

80090444.ContentEN: Get ahold of yourself! Sorry, this kid is a bit of a wild card. Ahem, I'm the youngest, and only recently became sentient.

80090445.ContentEN: Actually, I woke up once a long time ago. But then that little fish vendor girl got separated from Tabethe, which made her very sad. She didn't talk about it, but it hit her really hard and even affected me — I fell back into slumber, immersed in those memories.

80090446.ContentEN: Until she met another person who also truly cherishes her — yes, it was because of you that I woke up again.

80090447.ContentEN: Thank you for taking care of Tabethe. Your kindness woke me from my dream. And it was on my suggestion that she decided to make this drink as a thank you.

80090448.ContentEN: But I didn't expect her to go this overboard! She knows nothing about mixing drinks and just tossed in whatever looked good — and you two, 3 and 5! You two egged her on!

80090452.ContentEN: Tabethe's waking up. How do you feel?

80090453.ContentEN: Ah, already?! I haven't finished my speech...

80090454.ContentEN: What a weird dream. Better wake up ASAP...

80090455.ContentEN: They're adorable. I hope this could happen more often.

80090456.ContentEN: That odd taste hits you again. Even though you've experienced it before, it still overwhelmingly floods your senses.

80090457.ContentEN: Before blacking out again, you seem to hear a cacophony of voices: \"Gods bless the kind-hearted,\" \"What doesn't kill you makes you stronger,\" \"I'll take the lead with the head,\" along with many voices murmuring, \"Thank you.\"

80090458.ContentEN: Aaaare you alright?! Oh no... it wasn't the drink, was it...?

80090459.ContentEN: ...I drank the same thing! It was so good that it knocked me out for a moment, but I'm perfectly fine now! Hey, wake up! Don't even think about trying to scam me by pretending it's food poisoning...!

80090460.ContentEN: Will you keep it down...? I'm fine... just heard some tentacles talking, that's all...

80090463.ContentEN: You're still feeling awful, but you seem to see Tabethe's tentacles cheerfully quivering, as if they are nodding at you.

80100100.ContentEN: Are we going on a private date?

80100101.ContentEN: Finally received your invitation. Much time has passed since I arrived at this place, and I'd been wondering how long you were going to keep this poor wandering perfumer waiting.

80100102.ContentEN: You should know even the most passionate heart cannot burn forever. Indifference will extinguish those flames, leaving it hard and cold.

80100103.ContentEN: You left me out in the cold. Fate is so cruel for giving me a romance that begins with the coldest of shoulders.

80100104.ContentEN: *sigh* Never thought your words could be even colder than your actions. Are you truly blind to the romance that is about to blossom?

80100105.ContentEN: Between you and me, of course. Who else's eyes are looking deep into each other at this very moment?

80100106.ContentEN: Don't be so surprised, hehe. You might treat me as a temporary guest staying over at your place. But for me, every encounter is a story waiting to unfold, especially when it's you.

80100107.ContentEN: Don't look away. Your wine-red eyes reflect possibilities of our future. Within this intoxicating haze, we shall share a duet of love or a walk in my aroma garden.

80100108.ContentEN: You will eventually sway to my passions, and every inch of you shall bear my scent. When that moment comes, fate shall reveal if you are indeed the destined one.

80100109.ContentEN: You don't even need to make your own move for all this to happen. Just submit and follow my lead, and I shall let you experience a love of utmost purity and sweetness.

80100110.ContentEN: Hehe, I understand your concerns. But you should know that no law or tradition dictates the number of days one must wait for love to sprout.

80100111.ContentEN: Ahem... What a cute and lovely guess. Perhaps I shall rephrase my words: I'm about to ascend the stage called Love, and I'm seeking a suitable partner.

80100112.ContentEN: Of course, if you wish to refuse, then just treat today's encounter as a scented dream that I have carefully concocted for you.

80100113.ContentEN: But I want you to know that I, Rebecca the wandering perfumer, am always seeking my destined life partner.

80100114.ContentEN: When I finally find the one, I shall share countless moments and sweet words with them, and we will never be apart.

80100115.ContentEN: I know it is difficult, for I am enshrouded in a warm layer of sweet venom. Though the coating protects me, it renders me incapable of receiving intimate hugs or loving kisses.

80100116.ContentEN: But I never give up. I strongly believe that if this land gave birth to a freak like me, it must have given birth to another who can withstand my venom and accept me for who I am.

80100117.ContentEN: And you, my darling with wine-red eyes, you showed me the potential in this.

80100118.ContentEN: So, let's consider this very moment as our very first date, a sweet little gift for your sincerity.

80100119.ContentEN: You can refuse, but then my venom will seal your tongue to safeguard my secret forever. Which one do you prefer?

80100201.ContentEN: Another occasion of us alone. It's rare that someone hasn't fled screaming in terror after discovering that side of me.

80100202.ContentEN: You must have sensed it already.

80100203.ContentEN: Stretch out your arms and take a look. Aww, such clean and lovely arms. Though callused and scarred, they remain pure and immaculate. And when tired, they only weep with salty sweat—

80100204.ContentEN: They differ from mine, which solely exude and bleed deadly venom.

80100205.ContentEN: The uncontrollable venom is like a wild old friend of mine. I rely on it to ward off Filthoids pouncing on me in forest trails or to send pursuing soldiers to an eternal sleep.

80100206.ContentEN: But the venom is the vile and vicious repellant of anything and anyone that I wish to get closer to. Merely washing my face in a pond paralyses and suffocates any fish that tries to give me a friendly peck.

80100207.ContentEN: I once detested it. If not for my venom, I would be like many other girls of my age. I would be picking out my favorite clothes at the market, or stealing a glance at my crush.

80100208.ContentEN: They're not dreams. Just occasional notions that never linger. I laugh at myself for having had those thoughts.

80100209.ContentEN: Not exactly. It's more like I've subdued the venom. I found a more fitting way to coexist with it.

80100210.ContentEN: Now, I no longer peep at someone I like, nor waste time on hours of useless talk to test their sincerity. A moment of sweet embrace is all I need to determine if this one is suited for a long-term commitment with me.

80100211.ContentEN: The venom serves as my most valuable touchstone. If I meet someone capable of withstanding my embrace, I would immediately know that I've met the destined one.

80100212.ContentEN: It's just that this person has yet to appear — perhaps they never will. But don't you find this far more romantic than the inane love talks between worldly people?

80100213.ContentEN: At least for me, it's a gift. Those who fear me, intimidate me, care for me, or obey me are all subject to this fair and equal trial.

80100214.ContentEN: Although I remain the same as I was and my wanderings continue, I no longer envy others, because my unique venom will help me find the special love that will be wholly mine.

80100215.ContentEN: Now, I intend to open my arms and ask you one question: Will you embrace me?

80100216.ContentEN: Hehe, don't be scared. You're the first to hear me divulge this much about my past. You get only one chance, but perhaps you're indeed the one I've been searching for.

80100217.ContentEN: And then you'll pierce my throat with that sword in your hand, right? Hehe, don't be so on guard. I can feel it. We're kindred souls, you and me, fated to lead lives not shared by any other.

80100218.ContentEN: *sigh* I didn't expect that this date, iniciated by you, would actually end with your rejection of my advance. What a pity.

80100219.ContentEN: But we still have time, and you'd better be careful. A day might come when I decide to appear right behind you and hold you tight.

80100220.ContentEN: Oh, how cute, just like a little kitten baring its tiny fangs. Perhaps I should keep my distance, then. Goodbye, I look forward to our next rendezvous.

80100221.ContentEN: Only a few seconds have passed, yet we meet again.

80100222.ContentEN: Hehe, it seems you're not that wary of me, which is nice. Don't worry, I don't intend to embrace you right now, but I have a word of advice:

80100223.ContentEN: Turn around and look at me once you hear my voice the next time we meet, and do not shift your gaze elsewhere, or something dangerous might happen.

80100224.ContentEN: Now, this is goodbye for sure. Arrivederci.

80100301.ContentEN: The 'Unspoken Bond of Love' has called me here today. Every drop of my venom yearns to see you.

80100302.ContentEN: Interested in seeing how in tune we are with each other? Guess what I'm about to say next.

80100303.ContentEN: And being so straightforward happens to be one of your charms.

80100304.ContentEN: Then let's just skip the senseless prattle and focus directly on matters of the past.

80100305.ContentEN: That's right. See, we are so in sync with each other. Seems I've made the right choice in deciding to do this.

80100306.ContentEN: I'm about to share a certain secret with you, which also means danger is approaching.

80100307.ContentEN: I once met someone like me. She was born with fiery-red skin. Her temperament is the same, a blazing firebrand with little tolerance for the impure.

80100308.ContentEN: Unlike me, a monster despised and abandoned since childhood, she carries the legacy and hopes of her family, and ultimately becomes the righteous warden. No criminal she sets her sights on can ever escape her.

80100309.ContentEN: However, like my venom, her flames tend to drive away or scare off anyone who tries to approach, be it with good or ill intent.

80100310.ContentEN: Yes. You know, a monster like me, who's born with lethal venom, can't help but leave a few bodies behind, whether by accident or willful intent. It shouldn't surprise you that I'm wanted.

80100311.ContentEN: During her long and persistent chase, I realised something — she's just like me, we're both lonely monsters. So, I took advantage of this.

80100312.ContentEN: I offered a seemingly sincere confession to confuse her, making her realise that she wasn't the only freak in this vast land and think that her pity and clemency would get me back on track.

80100313.ContentEN: But then, I just ran away right after she destroyed the evidence of my crimes.

80100314.ContentEN: You can hardly imagine how furious she became, how her fires burnt as she gnashed her teeth and swore to throw me in prison. However, you should know that by granting me refuge, you will be seen as an accomplice.

80100315.ContentEN: Is that so? Now I understand why I always feel an intoxicating aura of danger whenever I see you.

80100316.ContentEN: Since you showed no sign of displeasure or rejection after I told you about a potential threat, does that mean we're growing closer?

80100317.ContentEN: I confess that I did struggle a bit when I was deciding if I should tell you about my dangerous past. I was worried that I would end up wandering this world on my own again.

80100318.ContentEN: But I cannot bear to see you menaced by other threats. My venom alone is dangerous enough as it is.

80100319.ContentEN: Yet your answers have strengthened my belief that I shall find my destined one by staying here.

80100320.ContentEN: Yes, someone that I've yet to find as I travelled from Luca to Hyperborea. I thought that person only appeared in my dreams as a shiny yet indistinct figure.

80100321.ContentEN: {性别:His|Her} body is strong enough to withstand every drop of my venom... whose heart is pure enough to take in all my love... and whose hands are gentle enough to wipe away all my sorrows...

80100322.ContentEN: Do you think {性别:he|she} has heard all that?

80100324.ContentEN: You are so cute, weird, and interesting that I just can't get enough of...

80100325.ContentEN: I really want to embrace you with my venom now... But I'm 100% serious when it comes to love.

80100326.ContentEN: So, let's give us some time to ponder over it.

80100327.ContentEN: How cunning. How do you come up with these ambiguous lines of rejection that subtly lead people on?

80100328.ContentEN: Appropriate... how am I supposed to interpret that? For me, shadowing you around is the appropriate distance... But what about you? I'm not sure what's the appropriate distance for you.

80100329.ContentEN: Is it like secret lovers who frolic only when alone and pretend to be strangers in the presence of others? Or should we just go our separate ways and never, ever see each other again?

80100330.ContentEN: But these two extremes might just offer the easiest solutions. Instead of just saying \"I do\" or \"I hope you find someone who actually deserves you\", you chose the option that paves the way for future dialogues and tests.

80100331.ContentEN: I can't get too close and risk putting you in danger, nor can I stay away from you and let us become strangers.

80100332.ContentEN: This is like crafting a perfume formula without precise measurements. I can only keep fiddling with the weights and measures as I work towards the perfect result.

80100333.ContentEN: Of course I am. I've never had a problem like this before, and I believe that by solving it, I will get the answer I've been looking for and find my destined one.

80100334.ContentEN: Yes, someone that I've yet to find as I travelled from Luca to Hyperborea. I thought that person only appeared in my dreams as a shiny yet indistinct figure.

80100335.ContentEN: {性别:His|Her} body is strong enough to withstand every drop of my venom... whose heart is pure enough to take in all my love... and whose hands are gentle enough to wipe away all my sorrows...

80100336.ContentEN: As for whether the destined one is you, who is so cute, weird, and interesting that I just can't get enough of...

80100337.ContentEN: Please give me some time to ponder over it.

80100402.ContentEN: Yes, a most vexing matter, and the person who is in front of me is the very source of that trouble.

80100403.ContentEN: No, it's not about the timing, it's the person. My troubles began the moment I received your invitation.

80100404.ContentEN: Despite your pure, flawless appearance, you can suffocate people with your own \"venom.\"

80100405.ContentEN: You did not announce your danger like I did at our first encounter, but instead cautiously wove a web of words.

80100406.ContentEN: Perhaps you didn't mean to, but it makes people more accustomed to staying here subconsciously, being imperceptibly influenced and changed by you.

80100407.ContentEN: After leaving Luca, I hardly stayed at any place for long or met anyone worthy of my attention.

80100408.ContentEN: I thought it would be the same this time — that I would bid farewell to the one with my embrace when I was tired of the journey.

80100409.ContentEN: But I hesitated this time. The venom within my body keeps whispering that I can never leave this place.

80100410.ContentEN: I can't take this, and this is the source of my troubles. So, I've decided to conclude this journey today.

80100411.ContentEN: Simply put — I want to wrap you in my venom and bid you farewell.

80100412.ContentEN: So, any last words for the last seconds?

80100413.ContentEN: Running away? Not at all. I know exactly what I want, and I yearn to see the terror on your face.

80100414.ContentEN: But you don't seem scared. What a pity.

80100415.ContentEN: Really? That didn't scare you at all? I was so hoping to see terror on your face. What a pity.

80100416.ContentEN: Then I'll have to settle for the next best thing, and tell you about my real thoughts.

80100417.ContentEN: Days I shared with you are unlike the others I had before. I would say romantic things and we would test each other's sincerity during these afternoon dates...

80100418.ContentEN: And when the date ended, I would take my umbrella and find a deserted alley. There, I would mull over the conversations we had while dancing and swaying all on my own.

80100419.ContentEN: Hehe... Isn't that romantic as well?

80100420.ContentEN: I had always wanted to find the destined one who was capable of surviving my embrace. But today, I finally realised that all I want is love that belongs to me.

80100421.ContentEN: My embrace used to be my touchstone. But when my heart skipped a beat, I started to know that true love, the kind I can call my own, does not need to be tested.

80100422.ContentEN: The kisses and hugs are not necessary. I prefer the lingering aftertaste that does not fade.

80100423.ContentEN: It doesn't seem bad to have daily routines like morning greetings, smelling my latest perfume, and continuing my work on other perfume recipes...

80100424.ContentEN: I will try to make a perfume that can neutralise my venom, or search for a spell that can cleanse the toxins. Like some little mermaid in those fairytales, I'll do whatever I can to change for my love.

80100425.ContentEN: Perhaps a day will come when I can finally hold you in my arms.

80100426.ContentEN: Not for any test, but only to express my love for you.

80110101.ContentEN: Assessing your drink mixing skills? You got the wrong person. I know nothing about this.

80110102.ContentEN: All drinks are the same to me — If it tastes right, I'll drink it. When it comes to these bottles and flasks sounds, they are just noise to me.

80110103.ContentEN: The Legion's built for war, not picnics.

80110105.ContentEN: ...What do you want? What are you planning? Who are you? Who sent you? What intel are you after? Spill it.

80110106.ContentEN: You're too well-informed for a mere Phoxhunter.

80110107.ContentEN: …I should've known. No one offers gifts without wanting something in return.

80110108.ContentEN: Time to take you to the Legion for questioning. Cooperate, and don't make me tie you up — it won't look good for either of us.

80110109.ContentEN: (The following quickly flashes through your mind: Lynn takes out her gun immediately, and the dark muzzle is pointed straight at your forehead.)

80110110.ContentEN: (This outcome is predictable. You shook your head and dismissed the risky idea to keep fishing out intel from her.)

80110111.ContentEN: You've got it wrong. I just saw you and thought I'd invite you for a drink.

80110113.ContentEN: Guess I was too on edge. Ahem, sorry about that.

80110114.ContentEN: It's just there have been some audacious Phoxhunters who, seeing that I was one of them, tried to get close to me and fish for the secrets of the legion.

80110115.ContentEN: Yeah, that was years ago. Wait, should I reveal this to others?

80110116.ContentEN: ...Never mind. The Legion doesn't say we have to hide who we were.

80110117.ContentEN: Ugh, you have no idea what it's like in the Legion.

80110118.ContentEN: Legion camps are surrounded by electric fences powered by Phoxichor. They crackle with sparks, detering deserters, as well as discouraging thieves and spies.

80110119.ContentEN: But at least you can see those fences. It's the invisible ones you have to worry about — if you slip up, say the wrong thing, one zap, and you're gone.

80110120.ContentEN: My supreme officer has something personal against traitors. I don't want to end up dead over some accidental leak.

80110121.ContentEN: You think? I never wanted to be in the Legion.

80110122.ContentEN: Status and prestige? Sure, if you think risking your neck daily is worth it.

80110123.ContentEN: ...I was happier as a Phoxhunter. It wasn't an easy gig, but at least I was free.

80110124.ContentEN: Not all commissions were about cheating death. Sometimes you'd get to walk dogs or hunt deer. And after a big score, you could enjoy a pint at The Asphodel.

80110125.ContentEN: You can do it on your own. No need to explain to anyone about your plans or worry about dead weight.

80110126.ContentEN: Most importantly, you didn't have to deal with commanders who can't stop their yapping.

80110127.ContentEN: I thought bad-mouthing your superiors can be considered as something wrong. Wouldn't that get you zapped?

80110129.ContentEN: A...Absolutely! I'm no noble — those thick-skinned aristocrats can definitely survive a zap. But if my superiors heard this, they'd fry me, or worse.

80110130.ContentEN: If you go around telling people what I just said, I'll put a bullet in your head. Understood?

80110131.ContentEN: Anyway, I find you quite... different.

80110132.ContentEN: I thought as a Hyperborean officer, you would have some... belief in the Empire. Like, talk about honour, loyalty, stuff like that...

80110133.ContentEN: Pfft, that kind of crap might work on the noobs.

80110134.ContentEN: Many would sacrifice everything for those invisible and untouchable things like sense of faith, but I am not one of them. I know exactly why I became a Phoxhunter and why I joined the Legion.

80110135.ContentEN: ...I just needed a job that brings food to the table. I got that figured out from the start. The Legion needs my skills and I need their paycheck. Simple exchange.

80110136.ContentEN: All that talk of \"glory\" and \"faith\" — it's not why I'm here.

80110138.ContentEN: D**n it! I knew I shouldn't have had this drink. Can't keep my mouth shut when I'm a bit tipsy.

80110139.ContentEN: I'm done here! And don't you dare let today's conversation out!

80110202.ContentEN: Hey, how do you usually pick up your gigs? Still at The Asphodel?

80110203.ContentEN: Hmm, just like old times. The Asphodel is a neat place... At least Camilla doesn't suddenly throw in jobs where you have to kill people and rob their stuff.

80110204.ContentEN: Hah, never underestimate Icelake. It's teeming with tougher nuts than the capital, especially with the Security Bureau ignoring the outskirts. But don't worry — Camilla's gigs are clean, unless you're dabbling in the sketchy ones.

80110205.ContentEN: Speaking of which, how is Camilla these days? Still got that edge?

80110206.ContentEN: That's good to hear! Ugh, time flies, even turned Camilla sweet, but it still couldn't soften up my iron-fisted supreme officer.

80110207.ContentEN: Okay, so Camilla hasn't changed at all... Ugh, she's just like my supreme officer — pretty but goes around acting like a pissed volcano.

80110208.ContentEN: Her name is... Sorry, can't tell you. I'd rather not end up on the electric fence getting zapped to ashes.

80110209.ContentEN: She's always got this long face like the entire Legion owes her money or something.

80110210.ContentEN: Ugh, and her quirks! Like, who doesn't use a gun these days? But she insists on using her electrified whip and claims it works better.

80110211.ContentEN: (Your heart skipped a beat. Her descriptions reminded you of someone you're looking for — Sibylle.)

80110212.ContentEN: And people usually prefer peace and quiet when they have something to think about, right? Not her — she always blasts a loud recording and says it pumps her up and helps her think better.

80110213.ContentEN: She even keeps crows in her office. Hasn't she ever worried about bird droppings on her reports to His M—um, her higher-ups?

80110214.ContentEN: And then there's this: normal people go to the riverside to unwind and enjoy the breeze and scenery, right? My boss? She goes there only to watch anglers come back empty-handed, says it's funny and stress-relieving.

80110216.ContentEN: She's nuts. Trust me, she's far less interesting in person. Oh, and that's just the top boss. My direct superior? Even nuttier.

80110217.ContentEN: Now this dude rambles in circles and thinks he's all classy. Honestly? He sounds like a wishy-washy wet goose.

80110218.ContentEN: That guy's always babbling about efficiency and energy saving. Ugh, everyone knows that he's just making excuses for his laziness.

80110219.ContentEN: But I'll give him this — he's sharp. Slacks off, sure, but somehow still manages to get the job done. No one can really fault him for that.

80110220.ContentEN: Not long ago, he cracked the location of a treasure with just a few clues. That's something my supreme officer had been chasing for years. But, well, there was... a little hiccup.

80110221.ContentEN: (If I guessed correctly, the \"treasure\" that Lynn mentioned could very well be Berry.)

80110222.ContentEN: Don't ask me... The two of them handled that mission together. It's all top secret — how would I know?

80110224.ContentEN: Crap. I really said a load of stuff I shouldn't be saying at all... It must be this lousy booze! You didn't spike it with a truth serum or something, did you?

80110225.ContentEN: Sheesh. I'm outta here. Ugh — thank goodness I don't drink in Dismania, or I'd end up zapped by my superior's whip... Argh, better stop talking now...

80110226.ContentEN: And I trust you won't go blabbing about what I said.

80110227.ContentEN: I know exactly why you chose that extra-strong drink. You had your own reasons for coaxing intel from me — but I chose to act the fool and play along.

80110228.ContentEN: Let's stop here. Don't push any further. I can't cross the Legion — everyone's gotta live, right?

80110229.ContentEN: And I don't want to... lose someone that I can actually talk to.

80110301.ContentEN: Hey, do me a favor. I'll pay you.

80110302.ContentEN: I'm off to the capital tomorrow and I've got a package here that needs to be delivered to No. 48, Oak Street in the west suburbs. It's for a lady named Riola Baker.

80110304.ContentEN: Fair point. Alright, I'll spill it. There's a gun and a mask in there.

80110305.ContentEN: Don't be nervous. It's just a toy gun. If you don't believe me, feel free to test it on me.

80110307.ContentEN: Ow! Fake bullets hurt too! And why aim at the head!? Get over here, I'm gonna give you a thrashing! Damn, that friggin' hurt.

80110308.ContentEN: *sigh* You know what, this reminds me of the fights I used to have with Riola when we were little. We'd use slingshots to hit each other in the head. Lucky I'm still alive, huh? Anyway, this gun... is my present for her.

80110309.ContentEN: Yeah, sort of... Had to come to Icelake for a mission, figured I might as well bring something.

80110310.ContentEN: And you've had way too many questions. Look, are you in or out? There's no shortage of Phoxhunters for the job, you know.

80110311.ContentEN: Deliver it myself? Forget it. If it weren't for orders from the top, I wouldn't bother coming back to Icelake.

80110313.ContentEN: I did come back here before and had plans to catch up with the old gang. We used to climb trees and swipe veg together as kids. I wanted to chat with them, laugh about those silly pranks over a pint or two, and forget about life in the Legion for a while.

80110314.ContentEN: But word got out I was coming. They all lined up, saluted from a distance, yelling \"Officer Lynn\" so loud it scared the birds off the roofs.

80110315.ContentEN: I thought I'd let them do their thing. Get it out of their system. Then we'd all loosen up a bit reminiscing about tearing down the streets as kids.

80110316.ContentEN: But the old gang never gave me the chance. Everyone was too busy saluting, bowing like they owed me something. Couldn't even look me in the eye.

80110317.ContentEN: Of course it's normal. I've seen my fair share of things to know why they're so afraid of me. If it weren't for my joining the Legion, I'd be the one who trembles at the sight of soldiers.

80110318.ContentEN: Icelake... No, it's the same for the whole of Hyperborea — the strong and rich walk all over the weak and poor... This has always been the way since I was a little girl. Nothing's changed.

80110319.ContentEN: Anyway, do you know what the gun and mask are for?

80110320.ContentEN: When we were kids, Riola and I were obsessed with this comic about Leblanc, a rogue who'd steal from wicked rich folks and give to the poor. They called him the \"Masked Hero.\"

80110321.ContentEN: We made masks from scrap cardboard and used slingshots as our guns. We'd climb the town walls of Icelake, shouting Leblanc's lines from the comics. Silly, I know, but we didn't feel a bit embarrassed.

80110322.ContentEN: Those were the days when we felt we could... well... eventually become heroes ourselves.

80110323.ContentEN: Years later, I spotted a beautifully crafted Leblanc mask and toy gun in a Dismania store. I couldn't resist, so I bought them.

80110324.ContentEN: Back then, I thought, \"I might have turned into a Charon-killing baddie, but at least Riola could still be a hero...\"

80110325.ContentEN: The last time I saw her in Icelake, she trembled like a scared goose and called me \"Officer Lynn.\" That's when I knew, we'd both changed. There's no going back to the good old days.

80110326.ContentEN: ...Ugh, my head's hurting. Hit me with another!

80110327.ContentEN: These are the reasons why I avoid being back at Icelake. I don't even want to meet my own siblings. Just seeing them from afar, knowing they're alive and well, that's enough for me.

80110328.ContentEN: No, quite the opposite. They write all the time, saying how much they miss me and wish I'd visit.

80110329.ContentEN: But what could I tell them? About the latest horrors I've seen at the Academy? Or how many Charon prisoners I took?

80110330.ContentEN: ...Forget it. Everyone's got their own burdens. It's all so damn normal these days.

80110331.ContentEN: This should be a world where you can return home whenever you want... Perhaps our generation should try to make it one.

80110332.ContentEN: Only outsiders like you would think this is weird and believe this can change.

80110333.ContentEN: Perhaps you also believe a day will come when Charons and humans can live together in peace, and that people won't be judged for their strange-looking horns and spines, and the weird magic in their veins.

80110335.ContentEN: Even if you can't stop the snow in Icelake, you can at least shovel it away and make snowmen out of it, right?

80110336.ContentEN: You can at least go to your friend and tell her you remember your childhood dreams, even if they're broken now. You should be able to knock on the door of your family home and tell your folks that you'll always miss them no matter who you've become. That part of you never changes.

80110337.ContentEN: ...Hah. To be honest, I like your way of thinking, even if it's a bit naive for my taste. It's way better than the usual crap like \"Oh, that's the way it is, nobody can change the world.\"

80110338.ContentEN: And your words actually made this Icelake breeze a bit warmer, I must say. Hmm... Pour me another.

80110339.ContentEN: Let's see how far you can take this dream of changing the world. I'm curious if a naive fool can actually make a difference, even a little.

80110340.ContentEN: And if you ever need help, and I'm free, just ask — as long as it's nothing against the Legion. But not today — I've just changed my mind about something and will be busy later.

80110341.ContentEN: I'm cancelling the commission. Now, gimme back my mask and gun.

80120100.Content: 屋里的家具都是我三十年前从皇都迪斯玛尼亚带过来的，它们的材质之珍稀、工艺之精美，不是你们能想象得到的。

80120101.Content: 既然是这么珍贵的物品，真的可以交给我们来处理吗？我们是小本生意，万一您中途折回来了……

80120102.Content: 你已经问了好几遍了，我也回答了更多遍：这些家具，就是交给你们处理的。我这么多年积攒下来的乐谱才是真正的宝贝，早就被我放在了它该放的位置。

80120103.Content: 那……为了以防万一，还是得跟您确认一下，我看书房里散落着不少纸张，整理出来有这么厚的一沓！我看了看，也是些乐谱……

80120105.Content: 那些都是废稿，是垃圾，是没有用的东西。你随便找一户穿不暖的，让他们烧了取暖。

80120106.Content: 真是好笑，如果我真觉得那些东西重要，早就收好了，还用你特意提醒？

80120108.Content: 远方又一次响起了列车的汽笛，仿佛在催促着这位脾气古怪的音乐家踏上前往塔斯玛尼亚的旅途。

80120109.Content: 该走了。永不再见了，卡戎人。

80120111.Content: 是你呀，麻烦稍等一下，给我一分钟！

80120112.Content: （玛尔洁她深深吸了一口气，压低声音喃喃自语着，但是让声音听得更清楚了。）

80120113.Content: 人生就是垃圾场，垃圾处处也正常，垃圾没腿我有腿，适时远离保健康……

80120114.Content: 别把叫嚣放心上，就当小狗吠汪汪，和狗置气伤身体，不如收工晒太阳……

80120116.Content: 好了……我没事了！狗眼看人低而已，在冰湖城生活了这么久，我早就习惯了。

80120117.Content: 小狗？哪里有小狗，我要摸摸……等等，原来你是指可萨克先生啊。

80120118.Content: 他呀，听说是帝都迪斯玛尼亚的大音乐家，有名的很，说是他写的什么《尤里乌斯皇颂歌》，皇帝本人听了都说好，每年的建国纪念周，那些军人都得唱一整天。

80120119.Content: 但不知为什么，他在最风光的时候被赶出了帝都，只能在这里的银色和平剧院敲敲破锣，一呆就是三十年。

80120120.Content: 不过说是他几个月前新写了一组叫做《海伯利亚之辉》的交响曲，得到了帝都里大人物的赏识，让他回去。

80120121.Content: 至于他剩下这一宅子的东西，就找上了卡米拉姐处理，卡米拉姐又把这笔大单子介绍给了我，原来以为是意外之喜，没想到雇主是这样的家伙，真倒霉……

80120122.Content: 是呀，我平时都是在各个垃圾桶之间奔波，一发现有用的东西就收集起来，转卖给有需要的人。

80120123.Content: 但舍得留下一大堆东西，头也不回离开冰湖城的富人可不多见，他家剩的那些东西啊，比得上一百个……唔，有点夸张了……比得上五十个垃圾桶！

80120124.Content: 那些老古董家具木质好得很，拆开来就能做成床板和饭桌。裁缝店的老板我也问了，那些窗帘、桌布和地毯，好好洗上几遍就能当做衣服的料子。

80120125.Content: 贫民窟又有几户人家能睡好穿好，我也能小赚一笔，外加那个音乐家虽然说话难听，但是给的佣金可不少，嘿嘿……

80120126.Content: 你说奇不奇怪，刚刚心里还生气地着了火一样，现在嗖地一下就熄灭了！

80120127.Content: 总之，可萨克先生回到了迪斯玛尼亚，贫民窟的大家收获了生活物资，虽然我被他数落了一两句，但是没关系！只要开始干活，很快就会忘掉！

80120128.Content: 好呀好呀，我一个人要把他的那些柜子弄出来还得费点功夫。搬的时候看到有什么喜欢的随便挑。

80120129.Content: 好呀，就当是你听我这么牢骚一通的报酬好了，来来来，和我一起收拾，看见喜欢的东西随便挑。

80120130.Content: 和玛尔洁一起度过了很有意义的一天……就是回到家后晚上睡觉手臂很痛……

80120201.Content: 玛尔洁接手了大音乐家可萨克的留下的物件，还把休憩之所的一个房间临时征用了。屋子里经常传出叮叮当当的声音，应该是她在不停地变废为宝。

80120203.Content: 哎？{nickname}，是你？快过来快过来，正好我找到了一个怪东西！

80120204.Content: 这是我拆柜子的时候发现的一块木板。至于怪在哪里，我来敲一下你就知道了。

80120205.Content: 是哦，敲起来“咚咚咚”的，里面一定藏着东西。

80120206.Content: 没错，可萨克说他的家具都是什么什么名字记不清的高级木头。但重点是——里面是空心的。

80120207.Content: 以本“侦探”的嗅觉，这块木头一定大有文章！毕竟，自打我开始从垃圾桶里寻宝之后，各种秘密——无论是我想知道的还是不想知道的，都会找上门来。

80120208.Content: 谁家扔了玻璃窗的碎片，那就可能是吵架了；谁家突然扔掉很多旧衣服，那就是得了一笔意外之财；偶尔还会发现被撕碎的情书……

80120209.Content: 哎扯远了，回到这块空心的木板上。我在屋里看不清楚，所以我拿到屋外，刚打算打开你就来了。这里一定藏着些什么……

80120210.Content: ……怎么还是乐谱？他不是说过，珍贵的乐谱他都带走了。但如果不珍贵的话，他又为什么要特意藏起来？

80120211.Content: 让我看看到底写了什么……《恶魔挣脱了锁链》？从来没听说过的曲子……

80120212.Content: “你好啊，很久以后的可萨克，你现在开心吗？还是不太高兴？我要和你说，我即将做一件很冒险的事情：

80120213.Content: 我要以我们的国土上最为人熟视无睹的群体——卡戎作为创作题材。怎么样，听起来是不是一个好主意？

80120214.Content: 我不知道它发表后会给我带来什么，最好是名声啦，以及让大家开始同情卡戎们。但更可能是会被那些老前辈训斥说玷污了艺术吧。

80120215.Content: 或许不久后我会后悔自己的冲动，但至少此时此刻的我，明确地坚信着，我在做一件正确的事情。

80120216.Content: 所以，我留了一份副本在这里，以防遭受了冷遇的你或是古板的老前辈们彻底销毁我的心血。

80120217.Content: 真希望你再次看到这封信的时候，窗外能传来卡戎们唱着这首歌的声音。也希望你能和现在的我一样，能够笑着面对一切。”

80120219.Content: 哎，这个很久以前的可萨克，其实还是一个好人嘛。

80120220.Content: 唔……确实有可能，他对所有乐谱都不屑一顾，却偏偏很确定最重要的宝贝“早就放在了它该放的位置”……

80120221.Content: 也就是说，也许他心中最珍贵的乐谱，就是这一张……而“该放的位置”指的是，把它交到一个卡戎之民手里，因为那本来就是一首为卡戎而写的歌。

80120222.Content: 歌词写得真好……哎，也不知道这首歌唱出来到底是什么样的。

80120224.Content: 不管这首歌是可萨克先生是忘记了还是故意留下来的，但他既然让我来处理他余下的东西，我就要认真对待。

80120225.Content: 来，{nickname}，和一起去卡米拉姐那边，她好像是认识乐谱的，我要让她教我怎么唱。

80120226.Content: 等我学会了，就教给冰湖城里的卡戎们，和他们说，这是一位值得尊敬的音乐家专门为我们卡戎之民写的曲子。

80120227.Content: 这样一来，这首歌就不会像他的废稿一样，被扔进烤火的炉子，烧个一干二净了。

80120228.Content: 说不定有一天这首歌会传到皇都去，让他真的听到卡戎们在唱这首歌，不过听不到无所谓，反正，我做了我应该做的——

80120229.Content: 让那些不应该被视为垃圾的事物重见天日，变废为宝，就是我的责任！

80120230.Content: 后来，据卡米拉说，这首《恶魔挣脱了锁链》确实是非常精妙的曲目，并且难度很高。

80120231.Content: 最终，玛尔洁花了三天，并降了一个八度，才学会了这首歌。而在那之后不久，在冰湖城，就能时不时听到有人唱起那首歌。

80120232.Content: 这就是玛尔洁所谓的“变废为宝”吧。

80120302.Content: 又苦又甜……呃，感觉像是我家臭老头会喜欢的味道！至于我，大概还要再过十年，不，二十年才能理解这种口味吧。

80120303.Content: 一点也不理解！人为什么要自讨苦吃呢！

80120304.Content: 没错！干完活来几杯，感觉能从脑壳通透到脚后跟！

80120305.Content: 是我爸爸啦！大家都叫他老马丁，在我能独当一面之前，冰湖城的垃圾桶都是他在管。

80120306.Content: 要不是大家都称他为“垃圾桶之王”，我怎么会有“垃圾桶公主”这种又土又俗的称号……呜呜呜，那个花里胡哨的臭老头可把我害惨了！

80120307.Content: 明明人家想要的是更帅气、更有智慧、更可靠的……

80120308.Content: 没错没错~嘿嘿嘿，还是你懂我！

80120309.Content: 呜哇——住口住口！再说就吃我一铲！

80120310.Content: 唉……那个臭老头，自从把工作甩给我就整天不见踪影，也不知道他在做什么。最好不要给我和卡米拉姐惹事！

80120311.Content: 呃，要不是这个苦苦的味道……我似乎，好像，其实……也好久没想起臭老头的事了……

80120312.Content: 我工作很忙啊！而且说到底，这些活儿不都是他丢给我的嘛！

80120313.Content: 咳咳……小动物长大了不都要离开家独自生存，正常正常。

80120314.Content: 再说了，在我人生的前十几年，臭老头几乎一直围着我转。特别是从老家来冰湖城的时候，我们一整年都是在雪原上过的，就我们俩面面相觑，都没见过第三个活人。

80120315.Content: 我早就听够了他说的话，唱的歌，耍的赖皮，所以，我就没那么想他啦……大概吧。

80120316.Content: 而且到了冰湖城没多久，臭老头就开始“划分地盘”，“收编地头蛇”，“确定收保护费的办法”，“和原有势力联手”，“成为话事人”……我看他一个人也挺乐呵的。

80120317.Content: 哦，就是摸清了垃圾桶分布，收编原来的环卫工人，确定垃圾桶进货的标准，通过卡米拉姐寻找愿意回收货物的商家，最后成为“垃圾桶之王”。

80120318.Content: 哎呀，臭老爹就是喜欢说一些花里胡哨的话，像剧院的小本本上写的台词！大概是他在老家那个到处都在斗殴的破地方留下了坏习气，现在也改不掉，呃啊——

80120319.Content: 难说！臭老头最喜欢把自己从前的“丰功伟绩”当成故事讲给我听了！什么……

80120320.Content: “‘清道夫’接受的每一份命令都事关个人荣耀与家族利益，从制定计划到当日的仪容仪表，一切都要筹备完全。而你父亲我，就是最优秀的‘清道夫’。”

80120321.Content: 都怪他的影响太糟糕，我刚到冰湖城的那阵子，说起话来活脱脱就是一个“小马丁”。最后还是卡米拉姐讨厌这种腔调，花了好长一阵子才给我纠正过来……

80120324.Content: 啊！！！！我招，我招还不行吗？！别念了——

80120325.Content: 呃……老马丁把我寄放在卡米拉姐店里，他自己出去办事的时候，我会说……

80120326.Content: “牢记你的使命，父亲，我与你的未来取决于你接下来的每个步骤，所以，我希望你能确保自己已经洗完脸、刷完牙、做好了完全的计划。”

80120327.Content: 然后老马丁会摘下帽子对我说：“照您的意思做，女士！若你我中有谁任务失败，就把对方的名字加上‘笨蛋’一词，写在水仙平原的大门上示众。”

80120328.Content: 我会说：“哦，鉴于我们共享一个姓氏，还是写在锅底上吧，既免于丢我的人，也能让灶火灼烧你的耻辱！”

80120329.Content: 哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈哈！

80120330.Content: 现在我觉得你被叫“垃圾桶公主”，也不全是老马丁的错了。

80120331.Content: 我不管！就是他的错！一想起差点就成为和他一样装腔作势的家伙，我就浑身起鸡皮疙瘩。

80120332.Content: 而且你听出来没有，臭老头对自己的过去明明充满了怀念与自得，我总觉得他并不完全是讨厌老家的混乱才离开那里的。

80120333.Content: 但到底发生了什么事情，让他不惜带着我穿越雪原，也要离开老家呢？

80120334.Content: 他肯定有个天大的秘密瞒着我！但我每次问，他都说什么“不告诉你，想知道的话就动动自己的脑子想办法。”

80120335.Content: 所以去年，我偷偷调查了他很久，但臭老头神出鬼没，老家带来的行李也不知藏到哪儿去了。

80120336.Content: 我调查了好几个月，还是一无所获。最后，还被他狠狠地嘲讽了一通——

80120337.Content: 对，嘲讽！后来有一天，神出鬼没的老爹破天荒回来了，陪我玩了一整天，最后甚至还忘了带走行李箱——就是他从老家带来的那一只！

80120338.Content: 我就想着，臭老头百密一疏，终于被我抓到了！于是我打开箱子，可是里面只有一口锅……

80120339.Content: （玛尔洁愤怒地敲了敲自己盖在头顶的东西，发出了咚咚的响声。）

80120340.Content: 就是这个！他还在行李箱里留了一张字条……

80120341.Content: “玛尔洁女士，我预判到您一定会打开这只行李箱，探寻我的秘密，因此我早已将秘密转移至您意想不到之处。

80120342.Content: “为了弥补您的不悦，特地将此物留给您——这只多功能头盔正着用可有效防护头部，倒过来用可生火自炊，前面的矿灯还可用于照明，实乃居家外出的不二之选。”

80120344.Content: ……我看他明明是在嘲讽我才对！

80120345.Content: 总之在那之后，我就懒得管他的秘密了。

80120346.Content: 说起来，我突然有一种预感……

80120348.Content: 他的秘密……会不会就藏在这只“多功能头盔”里？

80120349.Content: 既然他说“秘密在意想不到之处”，那么有没有一种可能……最危险的地方反而最安全？

80120350.Content: 啊……！！这么说来，那次我都泄气了，就没仔细研究这只头盔！现在想来，这只头盔既然是改装过的，说不定里面还藏着什么！让我拆开看看！

80120351.Content: 真的！减震层下面是有夹层的！我果然没看错你，真有做侦探的潜质！

80120352.Content: 臭老头！这下你的秘密被我逮到了吧！

80120353.Content: （玛尔洁熟练地摆弄着锅子做的头盔——想必是多次改装过废品，玛尔洁手指灵巧，很快便完成了拆解。）

80120355.Content: （玛尔洁瞪圆了眼睛，看着锅子说不出话来。你从她手中接过锅子，只见底层刻着一行小字——）

80120357.Content: “恭喜你在‘寻找老马丁的秘密’游戏中再次失败。因此，我将在你的名字前加上‘笨蛋’一词。

80120358.Content: “鉴于我们共享一个姓氏，我将你的名字刻于锅底，既免于丢我的人，也能让灶火灼烧你的耻辱。”

80120401.Content: 呜呜！呜呜呜……侦探小姐又破获一件爆炸性案件……

80120403.Content: （玛尔洁灌下满满一杯水，把口袋里的东西小心地捧到你面前，那是一把小动物身上掉下来的毛发，看颜色有点眼熟……）

80120405.Content: 是以前和我一起在雪原流浪的小猫！

80120406.Content: 后来我来了冰湖城，它不肯跟着，自己留在了外头。我还专门缝了一个和它一模一样的布偶纪念它！

80120407.Content: 今天我本来打算去城门附近的垃圾桶进货来着，但意外捡到了这些浮毛，你看！

80120408.Content: 这个灰蒙蒙带黑点的毛色，软中带硬的手感，再加上捡到的时候还有点湿漉漉的……绝对是胖尾巴来找我了，错不了！

80120409.Content: 以前，我和胖尾巴玩“嫌犯追踪”的时候，把舔下来的毛放在不同的方向迷惑我就是它的招牌伎俩。

80120410.Content: 那时本侦探经验不足，经常被它耍得找不着北，等我白忙活半天，累得气喘吁吁的时候，它就昂着脑袋，翘着尾巴，趾高气昂地在我面前走来走去！

80120411.Content: 想起来了……都想起来了……被“嫌疑猫”戏弄的怒火、丢失追踪方向的苦恼、不慎在雪原迷路的惊恐……还有握着一把湿乎乎的猫毛时的不知所措！

80120412.Content: 哼！时隔多年，我已经不是当年的新人侦探了！况且，冰湖城可是本侦探的主场，这一次说什么我也要把“嫌疑猫”捉拿归案。

80120413.Content: 除了根据每条小巷的地形来推测胖尾巴的藏身之地，我还用小鱼干贿赂了本地的“小流浪”们，能提供外来猫线索者，重重有赏！

80120414.Content: 捉到谎报军情的白毛大猫一只！惩罚你半个月不许吃小鱼干！

80120415.Content: 嘿嘿，就算这么夸我，嘿嘿，我也不会高兴的，嘿嘿！

80120416.Content: 咳咳，言归正传……根据精密的推理，最终我在一个堆满纸盒子的小巷里找到了胖尾巴——对于生活在野外的猫来说，一堆纸盒，那是多么大的诱惑啊！

80120417.Content: 果然，嫌犯被逮捕时还躺在纸盒里晒太阳，还优哉游哉地冲我摇尾巴呢！

80120418.Content: 这么久没见，胖尾巴还是那个胖尾巴，但它看起来和以前有点不一样了……

80120419.Content: 我们分别的时候，胖尾巴刚刚长大，不太喜欢别人摸它，一不高兴就跑得无影无踪，这次见面，总感觉它成熟多了，甚至有点老态龙钟的。

80120420.Content: 难道“年纪大了脾气就会变好”也适用于动物吗？就算我没带它最喜欢吃的肉干。它也眯着眼睛随便我摸来摸去，肚子也给揉，爪子也给捏，尾巴也给摸。

80120421.Content: 这次胖尾巴还带了几只小猫来找我，只不过它们和小时候的胖尾巴一样胆小，只敢在箱子里伸出小脑袋偷看。但光看毛色就知道，胖尾巴一定把它们照顾得很好！

80120422.Content: 真令人感慨啊……那只连雪原鼠都抓不到的笨猫，居然已经能罩着小小猫平安长大了！

80120423.Content: 这么一说，我们都比相遇的时候更加成长了。嘿嘿……怪不好意思的……

80120424.Content: 不瞒你说，刚来冰湖城的时候，我还不像现在这样。那时候我经常哭鼻子——哎呀，你可千万别笑话！

80120425.Content: 有好几次，我都想离开冰湖城，就假装当初没有来过。我想找到胖尾巴，和它一起四处游荡，好像也很不错。

80120426.Content: 老马丁总说城市是个好地方，我就也这么以为。我总想着，“城市”应该是一个一群拿着火把的人凑在一起，互相依赖、彼此守护的避难所——

80120427.Content: 结果——唉！避难所里的荒唐事可真不少。卡戎会被毫无道理地区别对待，贵人老爷们一个人就有几辈子都穿不完的兽皮，贫民窟的穷人却可能熬不过这个冬天……

80120428.Content: 而且我实在是太想胖尾巴了！反正每个地方都有好坏，我干吗不选择和我最喜欢的胖尾巴在一起呢！

80120429.Content: 他？他才不会——也、也不一定……总之，我不还好好在冰湖城嘛！

80120430.Content: 现在回想一下，只是小孩子遇到难事想逃避罢了。

80120431.Content: 那时我真的这样做了。有次被人类小孩扔了石子，我就气昏了头，直冲着城门跑出去了。我喊着胖尾巴的名字，一直、一直向前跑。

80120432.Content: 然后……我真的见到了它。胖尾巴正在和一只雪狼打架……为了一只银贝鼠，那是它们共同的猎物。

80120433.Content: 我想胖尾巴可能饿坏了，就丢了一块肉干给它。但它看都不看一眼，眼里只有自己的猎物，和眼前的敌人。

80120434.Content: 最后，它打赢了雪狼，迈着高傲的步子到我脚边“嗷呜”、“嗷呜”地叫着，不知道是在炫耀，还是很多天没见了，想来蹭蹭我。

80120435.Content: 我就摸着它毛茸茸的脑袋，对它说，“胖尾巴，我跟你走，我们以后一起生活吧。”

80120436.Content: 但胖尾巴并没有带我去它的家。它从我怀里一溜烟窜下去，朝着一个方向嗷呜嗷呜叫个不停。那是冰湖城的方向……

80120437.Content: 我想，它大概是在告诉我，雪原不是我的家，冰湖城才是。

80120438.Content: 那个时候我突然就明白了。即使有我在投喂，胖尾巴也还是会努力地捕猎……因为，那是它生存的方式。

80120439.Content: 我也有我的生存方式，但我却不敢面对城里的生活，非得躲到胖尾巴那边去——呜呜，好丢人啊！

80120440.Content: 嗯，所以我就听它的，回去了。不过还是出了点小状况……

80120441.Content: 呜呜，别骂了别骂了，老马丁都没骂我！说起来那次老头儿难得地担心了一回，因为回去路上出了点小状况……

80120442.Content: 我只闷着头往外跑……根本没记路！我告别了胖尾巴，走着走着就迷了路，越走越累，越走越累，走着走着就……睡着了……

80120443.Content: 醒来的时候我觉得一颠一颠的，原来是臭老头把我背在背上。他个子不高，但他的背真结实啊，和小时候一样结实。

80120444.Content: 我浑身上下热烘烘的，原来是老头儿像人类那样，用一条围巾把我裹了好几层，连嘴巴都被捂上了。

80120445.Content: 于是玛尔洁来到冰湖城之后的第一次城外冒险，就这样稀里糊涂地结束啦。

80120446.Content: 从那以后我就学着如何努力在冰湖城生活，但每次碰到难题，臭老头还是会笑我是“学不会捕猎的胖尾巴二号”。

80120447.Content: 可他说的不对！胖尾巴最终成为了一个好猎手，而我也学会了如何在这里生存——就像你说的一样，我们都长大了。

80120448.Content: 不怪我，都怪胖尾巴！谁叫它太阳还没下山就又要走了！我明明在心里说了无数遍“拜托！留下来！”但它们还是走了……

80120449.Content: ……算了，不找借口了！到下次，我和胖尾巴的下一次见面，我会笑着和它说再见的！

90000001.ContentEN: Young one, it seems you've finally gathered all the materials for that treasure you've been seeking.

90000021.ContentEN: Grants a mid-tier sigil of your choice

90000032.ContentEN: Grants a random relic of any tier

90000051.ContentEN: O great Grantor of Sigils, I beseech your almighty power!

90000052.ContentEN: Grants a low-tier sigil of your choice

90000061.ContentEN: O great Grantor of Relics, I beseech your almighty power!

90010101.ContentEN: Don't falter, keep hammering... You can do it! No... No breaks allowed!

90010201.ContentEN: Listen up, kiddo! A weapon is like your life partner. You gotta treat it well!

90010301.ContentEN: That's my little friend. Tiny, but strong — it keeps the forge fire going.

90020101.ContentEN: Our fermented drinks are right there for the choosing... Mind you, they're not for the youngsters.

90020201.ContentEN: Rest is part of the journey. Care for a cup of Luno's special?

90030001.ContentEN: Welcome back. What are your plans for today? Or are you planning to rest at home?

90030101.ContentEN: Wishes? I... can't think of any. Your smile in the morning is already the greatest pick-me-up of all.

90030103.ContentEN: I promise I'll get you back.

90030104.ContentEN: Don't push yourself. If you ever feel down, just come to me for a chat. Or, if you don't feel like talking, we can just spend some quiet time together.

90030301.ContentEN: Unlike Purgatorio Island, it snows here every day. Thankfully, you have a warm place to stay. Compared to our little shack back on the island, this place feels quite luxurious.

90030303.ContentEN: But I'm still a bit chilly.

90030304.ContentEN: Remember how your hands would always get very cold in winter? Here, let me warm them up.

90030401.ContentEN: ...I'm not sure either. Maybe it's a beautiful dream where I've never left your side, as always.

90030403.ContentEN: I'd give anything to see you again.

90030404.ContentEN: I feel the same, very much so... May we truly reunite one day.

90030501.ContentEN: Well, that place is like a city made of steel... Mm, more like a prison, to be precise. I spent my early years there.

90030503.ContentEN: Later on, along with you, I was taken away from there by someone, and we ended up on Purgatorio Island. I can't share much about her, though — Sorry, I promised her.

90030504.ContentEN: ...Life on Purgatorio Island was so peaceful, that I almost believed we could live that way forever. But it wasn't until the day they came for me that I realised I had never truly escaped that prison.

90030601.ContentEN: It's somewhat noisy, but I don't hate it. You've made many new friends here, which is a good thing — I'm really happy for you.

90030603.ContentEN: This way, you'll never feel lonely, even when I'm not around.

90030801.ContentEN: Then rest your head on my lap for a while, just like old times.

90040001.ContentEN: I've been waiting here ever since I woke up. My venom has almost run dry... So, it's a good thing you came. I can feel it bubbling through my veins again. Can you come a little closer...?

90040101.ContentEN: Yes, I love rainy days. They remind me of the love stories I've read, where romantic encounters always happen on a rainy day.

90040103.ContentEN: Aren't rainy days more for sleeping in? Why would there be romantic encounters?

90040104.ContentEN: Have you ever observed those seeking shelter from the rain? They meet under eaves, the damp air enhancing the fragrance of greenery, love gently flowing with tentative advances...

90040105.ContentEN: Hehe, join me next time it rains, and you'll see what I mean.

90040201.ContentEN: Ah, you're initiating a conversation about love with me — how unexpected.\

90040203.ContentEN: Hmm, how should I put it? ...It's like water in perfume, which kisses and embraces each ingredient, devours and absorbs their fragrance, and eventually blends with them to create a long-lasting aroma...

90040204.ContentEN: You mean it's about cuddling up together every day?

90040205.ContentEN: There's much more to that. I seek a love so profound that we become truly inseparable... Even if life itself ends, one will become the mulch for the flowers in our garden; the blooms will turn into perfume, lingering around the other for eternity.

90040301.ContentEN: Special? Indeed... Many have seen me as a \"monster\" since I was young.

90040303.ContentEN: The looks of disgust on their faces aren't pleasant, which should be corrected...

90040304.ContentEN: Perhaps a little sting of my toxin in their skin will soften those harsh looks... Hehe.

90040305.ContentEN: So, when you say \"special\", do you mean special like a monster... or specially enchanting?

90040401.ContentEN: I'm perfectly fine. My venom is part of me, like a gift from the God of Love — it's harmless to me, and will help me find my destined lover.

90040403.ContentEN: Sounds like you really appreciate this gift.

90040404.ContentEN: Of course. Though it often casts me as a monster, it also sets me apart. I believe that the destined lover meant for a monster must be quite special, don't you think?

90040501.ContentEN: It's my signature perfume, with top notes as intense as a first encounter, heart notes of sweet nothings that fix the scent, and a base note that lingers with a bittersweet aftertaste.

90040504.ContentEN: That's my little secret. However, I'd be delighted to guide you through the blending process myself, one step at a time.

90050001.ContentEN: Now's the perfect timing. I should head out before... Huh?! When did you get here?

90050104.ContentEN: \"Your smile in the morning is already the greatest pick-me-up of all. From now on, I'll always be there to keep you safe.\" Hee hee, pretty convincing, isn't it?

90050105.ContentEN: No! Not even close! And stop mimicking us!

90050106.ContentEN: Are you angry? Hehehe, that scowl on your face makes me want to mimic you even more!

90050201.ContentEN: Easy, I can change my look however I want! Hehe, I can take any shape, any colour, and blend in anywhere perfectly. No one can spot me!

90050203.ContentEN: One time, I even turned into a barrel just to scare you, but you never came near...

90050204.ContentEN: Well, a random barrel popping up in the middle of a room? That's a bit of a giveaway...

90050205.ContentEN: What?! Wait, so you knew it was me and just walked away? That's not cool!

90050301.ContentEN: Hey! Don't lump me together with those baddies who steal from just anyone! I'm nothing like them!

90050304.ContentEN: I only steal from thieves. I blend in, sneak up close, and pluck my favourite treasures right from their pockets!

90050305.ContentEN: When they find out, their faces are priceless! Hehe... If anything, I'm more like a vigilante!

90050401.ContentEN: Of course not. You wouldn't like it either if people called you a \"demon\" with a frown and disgust.

90050403.ContentEN: Then why do you call yourself \"Demon Tabethe the Red Hand\"?

90050404.ContentEN: That's because I want to make the word \"demon\" cool. Now, the mere mention of my title \"Demon Tabethe the Red Hand\" sends shivers down the spine of those thieves.

90050405.ContentEN: And one day, the word \"demon\" will only make people think how awesome I am. That'll be pretty cool, don't you think?

90060101.ContentEN: If you learned about history, you'd know that the first warden of the Royal Military Prison had skin like molten lava. Even the most ruthless criminals feared her interrogations.

90060102.ContentEN: As her descendant, I proudly bear her name, ready to incinerate all sins with my fire.

90060103.ContentEN: Then... does your scorching skin make everyday life difficult?

90060104.ContentEN: It does pose some challenges — I can only sleep on iron beds and can't linger in wooden structures for long. However, it allows me to pull criminals from burning buildings and administer justice. And the cold never bothers me.

90060105.ContentEN: My unusual appearance is more of a gift. If there's any downside... I've always wanted to try ice cream, but it melts in my hand before I can taste it...

90060201.ContentEN: Since the Empire's inception, my family has managed the prison that holds the most heinous criminals, correcting wrongs and neutralising threats.

90060202.ContentEN: My fiery red skin, a legacy from the first warden, predestined me to continue enforcing the iron-clad code she established. So it wasn't me who chose to become a warden; it was the mantle of warden that chose me.

90060203.ContentEN: Does that mean you've already achieved your aspirations?

90060204.ContentEN: Becoming a warden is merely the beginning. It compels me to remain vigilant, eradicating any injustice within the Empire until my final breath.

90060301.ContentEN: Certainly. The Imperial Prison is teeming with devious criminals. My duties include conducting interrogations, reviewing case files, and thwarting escape attempts.

90060302.ContentEN: Every minute of rest delays justice a bit, and when justice is delayed, chaos and the law of the jungle take over.

90060303.ContentEN: Would your job be easier if there were fewer prisoners?

90060304.ContentEN: Some scholars have envisioned a crime-free world. Should such a day come, my purpose would vanish, for evil necessitates a warden's existence. Until then, I am committed to upholding order.

90060401.ContentEN: Justice? It is the restraint of desire through power, the suppression of evil through strength, and the punishment of the wicked by the mighty.

90060402.ContentEN: Isn't that a bit \"painting with a broad brush\"?

90060403.ContentEN: Hmph, broad? I wouldn't expect a naive child to understand. We don't live in a utopia where people simply hold hands and love each other. Only through absolute power and order can true justice be secured!

90060501.ContentEN: With criminals still roaming the streets of the Empire, spare time is a luxury for a warden. The only respite I get is when I sneak in a few strong drinks amidst a busy schedule.

90060503.ContentEN: Why so surprised? It's merely a diversion. During interrogations, I always hear about various kinds of alcohol, which made me curious about this so-called wicked potion that seems to be associated with crime. So I drink once in a while.

90060504.ContentEN: And the more I drink, the more I'm convinced that it's not the drink that is wicked.

90070001.ContentEN: Do what you need to. Cherish your freedom before the chains of law bind you.

90070101.ContentEN: ...Go read a tome or seek another's company for such trivial discourse. Perhaps the Starweavers peddling their crafts would indulge your curiosity.

90070102.ContentEN: Everyone looks at the world differently. I'm asking about your views.

90070103.ContentEN: I am oft preoccupied, and my perspectives are notably skewed. Should your curiosity truly beckon, a visit thither would enlighten you far beyond any second-hand account.

90070201.ContentEN: The Nine Chapters are the sacred laws of Huaxu, brooking no defiance. Should anyone dare to challenge divine decree, it falls upon some to quell the ensuing turmoil.

90070202.ContentEN: Does that make you a respected senior official then?

90070203.ContentEN: ...Perhaps in title. I seldom consort with the commoners. My presence, necessary as it may be for law's enforcement, often brings collateral grief. Few in Huaxu would greet me with joy.

90070301.ContentEN: There is nought to celebrate. That is the entirety of the matter.

90070302.ContentEN: Maybe you can try sharing your troubles with me.

90070303.ContentEN: Your concern is appreciated, yet I would not burden another soul with my woes. It is unnecessary.

90070401.ContentEN: Indeed. The moon, a celestial marvel, purifies the remnants of the day, be it festivity or foul deed. Through the ages, the crescent merely watches from its lofty perch.

90070402.ContentEN: Are you thinking about the past?

90070403.ContentEN: No, I am one who has bid farewell to the past. Tonight, I simply indulged in an extra half cup of wine.

90080001.ContentEN: Ahh... I feel so fresh after just waking up. Listen, buddy, there's no point in working all day. Your to-do list will never end. Remember, relaxation is a necessity, not a luxury.

90080101.ContentEN: My family? My parents haven't really fussed over me for years; just my sisters occasionally trying to boss me around. But now that I'm in the Legion, they're out of reach.

90080103.ContentEN: Sounds like your sisters are pretty mean.

90080104.ContentEN: Oh, not at all! T-They're absolutely delightful, smart, kind-hearted, gentle, charming, beautiful, and just about perfect! Though, a bit more decorum would be nice...

90080201.ContentEN: Huh, you're one of those who don't appreciate a good rest! Listen up: Beds are havens, where souls find ease; rooftops sanctuaries, where anxieties cease. In afternoon gardens, the sunlight gleams; take a nap, and enjoy the symphony of sweet dreams...

90080301.ContentEN: She sure knows how to run you ragged... I'd need to split myself in three just to keep up... Ahem, I mean, Chief Sibylle is always perfectly strict with us.

90080303.ContentEN: Too late, I heard that clearly.

90080304.ContentEN: ...How about I treat you to some afternoon tea, and we pretend this conversation never happened? Don't worry, it won't be spiked.

90080401.ContentEN: I've rigged up something awesome for you — a tiny robot sidekick! It'll follow you around in battle, waving a little banner and cheering, \"Go get'em! You're smashing it!\"

90080403.ContentEN: Pretty cool, huh? Just wait till I actually get it working...

90080405.ContentEN: Hey, I didn't finish! I drew up these plans during my precious breaks — do you know how hard it was for me to keep them from Chief Sibylle?

90090001.ContentEN: Watching your relentless efforts to strengthen yourself, I can't help but look forward to the day you challenge me again.

90090101.ContentEN: A special force under the direct command of the Emperor, tasked with covert missions and serving as a hammer ready to strike on the battlefield.

90090103.ContentEN: Huh, backed by the Emperor — no wonder you're always so overbearing.

90090104.ContentEN: You got it all wrong. Without the Emperor, the Legion still stands; without the Legion, however, the crown would surely fall.

90090105.ContentEN: Should I report you for treason based on that statement?

90090106.ContentEN: Feel free to try. Treason is a grave offence, and any accusation would work its way up through the ranks and end up right on my desk.

90090201.ContentEN: Hmph, my allegiance is not to the Empire, but to my ideals. A man once gave everything for these, and it is his legacy that I strive to uphold.

90090203.ContentEN: You're just making excuses. No matter the reason, your actions are nothing more than enabling tyranny.

90090204.ContentEN: You're not wrong. To get what I desire, I'll use everything at my disposal and climb the ladder by any means necessary; but each step I take is a step closer to what I believe in. Where have your steps led you?

90090301.ContentEN: It's okay. My family's long gone anyway.

90090304.ContentEN: I find it liberating, actually. It means no more distractions — just a clear path to contend with my enemies, both known and hidden.

90090305.ContentEN: Sentiment and feelings are merely weaknesses for anyone in the Legion.

90090401.ContentEN: Indeed. I've endured my share of curses and jibes to my face, and those from the gutter surely grumble even more.

90090403.ContentEN: Fortunately, in this unjust world, absolute power can still earn one a modicum of respect.

90090404.ContentEN: In that case, if you ever lost your power, they'd certainly kick you hard while you're down.

90090405.ContentEN: Exactly, which is why I'll never show weakness; otherwise, they'd pounce like wolves at the scent of blood, eager to tear me apart.

90100001.ContentEN: Such a relief — I'm still here today. And so are you...

90100101.ContentEN: Thank you! Actually, we Charons are quite resilient to the cold, so there's no need for expensive, heavy coats.

90100103.ContentEN: My mom made this dress, but I chose the colour — this vibrant green — and the butterfly details too. They'd look right at home somewhere warm, like the south.

90100104.ContentEN: I see. The butterflies are a nice touch — they suit you perfectly.

90100105.ContentEN: Really? That's so nice to hear! Actually, I've only seen blue butterflies around Icelake. I'd love to see what other colours are out there someday.

90100201.ContentEN: Yeah, it's been that way for ages. We're treated like pests and I've faced harassment and insults for no reason.

90100203.ContentEN: Is it because humans fear what Charons can do?

90100204.ContentEN: Probably. They say \"Magic is the root of all evil.\" History books claim our ancestors used it to rule over humans a thousand years ago, committing terrible acts.

90100205.ContentEN: Honestly, I can hardly imagine that... The Charons I know are too terrified of humans to even speak up around them, let alone use magic.

90100206.ContentEN: And Most Charon magic is quite ordinary — just good for simple things like lighting fireplaces or freezing food.

90100207.ContentEN: Would you wish to go back to those times — when Charons ruled over humans?

90100208.ContentEN: Not at all. Why must one rule over the other? Why can't Charons and humans just live in peace?

90100209.ContentEN: All I wish for is that when spring comes, everyone can go out together to enjoy all kinds of flowers. That would be enough for me.

90100301.ContentEN: Ah, that might be from my new gardening project. The courtyard at the Hypnos' House looked a bit barren with just a few trees, so I planted some white flowers there.

90100303.ContentEN: Perhaps we should plant some here too — bellflowers, windflowers, white dryas... Which would suit this place best?

90100304.ContentEN: Maybe you could ask around and gather everyone's thoughts on it.

90100305.ContentEN: Right, it should be a group decision... I'll ask around! By the way, which flower do you like best? I'll pick some for you when they bloom.

90100401.ContentEN: No, I've been here my whole life. I always hear those trains and wonder about the places they're heading to. I'd really love to see what's out there.

90100403.ContentEN: What places are on your wish list?

90100404.ContentEN: Mm, I'd definitely want to visit the capital, for starters; Uncle Henrik once told me the sunsets in Scarletriver are breathtaking... Oh, and I'd love to visit Purgatorio Island you told me about — to feel the sea breeze and see if it's as salty as you described!

90100501.ContentEN: Oh, it's just that... I want to take a good look at you all, to memorize your faces better.

90100502.ContentEN: Could you maybe take a moment to look at me carefully? I'd like you to remember me... just as I am right now.

90110001.ContentEN: Constantly staying indoors is detrimental to health. As the day is clear, why not venture out for a walk? Fall ill, and you may face some bitter potions — next time, I might not sweeten them for you.

90110101.ContentEN: Hyperborea bears a different essence compared to Huaxu; even the same herbs here are tinged with notes of blood and rust.

90110104.ContentEN: Like twins raised apart, herbs too vary based on their surroundings. It's essential to verify each one's properties, be it mild or potent.

90110201.ContentEN: It was for an old friend.

90110203.ContentEN: They must have been very important to you.

90110204.ContentEN: Mayhap... We were trained under the same master, yet our paths diverged long ago. It was not until the apricot blossoms whispered of her demise, which was tied to an incident in Hyperborea, that I perceived how vast a gulf time had rent between us.

90110206.ContentEN: Grieve not. Neither she nor I harbour regrets over the paths we chose, even though they meant we would never meet again.

90110301.ContentEN: A sanctuary dedicated to healing and saving lives.

90110303.ContentEN: Can you tell me more about it?

90110304.ContentEN: If more you seek... Each physician initiates their training by planting an apricot tree, now numbering over a thousand.

90110305.ContentEN: Beyond those seeking medical treatment, children also come to frolic amongst the apricot trees, turning the grove into their playground. Yet, each year, the quest for high-hanging apricots leaves some with minor bruises and scrapes... I wonder if this year has been any different.

90110306.ContentEN: Should you ever visit, refrain from climbing those apricot trees. If you crave their fruit, I'll pick some for you.

90110401.ContentEN: I dream of a world without incurable illnesses.

90110404.ContentEN: It rings as but a fanciful daydream, doesn't it? Yet someone once cured me when I was thought \"incurable\". Thus inspired, I aim to fight for others... against even the direst maladies.

90120001.ContentEN: The sun is shining bright, and the little birdies are chirping with joy after a hearty meal. Are you hungry too? Wanna grab something to eat as well?

90120101.ContentEN: Huh? You don't know? A commissary's job is to make sure everyone's well-fed, dealing with all sorts of food every day.

90120103.ContentEN: For example, I go out to gather all kinds of ingredients from the wild, have Filbert haul them back, and then get Mr Beard at the bakery to turn them into yummy food for everyone.

90120104.ContentEN: And just so you know, haggling with Mr Beard is part of my job too! Hehe.

90120105.ContentEN: Wow! That sounds impressive. Is it the same for all commissaries?

90120106.ContentEN: Oh, not at all! The others seem to be brainy types; they're all about the paperwork — filling out application forms, then waiting for trains loaded with food to roll in.

90120107.ContentEN: But for a small town like ours, just Filbert and I can feed everyone! Otherwise, I might have to start filling out those forms too — ugh, it's all gibberish to me.

90120201.ContentEN: Hmm... maybe it does? I've never really thought about it, but Filbert only knocks down those no-good, shouty, fighty troublemakers! They totally deserve it!

90120203.ContentEN: Those guys always end up hungry after their brawls. They'd do more good ploughing fields than swinging weapons — that way, less people would go to bed hungry.

90120204.ContentEN: You must really hate wars, then.

90120205.ContentEN: Absolutely! Fighting just leads to hunger — that's really awful! I've heard that in times of war, everyone ends up starving, which is just the worst! I hope I never have to see that.

90120206.ContentEN: If war does break out, you could mount Filbert and ram those troublemakers.

90120207.ContentEN: Right! Anyone who makes people go hungry will sooner or later get knocked over by Filbert!

90120301.ContentEN: Yeah, she is! And you know what, even across several creeks, Filbert can sniff out ripe berries and then off we go charging! Pretty awesome, isn't she?

90120303.ContentEN: Awesome. No risk of food shortage then.

90120304.ContentEN: No worries at all! Filbert always brings more food. So never ever make fun of her — it would hurt her feelings, and mine too.

90120401.ContentEN: Thank you! Actually, these are shorts, not a dress. They did start as a pretty, long, white dress; then the lady at the tailor's shop turned them into shorts for me.

90120404.ContentEN: Because dresses aren't the best for all the running around I do. One time, I tripped over the hem and all the bread in my arms went flying.

90120405.ContentEN: *sighs* But if the day comes, when no one's starving anymore, I'll have them changed back into a dress!

90120501.ContentEN: Oh, I was meditating, not zoning out. I'm a member of the Elysian Church after all, so I do try to give some deep thought occasionally.

90120503.ContentEN: What were you thinking, then? Why isn't there a god of full bellies, perhaps?

90120504.ContentEN: I used to wonder about that, but the clergy said it was... blastphomy or something. So I stopped thinking about that.

90120505.ContentEN: I never quite get what they say, like how gluttony is a terrible sin... but it seems like the higher someone's status, the more they eat.

90130001.ContentEN: Need anything? Spit it out quickly. I've got a mission to finish.

90130101.ContentEN: Sibylle? She's the chief of the 13th Legion.

90130104.ContentEN: Ugh, what do you expect me to know? She calls the shots, I do the work. That's all.

90130201.ContentEN: Tips? The only tip I have is there's no problem a good punch can't fix. If that doesn't work, throw another.

90130203.ContentEN: What if two punches don't sort it out either?

90130204.ContentEN: Then a bullet usually does the trick.

90130205.ContentEN: But I heard some people can take a bullet and still stand.

90130206.ContentEN: It's just a figure of speech. My point is: be as tough and strong as you can be, and that's all you need. Keep nitpicking, and your face will be getting those punches next.

90130301.ContentEN: Saw a really nice gun the other day... Forget it, can't skimp on food just to buy it. The old one feels better in my hands anyway.

90130303.ContentEN: If you really like it, maybe I can get one for you.

90130304.ContentEN: Really?... Nah, you look as broke as me... I appreciate the gesture, but don't go break a piggy bank for me. I don't wanna owe anyone anything.

90130401.ContentEN: No work, no food. What don't you get?

90130403.ContentEN: But it's also important to find a balance, right?

90130404.ContentEN: Balance would be great, but my clients don't see it that way — always hounding me, \"Is the job done yet? Hurry up!\" Ugh, if I didn't have a family to feed, I'd punch them in their stupid faces.

90140001.ContentEN: How may I be of assistance today? Would you like a refreshing cup of flower tea? Or perhaps you would prefer me to deal with some of your pesky foes?

90140101.ContentEN: Indeed. The persistent fog means laundry never dries and it clings to the ever-present dust.

90140103.ContentEN: And sometimes, it emboldens certain undesirables to creep close to Miss Flora.

90140104.ContentEN: You must prefer sunny days, then?

90140105.ContentEN: Sunny days do favour the laundry, yet they also make it easier for Miss Flora and me to be spotted. There's no ideal weather for us, just less troublesome days.

90140201.ContentEN: Why, isn't it normal for a maid to be able to fight? Nothing out of the ordinary here.

90140203.ContentEN: Normal? For all I know, maids are always busy cleaning.

90140204.ContentEN: Be it flies or Filthoids, all are mere dirt that needs to be cleared away. Think of my combat as just another form of cleaning — only more exhilarating.

90140301.ContentEN: Dangerous items? What do you mean? Could you be more specific? Please don't beat around the bush.

90140303.ContentEN: I mean guns! You seem to have quite a collection.

90140304.ContentEN: ...Ah, yes, I do have a certain preference for firearms. Among all the cleaning tools, I find them uniquely satisfying to handle, and unmatched in cleaning up certain messes.

90140305.ContentEN: If you've been feeling stressed, perhaps I could lend you a few. A little \"rat-a-tat-tat\", you might find it quite therapeutic.

90140401.ContentEN: Mm, maybe. I don't waste time on pleasantries with those who matter little to me.

90140403.ContentEN: Huh, and yet you've spoken quite a bit with me.

90140404.ContentEN: That's because you've paid well. Should your funds dry up, my enthusiasm might just wane.

90140405.ContentEN: Wow, that would really break my heart.

90140406.ContentEN: No need to fret. Trust me, I won't let it come to that.

90140501.ContentEN: Hmm? W...Where? She shouldn't be here today according to her calendar...

90140504.ContentEN: Don't you think you were overreacting a little?

90140505.ContentEN: Not at all. Miss Flora means the world to me. Perhaps it's bold of me to say, but she's much more than just my honorable lady...

90140506.ContentEN: Regrettably, I'm not a poet; otherwise, I'd find the perfect word for her, which combines the meanings of friend and family.

90140507.ContentEN: Sometimes, the deepest bonds don't need words.

90140508.ContentEN: I prefer keeping such feelings to myself — clearing the path for Miss Flora is both my duty and my privilege.

90150001.ContentEN: ...Ah, it's you. Hello, how are you?

90150101.ContentEN: Um, I was wondering... if there were a candy that could make me grow very tall...

90150103.ContentEN: So tall that I could see above the clouds and even touch the stars!

90150104.ContentEN: But what if you accidentally stepped on me and flattened me like a pancake...

90150105.ContentEN: I'd walk carefully, I promise! Well... if you're really worried, you could perch on my hand and we'll go for a spin. What do you think?

90150201.ContentEN: I have a big glass chest filled with the soft snow from outside my window and marshmallows as white as the snow. I'd also like to put in clouds as fluffy as those marshmallows, and breezes as warm as those clouds...

90150203.ContentEN: And our giggles and chuckles in there too, every single one~

90150204.ContentEN: Wow... it must be heavenly to nestle inside.

90150205.ContentEN: Well... if you nibble one of those candies that shrinks you down tiny, you could get in for a visit. But everything's white in there, so be careful not to wander off and lose your way.

90150206.ContentEN: If I do get lost in there, will Fina come to find me?

90150207.ContentEN: Mmm... If you get lost, I'll scatter breadcrumbs in a trail for you... Follow them and you'll find the way out!

90150301.ContentEN: Mm-hmm! I dreamed of a nightingale, pure as driven snow, resting on my hand one moment, and playing hide-and-seek with me the next... Hmm, was it me who dreamed, or did it dream of me, I wonder?

90150303.ContentEN: Perhaps you both visited the same dreamland.

90150304.ContentEN: You might be right! Maybe it's a wonderland where all the sleeping children and little animals can play together. Hmm... I wonder who I'll meet in my next dream — Owl the Wise, Miss Canary, or Sir Rabbit?

90150401.ContentEN: I used to have a mum and two dads. But they've all gone...

90150402.ContentEN: The first dad went to a faraway land with mum. And the second one... he's in that faraway land too... I sent him there.

90150501.ContentEN: He's the greatest magician, with the most soothing voice and the gentlest soul in the world...

90150504.ContentEN: Er, what's wrong? You look very confused.

90150505.ContentEN: This is so not the Outsider I know!

90150506.ContentEN: Huh...? You mean he's not kind or gentle to you? I'm so sorry... I'll give him a little tap on his head and ask him to be nicer!

90160001.Content: 你可来了，我把之前剩下的杂活清了一下，钱没赚多少还差点把自己累死，唉，为了这个家我真是付出了太多啊。

90160101.Content: 手册？没有，干这行的可大部分没看书的耐性，但是口诀倒是不少，比如我自创的打人口诀：“两下腰子一下头，皇帝看了说没救”。

90160104.Content: 别贪多，饭一口一口吃，干这行的，最大的敌人永远是贪婪，有时候来自别人，但更多时候来自自己。

90160201.Content: 他们是一团未熄灭的野火，稍不留神就会烧成满山烈焰。为你个人考虑，还是少与他们接触为好……

90160204.Content: 那当然是因为……有过一些小过节，要是哪天你和他们打上交道，可千万记得别报我名字。

90160301.Content: 嗯，能帮我拿一下那边的纱布吗？可不能被菲娜发现，不然又她又要唠叨了。

90160304.Content: 我知道，但干咱们这一行总免不了受点伤，我也不想让她一直担心嘛。她要是真的问起来，你记得帮我打个圆场啊，回头请你吃饭。

90160401.Content: 噢，你要不要也试试这些小家伙？别看它们长得丑，去掉头就跟小饼干一样脆脆的，甚至能在嘴巴里留下一丝肉类的回甘……

90160404.Content: 你别跑啊，这可是很有用的生存智慧……等你迷失在野外，干粮吃完的时候，它们就是最宝贵的能量来源。

90160501.Content: 嗯……等等，你手上怎么才这么几个钱，是不是又把你那份报酬随便分给其他人了？

90160503.Content: 他们比我更需要那些钱。

90160504.Content: 你……哎，算了，这大概就是你的优点吧。手头紧的时候记得跟我说。

90160506.Content: ……我这是身为朋友在关心你，你别得寸进尺耍无赖啊！

90170001.ContentEN: I've cleared the snow from your doorstep on my way here! Touched, huh? Bet you're thinking of treating me to a cup of cocoa~

90170101.ContentEN: Well... it's about giving discarded items a new home and providing those in need with a chance at a better life.

90170104.ContentEN: For instance, turning an aristocrat's cast-off velvet curtains into warm winter coats for the elderly, or bringing discarded dolls to children whose only playthings are pebbles — they'll be overjoyed for a long time.

90170105.ContentEN: There was one time, I dragged back a broken bookshelf someone had thrown out. Though I was half-dead from the effort, it quickly turned into a non-stop playground for a litter of kittens — totally worth it!

90170106.ContentEN: That's scavenging for you! It's mostly small fry stuff, but never a dull moment. So, what do you say, wanna join us?

90170201.ContentEN: Shhhh! That's a scavenger's top secret! I wouldn't have let you in on it if you hadn't helped me out with that thief!
