90170203.ContentEN: This map charts every rubbish bin in Icelake, and I've marked the few where the best stuff tends to gather — I've upgraded those bins to larger sizes and timed my visits to perfection!

90170204.ContentEN: But scavenging is really hit-or-miss — mostly, it all comes down to luck...

90170205.ContentEN: Scavenging's no picnic, that's for sure...

90170301.ContentEN: Oh, you've got it backwards! I love Icelake through and through. It's just that I often reminisce about the days I spent wandering the snowfields with my dad; that's how I grew up.

90170303.ContentEN: How do you feel about those days?

90170304.ContentEN: From here, the snowfields look like something out of a fairy tale. But once you step into it, you'd feel so very small. Even after trudging through knee-high snow for hours, that feeling would never leave.

90170305.ContentEN: I don't hate those days. But the bustling, lively Icelake is my absolute favourite!

90170401.ContentEN: That's the big cat that used to roam the snowfields with me when I was little! We called him \"Plumpytail\". He would only let me pet him in exchange for some jerky, but oh, the feel of his fur — hehehe, it's the best of the best!

90170403.ContentEN: What does a big snowfield cat sound like? More like a cat or a tiger?

90170404.ContentEN: Mmm... it's certainly not like \"meow\"; it's more like, \"raawr—raawr—!\"

90170406.ContentEN: Plumpytail prefers the wild over city life. We had to go our separate ways, but she'll always be a part of me, just like the snowfields.

90170501.ContentEN: Nah-uh! That's not me! I'm too grown up for such a childish title! Please, I beg of you, don't ever call me that again!

90170503.ContentEN: Then how would you like to be referred to?

90170504.ContentEN: Ahem, that would be — Lady Margie the reticent detective, a lone shadow-walker of the city! Today, I will unveil for you the secrets of Icelake, as always!

90170505.ContentEN: Hehe, now that's a proper title for me~

90180001.ContentEN: Hi... Such a nice day, isn't it... Perfect for some explosive experiments... Um, what a nice day.

90180101.ContentEN: Oliver is not a talking bomb... It might sound strange, but... he's actually...

90180103.ContentEN: Ugh, you're killing me here! I am Yale, and Yale is me. Got it? Not that I'd expect someone with your pea-sized brain to understand.

90180104.ContentEN: What a rude bomb, maybe you should get rid of it.

90180105.ContentEN: Oliver's a-a-actually a nice guy! He might s-seem a bit rough, and mean, a-and likes to pop up out of the b-blue, but...

90180106.ContentEN: Hey! That's your idea of nice words?

90180201.ContentEN: I... I might not be much help. The only thing I'm good at... is probably making Tot Poppers...

90180204.ContentEN: They're the most popular items at our \"Snap 'n' Spark\" toy store... They take a lot of time to make.

90180205.ContentEN: But it's not because I'm skilled... It's all thanks to Oliver's expertise.

90180301.ContentEN: Ah, sorry! B-But if I start speaking fast, my tongue tends to get all t-t-tied up.

90180303.ContentEN: It must be hard for you to communicate with others then.

90180304.ContentEN: I-It's okay, sometimes Oliver speaks for me... And when no one else's around, Oliver would always hear me out.

90180401.ContentEN: I never really had a \"childhood\"... From my earliest memories, I've been in this body. Oliver might have one, though.

90180403.ContentEN: Missing out on childhood, that's kind of sad.

90180404.ContentEN: I've sometimes wondered what having a \"childhood\" would be like... Would Mr Jones have told me bedtime stories every night, like a normal dad...?

90180405.ContentEN: You expect that jerk to tell you bedtime stories? Have you lost your mind?

90180406.ContentEN: S-Sorry! I-I know he only cared about his experiments... He wouldn't have done that...

101004021.ContentEN: Don't be afraid, everything's all right now.
101004021.Subtitle: Don't be afraid, everything's all right now.

101004022.ContentEN: I remember someone just promised to protect me.
101004022.Subtitle: I remember someone just promised to protect me.

101006061.ContentEN: From a small island in the South.
101006061.Subtitle: From a small island in the South.

101006062.ContentEN: I'm a relative of Ms Camilla.
101006062.Subtitle: I'm a relative of Ms Camilla.

101008011.ContentEN: ...I just felt a hint of danger there.
101008011.Subtitle: ...I just felt a hint of danger there.

101008061.ContentEN: Your saving me doesn't seem like a coincidence. Is this the \"deal\" you just mentioned?
101008061.Subtitle: Your saving me doesn't seem like a coincidence. Is this the \"deal\" you just mentioned?

101008151.ContentEN: I want to know how to get back to Purgatorio Island.
101008151.Subtitle: I want to know how to get back to Purgatorio Island.

101008191.ContentEN: I still want to see Sibylle. I'm serious.
101008191.Subtitle: I still want to see Sibylle. I'm serious.

101012131.ContentEN: Let's go, there'll be other ways.
101012131.Subtitle: Let's go, there'll be other ways.

101012132.ContentEN: Aren't you afraid that you'd go out of business with that attitude?
101012132.Subtitle: Aren't you afraid that you'd go out of business with that attitude?

101012133.ContentEN: Actually, I'm here on behalf of the Security Bureau. You will pay for this.
101012133.Subtitle: Actually, I'm here on behalf of the Security Bureau. You will pay for this.

101024191.ContentEN: It's not really up to them, I suppose.
101024191.Subtitle: It's not really up to them, I suppose.

101024192.ContentEN: Snow has a point. An eye for an eye.
101024192.Subtitle: Snow has a point. An eye for an eye.

101026091.ContentEN: I've been faced with greater dangers.
101026091.Subtitle: I've been faced with greater dangers.

101026092.ContentEN: Between starvation and danger, I choose the latter.
101026092.Subtitle: Between starvation and danger, I choose the latter.

101040141.ContentEN: I think I'll give it a try.
101040141.Subtitle: I think I'll give it a try.

101043011.ContentEN: Please tell me more about Icelake.
101043011.Subtitle: Please tell me more about Icelake.

101043051.ContentEN: Please tell me more about Phoxhunters.
101043051.Subtitle: Please tell me more about Phoxhunters.

101043091.ContentEN: Please tell me more about yourself.
101043091.Subtitle: Please tell me more about yourself.

101044052.ContentEN: Since it's a job offered by you guys, it's only right.
101044052.Subtitle: Since it's a job offered by you guys, it's only right.

101046092.ContentEN: Don't listen to Snow, she just wants extra help.
101046092.Subtitle: Don't listen to Snow, she just wants extra help.

101054041.ContentEN: We defeated that Filthoid. Give it back.
101054041.Subtitle: That Filthoid was defeated by us; you shouldn't snatch our spoils.

101054042.ContentEN: If there's no such thing as dibs, that means we can just beat you up and take the Crystallo back.
101054042.Subtitle: Hand it over. Or prepare to join that Filthoid.

101054152.ContentEN: What a coincidence! So am I!
101054152.Subtitle: What a coincidence! So am I!

101054191.ContentEN: There's a bounty worth 5,000 silver coins on it.
101054191.Subtitle: There's a bounty worth 5,000 silver coins on it.

101054212.ContentEN: How do I know you'll keep your word?
101054212.Subtitle: How do I know you'll keep your word?

101058131.ContentEN: She isn't your daughter, you know.
101058131.Subtitle: She isn't your daughter, you know.

101058132.ContentEN: You are quite a polite, friendly person.
101058132.Subtitle: You are quite a polite, friendly person.

101063031.ContentEN: You didn't want Snow to hear?
101063031.Subtitle:
He's been trying to sell off his estate these days, but not much luck. Five thousand silver coins isn't chump change,\
and given his current state, I doubt he can cough up more than the guarantee.

101063032.ContentEN: You didn't want Psyche to hear?
101063032.Subtitle: Shady?

101070021.ContentEN: Thank you, Psyche. But I managed to get the Crystallo back from Outsider.
101070021.Subtitle: Thank you, Psyche. But I managed to get the Crystallo back from Outsider.

101070031.ContentEN: I told him a story that brought him to tears.
101070031.Subtitle: I told him a story that brought him to tears.

101070032.ContentEN: He broke his leg on his way back and is now howling in pain at home.
101070032.Subtitle: He broke his leg on his way back and is now howling in pain at home.

101070071.ContentEN: The lodgers here all seem... a bit listless.
101070071.Subtitle: The lodgers here all seem... a bit listless.

101070131.ContentEN: When is Mr Henrik usually at home?
101070131.Subtitle: When is Mr Henrik usually at home?

101071031.ContentEN: Doesn't that just make it more intriguing?
101071031.Subtitle: Doesn't that just make it more intriguing?

101071061.ContentEN: Every day? Sounds like a lot of work.
101071061.Subtitle: Every day? Sounds like a lot of work.

101071062.ContentEN: This door's spotless, no need for further cleaning now.
101071062.Subtitle: This door's spotless, no need for further cleaning now.

101071081.ContentEN: That makes sense; I should adopt a habit too. Does Mr Henrik have any?
101071081.Subtitle: That makes sense; I should adopt a habit too. Does Mr Henrik have any?

101071121.ContentEN: It's more than enough. Those are certainly meaningful habits.
101071121.Subtitle: It's more than enough. Those are certainly meaningful habits.

101073041.ContentEN: I didn't mean to, you were loud...
101073041.Subtitle: I didn't mean to, you were loud...

101073051.ContentEN: Let's talk about Hunt. Where has he gone?
101073051.Subtitle: Let's talk about Hunt. Where has he gone?

101078021.ContentEN: The Hypnos' House is actually a sanatorium.
101078021.Subtitle: The Hypnos' House is actually a sanatorium.

101078071.ContentEN: There's a locked room in the house. It might hold the secret.
101078071.Subtitle: There's a locked room in the house. It might hold the secret.

101078111.ContentEN: Henrik spends most of his time in the house, but there's a window.
101078111.Subtitle: Henrik spends most of his time in the house, but there's a window.

101089032.ContentEN: Investigate the log on the cupboard
101089032.Subtitle: Investigate the log on the cupboard

101089041.ContentEN: Investigate the log on the cupboard
101089041.Subtitle: Investigate the log on the cupboard

200005262.ContentEN: (Labour never comes this cheap. I'd better be careful.)
200005262.Subtitle: (Labour never comes this cheap. I'd better be careful.)

200006051.ContentEN: Could you tell me more about Lunos?
200006051.Subtitle: Could you tell me more about Lunos?

200006152.ContentEN: How much will the leader of your legion get paid?
200006152.Subtitle: How much will the leader of your legion get paid?

200008091.ContentEN: (She looks rather lethargic. Something seems to be on her mind.)

200008092.ContentEN: (You noticed the potted plant she was taking care of, and she was sighing at it.)

200008093.ContentEN: Resting might not do much. Why not try going out and doing something fun to lift your spirits?

200008161.ContentEN: The flowers seem a bit under the weather.

200008341.ContentEN: (Comfort her — even the toughest flower can be vulnerable and will wilt one day.)

200008342.ContentEN: (Ask her to think of any changes or differences compared to the way the plant used to be nurtured.)

200008411.ContentEN: (You are interested in this special soil.)

200009111.ContentEN: Indeed... If flowers had a choice, they probably wouldn't want to be snipped off.

200009112.ContentEN: But maybe that is the flowers' purpose, to have their beauty appreciated by others.

200009151.ContentEN: I'll do my best to make them survive for as long as I can.

200009152.ContentEN: I will cherish the moment of their blossoming.

200009153.ContentEN: I actually feel sorry for them as well...

200009222.ContentEN: Personally, I prefer to leave them on the plant rather than snipping them off.

200009261.ContentEN: You're welcome. And if you ever need more, just let me know.

200009262.ContentEN: I could really use a teacher if you're available.

510001041.ContentEN: Ahhh! I'll drink it myself! Thank you!

510001042.ContentEN: (Skillfully sidestep — You're wary of over-the-top kindness from strangers.)

510001101.ContentEN: The lady you mentioned — is she sick?

510003021.ContentEN: (The fabric of her outfit appears quite luxurious.)

510003022.ContentEN: (She seems to be looking for someone.)

510004031.ContentEN: Umm... {性别:I am a man.|I am not your daughter.}
510004031.Subtitle: Umm... {性别:I am a man.|I am not your daughter.}

510004032.ContentEN: Please calm down. Are you looking for someone? I'll keep an eye out for you.
510004032.Subtitle: Please calm down. Are you looking for someone? I'll keep an eye out for you.

510004921.ContentEN: Please think carefully about your daughter's features and how she disappeared, so I can see what I can do.
510004921.Subtitle: Please think carefully about your daughter's features and how she disappeared, so I can see what I can do.

510007011.ContentEN: Have you been wandering around here all this time? Is there anything I can help you with?
510007011.Subtitle: Have you been wandering around here all this time? Is there anything I can help you with?

510007031.ContentEN: I understand. Losing a sense of belonging is awful.
510007031.Subtitle: I understand. Losing a sense of belonging is awful.

510007032.ContentEN: Staying out here isn't safe. It's best to figure out your true identity as soon as possible.
510007032.Subtitle: Staying out here isn't safe. It's best to figure out your true identity as soon as possible.

510007033.ContentEN: Seeing is not always believing. You've got to investigate everything thoroughly before jumping to conclusions.
510007033.Subtitle: Seeing is not always believing. You've got to investigate everything thoroughly before jumping to conclusions.

510009031.ContentEN: I only see some junk here. According to my evaluation, they're not worth more than a few stones.
510009031.Subtitle: I only see some junk here. According to my evaluation, they're not worth more than a few stones.

510009032.ContentEN: It's better not to take things without asking.
510009032.Subtitle: It's better not to take things without asking.

510009033.ContentEN: Where did you swipe these from? Teach me that!
510009033.Subtitle: Where did you swipe these from? Teach me that!

510009071.ContentEN: Sadly, there's nothing I need here.
510009071.Subtitle: Sadly, there's nothing I need here.

510009072.ContentEN: (He scrutinises you closely, revealing a thoughtful expression)
510009072.Subtitle: (He scrutinises you closely, revealing a thoughtful expression)

510009101.ContentEN: I heard someone can provide some low-priced fuel and cloth to help many poor people get through the winter.
510009101.Subtitle: I heard someone can provide some low-priced fuel and cloth to help many poor people get through the winter.

510009102.ContentEN: You sell information, but you don't look like a private detective. Do you have a special source for receiving intelligence?
510009102.Subtitle: You sell information, but you don't look like a private detective. Do you have a special source for receiving intelligence?

510009103.ContentEN: I've already heard you say Martin three times. Who exactly are you?
510009103.Subtitle: I've already heard you say Martin three times. Who exactly are you?

510010071.ContentEN: You've lost something. That thing proves that you are a shack-dwelling tycoon just like him.
510010071.Subtitle: You've lost something. That thing proves that you are a shack-dwelling tycoon just like him.

510010072.ContentEN: You've lost something. Normally, expired tickets should be destroyed to prevent counterfeiting, and keeping them is obviously a violation.
510010072.Subtitle: You've lost something. Normally, expired tickets should be destroyed to prevent counterfeiting, and keeping them is obviously a violation.

510010101.ContentEN: Legend has it that stars have the power to fulfill wishes. You folded hundreds of stars from tickets, so what's your wish?
510010101.Subtitle: Legend has it that stars have the power to fulfill wishes. You folded hundreds of stars from tickets, so what's your wish?

510010181.ContentEN: I understand your frustration and sorrow. Life always has disappointment, but what's insurmountable now might one day become a clear path.
510010181.Subtitle: I understand your frustration and sorrow. Life always has disappointment, but what's insurmountable now might one day become a clear path.

510010182.ContentEN: Regardless, the gentleman earlier should not have been humiliated by you, and I disagree with your act of venting your anger on others.
510010182.Subtitle: Regardless, the gentleman earlier should not have been humiliated by you, and I disagree with your act of venting your anger on others.

510010183.ContentEN: Whatever you think, if you don't want any trouble, you should either take this thing back and store it properly or destroy it. That's something you should take care of.
510010183.Subtitle: Whatever you think, if you don't want any trouble, you should either take this thing back and store it properly or destroy it. That's something you should take care of.

510010184.ContentEN: Why don't you sit up on the roof of the car for a round trip for fun?
510010184.Subtitle: Why don't you sit up on the roof of the car for a round trip for fun?

510012011.ContentEN: Are these golden plume birds yours?
510012011.Subtitle: Are these golden plume birds yours?

510012012.ContentEN: So, these birds are yours? I was hoping to have some fresh poultry for dinner.
510012012.Subtitle: So, these birds are yours? I was hoping to have some fresh poultry for dinner.

510012041.ContentEN: (Recalling what you've read about golden plume birds — their behaviour and their utility as detection tools.)
510012041.Subtitle: (Recalling what you've read about golden plume birds — their behaviour and their utility as detection tools.)

510012042.ContentEN: (Agree with him and lament the disregard for tradition.)
510012042.Subtitle: (Agree with him and lament the disregard for tradition.)

510012043.ContentEN: (Commend the progress in technology for enhancing the efficiency of human society.)
510012043.Subtitle: (Commend the progress in technology for enhancing the efficiency of human society.)

510013011.ContentEN: You can't insult a respected lady like that.
510013011.Subtitle: Oi! You can't insult a respected lady at the doorstep of The Asphodel!

510013013.ContentEN: Throw her a compliment and she's walking all over me. Thinks she's too good for my booze? I'll make her regret it someday!

510013041.ContentEN: No, Ms Camilla is a trustworthy friend and she's helped me out before.
510013041.Subtitle: I'd rather see Camilla as a reliable and strong ally. She's been our saviour on numerous occasions. Not just us — at least half the city is in her debt.

510013042.ContentEN: Save your breath. Ms Camilla's integrity is not up for debate. I trust my own judgment of her.
510013042.Subtitle: That doesn't give you the right to spout nonsense here. Camilla's integrity is not up for debate, and it's certainly not to be smeared by your baseless accusations.

510013043.ContentEN: Let me guess — she turned down your swill, and now you're bitter.
510013043.Subtitle: I've seen Camilla's discernment in action. She has an eye for both people and liquor. It seems to me that you're the one who can't recognise good stuff.

510013061.ContentEN: Ahem... you ain't from around here, huh? Let me guess — you haven't been to any taverns other than Camilla's since hitting town, right?

510013092.ContentEN: You get what you pay for. I'll pass.
510013092.Subtitle: You get what you pay for.

510013231.ContentEN: Competing for business is one thing, but what if your fake booze causes actual harm to people?

510013232.ContentEN: Yeah! Don't let her words scare you, buddy! Why not chug a barrel to prove how good your stuff is?

510013281.ContentEN: He's not wrong — his stuff knocks people out...

510014021.ContentEN: Children are natural poets seeing through life's essence, aren't they?
510014021.Subtitle: Children are natural poets seeing through life's essence, aren't they?

510014022.ContentEN: You seem to be very proud of them.
510014022.Subtitle: You seem to be very proud of them.

510014023.ContentEN: Darn it, it seems I was behind right from the start.
510014023.Subtitle: Darn it, it seems I was behind right from the start.

510014061.ContentEN: Not at all. You've preserved the children's precious innocence and sense of wonder.
510014061.Subtitle: Not at all. You've preserved the children's precious innocence and sense of wonder.

510014901.ContentEN: It seems you've gained a lot from your time with the children.
510014901.Subtitle: It seems you've gained a lot from your time with the children.

510015021.ContentEN: Maybe try soaking it in detergent first?
510015021.Subtitle: Maybe try soaking it in detergent first?

510015022.ContentEN: You got cash? I can clean it for you.
510015022.Subtitle: You got cash? I can clean it for you.

510015023.ContentEN: Getting beaten up is good for character building, isn't it?
510015023.Subtitle: Getting beaten up is good for character building, isn't it?

510015071.ContentEN: What a heartless thing to say!
510015071.Subtitle: What a heartless thing to say!

510016021.ContentEN: (He seems temperamental. Maybe touching his horns will calm him down.)
510016021.Subtitle: (He seems temperamental. Maybe touching his horns will calm him down.)

510016022.ContentEN: Charons and humans are equals. Prejudice is not cool.
510016022.Subtitle: Charons and humans are equals. Prejudice is not cool.

510016023.ContentEN: But you're a Charon too... aren't you?
510016023.Subtitle: But you're a Charon too... aren't you?

510016121.ContentEN: May I have the honour to take a peek at your \"Laurelled Charon\" medal?
510016121.Subtitle: May I have the honour to take a peek at your \"Laurelled Charon\" medal?

510017031.ContentEN: (Sincerely suggest he looks into personal hygiene.)
510017031.Subtitle: (Sincerely suggest he looks into personal hygiene.)

510017032.ContentEN: (Apologise for your rather impolite reaction just now.)
510017032.Subtitle: (Apologise for your rather impolite reaction just now.)

510017033.ContentEN: (Complain that his stench is unbearable and affects those around him.)
510017033.Subtitle: (Complain that his stench is unbearable and affects those around him.)

510017081.ContentEN: A life-saver like you shouldn't be stuck mending sewers.
510017081.Subtitle: A life-saver like you shouldn't be stuck mending sewers.

510017161.ContentEN: If you had a chance to do it all over, would you make the same choice to save him?
510017161.Subtitle: If you had a chance to do it all over, would you make the same choice to save him?

510019231.ContentEN: The shape of these cracks... I see. It protected you from a fatal blow to the chest.
510019231.Subtitle: The shape of these cracks... I see. It protected you from a fatal blow to the chest.

510019232.ContentEN: ...Mr. Wells, no matter how hard life is, you shouldn't steal someone else's watch.
510019232.Subtitle: ...Mr. Wells, no matter how hard life is, you shouldn't steal someone else's watch.

510019911.ContentEN: Mr. Wells isn't as bad as you say. You're pushing things too far.
510019911.Subtitle: Mr. Wells isn't as bad as you say. You're pushing things too far.

510019912.ContentEN: We have no interest in becoming laurelled Charon. Don't try to put everyone into a box with your shallow understanding.
510019912.Subtitle: We have no interest in becoming laurelled Charon. Don't try to put everyone into a box with your shallow understanding.

510019913.ContentEN: Watch your mouth. Otherwise, another \"Mr. Wells\" might end up getting beaten up like a dog today.
510019913.Subtitle: Watch your mouth. Otherwise, another \"Mr. Wells\" might end up getting beaten up like a dog today.

510020031.ContentEN: Why don't you go treasure hunting yourself?
510020031.Subtitle: Why don't you go treasure hunting yourself?

510020032.ContentEN: Could you briefly describe this treasure?
510020032.Subtitle: Could you briefly describe this treasure?

510020033.ContentEN: You are not trying to defraud, are you?
510020033.Subtitle: You are not trying to defraud, are you?

510020131.ContentEN: I feel like I've heard of this southern island before.
510020131.Subtitle: I feel like I've heard of this southern island before.

510023011.ContentEN: Hamel Dickinson... that name rings a bell...

510023041.ContentEN: (Hand over the journal retrieved from the pit)

510024031.ContentEN: Could you tell me more about Mr Dickinson?

510025021.ContentEN: I'm not buying, but I can find you a buyer if we split it fifty-fifty.

510025023.ContentEN: This is illegal in the Empire. You should leave if you don't want any trouble.

510025024.ContentEN: Ahem! The Legion commissioned me to search the likes of you. Show me your travel permit!

510026031.ContentEN: Kevin, there's someone illegally selling Phoxene in the slums.

510029011.ContentEN: It's okay. I doubt there are more than five people in Icelake who can understand his words.

510029012.ContentEN: Only a sharp mind like yours is suited for this task.

510030010.ContentEN: A playwright's night cannot be squandered on sleep! I implore any of you to heed my plea! Banish this vile burglar of inspiration so that my magnum opus may yet be completed!

510030011.ContentEN: I shall bestow upon you the honour and perhaps grant you the role of the hero in my next epic! Demonstrate your unmatched skills to me so that I may dedicate myself to chronicling the biography of the great Phoxhunter, my saviour!

510030012.ContentEN: So this appears to be a pro bono commission. It sounds interesting, though. Are you willing to take it?

510030013.ContentEN: Oh! A champion has answered my call for help! Perhaps this marks the beginning of a new epic odyssey!

510030014.ContentEN: I am exceedingly curious about the adventures you will undertake. Please, do share your story with me once you return!

510033051.ContentEN: How's business today? Will it cover your heating expenses for the night?

510033052.ContentEN: These are hardly enough for me. I'm a big eater.

510033053.ContentEN: Your concern is appreciated. I can either afford enough food or fuel. Guess for some people, having it all isn't an option.

510033054.ContentEN: Then think of them as appetisers! There isn't much, but the flavor is definitely top-notch!

510033141.ContentEN: You don't hate him and you stole nothing from him. Let me guess why you sneaked into his home in the middle of the night.

510035051.ContentEN: You better treat Memorial Week more seriously, or your teacher will list you as a naughty kid.

510035052.ContentEN: Is there something you'd rather be doing instead of participating in this memorial ceremony?

510035053.ContentEN: Tuning out on an occasion like this is quite disrespectful, especially to those being memorialised.

510035061.ContentEN: Do I look like a blabbermouth to you?

510036041.ContentEN: Emma has a message for you. Something came up and she can't meet you today, but she wanted you to have this.

510037041.ContentEN: How are you today? May fortune and happiness accompany you.

510037042.ContentEN: Ms Belinda is the best, even with her horns...

510038081.ContentEN: I've never heard of such magic.

510038082.ContentEN: I can't believe there's such magic. Can you teach me?

510044013.ContentEN: The Glory of Days Long Gone

510049091.ContentEN: Relax. I'm not here to threaten you.

510049171.ContentEN: But it won't change anything. It only gets you in trouble.

510049172.ContentEN: Despite enduring such a great misfortune, you still keep on writing. I truly admire your courage.

510049173.ContentEN: This \"prescription\" is now in my hands. Better pay up if you want it back.

510060171.ContentEN: The name might make some people uncomfortable.

510060172.ContentEN: It might scare off potential clients.

510060173.ContentEN: I like it. We should look into edible insects.

510067091.ContentEN: That's understandable. I wouldn't want to compete against an unbeatable record either.

510067092.ContentEN: So you were using me to get back at Outsider.

510067093.ContentEN: You're too slow, Outsider. That's just embarrassing. Maybe it's time for a career switch.

510070011.ContentEN: Seems par for the course in this city. You'll get used to it after a while.

510070012.ContentEN: You can't even throw a comeback?

510070051.ContentEN: Excuse me, I think I can smooth things over here.

510071161.ContentEN: These stars obviously hold sentimental value. Is it really okay to let someone else take them away?

510071162.ContentEN: (Unfolds another star and reads the message aloud.)

699911042.ContentEN: The unnatural figures dissipate before your eyes, leaving behind nothing but smouldering embers.

699911052.ContentEN: The kids smile, offering a gift in return for your reverence.

699911062.ContentEN: The kids smile, offering a gift in return for your kindness.

699912042.ContentEN: Accepting your Embers, the kids leave behind a gift and quietly depart.

699912051.ContentEN: (Ask them to spend some quiet time with you)

699912052.ContentEN: Accepting your Embers, the kids leave behind a gift and quietly depart.

699912062.ContentEN: The kids mean you no harm and slowly walk away.

699913042.ContentEN: The flames flicker, but nothing else happens, save for the heavy weight on your conscience.

699913052.ContentEN: Suddenly, the blacksmith appears behind you, handing you several Lampwicks.

699913061.ContentEN: (Leave, as a creeping sense of dread fills your heart)

699913062.ContentEN: A hunched figure flickers in the firelight, but he seems uninterested in you.

699914051.ContentEN: (A [Nocturne Moth] Lampwick left by those who came before)

699914052.ContentEN: \"Take this. It's what you're after.\" With that, the old man returns to his hammering.

699914061.ContentEN: (A [Glimmerfly] Lampwick left by those who came before)

699914062.ContentEN: \"Take this. It's what you're after.\" With that, the old man returns to his hammering.

699915042.ContentEN: \"May this carry you further on your journey.\"

699915052.ContentEN: \"May this carry you further on your journey.\"

699916042.ContentEN: \"May this carry you further on your journey.\"

699916052.ContentEN: \"May this carry you further on your journey.\"

699917042.ContentEN: \"Alas, another powerless passer-by... Take this as a token of my gratitude for your kindness. Farewell.\"

699917051.ContentEN: (Point out that it's just a reflection in the water)

699917052.ContentEN: \"Alas, another passer-by who speaks only folly... Take this and leave. I wish to be alone with her.\"

699918041.ContentEN: (Extend your lantern towards the lake's surface)

699918042.ContentEN: \"Alas, another powerless passer-by... Take this as a token of my gratitude for your kindness. Farewell.\"

699918052.ContentEN: \"Alas, another powerless passer-by... Take this as a token of my gratitude for your kindness. Farewell.\"

699919041.ContentEN: (Put a small amount of Embers into the Lantern)

699919042.ContentEN: The lantern glows faintly for a moment, but soon dims again.

699919051.ContentEN: (Put a large amount of Embers into the Lantern)

699919052.ContentEN: The lantern glows softly for a while, then fades once more.

699919062.ContentEN: The lantern remains unchanged. No amount of devotion will bring about the miracle they hope for.

699920042.ContentEN: A pale flame flickers to life, causing the devotees to scatter in fear, leaving behind a clutter of their belongings.

699920052.ContentEN: What lies within the lantern surprises you. But you know it will aid you on your journey through the abyss.

710001001.ContentEN: (The cat looks hungry. Maybe I should find something to feed it.)
710001001.Subtitle: (The cat looks hungry. Maybe I should find something to feed it.)

710001002.ContentEN: (The cat seems lonely. Perhaps spending some time playing with it might help.)
710001002.Subtitle: (The cat seems lonely. Perhaps spending some time playing with it might help.)

710001003.ContentEN: (With so many people starving, who has time to worry about a cat?)
710001003.Subtitle: (With so many people starving, who has time to worry about a cat?)

710002001.ContentEN: No. We're barely managing to feed people, let alone pets.
710002001.Subtitle: No. We're barely managing to feed people, let alone pets.

710002101.ContentEN: Yes, take your pick. This is rare. I thought only the wealthy folks from the inner city buy cat food for their pets.
710002101.Subtitle: Yes, take your pick. This is rare. I thought only the wealthy folks from the inner city buy cat food for their pets.

710002201.ContentEN: The cat circles the food warily before eventually lowering its guard and digging in. Watching it eat fills your heart with a sense of peace and joy.
710002201.Subtitle: The cat circles the food warily before eventually lowering its guard and digging in. Watching it eat fills your heart with a sense of peace and joy.

710007211.ContentEN: Sorry, I'm a bit tied up right now.
710007211.Subtitle: Sorry, I'm a bit tied up right now.

710009060.ContentEN: Alright, I can play with you for a while.
710009060.Subtitle: Alright, I can play with you for a while.

710010020.ContentEN: (イコルエネルギー装置を盗もうとする）
710010020.Subtitle: (Try to take the Phoxichor Canister.)

710012010.ContentEN: Perhaps it's time to clean up around the statue — to preserve both the monument and your cherished memories.
710012010.Subtitle: Perhaps it's time to clean up around the statue — to preserve both the monument and your cherished memories.

710014042.ContentEN: (Need some time to mull it over)
710014042.Subtitle: (Need some time to mull it over)

710014052.ContentEN: (Need some time to mull it over)
710014052.Subtitle: (Need some time to mull it over)

710015031.ContentEN: Alright, let me see what I can do.
710015031.Subtitle: Alright, let me see what I can do.

710015032.ContentEN: Just give it a good smack. That should do the trick.
710015032.Subtitle: Just give it a good smack. That should do the trick.

710015033.ContentEN: (Better not get involved with the Legion. Just walk away)
710015033.Subtitle: (Better not get involved with the Legion. Just walk away)

710016082.ContentEN: (Need some time to mull it over)
710016082.Subtitle: (Need some time to mull it over)

710016102.ContentEN: (Need some time to mull it over)
710016102.Subtitle: (Need some time to mull it over)

800202021.ContentEN: Ah, why don't you go take a rest now? Our little tea party can wait.

800202022.ContentEN: That's a slight exaggeration, isn't it?

800202091.ContentEN: Are you really just a maid?

800204021.ContentEN: Sounds like you're in a good mood.

800204022.ContentEN: That sounds like a typical maid's chore.

800204092.ContentEN: Care to share more about your former colleagues?

800204171.ContentEN: Why not go visit her then?

800205012.ContentEN: Well, with hair as bright as yours, it's hard not to notice you.

800205071.ContentEN: Sounds like you've resolved some inner conflicts.

800205121.ContentEN: While I was hesitating, she didn't think twice about fulfilling her task — even considering me as a potential obstacle to be removed if necessary.

800205143.ContentEN: To be honest, I don't know. I just feel a bit indignant, aggrieved, and wistful. For agents like us, love and hate are luxuries we can't afford.

800205181.ContentEN: Hm? Did you just say \"thank you\"?

800301051.ContentEN: You're indeed a man of principles when it comes to this.

800302051.ContentEN: A gentleman who lies to get off work?

800302052.ContentEN: Yeah, definitely. You're such a gentleman.

800302091.ContentEN: Your sisters? They must've been fair ladies.

800302092.ContentEN: I can't imagine what you were like as a boy.

800302131.ContentEN: Love? That doesn't sound so bad.

800302132.ContentEN: Tough love? That sounds as sarcastic as the word \"gentleman\". You must've had a bitter childhood.

800304031.ContentEN: Is something troubling you? You seem a bit off today.

800304032.ContentEN: Why are you hurrying to leave? Got another dance with a noble lady?

800304351.ContentEN: If your dad regains consciousness, he'll be very proud of you!

800304352.ContentEN: Let me make one more drink for you.

800305011.ContentEN: Thanks, you seem to be in a good mood today.

800305081.ContentEN: But you need a gorgeous lady. Why did you come to me?

800305082.ContentEN: So, you're asking me to be your partner.

800305142.ContentEN: You just want to dress up like a girl, don't you?

800305171.ContentEN: Fine, I give up. I'll help you.

800305261.ContentEN: Are you going to arrest me at the ball?

800305311.ContentEN: I'm just kidding. Of course I don't.

800305351.ContentEN: Sorry, I just wanted to see you panic. I couldn't help myself.

800305352.ContentEN: No, I'm really worried about being arrested!

801001022.ContentEN: ...That's right, that's what I am, cold and uncaring.

801001092.ContentEN: I get it now. You're rehearsing poetic literature for a theatre show.

801002071.ContentEN: Never thought you'd dream of that.

801002072.ContentEN: You said once... Does that mean you've grown used to it?

801002191.ContentEN: You won't get a chance like that.

801003021.ContentEN: I don't like guessing what others are thinking.

801003141.ContentEN: I'm already wanted by the Empire anyway. Being listed for another crime hardly matters to me.

801003142.ContentEN: Perhaps we should keep an appropriate distance.

801003221.ContentEN: Every word of it, I believe.

801003222.ContentEN: Who would that be? I can relay your words if you want.

801003321.ContentEN: Why do I get the feeling that you're enjoying this?

801004012.ContentEN: Guess I didn't invite you at the right time.

801004121.ContentEN: You're running away from who you really are.

801101021.ContentEN: Seems like the Legion has better food and drinks.

801101051.ContentEN: I heard the Legion got a treasure called \"No. 0\".

801101052.ContentEN: You're overthinking it. I just want to offer you a drink.

801101141.ContentEN: So you were a Phoxhunter before?

801101161.ContentEN: You seem to be so careful of what you say.

801101201.ContentEN: The Legion must have made you feel repressed.

801101202.ContentEN: I wouldn't have guessed — you seem to thrive on the status and prestige it brings.

801101261.ContentEN: Is this something I can know?

801102031.ContentEN: You mean there are commissions that involve killing and robbing people!?

801102051.ContentEN: Nah, she's a very kind lady now.

801102052.ContentEN: Yes, still being fierce and sharp-tongued.

801102091.ContentEN: You give me the same vibes...

801102151.ContentEN: ...Your superior officer sounds like an interesting person. Can you tell me more about her?

801102211.ContentEN: Keep going. Did they finally find the treasure? Where is it now?

801103031.ContentEN: I need to know if there are any hazardous materials.

801103032.ContentEN: I don't want to end up delivering something illegal and get zapped for it.

801103101.ContentEN: I can do the job. But if it's a gift for a friend, why don't you deliver it yourself?

801103112.ContentEN: What, gotten too used to the big city life to care about your humble hometown?

801103161.ContentEN: Do you think this is normal?

801103271.ContentEN: Is your family afraid of you?

801103301.ContentEN: I don't think any of this feels normal.

801202111.Content: 这一页夹了张纸条，上面写了些什么？

801202181.Content: 他终究还是被时间改变了。

801202182.Content: 也许他从未改变，所以他故意留下了这份乐谱。

801203021.Content: 虽然加了糖，但玛尔洁还喝不惯咖啡呢。

801203031.Content: 玛尔洁更喜欢清凉爽口或者甜滋滋的味道吗？

801203081.Content: 收到！史上最帅气、智慧、可靠的“垃圾桶公主”殿下！

801203101.Content: 之前好像没听你提过父亲？

801203121.Content: 要不怎么你俩是父女呢。

801203161.Content: ……你刚才是不是说了什么很不妙的东西？！

801203181.Content: 但是，既然马丁带着你离开了老家，那他也不喜欢那里吧。

801203211.Content: 还有这事？当时你是怎么说话的，能不能再表演一下？

801203221.Content: 拜托了，尊敬的缄默侦探小姐，我愿意用你最爱喝的饮料交换！

801203231.Content: 不说的话，那我只有……垃圾桶公主殿下——

801203431.Content: 用锅子做头盔……老马丁真是品味独特。

801203432.Content: 原来这是生日礼物……看来老马丁很爱你。

801204011.Content: 你怎么眼泪汪汪的！破案了要笑啊！

801204111.Content: 哦~可怜的侦探，被“胖尾巴”玩弄于股掌之间！

801204131.Content: 喵喵喵！侦探小姐，我有重大发现！

801204141.Content: 不仅对垃圾桶了如指掌，甚至组建起了猫猫情报网，不愧是行走于冰湖城背面的缄默侦探小姐！

801204221.Content: 你不也慢慢不再需要老马丁的照顾，和胖尾巴一样，照顾着那些需要帮助的人。

801204281.Content: 你居然不选择和老马丁在一起，他听到会哭的。

801204291.Content: 但以你当时的年纪，回到雪原很不安全。

801204401.Content: 猫叫你回家，猫好。你害猫担心，你坏。

801204471.Content: 都长大了——指今天又哭着鼻子跑了过来？

900103011.ContentEN: What's that black thingy over there?

900300011.ContentEN: Do you have any wishes, Berry?

900300013.ContentEN: It's so bitterly cold here in Icelake...

900300014.ContentEN: Berry? How come you are here?

900300016.ContentEN: You've always preferred quiet settings; does the noise here bother you?

900400011.ContentEN: You always seem so happy when it rains.

900400012.ContentEN: You're always talking about love. What does \"love\" really mean to you...?

900400013.ContentEN: Your way of thinking is quite special.

900400014.ContentEN: Are you alright with that much toxin in your body?

900400015.ContentEN: There's always a pleasant smell around you.

900500011.ContentEN: You're so quiet today... It's like you're a completely different person.

900500012.ContentEN: Thieves are usually quite alert. How do you manage to swipe their stuff right under their noses?

900500013.ContentEN: Those who like to steal are no good.

900500014.ContentEN: I thought most Charons wouldn't appreciate being called a \"demon\"...

900600011.ContentEN: Your skin is as red as fire. That's quite unique.

900600012.ContentEN: Why did you choose to become a warden?

900600013.ContentEN: Is being a warden a busy job?

900600014.ContentEN: What does justice mean to you?

900600015.ContentEN: What do you do in your spare time?

900700011.ContentEN: You said you're from Huaxu. What is the place like?

900700012.ContentEN: You call yourself a servant guarding the Nine Chapters of Dafeng. What does that mean?

900700013.ContentEN: You always seem so sombre. Has something happened recently?

900700014.ContentEN: I notice you often gaze at the moon at night.

900800011.ContentEN: Have you always been this idle? Doesn't your family say anything about this?

900800012.ContentEN: How come you nap just about anywhere?

900800013.ContentEN: What's it like working under Chief Sibylle?

900900012.ContentEN: As a Charon, why would you still serve the Empire?

900900013.ContentEN: Have you ever thought about how you'd feel if someone took your family the way you've taken others'?

900900014.ContentEN: Given the Empire's disdain for Charons, I imagine they don't look kindly on you either.

901000011.ContentEN: That's really a lovely dress, but are you not worried about catching a cold?

901000012.ContentEN: I remember you mentioned that people don't look kindly on Charons in Hyperborea.

901000013.ContentEN: There's a flowery smell around here lately.

901000014.ContentEN: Have you ever left Icelake, Psyche?

901000015.ContentEN: It seems like you have something on your mind.

901100011.ContentEN: How are you adjusting to Hyperborea?

901100012.ContentEN: Fushu, what brought you from Huaxu to Hyperborea?

901100014.ContentEN: Fushu, do you have any dreams?

901200011.ContentEN: I heard you're a commissary. What's that all about?

901200012.ContentEN: Just wondering — does it hurt to get bumped by Filbert?

901200013.ContentEN: Filbert's so cute. She must be a good helper.

901200014.ContentEN: I've been meaning to say — your dress is really cute.

901200015.ContentEN: You seem to have been zoning out here for a while.

901300011.ContentEN: Can you tell me something about Sibylle?

901300012.ContentEN: Heard you pulled quite a few gigs before joining the Legion. Got any pro tips?

901300013.ContentEN: You seem to be lost in thought; what's on your mind?

901300014.ContentEN: Why do you always push yourself so hard at work?

901400011.ContentEN: You don't seem to like the weather in Icelake.

901400012.ContentEN: You're quite skilled in combat for a maid, aren't you?

901400013.ContentEN: Um, do you perhaps keep too many dangerous items?

901400014.ContentEN: I heard you can be quite harsh with others sometimes.

901500012.ContentEN: Got any little secrets you'd like to share with me, Fina?

901500013.ContentEN: Did you have a good night's sleep?

901500014.ContentEN: Fina, do you have any family other than your brother?

901600011.Content: 有没有什么资深狩月人速成手册之类的东西，传授一下？

901600012.Content: 帝国严加防范的“神弃者同盟”是什么来头？

901600014.Content: 你手里拿的是什么东西？！

901600015.Content: 这次的委托顺利完成了。

901700012.ContentEN: \"The One-Stop Rubbish Bin Map Guide of Icelake\"...?

901700013.ContentEN: I sometimes see you gazing at the distant snowfields. Do you wish to leave here?

901700014.ContentEN: What animal is on your charm?

901700015.ContentEN: You know, people in the slums call you \"Princess Rubbish Bin\".

901800012.ContentEN: Are you interested in Phoxhunter commissions? Care to join me?

901800013.ContentEN: You seem to always speak very slowly.

901800014.ContentEN: Were you and Oliver childhood friends?

2000050601.ContentEN: I regret what I said and offer my sincere apologies.
2000050601.Subtitle: I regret what I said and offer my sincere apologies.

5100030511.ContentEN: (Ask if she's in some sort of trouble. Offer to help with proper payment in return.)

5100030512.ContentEN: (Ask if she's looking for someone. Offer to keep an eye out during your travels.)

5100030513.ContentEN: (Ask if there's anything you can do to help her.)

5100050101.ContentEN: Elsa, I have news about Annie...

5100050201.ContentEN: I'm so sorry, but Annie has passed away... my condolences. In her final moments, she helped another girl survive, and her kindness will always be remembered.

5100291001.ContentEN: Perhaps sorting out Mr Buck's convoluted vocabulary and reorganising the keywords would clarify his script.

5100300301.ContentEN: Mr Buck likes to stay up writing his play.

5100300501.ContentEN: Mr Buck isn't making too much progress in his work.

5100300502.ContentEN: Oh. So he fell asleep while writing his play. Maybe he should focus on bedtime stories instead.

5100300701.ContentEN: Mr Buck noticed strange happenings while he was asleep.

5100300702.ContentEN: It's possible that he overslept and started seeing things. But we can't rule out the possibility of someone messing with him.

5100300901.ContentEN: Mr Buck did not lose any money or personal belongings.

5100300902.ContentEN: The thief stole nothing? So they just love to spy on people in their sleep? Yeesh!

5100341401.ContentEN: Something is about to happen! We stand upon the frozen lake, yet we perceive only coldness, deep isolation, and the frigid rigidity of our surroundings.

5100341402.ContentEN: But we all know a dark tide is rising, gaining strength. One day it will consume everything we cherish. But before that day comes, I shall journey to the source that has been prophesied.

5100341403.ContentEN: I no longer have to worry about the cold winter. Thank you so much, Phoxhunter.

5100361101.ContentEN: You are a Charon with special abilities?

5100361103.ContentEN: I don't believe in superstitions and I don't understand a word you say.

5100380202.ContentEN: Unlike me, you're obviously a human.

5100391302.ContentEN: Why bother playing with them? You should give them a thrashing.

5100391303.ContentEN: They lied. Don't believe a word they say.

5100400101.ContentEN: Imagine that you're a vicious demon.

5100400102.ContentEN: They call you names, right? It's tit-for-tat time.

5100400601.ContentEN: Since you know we're Charons, you better scram.

5100400602.ContentEN: Easy, kids. This young lady has something nice to say.

5100410901.ContentEN: And you seem to be really good at spouting insults. Practice when you have the chance. You'll get better.

5100410902.ContentEN: You flatter me. The most important lesson is that you learned to stand up for yourself.

5100413002.ContentEN: Actually, they look more like goat horns...

5100415101.ContentEN: My classmates still don't like me, but I'm not afraid of them anymore! All thanks to you!

5100420303.ContentEN: The silver coins in my pocket sent me here.

5100421701.ContentEN: (Well, can't let it fall into the wrong hands...)

5100421702.ContentEN: (It looks like a handy piece. I gotta get it...)

5100501201.ContentEN: Everyone sees this house as a haunted place, but you seem neither disturbed nor surprised.

5100501701.ContentEN: Have you known Mr Henrik for a long time?

5100502001.ContentEN: Too bad his kindness failed to earn him the reputation he deserved.

5100502002.ContentEN: He upheld the fundamental values that define the humanity.

5100502003.ContentEN: Perhaps... that Charon girl reminded him of his own daughter.

5100502301.ContentEN: Mr Henrik would be pleased to know his home has been well cared for after his departure.

5100502601.ContentEN: (The key in Ms Lina's hand stirs a sense of familiarity.)

5100502901.ContentEN: Ms Lina, is this key familiar to you?

5100503901.ContentEN: Please accept this. I shall bear witness to this transfer. This key is, and shall forever be, yours.

5100504101.ContentEN: Not all who dwell in the light live with a clear conscience.

5100510501.ContentEN: I don't judge and I don't care. I've got things to do here, and that's why I'm staying for now.

5100510502.ContentEN: It's my first visit to a large city like this. The place has a unique vibe. I've met plenty of interesting people and had some bizarre adventures here. Truth be told, I'm not very used to it...

5100511101.ContentEN: Just a bunch of second-hand stuff with no real value.

5100511102.ContentEN: I have to ask this first — these aren't... stolen, by any chance?

5100511103.ContentEN: Where did you get them? Count me in!

5100511501.ContentEN: (You pick up a prescription. A seemingly seditious poem is written behind it.)

5100511502.ContentEN: (You pick up a box of paper stars. Its owner probably had a wish they wanted to fulfil.)

5100511503.ContentEN: (You pick up a key that looks rather familiar — you remember seeing a similar key at Henrik's place.)

5100513201.ContentEN: Good luck with your investigations, Detective!

5100513202.ContentEN: Once you've investigated the stories behind them, come back and tell me what you think about Icelake!

5100520201.ContentEN: Dr Luna wrote the prescription. She was once a wandering bard, but some Charon-haters took her voice. Now, composing poems in this way is her only outlet for expressing her anguish.

5100520202.ContentEN: The biggest dream of Jessica, the ticket seller, is to take a train and leave this place. All she could do was fold expired tickets into paper stars and pray for a miracle.

5100520203.ContentEN: That key opens a safe. Inside, we found a will, and Ms Lina became my new landlady. She also said I could stay rent-free.

5100520801.ContentEN: Always try to play it \"safe\" in Icelake. Going the extra mile will just get yourself and others into trouble. It really isn't worth it.

5100520802.ContentEN: Life is seldom a breeze. The only thing we can do in Icelake is stick to our principles.

5100520803.ContentEN: Not everyone believes in the \"city laws\". It makes you wonder how many people break the rules in the dark.

5100520804.ContentEN: The people here cling to their hopes, faiths, and circumstances... These are all they have. They try to hold on, and then bad things happen.

5100520805.ContentEN: The city's like powder kegs ready to explode! Lamenting Lake shall vaporize and give us a show!

5100530301.ContentEN: (Take a closer look at his notes)

5100531101.ContentEN: Marinated seafood? So, is it eaten... raw?

5100531201.ContentEN: Please help me gather the ingredients. I'll use this time to refine the recipe.

5100540601.ContentEN: They're raw, aren't they? I'm good.

5100540602.ContentEN: (Take a cautious bite and muster a compliment)

5100540603.ContentEN: Even if I were starving, I'd rather eat ice and snow.

5100550701.ContentEN: While you're out fishing, I'll brainstorm some enhancements to the recipe.

5100560101.ContentEN: (You notice bloodstains on the Borealberry peels.)

5100560102.ContentEN: (You notice the bloodstains on Marcus's clothes.)

5100571201.ContentEN: (Be honest and tell him it's very delicious and people will definitely love it.)

5100571202.ContentEN: (Lie to Marcus by saying that the dish is good but ordinary. Advise him to take good care of himself first and find another job once he gets better.)

5100580201.ContentEN: Aren't all the chests in this city mine?

5100580202.ContentEN: Sorry. I didn't know this chest belonged to you.

5100580203.ContentEN: This chest doesn't have your names on it.

5100590401.ContentEN: Ugh... Fine, you can have it.

5100590402.ContentEN: (Give Small Bro a vicious kick with the other leg)

5100593701.ContentEN: ...Feels like we're taking advantage of these simpletons. I somehow feel a bit guilty.

5100593702.ContentEN: Nah, that's not enough. Hand over all you have and make your Super Bros happy.

7100210401.ContentEN: (You notice a glint at the soldier's side — he's readying his weapon! Prepare to defend yourself!)
7100210401.Subtitle: (You notice a glint at the soldier's side — he's readying his weapon! Prepare to defend yourself!)

7100210402.ContentEN: (Try to calm him down and suggest waiting for Kevin to clear things up.)
7100210402.Subtitle: (Try to calm him down and suggest waiting for Kevin to clear things up.)

51003001101.ContentEN: If anyone solves this case, Mr Buck will make them the protagonist of his next play.

51003001201.ContentEN: Let me help you, Mr Buck.

51003503001.ContentEN:
Emma quickly places the floral tribute at the designated location and offers an acknowledgement speech according to the program agenda.\
However, her teacher is displeased with her momentary distraction.

51003504001.ContentEN: Alright. We'll have a short break now. Feel free to explore this place, but do not stray too far. We will regather in half an hour beneath the statue.

51003504002.ContentEN: (The memorial event has ended. However, Emma lingers alone, mumbling absentmindedly to herself.)

510035051001.ContentEN: No, she won't! Miss Lisse nags from time to time, but she's actually very patient with us!

510035052001.ContentEN: Oh! Am I being that obvious?

510035053001.ContentEN: I already have Miss Lisse nag me about that. I don't need another one!
